arabic: ۞ اللَّهُ نُورُ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ ۚ مَثَلُ نُورِهِ كَمِشْكَاةٍ فِيهَا مِصْبَاحٌ ۖ الْمِصْبَاحُ فِي زُجَاجَةٍ ۖ الزُّجَاجَةُ كَأَنَّهَا كَوْكَبٌ دُرِّيٌّ يُوقَدُ مِنْ شَجَرَةٍ مُبَارَكَةٍ زَيْتُونَةٍ لَا شَرْقِيَّةٍ وَلَا غَرْبِيَّةٍ يَكَادُ زَيْتُهَا يُضِيءُ وَلَوْ لَمْ تَمْسَسْهُ نَارٌ ۚ نُورٌ عَلَىٰ نُورٍ ۗ يَهْدِي اللَّهُ لِنُورِهِ مَنْ يَشَاءُ ۚ وَيَضْرِبُ اللَّهُ الْأَمْثَالَ لِلنَّاسِ ۗ وَاللَّهُ بِكُلِّ شَيْءٍ عَلِيمٌ

translation: [Such niches are lit] in the houses [of worship] which Allah has ordered to raise up, and where His Name is mentioned, and He is glorified therein morning and evening
arabic: فِي بُيُوتٍ أَذِنَ اللَّهُ أَنْ تُرْفَعَ وَيُذْكَرَ فِيهَا اسْمُهُ يُسَبِّحُ لَهُ فِيهَا بِالْغُدُوِّ وَالْآصَالِ

translation: by men who are not distracted by buying or selling from the remembrance of Allah, or from performing prayer or giving zakah. They fear a Day when hearts and eyes will be petrified.
arabic: رِجَالٌ لَا تُلْهِيهِمْ تِجَارَةٌ وَلَا بَيْعٌ عَنْ ذِكْرِ اللَّهِ وَإِقَامِ الصَّلَاةِ وَإِيتَاءِ الزَّكَاةِ ۙ يَخَافُونَ يَوْمًا تَتَقَلَّبُ فِيهِ الْقُلُوبُ وَالْأَبْصَارُ

translation: [They hope] that Allah may reward them according to their best deeds, and give them yet more out of His bounty, for Allah gives provision to whom He wills without limit.
arabic: لِيَجْزِيَهُمُ اللَّهُ أَحْسَنَ مَا عَمِلُوا وَيَزِيدَهُمْ مِنْ فَضْلِهِ ۗ وَاللَّهُ يَرْزُقُ مَنْ يَشَاءُ بِغَيْرِ حِسَابٍ

translation: As for those who disbelieve, their deeds are like a mirage in a plain desert, which a thirsty person deems to be water, until when he reaches it, he finds nothing, but he finds Allah there [in the Hereafter], thus He will pay him his account in full, for Allah is swift in reckoning.
arabic: وَالَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا أَعْمَالُهُمْ كَسَرَابٍ بِقِيعَةٍ يَحْسَبُهُ الظَّمْآنُ مَاءً حَتَّىٰ إِذَا جَاءَهُ لَمْ يَجِدْهُ شَيْئًا وَوَجَدَ اللَّهَ عِنْدَهُ فَوَفَّاهُ حِسَابَهُ ۗ وَاللَّهُ سَرِيعُ الْحِسَابِ

translation: Or [their deeds] are like layers of darkness in a deep sea covered by waves upon waves, above which are clouds - layers of darkness, one above another. If one stretches out his hand, he can hardly see it. Whoever Allah does not give light will have no light at all.
arabic: أَوْ كَظُلُمَاتٍ فِي بَحْرٍ لُجِّيٍّ يَغْشَاهُ مَوْجٌ مِنْ فَوْقِهِ مَوْجٌ مِنْ فَوْقِهِ سَحَابٌ ۚ ظُلُمَاتٌ بَعْضُهَا فَوْقَ بَعْضٍ إِذَا أَخْرَجَ يَدَهُ لَمْ يَكَدْ يَرَاهَا ۗ وَمَنْ لَمْ يَجْعَلِ اللَّهُ لَهُ نُورًا فَمَا لَهُ مِنْ نُورٍ

translation: Do you not see that all those who are in the heavens and earth glorify Allah, as do the birds with wings outspread? Each knows its [way of] praying and glorification. And Allah is All-Knowing of what they do.
arabic: أَلَمْ تَرَ أَنَّ اللَّهَ يُسَبِّحُ لَهُ مَنْ فِي السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ وَالطَّيْرُ صَافَّاتٍ ۖ كُلٌّ قَدْ عَلِمَ صَلَاتَهُ وَتَسْبِيحَهُ ۗ وَاللَّهُ عَلِيمٌ بِمَا يَفْعَلُونَ

translation: To Allah belongs the dominion of the heavens and earth, and to Allah is the final return.
arabic: وَلِلَّهِ مُلْكُ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ ۖ وَإِلَى اللَّهِ الْمَصِيرُ

translation: Do you not see that Allah drives the clouds, then gathers them together, then turns them into a heap, and then you see raindrops coming out from their midst? He sends down hail from mountains [of clouds] in the sky, raining it down upon whoever He wills and turning it away from whoever He wills. The flash of its lightning almost takes away eyesight.
arabic: أَلَمْ تَرَ أَنَّ اللَّهَ يُزْجِي سَحَابًا ثُمَّ يُؤَلِّفُ بَيْنَهُ ثُمَّ يَجْعَلُهُ رُكَامًا فَتَرَى الْوَدْقَ يَخْرُجُ مِنْ خِلَالِهِ وَيُنَزِّلُ مِنَ السَّمَاءِ مِنْ جِبَالٍ فِيهَا مِنْ بَرَدٍ فَيُصِيبُ بِهِ مَنْ يَشَاءُ وَيَصْرِفُهُ عَنْ مَنْ يَشَاءُ ۖ يَكَادُ سَنَا بَرْقِهِ يَذْهَبُ بِالْأَبْصَارِ

translation: Allah alternates the night and day. Indeed, there is a lesson in this for people of insight.
arabic: يُقَلِّبُ اللَّهُ اللَّيْلَ وَالنَّهَارَ ۚ إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَعِبْرَةً لِأُولِي الْأَبْصَارِ

translation: Allah created every living creature from water. Some of them move on their bellies, and some walk on two legs and some walk on four. Allah creates what He wills. Allah is the Most Capable of all things.
arabic: وَاللَّهُ خَلَقَ كُلَّ دَابَّةٍ مِنْ مَاءٍ ۖ فَمِنْهُمْ مَنْ يَمْشِي عَلَىٰ بَطْنِهِ وَمِنْهُمْ مَنْ يَمْشِي عَلَىٰ رِجْلَيْنِ وَمِنْهُمْ مَنْ يَمْشِي عَلَىٰ أَرْبَعٍ ۚ يَخْلُقُ اللَّهُ مَا يَشَاءُ ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيرٌ

translation: We have sent down verses making things clear, and Allah guides whom He wills to a straight path.
arabic: لَقَدْ أَنْزَلْنَا آيَاتٍ مُبَيِّنَاتٍ ۚ وَاللَّهُ يَهْدِي مَنْ يَشَاءُ إِلَىٰ صِرَاطٍ مُسْتَقِيمٍ

translation: The hypocrites say, “We believe in Allah and in the Messenger, and we obey.” Then a party of them turns away after that. Such are not believers.
arabic: وَيَقُولُونَ آمَنَّا بِاللَّهِ وَبِالرَّسُولِ وَأَطَعْنَا ثُمَّ يَتَوَلَّىٰ فَرِيقٌ مِنْهُمْ مِنْ بَعْدِ ذَٰلِكَ ۚ وَمَا أُولَٰئِكَ بِالْمُؤْمِنِينَ

translation: When they are called to Allah and His Messenger so that he may judge between them, a party of them turns away.
arabic: وَإِذَا دُعُوا إِلَى اللَّهِ وَرَسُولِهِ لِيَحْكُمَ بَيْنَهُمْ إِذَا فَرِيقٌ مِنْهُمْ مُعْرِضُونَ

translation: But if the right is in their favor, they come to him in full submission[29].
footnotes: [29] For they care for their own interests and desires, not submission to the right judgment.
arabic: وَإِنْ يَكُنْ لَهُمُ الْحَقُّ يَأْتُوا إِلَيْهِ مُذْعِنِينَ

translation: Is there sickness in their hearts, or do they have doubt, or do they fear that Allah and His messenger will be unjust to them? Rather, it is they who are the wrongdoers.
arabic: أَفِي قُلُوبِهِمْ مَرَضٌ أَمِ ارْتَابُوا أَمْ يَخَافُونَ أَنْ يَحِيفَ اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِمْ وَرَسُولُهُ ۚ بَلْ أُولَٰئِكَ هُمُ الظَّالِمُونَ

translation: As for the believers, when they are called to Allah and His Messenger so that he may judge between them, they say, “We listen and obey.” It is they who are successful.
arabic: إِنَّمَا كَانَ قَوْلَ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ إِذَا دُعُوا إِلَى اللَّهِ وَرَسُولِهِ لِيَحْكُمَ بَيْنَهُمْ أَنْ يَقُولُوا سَمِعْنَا وَأَطَعْنَا ۚ وَأُولَٰئِكَ هُمُ الْمُفْلِحُونَ

translation: Whoever obeys Allah and His Messenger, and fears Allah and is conscious of Him – it is they who are the triumphant.
arabic: وَمَنْ يُطِعِ اللَّهَ وَرَسُولَهُ وَيَخْشَ اللَّهَ وَيَتَّقْهِ فَأُولَٰئِكَ هُمُ الْفَائِزُونَ

translation: The hypocrites swear by Allah their most solemn oaths that if you order them, they will surely march forth. Say, “Do not swear, [your] obedience is well known[30]. Allah is All-Aware of what you do.”
footnotes: [30] This is said in a sarcastic way; i.e., your obedience is well known to be a lie.
arabic: ۞ وَأَقْسَمُوا بِاللَّهِ جَهْدَ أَيْمَانِهِمْ لَئِنْ أَمَرْتَهُمْ لَيَخْرُجُنَّ ۖ قُلْ لَا تُقْسِمُوا ۖ طَاعَةٌ مَعْرُوفَةٌ ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ خَبِيرٌ بِمَا تَعْمَلُونَ

translation: Say, “Obey Allah and obey the Messenger. But if you turn away, he is only responsible for his duty[31] and you are responsible for your duty[32]. If you obey him, you will be guided. The duty of the Messenger is only to convey the message clearly.”
footnotes:
[31] The Prophet’s duty is only to convey the message.
 [32] Their duty is to obey the Prophet (ﷺ) and submit to the will of Allah.
arabic: قُلْ أَطِيعُوا اللَّهَ وَأَطِيعُوا الرَّسُولَ ۖ فَإِنْ تَوَلَّوْا فَإِنَّمَا عَلَيْهِ مَا حُمِّلَ وَعَلَيْكُمْ مَا حُمِّلْتُمْ ۖ وَإِنْ تُطِيعُوهُ تَهْتَدُوا ۚ وَمَا عَلَى الرَّسُولِ إِلَّا الْبَلَاغُ الْمُبِينُ

translation: Allah has promised those among you who believe and do righteous deeds that He will make them successors in the land, as He made those who came before them, and He will surely establish for them their religion which He has chosen for them, and He will surely change their state of fear into security; that they worship Me, not associating anything with Me. But whoever disbelieves[33] after that, it is they who are the rebellious.
footnotes: [33] i.e., denies Allah's favor or does not live by His ordinance.
arabic: وَعَدَ اللَّهُ الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا مِنْكُمْ وَعَمِلُوا الصَّالِحَاتِ لَيَسْتَخْلِفَنَّهُمْ فِي الْأَرْضِ كَمَا اسْتَخْلَفَ الَّذِينَ مِنْ قَبْلِهِمْ وَلَيُمَكِّنَنَّ لَهُمْ دِينَهُمُ الَّذِي ارْتَضَىٰ لَهُمْ وَلَيُبَدِّلَنَّهُمْ مِنْ بَعْدِ خَوْفِهِمْ أَمْنًا ۚ يَعْبُدُونَنِي لَا يُشْرِكُونَ بِي شَيْئًا ۚ وَمَنْ كَفَرَ بَعْدَ ذَٰلِكَ فَأُولَٰئِكَ هُمُ الْفَاسِقُونَ

translation: Establish prayer, give zakah and obey the Messenger, so that you may be shown mercy.
arabic: وَأَقِيمُوا الصَّلَاةَ وَآتُوا الزَّكَاةَ وَأَطِيعُوا الرَّسُولَ لَعَلَّكُمْ تُرْحَمُونَ

translation: Do not think that the disbelievers can escape in the land. Their abode will be the Fire. What a terrible destination!
arabic: لَا تَحْسَبَنَّ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا مُعْجِزِينَ فِي الْأَرْضِ ۚ وَمَأْوَاهُمُ النَّارُ ۖ وَلَبِئْسَ الْمَصِيرُ

translation: O you who believe, let your slaves and those among you who have not reached puberty ask for your permission [to enter] at three times: before dawn prayer, when you take off your outer garments at noon, and after the night prayer; three times of privacy[34] for you. Beyond that there is no blame on you nor on them to move about freely, attending to one another. This is how Allah makes the verses clear to you, for Allah is All-Knowing, All-Wise.
footnotes: [34] ‘Awrāt: (sing. ‘Awrah) lit., "exposure" or "being uncovered."
arabic: يَا أَيُّهَا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا لِيَسْتَأْذِنْكُمُ الَّذِينَ مَلَكَتْ أَيْمَانُكُمْ وَالَّذِينَ لَمْ يَبْلُغُوا الْحُلُمَ مِنْكُمْ ثَلَاثَ مَرَّاتٍ ۚ مِنْ قَبْلِ صَلَاةِ الْفَجْرِ وَحِينَ تَضَعُونَ ثِيَابَكُمْ مِنَ الظَّهِيرَةِ وَمِنْ بَعْدِ صَلَاةِ الْعِشَاءِ ۚ ثَلَاثُ عَوْرَاتٍ لَكُمْ ۚ لَيْسَ عَلَيْكُمْ وَلَا عَلَيْهِمْ جُنَاحٌ بَعْدَهُنَّ ۚ طَوَّافُونَ عَلَيْكُمْ بَعْضُكُمْ عَلَىٰ بَعْضٍ ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ يُبَيِّنُ اللَّهُ لَكُمُ الْآيَاتِ ۗ وَاللَّهُ عَلِيمٌ حَكِيمٌ

translation: When your children reach the age of puberty, let them ask permission [to enter], as their elders do. This is how Allah makes His verses clear to you, for Allah is All-Knowing, All-Wise.
arabic: وَإِذَا بَلَغَ الْأَطْفَالُ مِنْكُمُ الْحُلُمَ فَلْيَسْتَأْذِنُوا كَمَا اسْتَأْذَنَ الَّذِينَ مِنْ قَبْلِهِمْ ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ يُبَيِّنُ اللَّهُ لَكُمْ آيَاتِهِ ۗ وَاللَّهُ عَلِيمٌ حَكِيمٌ

translation: As for elderly women who have no interest in marriage, there is no blame on them if they take off their outer garments without revealing their beauty. But if they modestly refrain from it, that is better for them. And Allah is All-Hearing, All-Knowing.
arabic: وَالْقَوَاعِدُ مِنَ النِّسَاءِ اللَّاتِي لَا يَرْجُونَ نِكَاحًا فَلَيْسَ عَلَيْهِنَّ جُنَاحٌ أَنْ يَضَعْنَ ثِيَابَهُنَّ غَيْرَ مُتَبَرِّجَاتٍ بِزِينَةٍ ۖ وَأَنْ يَسْتَعْفِفْنَ خَيْرٌ لَهُنَّ ۗ وَاللَّهُ سَمِيعٌ عَلِيمٌ

translation: There is no blame on a blind person, nor on the lame, nor on the sick[35], nor on yourselves[36] if you eat from your houses or from your fathers’ houses or your mothers’ houses or your brothers’ houses or your sisters’ houses or your paternal uncles’ houses, or your paternal aunts’ houses or your maternal uncles’ houses or your maternal aunts’ houses or from the houses the keys of which are in your possession, or your friends’ houses. There is no blame on you if you eat together or separately. But when you enter houses, greet one another with greetings of peace from Allah, which is blessed and delightful. This is how Allah makes the verses clear to you, so that you may understand.
footnotes:
[35] These three people are excused for not participating in Jihad.
 [36] O believers.
arabic: لَيْسَ عَلَى الْأَعْمَىٰ حَرَجٌ وَلَا عَلَى الْأَعْرَجِ حَرَجٌ وَلَا عَلَى الْمَرِيضِ حَرَجٌ وَلَا عَلَىٰ أَنْفُسِكُمْ أَنْ تَأْكُلُوا مِنْ بُيُوتِكُمْ أَوْ بُيُوتِ آبَائِكُمْ أَوْ بُيُوتِ أُمَّهَاتِكُمْ أَوْ بُيُوتِ إِخْوَانِكُمْ أَوْ بُيُوتِ أَخَوَاتِكُمْ أَوْ بُيُوتِ أَعْمَامِكُمْ أَوْ بُيُوتِ عَمَّاتِكُمْ أَوْ بُيُوتِ أَخْوَالِكُمْ أَوْ بُيُوتِ خَالَاتِكُمْ أَوْ مَا مَلَكْتُمْ مَفَاتِحَهُ أَوْ صَدِيقِكُمْ ۚ لَيْسَ عَلَيْكُمْ جُنَاحٌ أَنْ تَأْكُلُوا جَمِيعًا أَوْ أَشْتَاتًا ۚ فَإِذَا دَخَلْتُمْ بُيُوتًا فَسَلِّمُوا عَلَىٰ أَنْفُسِكُمْ تَحِيَّةً مِنْ عِنْدِ اللَّهِ مُبَارَكَةً طَيِّبَةً ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ يُبَيِّنُ اللَّهُ لَكُمُ الْآيَاتِ لَعَلَّكُمْ تَعْقِلُونَ

translation: The true believers are those who believe in Allah and His Messenger. When they are with him on a public matter, they do not leave until they ask his permission. Those who ask your permission are the ones who believe in Allah and His Messenger. So when they ask your permission for a private matter, give permission to whom you will from among them, and ask Allah’s forgiveness for them, for Allah is All-Forgiving, Most Merciful.
arabic: إِنَّمَا الْمُؤْمِنُونَ الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا بِاللَّهِ وَرَسُولِهِ وَإِذَا كَانُوا مَعَهُ عَلَىٰ أَمْرٍ جَامِعٍ لَمْ يَذْهَبُوا حَتَّىٰ يَسْتَأْذِنُوهُ ۚ إِنَّ الَّذِينَ يَسْتَأْذِنُونَكَ أُولَٰئِكَ الَّذِينَ يُؤْمِنُونَ بِاللَّهِ وَرَسُولِهِ ۚ فَإِذَا اسْتَأْذَنُوكَ لِبَعْضِ شَأْنِهِمْ فَأْذَنْ لِمَنْ شِئْتَ مِنْهُمْ وَاسْتَغْفِرْ لَهُمُ اللَّهَ ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ غَفُورٌ رَحِيمٌ

translation: Do not consider the Messenger’s summons to you as your summons to one another[37]. Allah surely knows those of you who slip away hiding behind others. So let those who disobey his command beware lest some trial[38] may afflict them or they may be afflicted with a painful punishment.
footnotes:
[37] i.e., Do not call him, ‘O Muhammad.’ Rather, call him, ‘O Prophet.’
 [38] i.e., affliction, strife, dissension, etc.
arabic: لَا تَجْعَلُوا دُعَاءَ الرَّسُولِ بَيْنَكُمْ كَدُعَاءِ بَعْضِكُمْ بَعْضًا ۚ قَدْ يَعْلَمُ اللَّهُ الَّذِينَ يَتَسَلَّلُونَ مِنْكُمْ لِوَاذًا ۚ فَلْيَحْذَرِ الَّذِينَ يُخَالِفُونَ عَنْ أَمْرِهِ أَنْ تُصِيبَهُمْ فِتْنَةٌ أَوْ يُصِيبَهُمْ عَذَابٌ أَلِيمٌ

translation: Surely to Allah belongs all that is in the heavens and earth. He knows all what you do[39]. On the Day they return to Him, He will inform them of what they did. And Allah is All-Knowing of everything.
footnotes: [39] i.e., whether you are sincere in your faith and deeds or not.
arabic: أَلَا إِنَّ لِلَّهِ مَا فِي السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ ۖ قَدْ يَعْلَمُ مَا أَنْتُمْ عَلَيْهِ وَيَوْمَ يُرْجَعُونَ إِلَيْهِ فَيُنَبِّئُهُمْ بِمَا عَمِلُوا ۗ وَاللَّهُ بِكُلِّ شَيْءٍ عَلِيمٌ

translation: Blessed is the One Who has sent down the Criterion to His slave, so that he may be a warner to the worlds[1],
footnotes: [1] i.e., both men and jinn.
arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ تَبَارَكَ الَّذِي نَزَّلَ الْفُرْقَانَ عَلَىٰ عَبْدِهِ لِيَكُونَ لِلْعَالَمِينَ نَذِيرًا

translation: He to Whom belongs the dominion of the heavens and earth, Who has never begotten a son, and has no partner in His dominion. He has created everything and measured it precisely.
arabic: الَّذِي لَهُ مُلْكُ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ وَلَمْ يَتَّخِذْ وَلَدًا وَلَمْ يَكُنْ لَهُ شَرِيكٌ فِي الْمُلْكِ وَخَلَقَ كُلَّ شَيْءٍ فَقَدَّرَهُ تَقْدِيرًا

translation: They have taken besides Him other gods who can create nothing but are themselves created. Nor do they have the power to harm or benefit themselves, nor do they have the power to cause death, give life or resurrect the dead.
arabic: وَاتَّخَذُوا مِنْ دُونِهِ آلِهَةً لَا يَخْلُقُونَ شَيْئًا وَهُمْ يُخْلَقُونَ وَلَا يَمْلِكُونَ لِأَنْفُسِهِمْ ضَرًّا وَلَا نَفْعًا وَلَا يَمْلِكُونَ مَوْتًا وَلَا حَيَاةً وَلَا نُشُورًا

translation: Those who disbelieve say, “This [Qur’an] is nothing but a lie which he has fabricated, with the help of other people.” What they claim is totally unjust and false.
arabic: وَقَالَ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا إِنْ هَٰذَا إِلَّا إِفْكٌ افْتَرَاهُ وَأَعَانَهُ عَلَيْهِ قَوْمٌ آخَرُونَ ۖ فَقَدْ جَاءُوا ظُلْمًا وَزُورًا

translation: And they say, “Ancient fables which he has written down; they are dictated to him morning and evening.”
arabic: وَقَالُوا أَسَاطِيرُ الْأَوَّلِينَ اكْتَتَبَهَا فَهِيَ تُمْلَىٰ عَلَيْهِ بُكْرَةً وَأَصِيلًا

translation: Say, “It has been sent down by the One Who knows the secrets of the heavens and earth. He is All-Forgiving, Most Merciful.”
arabic: قُلْ أَنْزَلَهُ الَّذِي يَعْلَمُ السِّرَّ فِي السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ ۚ إِنَّهُ كَانَ غَفُورًا رَحِيمًا

translation: And they say, “What kind of messenger is this who eats food and walks in the markets?[2] If only an angel had been sent down to him to be a warner with him,
footnotes: [2] i.e., He is just a human being like us.
arabic: وَقَالُوا مَالِ هَٰذَا الرَّسُولِ يَأْكُلُ الطَّعَامَ وَيَمْشِي فِي الْأَسْوَاقِ ۙ لَوْلَا أُنْزِلَ إِلَيْهِ مَلَكٌ فَيَكُونَ مَعَهُ نَذِيرًا

translation: or a treasure had been cast down to him, or he had a garden to eat from it.” The wrongdoers say, “You are following none but a bewitched man.”
arabic: أَوْ يُلْقَىٰ إِلَيْهِ كَنْزٌ أَوْ تَكُونُ لَهُ جَنَّةٌ يَأْكُلُ مِنْهَا ۚ وَقَالَ الظَّالِمُونَ إِنْ تَتَّبِعُونَ إِلَّا رَجُلًا مَسْحُورًا

translation: See how they call you names[3]. Thus they have gone astray and cannot find a way.
footnotes: [3] Such as a magician, a poet, a liar, a madman, and a bewitched.
arabic: انْظُرْ كَيْفَ ضَرَبُوا لَكَ الْأَمْثَالَ فَضَلُّوا فَلَا يَسْتَطِيعُونَ سَبِيلًا

translation: Blessed is He Who, if He wills, could give you better than that: gardens under which rivers flow, and could give you palaces.
arabic: تَبَارَكَ الَّذِي إِنْ شَاءَ جَعَلَ لَكَ خَيْرًا مِنْ ذَٰلِكَ جَنَّاتٍ تَجْرِي مِنْ تَحْتِهَا الْأَنْهَارُ وَيَجْعَلْ لَكَ قُصُورًا

translation: But they deny the Hour, and We have prepared for those who deny the Hour[4] a Blazing Fire.
footnotes: [4] i.e., the Resurrection Day.
arabic: بَلْ كَذَّبُوا بِالسَّاعَةِ ۖ وَأَعْتَدْنَا لِمَنْ كَذَّبَ بِالسَّاعَةِ سَعِيرًا

translation: When it sees them from a far distance, they will hear its raging and roaring.
arabic: إِذَا رَأَتْهُمْ مِنْ مَكَانٍ بَعِيدٍ سَمِعُوا لَهَا تَغَيُّظًا وَزَفِيرًا

translation: And when they are thrown into a narrow space therein, chained together, they will cry out for death.
arabic: وَإِذَا أُلْقُوا مِنْهَا مَكَانًا ضَيِّقًا مُقَرَّنِينَ دَعَوْا هُنَالِكَ ثُبُورًا

translation: Do not cry out this Day for death only once, but cry out many times.”
arabic: لَا تَدْعُوا الْيَوْمَ ثُبُورًا وَاحِدًا وَادْعُوا ثُبُورًا كَثِيرًا

translation: Say, “Is that better or the Eternal Paradise which has been promised to the righteous?” It will be as a reward for them and as a final destination.
arabic: قُلْ أَذَٰلِكَ خَيْرٌ أَمْ جَنَّةُ الْخُلْدِ الَّتِي وُعِدَ الْمُتَّقُونَ ۚ كَانَتْ لَهُمْ جَزَاءً وَمَصِيرًا

translation: They will have there whatever they wish for, abiding therein forever. That is a promise that your Lord has taken upon Himself.”
arabic: لَهُمْ فِيهَا مَا يَشَاءُونَ خَالِدِينَ ۚ كَانَ عَلَىٰ رَبِّكَ وَعْدًا مَسْئُولًا

translation: On the Day when He will gather them along with those whom they worshiped besides Allah[5], He will say, “Did you mislead these slaves of Mine, or did they stray from the right way on their own?”
footnotes: [5] i.e., Jesus, angels, pious men, saints, etc.
arabic: وَيَوْمَ يَحْشُرُهُمْ وَمَا يَعْبُدُونَ مِنْ دُونِ اللَّهِ فَيَقُولُ أَأَنْتُمْ أَضْلَلْتُمْ عِبَادِي هَٰؤُلَاءِ أَمْ هُمْ ضَلُّوا السَّبِيلَ

translation: They will say, “Glory be to You! It was not for us to take besides You any guardians. But You provided for them and their forefathers pleasures, until they forgot the message, for they were a ruined people.”
arabic: قَالُوا سُبْحَانَكَ مَا كَانَ يَنْبَغِي لَنَا أَنْ نَتَّخِذَ مِنْ دُونِكَ مِنْ أَوْلِيَاءَ وَلَٰكِنْ مَتَّعْتَهُمْ وَآبَاءَهُمْ حَتَّىٰ نَسُوا الذِّكْرَ وَكَانُوا قَوْمًا بُورًا

translation: Thus they will deny all what you say[6], so you cannot avert [punishment] nor can you get any help. Whoever among you does wrong[7], We will make him taste a great punishment.
footnotes:
[6] i.e., False gods will deny their worshipers on the Day of Judgment.
 [7] i.e., associate partners with Allah.
arabic: فَقَدْ كَذَّبُوكُمْ بِمَا تَقُولُونَ فَمَا تَسْتَطِيعُونَ صَرْفًا وَلَا نَصْرًا ۚ وَمَنْ يَظْلِمْ مِنْكُمْ نُذِقْهُ عَذَابًا كَبِيرًا

translation: We did not send any messengers before you [O Prophet] except that they ate food and walked in the markets. We have made some of you as a trial for others. Will you have patience? For your Lord is All-Seeing.
arabic: وَمَا أَرْسَلْنَا قَبْلَكَ مِنَ الْمُرْسَلِينَ إِلَّا إِنَّهُمْ لَيَأْكُلُونَ الطَّعَامَ وَيَمْشُونَ فِي الْأَسْوَاقِ ۗ وَجَعَلْنَا بَعْضَكُمْ لِبَعْضٍ فِتْنَةً أَتَصْبِرُونَ ۗ وَكَانَ رَبُّكَ بَصِيرًا

translation: Those who do not expect to meet Us say, “Why are angels not sent down to us or why do we not see our Lord?” They have been too proud of themselves, and have transgressed immensely.
arabic: ۞ وَقَالَ الَّذِينَ لَا يَرْجُونَ لِقَاءَنَا لَوْلَا أُنْزِلَ عَلَيْنَا الْمَلَائِكَةُ أَوْ نَرَىٰ رَبَّنَا ۗ لَقَدِ اسْتَكْبَرُوا فِي أَنْفُسِهِمْ وَعَتَوْا عُتُوًّا كَبِيرًا

translation: On the Day when they see the angels[8], there will be no glad tidings for the wicked, and [the angels] will say, “Absolutely forbidden for you[9].”
footnotes: [8] i.e., upon death, after death, upon resurrection, etc. [9] Referring to all good things.
arabic: يَوْمَ يَرَوْنَ الْمَلَائِكَةَ لَا بُشْرَىٰ يَوْمَئِذٍ لِلْمُجْرِمِينَ وَيَقُولُونَ حِجْرًا مَحْجُورًا

translation: We will turn to whatever deeds they did and turn them into scattered dust[10].
footnotes: [10] Good deeds of the disbelievers will be of no avail to them on Judgment Day, such as charity, due to their disbelief and denial of the afterlife.
arabic: وَقَدِمْنَا إِلَىٰ مَا عَمِلُوا مِنْ عَمَلٍ فَجَعَلْنَاهُ هَبَاءً مَنْثُورًا

translation: On that Day the people of Paradise will have the best abode and the finest resting place.
arabic: أَصْحَابُ الْجَنَّةِ يَوْمَئِذٍ خَيْرٌ مُسْتَقَرًّا وَأَحْسَنُ مَقِيلًا

translation: On the Day when the sky will split asunder with clouds, and the angels will be sent down in succession.
arabic: وَيَوْمَ تَشَقَّقُ السَّمَاءُ بِالْغَمَامِ وَنُزِّلَ الْمَلَائِكَةُ تَنْزِيلًا

translation: The true dominion on that Day belongs to the Most Compassionate[11], and it will be a hard day for the disbelievers.
footnotes: [11] On Judgment Day the whole authority will be for Allah alone; whereas, in this world, Allah gave some authority to kings, rulers, etc.
arabic: الْمُلْكُ يَوْمَئِذٍ الْحَقُّ لِلرَّحْمَٰنِ ۚ وَكَانَ يَوْمًا عَلَى الْكَافِرِينَ عَسِيرًا

translation: On that Day, the wrongdoer will bite his hands saying, “Would that I had taken a way with the Messenger[12]!
footnotes: [12] i.e., followed the Prophet (ﷺ).
arabic: وَيَوْمَ يَعَضُّ الظَّالِمُ عَلَىٰ يَدَيْهِ يَقُولُ يَا لَيْتَنِي اتَّخَذْتُ مَعَ الرَّسُولِ سَبِيلًا

translation: Woe to me! Would that I had not taken so-and-so[13] as a close friend!
footnotes: [13] i.e., the one who misguided him.
arabic: يَا وَيْلَتَىٰ لَيْتَنِي لَمْ أَتَّخِذْ فُلَانًا خَلِيلًا

translation: He led me astray from the Reminder[14] after it had come to me.” Satan always betrays man[15].
footnotes: [14] i.e., the Qur’an or Allah’s remembrance. [15] Forsakes him after leading him into evil.
arabic: لَقَدْ أَضَلَّنِي عَنِ الذِّكْرِ بَعْدَ إِذْ جَاءَنِي ۗ وَكَانَ الشَّيْطَانُ لِلْإِنْسَانِ خَذُولًا

translation: The Messenger said, “O my Lord, my people have taken this Qur’an as a thing to be abandoned[16].”
footnotes: [16] i.e., not reading it; not listening to it; not understanding it; not living by it; not conveying it to others; preferring something else to it, etc.
arabic: وَقَالَ الرَّسُولُ يَا رَبِّ إِنَّ قَوْمِي اتَّخَذُوا هَٰذَا الْقُرْآنَ مَهْجُورًا

translation: Thus did we assign for every prophet an enemy from among the wicked, but your Lord is sufficient as a Guide and Helper.
arabic: وَكَذَٰلِكَ جَعَلْنَا لِكُلِّ نَبِيٍّ عَدُوًّا مِنَ الْمُجْرِمِينَ ۗ وَكَفَىٰ بِرَبِّكَ هَادِيًا وَنَصِيرًا

translation: Those who disbelieve say, “Why was the Qur’an not sent down to him all at once?” [We sent it] in this way so that We may strengthen your heart thereby, and We have revealed it in a gradual manner.
arabic: وَقَالَ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا لَوْلَا نُزِّلَ عَلَيْهِ الْقُرْآنُ جُمْلَةً وَاحِدَةً ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ لِنُثَبِّتَ بِهِ فُؤَادَكَ ۖ وَرَتَّلْنَاهُ تَرْتِيلًا

translation: Whenever they bring you an argument, We bring you the truth and the best explanation.
arabic: وَلَا يَأْتُونَكَ بِمَثَلٍ إِلَّا جِئْنَاكَ بِالْحَقِّ وَأَحْسَنَ تَفْسِيرًا

translation: Those who will be dragged on their faces to Hell – they will be in the worst position and farthest astray from the right path.
arabic: الَّذِينَ يُحْشَرُونَ عَلَىٰ وُجُوهِهِمْ إِلَىٰ جَهَنَّمَ أُولَٰئِكَ شَرٌّ مَكَانًا وَأَضَلُّ سَبِيلًا

translation: We gave Moses the Scripture and appointed along with him his brother Aaron as a helper.
arabic: وَلَقَدْ آتَيْنَا مُوسَى الْكِتَابَ وَجَعَلْنَا مَعَهُ أَخَاهُ هَارُونَ وَزِيرًا

translation: We said, “Go, both of you, to the people who have rejected Our signs[17].” Then We destroyed them utterly.
footnotes: [17] i.e., the divine teachings reached them through Prophet Jacob and Joseph, and the righteous people of Israel.
arabic: فَقُلْنَا اذْهَبَا إِلَى الْقَوْمِ الَّذِينَ كَذَّبُوا بِآيَاتِنَا فَدَمَّرْنَاهُمْ تَدْمِيرًا

translation: Also the people of Noah, when they rejected the messengers[18], We drowned them and made them an example for mankind. And We have prepared for the wrongdoers a painful punishment.
footnotes: [18] Denial of Noah was equal to denying all of Allah’s messengers.
arabic: وَقَوْمَ نُوحٍ لَمَّا كَذَّبُوا الرُّسُلَ أَغْرَقْنَاهُمْ وَجَعَلْنَاهُمْ لِلنَّاسِ آيَةً ۖ وَأَعْتَدْنَا لِلظَّالِمِينَ عَذَابًا أَلِيمًا

translation: Also [We destroyed] ‘Ād and Thamūd, and the people of the Well[19], and many generations between them.
footnotes: [19] i.e., people of prophet Shuʿayb, or those mentioned in Surah Yā Sīn (36:13-29), or a tribe of Thamūd, etc. Rass (lit., well); for they killed their prophet by throwing him into or hanging him down an old or dry well. (Well)
arabic: وَعَادًا وَثَمُودَ وَأَصْحَابَ الرَّسِّ وَقُرُونًا بَيْنَ ذَٰلِكَ كَثِيرًا

translation: To each We gave examples [of the previous nations], and each We destroyed completely.
arabic: وَكُلًّا ضَرَبْنَا لَهُ الْأَمْثَالَ ۖ وَكُلًّا تَبَّرْنَا تَتْبِيرًا

translation: They have surely passed by the town[20] that was destroyed by a terrible rain [of stones]. Have they not seen it? But they do not expect to be resurrected[21].
footnotes:
[20] i.e., the city of Sodom; the people of Prophet Lot.
 [21] So they do not take lessons from the doom of the past nations.
arabic: وَلَقَدْ أَتَوْا عَلَى الْقَرْيَةِ الَّتِي أُمْطِرَتْ مَطَرَ السَّوْءِ ۚ أَفَلَمْ يَكُونُوا يَرَوْنَهَا ۚ بَلْ كَانُوا لَا يَرْجُونَ نُشُورًا

translation: When they see you [O Prophet], they only ridicule you, “Is this the one whom Allah has sent as a messenger?
arabic: وَإِذَا رَأَوْكَ إِنْ يَتَّخِذُونَكَ إِلَّا هُزُوًا أَهَٰذَا الَّذِي بَعَثَ اللَّهُ رَسُولًا

translation: He would have almost led us astray from our gods if we had not been so devoted to them.” But when they see the punishment, they will come to know who is further astray from the right way.
arabic: إِنْ كَادَ لَيُضِلُّنَا عَنْ آلِهَتِنَا لَوْلَا أَنْ صَبَرْنَا عَلَيْهَا ۚ وَسَوْفَ يَعْلَمُونَ حِينَ يَرَوْنَ الْعَذَابَ مَنْ أَضَلُّ سَبِيلًا

translation: Have you [O Prophet] seen the one who takes his desire as his god, will you then be a keeper over him?
arabic: أَرَأَيْتَ مَنِ اتَّخَذَ إِلَٰهَهُ هَوَاهُ أَفَأَنْتَ تَكُونُ عَلَيْهِ وَكِيلًا

translation: Do you think that most of them hear or understand?[22] They are just like cattle[23], rather they are further astray from the right way.
footnotes:
[22] They follow others blindly.
 [23] i.e., like livestock or sheep, that follow without asking wherever they are led.
arabic: أَمْ تَحْسَبُ أَنَّ أَكْثَرَهُمْ يَسْمَعُونَ أَوْ يَعْقِلُونَ ۚ إِنْ هُمْ إِلَّا كَالْأَنْعَامِ ۖ بَلْ هُمْ أَضَلُّ سَبِيلًا

translation: Do you not see how your Lord extends the shade? If He had willed, He could have made it still. Then We made the sun an indication of it[24].
footnotes: [24] i.e., indication for its existence or making it apparent.
arabic: أَلَمْ تَرَ إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ كَيْفَ مَدَّ الظِّلَّ وَلَوْ شَاءَ لَجَعَلَهُ سَاكِنًا ثُمَّ جَعَلْنَا الشَّمْسَ عَلَيْهِ دَلِيلًا

translation: Then We gradually draw it towards Us [i.e., Then the sun climbs up]?
arabic: ثُمَّ قَبَضْنَاهُ إِلَيْنَا قَبْضًا يَسِيرًا

translation: It is He Who has made the night as a garment[25] for you, and made sleep for rest; and has made daytime for returning to life[26].
footnotes:
[25] It covers you in darkness and provides rest.
 [26] To return to your livelihood and activity.
arabic: وَهُوَ الَّذِي جَعَلَ لَكُمُ اللَّيْلَ لِبَاسًا وَالنَّوْمَ سُبَاتًا وَجَعَلَ النَّهَارَ نُشُورًا

translation: It is He Who sends the winds as harbingers before His mercy, and We send down from the sky pure water,
arabic: وَهُوَ الَّذِي أَرْسَلَ الرِّيَاحَ بُشْرًا بَيْنَ يَدَيْ رَحْمَتِهِ ۚ وَأَنْزَلْنَا مِنَ السَّمَاءِ مَاءً طَهُورًا

translation: so that We may revive therewith a dead land, and quench the thirst of countless beasts and humans We have created.
arabic: لِنُحْيِيَ بِهِ بَلْدَةً مَيْتًا وَنُسْقِيَهُ مِمَّا خَلَقْنَا أَنْعَامًا وَأَنَاسِيَّ كَثِيرًا

translation: We distribute it among them so that they may take heed[27], but most people persist in their ingratitude.
footnotes: [27] Such as Allah’s ability to bring the dead to life.
arabic: وَلَقَدْ صَرَّفْنَاهُ بَيْنَهُمْ لِيَذَّكَّرُوا فَأَبَىٰ أَكْثَرُ النَّاسِ إِلَّا كُفُورًا

translation: If We had willed, We could have sent to each town a warner[28].
footnotes: [28] But instead, Allah sent Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) as the final messenger for all people.
arabic: وَلَوْ شِئْنَا لَبَعَثْنَا فِي كُلِّ قَرْيَةٍ نَذِيرًا

translation: So do not obey the disbelievers, but strive against them with this [Qur’an] a great striving.
arabic: فَلَا تُطِعِ الْكَافِرِينَ وَجَاهِدْهُمْ بِهِ جِهَادًا كَبِيرًا

translation: It is He Who merges the two bodies of water: one fresh and palatable and the other salty and bitter, and He has made between them a barrier and an insurmountable partition[29].
footnotes: [29] When salt and fresh waters meet, although both mix together, each still keeps its distinctive qualities, as if a barrier prevents them from mixing completely.
arabic: ۞ وَهُوَ الَّذِي مَرَجَ الْبَحْرَيْنِ هَٰذَا عَذْبٌ فُرَاتٌ وَهَٰذَا مِلْحٌ أُجَاجٌ وَجَعَلَ بَيْنَهُمَا بَرْزَخًا وَحِجْرًا مَحْجُورًا

translation: It is He Who created human beings from water[30], then made between them bonds of kinship and marriage, for your Lord is Most Capable.
footnotes: [30] i.e., the zygote (the mixture of sperm and egg).
arabic: وَهُوَ الَّذِي خَلَقَ مِنَ الْمَاءِ بَشَرًا فَجَعَلَهُ نَسَبًا وَصِهْرًا ۗ وَكَانَ رَبُّكَ قَدِيرًا

translation: Yet they worship besides Allah that which can neither benefit nor harm them; the disbeliever always collaborates against his Lord[31].
footnotes: [31] i.e., helping and defending those who rebel against Allah.
arabic: وَيَعْبُدُونَ مِنْ دُونِ اللَّهِ مَا لَا يَنْفَعُهُمْ وَلَا يَضُرُّهُمْ ۗ وَكَانَ الْكَافِرُ عَلَىٰ رَبِّهِ ظَهِيرًا

translation: We have not sent you [O Prophet] except as a bearer of glad tidings and a warner.
arabic: وَمَا أَرْسَلْنَاكَ إِلَّا مُبَشِّرًا وَنَذِيرًا

translation: Say, “I do not ask you for any reward for it, except that anyone who wishes to take a path to his Lord[32].”
footnotes: [32] By spending in the way of Allah.
arabic: قُلْ مَا أَسْأَلُكُمْ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ أَجْرٍ إِلَّا مَنْ شَاءَ أَنْ يَتَّخِذَ إِلَىٰ رَبِّهِ سَبِيلًا

translation: Put your trust in the Ever-Living Who never dies, and glorify Him with praise. He is Sufficient as All-Aware of the sins of His slaves –
arabic: وَتَوَكَّلْ عَلَى الْحَيِّ الَّذِي لَا يَمُوتُ وَسَبِّحْ بِحَمْدِهِ ۚ وَكَفَىٰ بِهِ بِذُنُوبِ عِبَادِهِ خَبِيرًا

translation: it is He Who created the heavens and earth and all that is between them in six Days[33], then rose over the Throne[34]. He is the Most Compassionate, so ask about Him the One Who is All-Aware.
footnotes:
[33] The "six Days" does not necessarily mean six 24 hours of time; for a heavenly Day is 1,000 years of our time. (see 22:47), whereas the Day of Judgment will be 50,000 years of our time (see 70:4). Hence, its duration is only known to Allah.
 [34] See footnote 7:54.
arabic: الَّذِي خَلَقَ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضَ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا فِي سِتَّةِ أَيَّامٍ ثُمَّ اسْتَوَىٰ عَلَى الْعَرْشِ ۚ الرَّحْمَٰنُ فَاسْأَلْ بِهِ خَبِيرًا

translation: When it is said to them, “Prostrate to the Most Compassionate,” they say, “What is ‘the Most Compassionate?’ Shall we prostrate to what you order us?” And it only increases their aversion.
arabic: وَإِذَا قِيلَ لَهُمُ اسْجُدُوا لِلرَّحْمَٰنِ قَالُوا وَمَا الرَّحْمَٰنُ أَنَسْجُدُ لِمَا تَأْمُرُنَا وَزَادَهُمْ نُفُورًا ۩

translation: Blessed is He Who placed in the sky constellations and placed therein a radiant lamp[35] and a luminous moon.
footnotes: [35] i.e., the sun.
arabic: تَبَارَكَ الَّذِي جَعَلَ فِي السَّمَاءِ بُرُوجًا وَجَعَلَ فِيهَا سِرَاجًا وَقَمَرًا مُنِيرًا

translation: It is He Who made the night and the day to follow each other so that everyone who wishes may reflect or become grateful.
arabic: وَهُوَ الَّذِي جَعَلَ اللَّيْلَ وَالنَّهَارَ خِلْفَةً لِمَنْ أَرَادَ أَنْ يَذَّكَّرَ أَوْ أَرَادَ شُكُورًا

translation: The slaves of the Most Compassionate are those who walk on earth humbly[36], and when the ignorant address them, they only say words of peace[37];
footnotes: [36] i.e., without arrogance, but with dignity. [37] i.e., words free from evil.
arabic: وَعِبَادُ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الَّذِينَ يَمْشُونَ عَلَى الْأَرْضِ هَوْنًا وَإِذَا خَاطَبَهُمُ الْجَاهِلُونَ قَالُوا سَلَامًا

translation: and those who spend the night prostrating and standing before their Lord;
arabic: وَالَّذِينَ يَبِيتُونَ لِرَبِّهِمْ سُجَّدًا وَقِيَامًا

translation: and those who say, “Our Lord, turn the punishment of Hell away from us, for its punishment is unrelenting[38].”
footnotes: [38] i.e., ever adhering.
arabic: وَالَّذِينَ يَقُولُونَ رَبَّنَا اصْرِفْ عَنَّا عَذَابَ جَهَنَّمَ ۖ إِنَّ عَذَابَهَا كَانَ غَرَامًا

translation: It is an evil place to settle and an evil abode.”
arabic: إِنَّهَا سَاءَتْ مُسْتَقَرًّا وَمُقَامًا

translation: And those who neither spend wastefully nor stingily, but are moderate between them;
arabic: وَالَّذِينَ إِذَا أَنْفَقُوا لَمْ يُسْرِفُوا وَلَمْ يَقْتُرُوا وَكَانَ بَيْنَ ذَٰلِكَ قَوَامًا

translation: and those who do not invoke besides Allah another god, and who do not kill a soul whom Allah has forbidden, except in the course of justice, and who do not commit adultery, for whoever does any of this will face the penalty,
arabic: وَالَّذِينَ لَا يَدْعُونَ مَعَ اللَّهِ إِلَٰهًا آخَرَ وَلَا يَقْتُلُونَ النَّفْسَ الَّتِي حَرَّمَ اللَّهُ إِلَّا بِالْحَقِّ وَلَا يَزْنُونَ ۚ وَمَنْ يَفْعَلْ ذَٰلِكَ يَلْقَ أَثَامًا

translation: the punishment will be doubled for him on the Day of Resurrection, wherein he will remain disgraced forever,
arabic: يُضَاعَفْ لَهُ الْعَذَابُ يَوْمَ الْقِيَامَةِ وَيَخْلُدْ فِيهِ مُهَانًا

translation: except those who repent and believe, and do righteous deeds; for them Allah will change their evil deeds into good deeds, for Allah is All-Forgiving, Most Merciful.
arabic: إِلَّا مَنْ تَابَ وَآمَنَ وَعَمِلَ عَمَلًا صَالِحًا فَأُولَٰئِكَ يُبَدِّلُ اللَّهُ سَيِّئَاتِهِمْ حَسَنَاتٍ ۗ وَكَانَ اللَّهُ غَفُورًا رَحِيمًا

translation: Whoever repents and does righteous deeds has turned to Allah with sincere repentance.
arabic: وَمَنْ تَابَ وَعَمِلَ صَالِحًا فَإِنَّهُ يَتُوبُ إِلَى اللَّهِ مَتَابًا

translation: And those who do not witness falsehood[39], and when they pass by futility, they pass by with dignity;
footnotes: [39] i.e., places of sin, evil, and indecency.
arabic: وَالَّذِينَ لَا يَشْهَدُونَ الزُّورَ وَإِذَا مَرُّوا بِاللَّغْوِ مَرُّوا كِرَامًا

translation: and those who, when they are reminded of the verses of their Lord, they do not turn a deaf ear or a blind eye to them;
arabic: وَالَّذِينَ إِذَا ذُكِّرُوا بِآيَاتِ رَبِّهِمْ لَمْ يَخِرُّوا عَلَيْهَا صُمًّا وَعُمْيَانًا

translation: and those who say, “Our Lord, let our spouses and children be a source of joy for us[40], and make us good examples for the righteous.”
footnotes: [40] i.e., a source of happiness for their righteousness and adhering to a straight path.
arabic: وَالَّذِينَ يَقُولُونَ رَبَّنَا هَبْ لَنَا مِنْ أَزْوَاجِنَا وَذُرِّيَّاتِنَا قُرَّةَ أَعْيُنٍ وَاجْعَلْنَا لِلْمُتَّقِينَ إِمَامًا

translation: It is they who will be rewarded with high palaces [in Paradise] for their perseverance, and they will be received therein with salutations and greetings of peace,
arabic: أُولَٰئِكَ يُجْزَوْنَ الْغُرْفَةَ بِمَا صَبَرُوا وَيُلَقَّوْنَ فِيهَا تَحِيَّةً وَسَلَامًا

translation: abiding therein forever. What an excellent abode and a resting place!
arabic: خَالِدِينَ فِيهَا ۚ حَسُنَتْ مُسْتَقَرًّا وَمُقَامًا

translation: Say [O Prophet], “My Lord would not care at all about you, were it not for your supplication[41]. Now since you have rejected [the truth], the inevitable is bound to come[42].”
footnotes:
[41] i.e., faith and worship.
 [42] Or it will be adhering to you.
arabic: قُلْ مَا يَعْبَأُ بِكُمْ رَبِّي لَوْلَا دُعَاؤُكُمْ ۖ فَقَدْ كَذَّبْتُمْ فَسَوْفَ يَكُونُ لِزَامًا

translation: Tā sīn mīm.[1]
footnotes: [1] See footnote 2:1.
arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ طسم

translation: These are the verses of the clear Book.
arabic: تِلْكَ آيَاتُ الْكِتَابِ الْمُبِينِ

translation: Perhaps you[2] will grieve yourself to death because they do not believe.
footnotes: [2] O Muhammad.
arabic: لَعَلَّكَ بَاخِعٌ نَفْسَكَ أَلَّا يَكُونُوا مُؤْمِنِينَ

translation: If We willed, We could send down upon them a sign from the heaven, at which their necks would stay bowed in humility[3].
footnotes: [3] i.e., they would be compelled to believe, being humbled.
arabic: إِنْ نَشَأْ نُنَزِّلْ عَلَيْهِمْ مِنَ السَّمَاءِ آيَةً فَظَلَّتْ أَعْنَاقُهُمْ لَهَا خَاضِعِينَ

translation: No new reminder comes to them from the Most Compassionate except that they turn away from it.
arabic: وَمَا يَأْتِيهِمْ مِنْ ذِكْرٍ مِنَ الرَّحْمَٰنِ مُحْدَثٍ إِلَّا كَانُوا عَنْهُ مُعْرِضِينَ

translation: They have rejected [the Truth], soon there will come to them the consequences of their ridicule.
arabic: فَقَدْ كَذَّبُوا فَسَيَأْتِيهِمْ أَنْبَاءُ مَا كَانُوا بِهِ يَسْتَهْزِئُونَ

translation: Do they not see the earth, how many fine kinds of plants We grow in it?
arabic: أَوَلَمْ يَرَوْا إِلَى الْأَرْضِ كَمْ أَنْبَتْنَا فِيهَا مِنْ كُلِّ زَوْجٍ كَرِيمٍ

translation: Indeed, there is a sign in this, yet most of them will not believe.
arabic: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَآيَةً ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُمْ مُؤْمِنِينَ

translation: Your Lord is indeed the All-Mighty, the Most Merciful.
arabic: وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَهُوَ الْعَزِيزُ الرَّحِيمُ

translation: And [remember] when your Lord called out to Moses, “Go to the wrongdoing people –
arabic: وَإِذْ نَادَىٰ رَبُّكَ مُوسَىٰ أَنِ ائْتِ الْقَوْمَ الظَّالِمِينَ

translation: the people of Pharaoh; will they not fear [the punishment of] Allah?”
arabic: قَوْمَ فِرْعَوْنَ ۚ أَلَا يَتَّقُونَ

translation: He said, “My Lord, I fear that they may reject me,
arabic: قَالَ رَبِّ إِنِّي أَخَافُ أَنْ يُكَذِّبُونِ

translation: and I will feel distressed and my tongue will not be fluent, so send Aaron along [to help me].
arabic: وَيَضِيقُ صَدْرِي وَلَا يَنْطَلِقُ لِسَانِي فَأَرْسِلْ إِلَىٰ هَارُونَ

translation: Moreover, they have a charge against me, so I fear they may kill me[4].”
footnotes: [4] For killing a Coptic Egyptian by mistake before becoming a prophet.
arabic: وَلَهُمْ عَلَيَّ ذَنْبٌ فَأَخَافُ أَنْ يَقْتُلُونِ

translation: Allah said, “Certainly not! Go, both of you, with Our signs[5]; We are with you, listening.
footnotes: [5] i.e., the miracles of the staff and the shining hand, given to Moses.
arabic: قَالَ كَلَّا ۖ فَاذْهَبَا بِآيَاتِنَا ۖ إِنَّا مَعَكُمْ مُسْتَمِعُونَ

translation: Go to Pharaoh and say, ‘We are the messengers[6] from the Lord of the worlds,
footnotes: [6] The singular form in Arabic denotes that they both were sent with a single message.
arabic: فَأْتِيَا فِرْعَوْنَ فَقُولَا إِنَّا رَسُولُ رَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ

translation: that you let the Children of Israel go with us.’”
arabic: أَنْ أَرْسِلْ مَعَنَا بَنِي إِسْرَائِيلَ

translation: Pharaoh said, “Did we not bring you up as a child among us, and you stayed with us several years of your life?
arabic: قَالَ أَلَمْ نُرَبِّكَ فِينَا وَلِيدًا وَلَبِثْتَ فِينَا مِنْ عُمُرِكَ سِنِينَ

translation: Yet you did what you did[7], and you are extremely ungrateful.”
footnotes: [7] i.e., striking the Copt in support of a man from your people, who died as a result.
arabic: وَفَعَلْتَ فَعْلَتَكَ الَّتِي فَعَلْتَ وَأَنْتَ مِنَ الْكَافِرِينَ

translation: He said, “I did it when I had no guidance.
arabic: قَالَ فَعَلْتُهَا إِذًا وَأَنَا مِنَ الضَّالِّينَ

translation: So I fled from you in fear. Then my Lord gave me wisdom and made me one of the messengers.
arabic: فَفَرَرْتُ مِنْكُمْ لَمَّا خِفْتُكُمْ فَوَهَبَ لِي رَبِّي حُكْمًا وَجَعَلَنِي مِنَ الْمُرْسَلِينَ

translation: Is this a favor that you remind me with, that you have enslaved the Children of Israel?[8]
footnotes: [8] i.e., If you had not been cruel to the Israelites, I should not have been brought to your house for upbringing.
arabic: وَتِلْكَ نِعْمَةٌ تَمُنُّهَا عَلَيَّ أَنْ عَبَّدْتَ بَنِي إِسْرَائِيلَ

translation: Pharaoh said, “What is ‘the Lord of the worlds’?”
arabic: قَالَ فِرْعَوْنُ وَمَا رَبُّ الْعَالَمِينَ

translation: Moses said, “The Lord of the heavens and earth and all that is between them, if only you had sure faith.”
arabic: قَالَ رَبُّ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا ۖ إِنْ كُنْتُمْ مُوقِنِينَ

translation: Pharaoh said to those around him, “Did you hear [what he just said]?”
arabic: قَالَ لِمَنْ حَوْلَهُ أَلَا تَسْتَمِعُونَ

translation: Moses said, “Your Lord and the Lord of your forefathers.”
arabic: قَالَ رَبُّكُمْ وَرَبُّ آبَائِكُمُ الْأَوَّلِينَ

translation: Pharaoh said, “Your messenger who has been sent to you is truly insane!”
arabic: قَالَ إِنَّ رَسُولَكُمُ الَّذِي أُرْسِلَ إِلَيْكُمْ لَمَجْنُونٌ

translation: Moses said, “Lord of the east and west and all that is between them, if only you had sense!”
arabic: قَالَ رَبُّ الْمَشْرِقِ وَالْمَغْرِبِ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا ۖ إِنْ كُنْتُمْ تَعْقِلُونَ

translation: Pharaoh said, “If you take any god other than me, I will throw you into prison.”
arabic: قَالَ لَئِنِ اتَّخَذْتَ إِلَٰهًا غَيْرِي لَأَجْعَلَنَّكَ مِنَ الْمَسْجُونِينَ

translation: Moses said, “What if I bring you a clear proof?”
arabic: قَالَ أَوَلَوْ جِئْتُكَ بِشَيْءٍ مُبِينٍ

translation: Pharaoh said, “Bring it then if you are truthful!”
arabic: قَالَ فَأْتِ بِهِ إِنْ كُنْتَ مِنَ الصَّادِقِينَ

translation: So he threw down his staff, and suddenly it was a real serpent.
arabic: فَأَلْقَىٰ عَصَاهُ فَإِذَا هِيَ ثُعْبَانٌ مُبِينٌ

translation: And he drew out his hand, and it was glowing white to the beholders.
arabic: وَنَزَعَ يَدَهُ فَإِذَا هِيَ بَيْضَاءُ لِلنَّاظِرِينَ

translation: Pharaoh said to the chiefs around him, “This is indeed a learned magician!
arabic: قَالَ لِلْمَلَإِ حَوْلَهُ إِنَّ هَٰذَا لَسَاحِرٌ عَلِيمٌ

translation: He wants to drive you out of your land with his magic. What do you suggest?”
arabic: يُرِيدُ أَنْ يُخْرِجَكُمْ مِنْ أَرْضِكُمْ بِسِحْرِهِ فَمَاذَا تَأْمُرُونَ

translation: They said, “Let him and his brother wait and dispatch heralds to the cities
arabic: قَالُوا أَرْجِهْ وَأَخَاهُ وَابْعَثْ فِي الْمَدَائِنِ حَاشِرِينَ

translation: to bring you every learned magician.”
arabic: يَأْتُوكَ بِكُلِّ سَحَّارٍ عَلِيمٍ

translation: So the magicians were assembled at an appointed time on a known day[9].
footnotes: [9] i.e., the morning of the festival day. See 20:58-59.
arabic: فَجُمِعَ السَّحَرَةُ لِمِيقَاتِ يَوْمٍ مَعْلُومٍ

translation: And it was said to the people, “Will you join the gathering,
arabic: وَقِيلَ لِلنَّاسِ هَلْ أَنْتُمْ مُجْتَمِعُونَ

translation: so that we may follow the magicians, if they are victorious?”
arabic: لَعَلَّنَا نَتَّبِعُ السَّحَرَةَ إِنْ كَانُوا هُمُ الْغَالِبِينَ

translation: When the magicians came, they said to Pharaoh, “Will there be a reward for us if we are victorious?”
arabic: فَلَمَّا جَاءَ السَّحَرَةُ قَالُوا لِفِرْعَوْنَ أَئِنَّ لَنَا لَأَجْرًا إِنْ كُنَّا نَحْنُ الْغَالِبِينَ

translation: He said, “Yes, and then you will surely be of those who are close to me.”
arabic: قَالَ نَعَمْ وَإِنَّكُمْ إِذًا لَمِنَ الْمُقَرَّبِينَ

translation: Moses said to them, “Throw whatever you wish to throw.”
arabic: قَالَ لَهُمْ مُوسَىٰ أَلْقُوا مَا أَنْتُمْ مُلْقُونَ

translation: So they threw their ropes and staffs, and said, “By the glory of Pharaoh, it is we who will be the victorious!”
arabic: فَأَلْقَوْا حِبَالَهُمْ وَعِصِيَّهُمْ وَقَالُوا بِعِزَّةِ فِرْعَوْنَ إِنَّا لَنَحْنُ الْغَالِبُونَ

translation: Then Moses threw his staff, and at once it swallowed up all objects of their illusion.
arabic: فَأَلْقَىٰ مُوسَىٰ عَصَاهُ فَإِذَا هِيَ تَلْقَفُ مَا يَأْفِكُونَ

translation: So the magicians fell down in prostration.
arabic: فَأُلْقِيَ السَّحَرَةُ سَاجِدِينَ

translation: They said, “We believe in the Lord of the worlds,
arabic: قَالُوا آمَنَّا بِرَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ

translation: the Lord of Moses and Aaron.”
arabic: رَبِّ مُوسَىٰ وَهَارُونَ

translation: Pharaoh said, “How dare you believe in him before I give you permission. Indeed, he is your master who taught you magic, but you will soon come to know. I will surely cut off your hands and feet on opposite sides, then I will crucify you all.”
arabic: قَالَ آمَنْتُمْ لَهُ قَبْلَ أَنْ آذَنَ لَكُمْ ۖ إِنَّهُ لَكَبِيرُكُمُ الَّذِي عَلَّمَكُمُ السِّحْرَ فَلَسَوْفَ تَعْلَمُونَ ۚ لَأُقَطِّعَنَّ أَيْدِيَكُمْ وَأَرْجُلَكُمْ مِنْ خِلَافٍ وَلَأُصَلِّبَنَّكُمْ أَجْمَعِينَ

translation: They said, “No harm; we will surely return to our Lord.
arabic: قَالُوا لَا ضَيْرَ ۖ إِنَّا إِلَىٰ رَبِّنَا مُنْقَلِبُونَ

translation: We hope that our Lord will forgive us our sins, as we are the first of the believers.”
arabic: إِنَّا نَطْمَعُ أَنْ يَغْفِرَ لَنَا رَبُّنَا خَطَايَانَا أَنْ كُنَّا أَوَّلَ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ

translation: We inspired Moses, “Leave with My slaves by night; you will surely be pursued.”
arabic: ۞ وَأَوْحَيْنَا إِلَىٰ مُوسَىٰ أَنْ أَسْرِ بِعِبَادِي إِنَّكُمْ مُتَّبَعُونَ

translation: So Pharaoh sent heralds to the cities[10],
footnotes: [10] In order to prevent the emigration of the Children of Israel.
arabic: فَأَرْسَلَ فِرْعَوْنُ فِي الْمَدَائِنِ حَاشِرِينَ

translation: saying, “These are but a small band,
arabic: إِنَّ هَٰؤُلَاءِ لَشِرْذِمَةٌ قَلِيلُونَ

translation: and they have enraged us,
arabic: وَإِنَّهُمْ لَنَا لَغَائِظُونَ

translation: but we are all well-prepared.”
arabic: وَإِنَّا لَجَمِيعٌ حَاذِرُونَ

translation: Thus did We drive them[11] out of their gardens and springs,
footnotes: [11] i.e., Pharaoh and his people.
arabic: فَأَخْرَجْنَاهُمْ مِنْ جَنَّاتٍ وَعُيُونٍ

translation: and their treasures and splendid dwellings.
arabic: وَكُنُوزٍ وَمَقَامٍ كَرِيمٍ

translation: So it was, and We made the Children of Israel to inherit them.
arabic: كَذَٰلِكَ وَأَوْرَثْنَاهَا بَنِي إِسْرَائِيلَ

translation: They pursued them at sunrise.
arabic: فَأَتْبَعُوهُمْ مُشْرِقِينَ

translation: When the two groups saw each other, the companions of Moses said, “We are surely overtaken!”
arabic: فَلَمَّا تَرَاءَى الْجَمْعَانِ قَالَ أَصْحَابُ مُوسَىٰ إِنَّا لَمُدْرَكُونَ

translation: Moses said, “Certainly not! My Lord is with me; He will guide me.”
arabic: قَالَ كَلَّا ۖ إِنَّ مَعِيَ رَبِّي سَيَهْدِينِ

translation: Then We inspired Moses, “Strike the sea with your staff,” so it parted, and each part became like a huge mountain.
arabic: فَأَوْحَيْنَا إِلَىٰ مُوسَىٰ أَنِ اضْرِبْ بِعَصَاكَ الْبَحْرَ ۖ فَانْفَلَقَ فَكَانَ كُلُّ فِرْقٍ كَالطَّوْدِ الْعَظِيمِ

translation: Then We brought the others [i.e., the pursuers] close to that place,
arabic: وَأَزْلَفْنَا ثَمَّ الْآخَرِينَ

translation: and We saved Moses and all those who were with him.
arabic: وَأَنْجَيْنَا مُوسَىٰ وَمَنْ مَعَهُ أَجْمَعِينَ

translation: Then we drowned the others.
arabic: ثُمَّ أَغْرَقْنَا الْآخَرِينَ

translation: Indeed, there is a sign in this, yet most of them would not believe.
arabic: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَآيَةً ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُمْ مُؤْمِنِينَ

translation: Indeed, your Lord is the All-Mighty, the Most Merciful.
arabic: وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَهُوَ الْعَزِيزُ الرَّحِيمُ

translation: Relate to them the story of Abraham,
arabic: وَاتْلُ عَلَيْهِمْ نَبَأَ إِبْرَاهِيمَ

translation: when he said to his father and his people, “What do you worship?”
arabic: إِذْ قَالَ لِأَبِيهِ وَقَوْمِهِ مَا تَعْبُدُونَ

translation: They said, “We worship idols and remain devoted to them.”
arabic: قَالُوا نَعْبُدُ أَصْنَامًا فَنَظَلُّ لَهَا عَاكِفِينَ

translation: He said, “Do they hear you when you call upon them?
arabic: قَالَ هَلْ يَسْمَعُونَكُمْ إِذْ تَدْعُونَ

translation: Or can they benefit or harm you?”
arabic: أَوْ يَنْفَعُونَكُمْ أَوْ يَضُرُّونَ

translation: They said, “No, but this is what we found our forefathers doing.”
arabic: قَالُوا بَلْ وَجَدْنَا آبَاءَنَا كَذَٰلِكَ يَفْعَلُونَ

translation: He said, “Do you see what you have been worshiping,
arabic: قَالَ أَفَرَأَيْتُمْ مَا كُنْتُمْ تَعْبُدُونَ

translation: you and your ancestors?
arabic: أَنْتُمْ وَآبَاؤُكُمُ الْأَقْدَمُونَ

translation: Indeed, they are my enemies, except the Lord of the worlds[12],
footnotes: [12] As they worshiped idols in addition to worshiping Allah.
arabic: فَإِنَّهُمْ عَدُوٌّ لِي إِلَّا رَبَّ الْعَالَمِينَ

translation: Who created me, so He guides me;
arabic: الَّذِي خَلَقَنِي فَهُوَ يَهْدِينِ

translation: and it is He Who provides me with food and drink;
arabic: وَالَّذِي هُوَ يُطْعِمُنِي وَيَسْقِينِ

translation: and when I am ill He heals me;
arabic: وَإِذَا مَرِضْتُ فَهُوَ يَشْفِينِ

translation: and He will cause me to die and then bring me back to life;
arabic: وَالَّذِي يُمِيتُنِي ثُمَّ يُحْيِينِ

translation: and I hope that He will forgive me my sins on the Day of Judgment.”
arabic: وَالَّذِي أَطْمَعُ أَنْ يَغْفِرَ لِي خَطِيئَتِي يَوْمَ الدِّينِ

translation: “My Lord, grant me knowledge, and join me with the righteous,
arabic: رَبِّ هَبْ لِي حُكْمًا وَأَلْحِقْنِي بِالصَّالِحِينَ

translation: and grant me an honorable mention among the later generations[13],
footnotes: [13] Muslims invoke Allah’s blessings upon Abraham (ﷺ) along with Muhammad (ﷺ) in their daily prayers.
arabic: وَاجْعَلْ لِي لِسَانَ صِدْقٍ فِي الْآخِرِينَ

translation: and make me of those who will inherit the Garden of Bliss;
arabic: وَاجْعَلْنِي مِنْ وَرَثَةِ جَنَّةِ النَّعِيمِ

translation: and forgive my father, for he is one of those who have gone astray;
arabic: وَاغْفِرْ لِأَبِي إِنَّهُ كَانَ مِنَ الضَّالِّينَ

translation: and do not disgrace me on the Day when all will be resurrected –
arabic: وَلَا تُخْزِنِي يَوْمَ يُبْعَثُونَ

translation: the Day when neither wealth nor children will be of any avail,
arabic: يَوْمَ لَا يَنْفَعُ مَالٌ وَلَا بَنُونَ

translation: except the one who comes to Allah with a sound heart[14].”
footnotes: [14] A heart free from disbelief, polytheism, hypocrisy, arrogance, and show-off.
arabic: إِلَّا مَنْ أَتَى اللَّهَ بِقَلْبٍ سَلِيمٍ

translation: Paradise will be brought near to the righteous,
arabic: وَأُزْلِفَتِ الْجَنَّةُ لِلْمُتَّقِينَ

translation: and Hellfire will be uncovered to those who went astray,
arabic: وَبُرِّزَتِ الْجَحِيمُ لِلْغَاوِينَ

translation: and they will be told, “Where are those whom you used to worship
arabic: وَقِيلَ لَهُمْ أَيْنَ مَا كُنْتُمْ تَعْبُدُونَ

translation: other than Allah? Can they help you or even help themselves?”
arabic: مِنْ دُونِ اللَّهِ هَلْ يَنْصُرُونَكُمْ أَوْ يَنْتَصِرُونَ

translation: Then they will be hurled into Hell one upon another, along with those who led them astray,
arabic: فَكُبْكِبُوا فِيهَا هُمْ وَالْغَاوُونَ

translation: and the followers of Iblīs, all together.
arabic: وَجُنُودُ إِبْلِيسَ أَجْمَعُونَ

translation: There the deviants will say while quarreling with their false deities,
arabic: قَالُوا وَهُمْ فِيهَا يَخْتَصِمُونَ

translation: “By Allah, we were clearly misguided,
arabic: تَاللَّهِ إِنْ كُنَّا لَفِي ضَلَالٍ مُبِينٍ

translation: when we deemed you equal to the Lord of the worlds.
arabic: إِذْ نُسَوِّيكُمْ بِرَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ

translation: None led us astray except the wicked.
arabic: وَمَا أَضَلَّنَا إِلَّا الْمُجْرِمُونَ

translation: Now we neither have any intercessors,
arabic: فَمَا لَنَا مِنْ شَافِعِينَ

translation: nor a close friend.
arabic: وَلَا صَدِيقٍ حَمِيمٍ

translation: If only we had a chance to return, we would be among the believers.”
arabic: فَلَوْ أَنَّ لَنَا كَرَّةً فَنَكُونَ مِنَ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ

translation: Indeed, there is a sign in this, yet most of them would not believe.
arabic: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَآيَةً ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُمْ مُؤْمِنِينَ

translation: Your Lord is surely the All-Mighty, the Most Merciful.
arabic: وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَهُوَ الْعَزِيزُ الرَّحِيمُ

translation: The people of Noah rejected the messengers[15]
footnotes: [15] For denying Noah was equal to denying all of the messengers of Allah.
arabic: كَذَّبَتْ قَوْمُ نُوحٍ الْمُرْسَلِينَ

translation: when their brother Noah said to them, “Do you not fear Allah?
arabic: إِذْ قَالَ لَهُمْ أَخُوهُمْ نُوحٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ

translation: I am a trustworthy messenger to you,
arabic: إِنِّي لَكُمْ رَسُولٌ أَمِينٌ

translation: so fear Allah, and obey me.
arabic: فَاتَّقُوا اللَّهَ وَأَطِيعُونِ

translation: I seek of you no reward for this; my reward is only with the Lord of the worlds;
arabic: وَمَا أَسْأَلُكُمْ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ أَجْرٍ ۖ إِنْ أَجْرِيَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ

translation: so fear Allah, and obey me.”
arabic: فَاتَّقُوا اللَّهَ وَأَطِيعُونِ

translation: They said, “Shall we believe in you when you are followed by the lowest people[16]?”
footnotes: [16] For they were mostly the poor and ordinary people, who enjoyed no position in society.
arabic: ۞ قَالُوا أَنُؤْمِنُ لَكَ وَاتَّبَعَكَ الْأَرْذَلُونَ

translation: He said, “What knowledge do I have of what they do?
arabic: قَالَ وَمَا عِلْمِي بِمَا كَانُوا يَعْمَلُونَ

translation: Their reckoning is only with my Lord if you realize!
arabic: إِنْ حِسَابُهُمْ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّي ۖ لَوْ تَشْعُرُونَ

translation: I am not going to drive the believers away.
arabic: وَمَا أَنَا بِطَارِدِ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ

translation: I am only a clear warner.”
arabic: إِنْ أَنَا إِلَّا نَذِيرٌ مُبِينٌ

translation: They said, “O Noah, if you do not desist, you will certainly be stoned.”
arabic: قَالُوا لَئِنْ لَمْ تَنْتَهِ يَا نُوحُ لَتَكُونَنَّ مِنَ الْمَرْجُومِينَ

translation: He said, “My Lord, my people have rejected me.
arabic: قَالَ رَبِّ إِنَّ قَوْمِي كَذَّبُونِ

translation: So judge between me and them decisively, and save me and the believers who are with me.”
arabic: فَافْتَحْ بَيْنِي وَبَيْنَهُمْ فَتْحًا وَنَجِّنِي وَمَنْ مَعِيَ مِنَ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ

translation: So We saved him and those who were with him in the fully laden Ark.
arabic: فَأَنْجَيْنَاهُ وَمَنْ مَعَهُ فِي الْفُلْكِ الْمَشْحُونِ

translation: Then We drowned thereafter all the rest.
arabic: ثُمَّ أَغْرَقْنَا بَعْدُ الْبَاقِينَ

translation: Indeed, there is a sign in this, yet most of them would not believe.
arabic: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَآيَةً ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُمْ مُؤْمِنِينَ

translation: Indeed, your Lord is the All-Mighty, the Most Merciful.
arabic: وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَهُوَ الْعَزِيزُ الرَّحِيمُ

translation: The people of ‘Ād rejected the messengers
arabic: كَذَّبَتْ عَادٌ الْمُرْسَلِينَ

translation: when their brother Hūd said to them, “Will you not fear Allah?
arabic: إِذْ قَالَ لَهُمْ أَخُوهُمْ هُودٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ

translation: I am a trustworthy messenger to you,
arabic: إِنِّي لَكُمْ رَسُولٌ أَمِينٌ

translation: so fear Allah, and obey me.
arabic: فَاتَّقُوا اللَّهَ وَأَطِيعُونِ

translation: I do not ask you for any reward for this; my reward is only with the Lord of the worlds.
arabic: وَمَا أَسْأَلُكُمْ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ أَجْرٍ ۖ إِنْ أَجْرِيَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ

translation: Do you build a landmark[17] on every high place for no purpose?
footnotes: [17] They used to build lofty structures along the road to be seen by passersby, as a symbol of their wealth and power.
arabic: أَتَبْنُونَ بِكُلِّ رِيعٍ آيَةً تَعْبَثُونَ

translation: And do you construct for yourselves palaces, hoping that you will live forever?
arabic: وَتَتَّخِذُونَ مَصَانِعَ لَعَلَّكُمْ تَخْلُدُونَ

translation: And when you attack [others], do you attack ruthlessly?
arabic: وَإِذَا بَطَشْتُمْ بَطَشْتُمْ جَبَّارِينَ

translation: So fear Allah, and obey me.
arabic: فَاتَّقُوا اللَّهَ وَأَطِيعُونِ

translation: And fear the One Who has provided you with everything you know:
arabic: وَاتَّقُوا الَّذِي أَمَدَّكُمْ بِمَا تَعْلَمُونَ

translation: Who provided you with livestock and children,
arabic: أَمَدَّكُمْ بِأَنْعَامٍ وَبَنِينَ

translation: and with gardens and springs.
arabic: وَجَنَّاتٍ وَعُيُونٍ

translation: I fear for you the punishment of a momentous day.”
arabic: إِنِّي أَخَافُ عَلَيْكُمْ عَذَابَ يَوْمٍ عَظِيمٍ

translation: They said, “It is the same to us whether you admonish us or not.
arabic: قَالُوا سَوَاءٌ عَلَيْنَا أَوَعَظْتَ أَمْ لَمْ تَكُنْ مِنَ الْوَاعِظِينَ

translation: This is nothing but the custom of the former people,
arabic: إِنْ هَٰذَا إِلَّا خُلُقُ الْأَوَّلِينَ

translation: and we will never be punished.”
arabic: وَمَا نَحْنُ بِمُعَذَّبِينَ

translation: Thus they rejected him, so We destroyed them. Indeed, there is a sign in this, yet most of them would not believe,
arabic: فَكَذَّبُوهُ فَأَهْلَكْنَاهُمْ ۗ إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَآيَةً ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُمْ مُؤْمِنِينَ

translation: Your Lord is indeed the All-Mighty, the Most Merciful.
arabic: وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَهُوَ الْعَزِيزُ الرَّحِيمُ

translation: The people of Thamūd rejected the messengers
arabic: كَذَّبَتْ ثَمُودُ الْمُرْسَلِينَ

translation: when their brother Sālih said to them, “Will you not fear Allah?
arabic: إِذْ قَالَ لَهُمْ أَخُوهُمْ صَالِحٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ

translation: I am a trustworthy messenger to you,
arabic: إِنِّي لَكُمْ رَسُولٌ أَمِينٌ

translation: so fear Allah, and obey me.
arabic: فَاتَّقُوا اللَّهَ وَأَطِيعُونِ

translation: I do not ask you for any reward for this; my reward is only with the Lord of the worlds.
arabic: وَمَا أَسْأَلُكُمْ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ أَجْرٍ ۖ إِنْ أَجْرِيَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ

translation: Will you be left secure in whatever you have here,
arabic: أَتُتْرَكُونَ فِي مَا هَاهُنَا آمِنِينَ

translation: in gardens and springs,
arabic: فِي جَنَّاتٍ وَعُيُونٍ

translation: and in fields of crops and date palms laden with tender fruit,
arabic: وَزُرُوعٍ وَنَخْلٍ طَلْعُهَا هَضِيمٌ

translation: carving out houses in the mountains with great skill?
arabic: وَتَنْحِتُونَ مِنَ الْجِبَالِ بُيُوتًا فَارِهِينَ

translation: So fear Allah, and obey me.
arabic: فَاتَّقُوا اللَّهَ وَأَطِيعُونِ

translation: And do not obey the command of the transgressors,
arabic: وَلَا تُطِيعُوا أَمْرَ الْمُسْرِفِينَ

translation: those who spread corruption in the land and never do what is right.”
arabic: الَّذِينَ يُفْسِدُونَ فِي الْأَرْضِ وَلَا يُصْلِحُونَ

translation: They said, “You are but one of those who are bewitched!
arabic: قَالُوا إِنَّمَا أَنْتَ مِنَ الْمُسَحَّرِينَ

translation: You are but a human like us, so bring a sign if you are one of the truthful.”
arabic: مَا أَنْتَ إِلَّا بَشَرٌ مِثْلُنَا فَأْتِ بِآيَةٍ إِنْ كُنْتَ مِنَ الصَّادِقِينَ

translation: Sālih said, “This is a she-camel[18]; she will have her share of water and you will have yours, each on a specified day.
footnotes: [18] That was miraculously sent to them as a sign by Allah.
arabic: قَالَ هَٰذِهِ نَاقَةٌ لَهَا شِرْبٌ وَلَكُمْ شِرْبُ يَوْمٍ مَعْلُومٍ

translation: Do not touch her with harm, or you will be seized by the punishment of a horrible day.”
arabic: وَلَا تَمَسُّوهَا بِسُوءٍ فَيَأْخُذَكُمْ عَذَابُ يَوْمٍ عَظِيمٍ

translation: But they hamstrung her, then they became regretful,
arabic: فَعَقَرُوهَا فَأَصْبَحُوا نَادِمِينَ

translation: So the punishment seized them[19]. Indeed, there is a sign in this, yet most of them would not believe.
footnotes: [19] They were destroyed by a violent earthquake and a blast after Sālih told them: “You have only three days to enjoy yourselves in your houses”. See 11:65. Allah says: “We sent against them a single blast, leaving them like trampled hedge-building twigs”. See 54:31.
arabic: فَأَخَذَهُمُ الْعَذَابُ ۗ إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَآيَةً ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُمْ مُؤْمِنِينَ

translation: Your Lord is indeed the All-Mighty, the Most Merciful.
arabic: وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَهُوَ الْعَزِيزُ الرَّحِيمُ

translation: The people of Lot rejected the messengers,
arabic: كَذَّبَتْ قَوْمُ لُوطٍ الْمُرْسَلِينَ

translation: when their brother Lot said to them, “Will you not fear Allah?
arabic: إِذْ قَالَ لَهُمْ أَخُوهُمْ لُوطٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ

translation: I am a trustworthy messenger to you,
arabic: إِنِّي لَكُمْ رَسُولٌ أَمِينٌ

translation: so fear Allah, and obey me.
arabic: فَاتَّقُوا اللَّهَ وَأَطِيعُونِ

translation: I do not ask you for any reward for this; my reward is only with the Lord of the worlds.
arabic: وَمَا أَسْأَلُكُمْ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ أَجْرٍ ۖ إِنْ أَجْرِيَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ

translation: Do you approach males with lust among all people[20],
footnotes: [20] i.e., Are there any creatures besides you who commit this abominable act?
arabic: أَتَأْتُونَ الذُّكْرَانَ مِنَ الْعَالَمِينَ

translation: leaving the wives whom your Lord has created for you? You are but a transgressing people.”
arabic: وَتَذَرُونَ مَا خَلَقَ لَكُمْ رَبُّكُمْ مِنْ أَزْوَاجِكُمْ ۚ بَلْ أَنْتُمْ قَوْمٌ عَادُونَ

translation: They said, “O Lot, If you do not desist, you will surely be expelled.”
arabic: قَالُوا لَئِنْ لَمْ تَنْتَهِ يَا لُوطُ لَتَكُونَنَّ مِنَ الْمُخْرَجِينَ

translation: Lot said, “I am one of those who utterly abhor your practice.
arabic: قَالَ إِنِّي لِعَمَلِكُمْ مِنَ الْقَالِينَ

translation: My Lord, save me and my family from [the consequences of] what they do.”
arabic: رَبِّ نَجِّنِي وَأَهْلِي مِمَّا يَعْمَلُونَ

translation: So We saved him and all his family,
arabic: فَنَجَّيْنَاهُ وَأَهْلَهُ أَجْمَعِينَ

translation: except an old woman who was among those who remained behind[21].
footnotes: [21] Lot's wife, who betrayed him by not believing and remained a disbeliever; thus, she was among those destroyed.
arabic: إِلَّا عَجُوزًا فِي الْغَابِرِينَ

translation: Then We destroyed the rest,
arabic: ثُمَّ دَمَّرْنَا الْآخَرِينَ

translation: and We poured down upon them a rain [of stones]. How terrible was the rain of those who were warned!
arabic: وَأَمْطَرْنَا عَلَيْهِمْ مَطَرًا ۖ فَسَاءَ مَطَرُ الْمُنْذَرِينَ

translation: Indeed, there is a sign in this, yet most of them would not believe.
arabic: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَآيَةً ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُمْ مُؤْمِنِينَ

translation: Your Lord is indeed the All-Mighty, the Most Merciful.
arabic: وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَهُوَ الْعَزِيزُ الرَّحِيمُ

translation: The people of the Forest[22] rejected the messengers.
footnotes: [22] i.e., the people of Madyan, to whom Shu‘ayb was sent.
arabic: كَذَّبَ أَصْحَابُ الْأَيْكَةِ الْمُرْسَلِينَ

translation: When Shu‘ayb said to them, “Will you not fear Allah?
arabic: إِذْ قَالَ لَهُمْ شُعَيْبٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ

translation: I am a trustworthy messenger to you,
arabic: إِنِّي لَكُمْ رَسُولٌ أَمِينٌ

translation: so fear Allah, and obey me.
arabic: فَاتَّقُوا اللَّهَ وَأَطِيعُونِ

translation: I do not ask you for any reward for this; my reward is only with the Lord of the worlds.
arabic: وَمَا أَسْأَلُكُمْ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ أَجْرٍ ۖ إِنْ أَجْرِيَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ

translation: Give full measure and do not be of those who defraud others,
arabic: ۞ أَوْفُوا الْكَيْلَ وَلَا تَكُونُوا مِنَ الْمُخْسِرِينَ

translation: and weigh with accurate scales,
arabic: وَزِنُوا بِالْقِسْطَاسِ الْمُسْتَقِيمِ

translation: and do not defraud people of their goods, nor go about in the land spreading corruption.
arabic: وَلَا تَبْخَسُوا النَّاسَ أَشْيَاءَهُمْ وَلَا تَعْثَوْا فِي الْأَرْضِ مُفْسِدِينَ

translation: And fear the One Who created you and the former peoples[23].”
footnotes: [23] i.e., generations of the past.
arabic: وَاتَّقُوا الَّذِي خَلَقَكُمْ وَالْجِبِلَّةَ الْأَوَّلِينَ

translation: They said, “You are truly bewitched!
arabic: قَالُوا إِنَّمَا أَنْتَ مِنَ الْمُسَحَّرِينَ

translation: You are only a human being like us, and we think you are nothing but a liar.
arabic: وَمَا أَنْتَ إِلَّا بَشَرٌ مِثْلُنَا وَإِنْ نَظُنُّكَ لَمِنَ الْكَاذِبِينَ

translation: So cause pieces of the sky to fall upon us, if you are of the truthful.”
arabic: فَأَسْقِطْ عَلَيْنَا كِسَفًا مِنَ السَّمَاءِ إِنْ كُنْتَ مِنَ الصَّادِقِينَ

translation: Shu‘ayb said, “My Lord knows best whatever you do.”
arabic: قَالَ رَبِّي أَعْلَمُ بِمَا تَعْمَلُونَ

translation: Thus they rejected him, so they were seized by the punishment of the cloudy day; it was the punishment of a horrible day.
arabic: فَكَذَّبُوهُ فَأَخَذَهُمْ عَذَابُ يَوْمِ الظُّلَّةِ ۚ إِنَّهُ كَانَ عَذَابَ يَوْمٍ عَظِيمٍ

translation: Indeed, there is a sign in this, yet most of them would not believe.
arabic: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَآيَةً ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُمْ مُؤْمِنِينَ

translation: Your Lord is indeed the All-Mighty, the Most Merciful.
arabic: وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَهُوَ الْعَزِيزُ الرَّحِيمُ

translation: This is indeed a revelation from the Lord of the worlds,
arabic: وَإِنَّهُ لَتَنْزِيلُ رَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ

translation: which the Trustworthy Spirit [Gabriel] has brought down
arabic: نَزَلَ بِهِ الرُّوحُ الْأَمِينُ

translation: to your heart [O Prophet] so that you may be one of the warners,
arabic: عَلَىٰ قَلْبِكَ لِتَكُونَ مِنَ الْمُنْذِرِينَ

translation: in a clear Arabic language.
arabic: بِلِسَانٍ عَرَبِيٍّ مُبِينٍ

translation: And it was indeed [mentioned] in the scriptures of the former peoples.
arabic: وَإِنَّهُ لَفِي زُبُرِ الْأَوَّلِينَ

translation: Was it not a proof for them that the learned men of the Children of Israel recognized it [to be true][24]?
footnotes: [24] e.g., Abdullah ibn Salām, a Jewish scholar, accepted Islam during the lifetime of the Prophet (ﷺ), for he knew that he came with a true message.
arabic: أَوَلَمْ يَكُنْ لَهُمْ آيَةً أَنْ يَعْلَمَهُ عُلَمَاءُ بَنِي إِسْرَائِيلَ

translation: If We had sent it down to any of the non-Arabs,
arabic: وَلَوْ نَزَّلْنَاهُ عَلَىٰ بَعْضِ الْأَعْجَمِينَ

translation: and he had recited it to them[25]; still, they would not have believed in it.
footnotes: [25] As a miracle from Allah.
arabic: فَقَرَأَهُ عَلَيْهِمْ مَا كَانُوا بِهِ مُؤْمِنِينَ

translation: This is how We made it [i.e., disbelief] enter the hearts of the wicked.
arabic: كَذَٰلِكَ سَلَكْنَاهُ فِي قُلُوبِ الْمُجْرِمِينَ

translation: They will not believe in it until they see the painful punishment,
arabic: لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ بِهِ حَتَّىٰ يَرَوُا الْعَذَابَ الْأَلِيمَ

translation: which will come upon them suddenly when they least expect it.
arabic: فَيَأْتِيَهُمْ بَغْتَةً وَهُمْ لَا يَشْعُرُونَ

translation: They will then say, “Can we be granted some respite?”
arabic: فَيَقُولُوا هَلْ نَحْنُ مُنْظَرُونَ

translation: Do they really seek to hasten Our punishment?
arabic: أَفَبِعَذَابِنَا يَسْتَعْجِلُونَ

translation: Tell me [O Prophet] if We give them a life of ease for years,
arabic: أَفَرَأَيْتَ إِنْ مَتَّعْنَاهُمْ سِنِينَ

translation: then there came to them what they were warned of,
arabic: ثُمَّ جَاءَهُمْ مَا كَانُوا يُوعَدُونَ

translation: what would avail them the life of ease that they were given?
arabic: مَا أَغْنَىٰ عَنْهُمْ مَا كَانُوا يُمَتَّعُونَ

translation: We never destroyed any town without sending them warners,
arabic: وَمَا أَهْلَكْنَا مِنْ قَرْيَةٍ إِلَّا لَهَا مُنْذِرُونَ

translation: to admonish them, for We are never unjust.
arabic: ذِكْرَىٰ وَمَا كُنَّا ظَالِمِينَ

translation: This [Qur’an] is not sent down by the devils[26],
footnotes: [26] As the disbelievers claim; rather, it is brought down by Gabriel, the Trustworthy Spirit.
arabic: وَمَا تَنَزَّلَتْ بِهِ الشَّيَاطِينُ

translation: it is not for them to do this, nor is it within their capability,
arabic: وَمَا يَنْبَغِي لَهُمْ وَمَا يَسْتَطِيعُونَ

translation: for they are strictly barred from overhearing it[27].
footnotes: [27] So they cannot eavesdrop on heaven. See 72:9.
arabic: إِنَّهُمْ عَنِ السَّمْعِ لَمَعْزُولُونَ

translation: So do not call upon any other god besides Allah, lest you become of those who will be punished.
arabic: فَلَا تَدْعُ مَعَ اللَّهِ إِلَٰهًا آخَرَ فَتَكُونَ مِنَ الْمُعَذَّبِينَ

translation: And warn [starting with] the nearest kinsfolk,
arabic: وَأَنْذِرْ عَشِيرَتَكَ الْأَقْرَبِينَ

translation: and lower your wing [in kindness] to the believers who follow you.
arabic: وَاخْفِضْ جَنَاحَكَ لِمَنِ اتَّبَعَكَ مِنَ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ

translation: But if they disobey you, say, “I disown what you do.”
arabic: فَإِنْ عَصَوْكَ فَقُلْ إِنِّي بَرِيءٌ مِمَّا تَعْمَلُونَ

translation: And put your trust in the All-Mighty, the Most Merciful,
arabic: وَتَوَكَّلْ عَلَى الْعَزِيزِ الرَّحِيمِ

translation: Who sees you when you stand up [for prayer],
arabic: الَّذِي يَرَاكَ حِينَ تَقُومُ

translation: and your movements among those who prostrate.
arabic: وَتَقَلُّبَكَ فِي السَّاجِدِينَ

translation: Indeed, He is the All-Hearing, the All-Knowing.
arabic: إِنَّهُ هُوَ السَّمِيعُ الْعَلِيمُ

translation: Shall I inform you upon who the devils descend?
arabic: هَلْ أُنَبِّئُكُمْ عَلَىٰ مَنْ تَنَزَّلُ الشَّيَاطِينُ

translation: They descend upon every sinful liar,
arabic: تَنَزَّلُ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ أَفَّاكٍ أَثِيمٍ

translation: who whisper hearsay in the ears, but most of them are liars.
arabic: يُلْقُونَ السَّمْعَ وَأَكْثَرُهُمْ كَاذِبُونَ

translation: As for poets, they are followed by the deviants.
arabic: وَالشُّعَرَاءُ يَتَّبِعُهُمُ الْغَاوُونَ

translation: Do you not see that they wander aimlessly in every valley[28],
footnotes: [28] Telling lies indiscriminately, praising some, and disparaging others.
arabic: أَلَمْ تَرَ أَنَّهُمْ فِي كُلِّ وَادٍ يَهِيمُونَ

translation: and that they say what they do not do?
arabic: وَأَنَّهُمْ يَقُولُونَ مَا لَا يَفْعَلُونَ

translation: Except those who believe, do righteous deeds, remember Allah much and defend themselves[29] after being wronged. The wrongdoers will come to know what end awaits them.
footnotes: [29] By replying to the satire of hostile poets through poetry.
arabic: إِلَّا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَعَمِلُوا الصَّالِحَاتِ وَذَكَرُوا اللَّهَ كَثِيرًا وَانْتَصَرُوا مِنْ بَعْدِ مَا ظُلِمُوا ۗ وَسَيَعْلَمُ الَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوا أَيَّ مُنْقَلَبٍ يَنْقَلِبُونَ

translation: Tā Sīn[1]. These are the verses of the Qur’an and a clear book;
footnotes: [1] See footnote 2:1.
arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ طس ۚ تِلْكَ آيَاتُ الْقُرْآنِ وَكِتَابٍ مُبِينٍ

translation: a guidance and glad tidings for the believers,
arabic: هُدًى وَبُشْرَىٰ لِلْمُؤْمِنِينَ

translation: those who establish prayer and give zakah, and who firmly believe in the Hereafter.
arabic: الَّذِينَ يُقِيمُونَ الصَّلَاةَ وَيُؤْتُونَ الزَّكَاةَ وَهُمْ بِالْآخِرَةِ هُمْ يُوقِنُونَ

translation: As for those who do not believe in the Hereafter, We have made their deeds appealing to them, so they wander blindly.
arabic: إِنَّ الَّذِينَ لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ بِالْآخِرَةِ زَيَّنَّا لَهُمْ أَعْمَالَهُمْ فَهُمْ يَعْمَهُونَ

translation: Such are those who will have a terrible punishment, and it is they who will be the greatest losers in the Hereafter.
arabic: أُولَٰئِكَ الَّذِينَ لَهُمْ سُوءُ الْعَذَابِ وَهُمْ فِي الْآخِرَةِ هُمُ الْأَخْسَرُونَ

translation: Indeed, you are receiving the Qur’an from the All-Wise, All-Knowing.
arabic: وَإِنَّكَ لَتُلَقَّى الْقُرْآنَ مِنْ لَدُنْ حَكِيمٍ عَلِيمٍ

translation: [Remember] when Moses said to his family, “I have spotted a fire. I will bring you some news[2] from there, or bring you a burning brand so that you may warm yourselves.”
footnotes: [2] For they lost their way in the dark while traveling from Midian to Egypt.
arabic: إِذْ قَالَ مُوسَىٰ لِأَهْلِهِ إِنِّي آنَسْتُ نَارًا سَآتِيكُمْ مِنْهَا بِخَبَرٍ أَوْ آتِيكُمْ بِشِهَابٍ قَبَسٍ لَعَلَّكُمْ تَصْطَلُونَ

translation: When he came to it, he was called, “Blessed is He Who is at the fire and those who are around it[3]. Glory be to Allah, the Lord of the worlds.
footnotes: [3] i.e., the angels around the fire.
arabic: فَلَمَّا جَاءَهَا نُودِيَ أَنْ بُورِكَ مَنْ فِي النَّارِ وَمَنْ حَوْلَهَا وَسُبْحَانَ اللَّهِ رَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ

translation: O Moses, verily this is Me – Allah, the All-Mighty, the All-Wise.
arabic: يَا مُوسَىٰ إِنَّهُ أَنَا اللَّهُ الْعَزِيزُ الْحَكِيمُ

translation: Throw down your staff!” But when he saw it slithering as if it were a snake, he turned and ran away without looking back. “O Moses, do not be afraid! Indeed, the messengers should have no fear in My presence,
arabic: وَأَلْقِ عَصَاكَ ۚ فَلَمَّا رَآهَا تَهْتَزُّ كَأَنَّهَا جَانٌّ وَلَّىٰ مُدْبِرًا وَلَمْ يُعَقِّبْ ۚ يَا مُوسَىٰ لَا تَخَفْ إِنِّي لَا يَخَافُ لَدَيَّ الْمُرْسَلُونَ

translation: except he who does wrong, then substitutes good for evil, then I am indeed All-Forgiving, Most Merciful.
arabic: إِلَّا مَنْ ظَلَمَ ثُمَّ بَدَّلَ حُسْنًا بَعْدَ سُوءٍ فَإِنِّي غَفُورٌ رَحِيمٌ

translation: Put your hand into your garment, it will come out shining white without blemish, as one of nine signs to Pharaoh and his people[4], for they are indeed a rebellious people.”
footnotes: [4] See footnote 23:45.
arabic: وَأَدْخِلْ يَدَكَ فِي جَيْبِكَ تَخْرُجْ بَيْضَاءَ مِنْ غَيْرِ سُوءٍ ۖ فِي تِسْعِ آيَاتٍ إِلَىٰ فِرْعَوْنَ وَقَوْمِهِ ۚ إِنَّهُمْ كَانُوا قَوْمًا فَاسِقِينَ

translation: But when Our visible signs came to them, they said, “This is clear magic.”
arabic: فَلَمَّا جَاءَتْهُمْ آيَاتُنَا مُبْصِرَةً قَالُوا هَٰذَا سِحْرٌ مُبِينٌ

translation: They denied them wrongfully and arrogantly, although their hearts were convinced that they were true. See then how was the end of those who spread corruption!
arabic: وَجَحَدُوا بِهَا وَاسْتَيْقَنَتْهَا أَنْفُسُهُمْ ظُلْمًا وَعُلُوًّا ۚ فَانْظُرْ كَيْفَ كَانَ عَاقِبَةُ الْمُفْسِدِينَ

translation: We gave David and Solomon knowledge, and they said, “All praise be to Allah, Who has favored us[5] over many of His believing slaves.”
footnotes: [5] They were privileged by prophethood, the ability to communicate with animals and birds, control the wind, use the jinn for their service, etc.
arabic: وَلَقَدْ آتَيْنَا دَاوُودَ وَسُلَيْمَانَ عِلْمًا ۖ وَقَالَا الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ الَّذِي فَضَّلَنَا عَلَىٰ كَثِيرٍ مِنْ عِبَادِهِ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ

translation: Solomon succeeded David, and said, “O people, we have been taught the speech of birds, and we have been given from all things. This is indeed a clear favor.”
arabic: وَوَرِثَ سُلَيْمَانُ دَاوُودَ ۖ وَقَالَ يَا أَيُّهَا النَّاسُ عُلِّمْنَا مَنْطِقَ الطَّيْرِ وَأُوتِينَا مِنْ كُلِّ شَيْءٍ ۖ إِنَّ هَٰذَا لَهُوَ الْفَضْلُ الْمُبِينُ

translation: Solomon’s armies of jinn, men and birds were assembled before him, marching in organized ranks,
arabic: وَحُشِرَ لِسُلَيْمَانَ جُنُودُهُ مِنَ الْجِنِّ وَالْإِنْسِ وَالطَّيْرِ فَهُمْ يُوزَعُونَ

translation: until when they reached a valley of ants, an ant said, “O ants, get into your dwellings, so Solomon and his armies do not crush you unknowingly.”
arabic: حَتَّىٰ إِذَا أَتَوْا عَلَىٰ وَادِ النَّمْلِ قَالَتْ نَمْلَةٌ يَا أَيُّهَا النَّمْلُ ادْخُلُوا مَسَاكِنَكُمْ لَا يَحْطِمَنَّكُمْ سُلَيْمَانُ وَجُنُودُهُ وَهُمْ لَا يَشْعُرُونَ

translation: So he smiled in amusement at its words and said, “My Lord, inspire me to be grateful for Your favor which You have bestowed upon me and my parents, and to do righteous deeds that please you. And admit me, by Your mercy, among Your righteous slaves.”
arabic: فَتَبَسَّمَ ضَاحِكًا مِنْ قَوْلِهَا وَقَالَ رَبِّ أَوْزِعْنِي أَنْ أَشْكُرَ نِعْمَتَكَ الَّتِي أَنْعَمْتَ عَلَيَّ وَعَلَىٰ وَالِدَيَّ وَأَنْ أَعْمَلَ صَالِحًا تَرْضَاهُ وَأَدْخِلْنِي بِرَحْمَتِكَ فِي عِبَادِكَ الصَّالِحِينَ

translation: Once he checked the birds, and said, “Why is it that I do not see the hoopoe – or is he among the absent?
arabic: وَتَفَقَّدَ الطَّيْرَ فَقَالَ مَا لِيَ لَا أَرَى الْهُدْهُدَ أَمْ كَانَ مِنَ الْغَائِبِينَ

translation: I will surely punish him severely, or slaughter him, unless he brings me a valid reason.”
arabic: لَأُعَذِّبَنَّهُ عَذَابًا شَدِيدًا أَوْ لَأَذْبَحَنَّهُ أَوْ لَيَأْتِيَنِّي بِسُلْطَانٍ مُبِينٍ

translation: It was not long before the hoopoe came and said, “I have learned something that you do not know; I come to you from Sheba with sure news.
arabic: فَمَكَثَ غَيْرَ بَعِيدٍ فَقَالَ أَحَطْتُ بِمَا لَمْ تُحِطْ بِهِ وَجِئْتُكَ مِنْ سَبَإٍ بِنَبَإٍ يَقِينٍ

translation: I found a woman[6] ruling over them, who has been given of all things, and she has a great throne.
footnotes: [6] Known as Bilqīs, the Queen of Sheba.
arabic: إِنِّي وَجَدْتُ امْرَأَةً تَمْلِكُهُمْ وَأُوتِيَتْ مِنْ كُلِّ شَيْءٍ وَلَهَا عَرْشٌ عَظِيمٌ

translation: I found her and her people prostrating before the sun instead of Allah. Satan has made their deeds appealing to them and turned them away from the right way, so they are not guided.
arabic: وَجَدْتُهَا وَقَوْمَهَا يَسْجُدُونَ لِلشَّمْسِ مِنْ دُونِ اللَّهِ وَزَيَّنَ لَهُمُ الشَّيْطَانُ أَعْمَالَهُمْ فَصَدَّهُمْ عَنِ السَّبِيلِ فَهُمْ لَا يَهْتَدُونَ

translation: so that they do not prostrate before Allah Who brings forth what is hidden in the heavens and earth, and Who knows all that you conceal and all that you reveal.
arabic: أَلَّا يَسْجُدُوا لِلَّهِ الَّذِي يُخْرِجُ الْخَبْءَ فِي السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ وَيَعْلَمُ مَا تُخْفُونَ وَمَا تُعْلِنُونَ

translation: Allah; none has the right to be worshiped except Him, the Lord of the Mighty Throne.”
arabic: اللَّهُ لَا إِلَٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ رَبُّ الْعَرْشِ الْعَظِيمِ ۩

translation: Solomon said, “We will see whether you have told the truth or you are one of the liars.
arabic: ۞ قَالَ سَنَنْظُرُ أَصَدَقْتَ أَمْ كُنْتَ مِنَ الْكَاذِبِينَ

translation: Take this letter of mine and deliver it to them, then withdraw and see how they respond.”
arabic: اذْهَبْ بِكِتَابِي هَٰذَا فَأَلْقِهْ إِلَيْهِمْ ثُمَّ تَوَلَّ عَنْهُمْ فَانْظُرْ مَاذَا يَرْجِعُونَ

translation: The Queen said, “O chiefs, a noble letter has been delivered to me.
arabic: قَالَتْ يَا أَيُّهَا الْمَلَأُ إِنِّي أُلْقِيَ إِلَيَّ كِتَابٌ كَرِيمٌ

translation: It is from Solomon, and it reads, ‘In the name of Allah, the Most Compassionate, the Most Merciful.
arabic: إِنَّهُ مِنْ سُلَيْمَانَ وَإِنَّهُ بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ

translation: Do not be arrogant towards me, but come to me in full submission.”
arabic: أَلَّا تَعْلُوا عَلَيَّ وَأْتُونِي مُسْلِمِينَ

translation: She said, “O chiefs, advise me in this matter of mine, for I would make no decision without your consent[7].”
footnotes: [7] Or without your presence to hear from you.
arabic: قَالَتْ يَا أَيُّهَا الْمَلَأُ أَفْتُونِي فِي أَمْرِي مَا كُنْتُ قَاطِعَةً أَمْرًا حَتَّىٰ تَشْهَدُونِ

translation: They said, “We are powerful and great fighters, but the decision is yours, so consider what you will command.”
arabic: قَالُوا نَحْنُ أُولُو قُوَّةٍ وَأُولُو بَأْسٍ شَدِيدٍ وَالْأَمْرُ إِلَيْكِ فَانْظُرِي مَاذَا تَأْمُرِينَ

translation: She said, “When kings enter a town, they ravage it and humiliate its notables; this is what they really do.
arabic: قَالَتْ إِنَّ الْمُلُوكَ إِذَا دَخَلُوا قَرْيَةً أَفْسَدُوهَا وَجَعَلُوا أَعِزَّةَ أَهْلِهَا أَذِلَّةً ۖ وَكَذَٰلِكَ يَفْعَلُونَ

translation: But I will send them a gift, then see with what response the envoys will return[8].”
footnotes: [8] She wanted to see whether Solomon was a true prophet or only a king who would be satisfied with a tribute.
arabic: وَإِنِّي مُرْسِلَةٌ إِلَيْهِمْ بِهَدِيَّةٍ فَنَاظِرَةٌ بِمَ يَرْجِعُ الْمُرْسَلُونَ

translation: When the envoy came to Solomon, he said, “Do you seek to appease me with wealth? What Allah has given me is far better than what He has given you. Rather, it is you who take pleasure in gifts.
arabic: فَلَمَّا جَاءَ سُلَيْمَانَ قَالَ أَتُمِدُّونَنِ بِمَالٍ فَمَا آتَانِيَ اللَّهُ خَيْرٌ مِمَّا آتَاكُمْ بَلْ أَنْتُمْ بِهَدِيَّتِكُمْ تَفْرَحُونَ
