arabic: قُلْ أَرُونِيَ الَّذِينَ أَلْحَقْتُمْ بِهِ شُرَكَاءَ ۖ كَلَّا ۚ بَلْ هُوَ اللَّهُ الْعَزِيزُ الْحَكِيمُ

translation: We have not sent you [O Prophet] except as a bearer of glad tidings and a warner to all mankind, but most people do not know.
arabic: وَمَا أَرْسَلْنَاكَ إِلَّا كَافَّةً لِلنَّاسِ بَشِيرًا وَنَذِيرًا وَلَٰكِنَّ أَكْثَرَ النَّاسِ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ

translation: They say, “When will this promise come to pass, if you are truthful?”
arabic: وَيَقُولُونَ مَتَىٰ هَٰذَا الْوَعْدُ إِنْ كُنْتُمْ صَادِقِينَ

translation: Say, “There is an appointed Day for you that you can neither delay for a while, nor can you bring it forward.”
arabic: قُلْ لَكُمْ مِيعَادُ يَوْمٍ لَا تَسْتَأْخِرُونَ عَنْهُ سَاعَةً وَلَا تَسْتَقْدِمُونَ

translation: Those who disbelieve say, “We will never believe in this Qur’an or in any [Scripture] before it.” If only you could see when the wrongdoers would be made to stand before their Lord, throwing blame at one another! Those who were oppressed will say to those who were arrogant, “Had it not been for you, we would have been believers.”
arabic: وَقَالَ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا لَنْ نُؤْمِنَ بِهَٰذَا الْقُرْآنِ وَلَا بِالَّذِي بَيْنَ يَدَيْهِ ۗ وَلَوْ تَرَىٰ إِذِ الظَّالِمُونَ مَوْقُوفُونَ عِنْدَ رَبِّهِمْ يَرْجِعُ بَعْضُهُمْ إِلَىٰ بَعْضٍ الْقَوْلَ يَقُولُ الَّذِينَ اسْتُضْعِفُوا لِلَّذِينَ اسْتَكْبَرُوا لَوْلَا أَنْتُمْ لَكُنَّا مُؤْمِنِينَ

translation: Those who were arrogant will say to those who were oppressed, “Was it we who prevented you from guidance after it came to you? Rather, you yourselves were wicked.”
arabic: قَالَ الَّذِينَ اسْتَكْبَرُوا لِلَّذِينَ اسْتُضْعِفُوا أَنَحْنُ صَدَدْنَاكُمْ عَنِ الْهُدَىٰ بَعْدَ إِذْ جَاءَكُمْ ۖ بَلْ كُنْتُمْ مُجْرِمِينَ

translation: Those who were oppressed will say to those who were arrogant, “Rather, [it was your] conspiracy of night and day when you were ordering us to disbelieve in Allah and to set up rivals to Him.” They will hide their remorse when they see the punishment, and We will put shackles around the necks of those who disbelieved. Will they be recompensed except for what they used to do?
arabic: وَقَالَ الَّذِينَ اسْتُضْعِفُوا لِلَّذِينَ اسْتَكْبَرُوا بَلْ مَكْرُ اللَّيْلِ وَالنَّهَارِ إِذْ تَأْمُرُونَنَا أَنْ نَكْفُرَ بِاللَّهِ وَنَجْعَلَ لَهُ أَنْدَادًا ۚ وَأَسَرُّوا النَّدَامَةَ لَمَّا رَأَوُا الْعَذَابَ وَجَعَلْنَا الْأَغْلَالَ فِي أَعْنَاقِ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا ۚ هَلْ يُجْزَوْنَ إِلَّا مَا كَانُوا يَعْمَلُونَ

translation: We never sent a warner to a town except that its affluent ones said, “We disbelieve in what you have been sent with.”
arabic: وَمَا أَرْسَلْنَا فِي قَرْيَةٍ مِنْ نَذِيرٍ إِلَّا قَالَ مُتْرَفُوهَا إِنَّا بِمَا أُرْسِلْتُمْ بِهِ كَافِرُونَ

translation: They[20] said, “We have greater wealth and more children, and we will not be punished”.
footnotes: [20] i.e., the affluent ones of the people of Makkah and others.
arabic: وَقَالُوا نَحْنُ أَكْثَرُ أَمْوَالًا وَأَوْلَادًا وَمَا نَحْنُ بِمُعَذَّبِينَ

translation: Say, “My Lord extends provision to whom He wills or restricts it, but most people do not know”.
arabic: قُلْ إِنَّ رَبِّي يَبْسُطُ الرِّزْقَ لِمَنْ يَشَاءُ وَيَقْدِرُ وَلَٰكِنَّ أَكْثَرَ النَّاسِ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ

translation: It is not your wealth or your children that bring you closer to Us; but those who believe and do righteous deeds, it is they who will have a multiple reward for what they did, and they will be safe in the lofty mansions.
arabic: وَمَا أَمْوَالُكُمْ وَلَا أَوْلَادُكُمْ بِالَّتِي تُقَرِّبُكُمْ عِنْدَنَا زُلْفَىٰ إِلَّا مَنْ آمَنَ وَعَمِلَ صَالِحًا فَأُولَٰئِكَ لَهُمْ جَزَاءُ الضِّعْفِ بِمَا عَمِلُوا وَهُمْ فِي الْغُرُفَاتِ آمِنُونَ

translation: But those who strive against Our verses[21], seeking to discredit them, it is they who will be summoned to the punishment.
footnotes: [21] In order to undermine their credibility.
arabic: وَالَّذِينَ يَسْعَوْنَ فِي آيَاتِنَا مُعَاجِزِينَ أُولَٰئِكَ فِي الْعَذَابِ مُحْضَرُونَ

translation: Say, “My Lord extends provision to whom He wills of His slaves or restricts it. Whatever you spend in charity, He will compensate for it, for He is the Best of Providers.”
arabic: قُلْ إِنَّ رَبِّي يَبْسُطُ الرِّزْقَ لِمَنْ يَشَاءُ مِنْ عِبَادِهِ وَيَقْدِرُ لَهُ ۚ وَمَا أَنْفَقْتُمْ مِنْ شَيْءٍ فَهُوَ يُخْلِفُهُ ۖ وَهُوَ خَيْرُ الرَّازِقِينَ

translation: On the Day when He gathers them all together, then He will say to the angels, “Was it you that they used to worship?”
arabic: وَيَوْمَ يَحْشُرُهُمْ جَمِيعًا ثُمَّ يَقُولُ لِلْمَلَائِكَةِ أَهَٰؤُلَاءِ إِيَّاكُمْ كَانُوا يَعْبُدُونَ

translation: They will say, “Glory be to You! You are our Protector, not they. Rather they used to worship the jinn[22]; most of them believed in them.”
footnotes: [22] i.e., the devils.
arabic: قَالُوا سُبْحَانَكَ أَنْتَ وَلِيُّنَا مِنْ دُونِهِمْ ۖ بَلْ كَانُوا يَعْبُدُونَ الْجِنَّ ۖ أَكْثَرُهُمْ بِهِمْ مُؤْمِنُونَ

translation: So Today none of you has the power to benefit or harm one another. And We will say to the wrongdoers, “Taste the punishment of the Fire which you used to deny!”
arabic: فَالْيَوْمَ لَا يَمْلِكُ بَعْضُكُمْ لِبَعْضٍ نَفْعًا وَلَا ضَرًّا وَنَقُولُ لِلَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوا ذُوقُوا عَذَابَ النَّارِ الَّتِي كُنْتُمْ بِهَا تُكَذِّبُونَ

translation: When Our clear verses are recited to them, they say, “This is nothing but a man who wishes to turn you away from what your forefathers used to worship.” And they say, “This is nothing but a fabricated lie.” And the disbelievers say about the Truth when it comes to them, “This is nothing but clear magic,”
arabic: وَإِذَا تُتْلَىٰ عَلَيْهِمْ آيَاتُنَا بَيِّنَاتٍ قَالُوا مَا هَٰذَا إِلَّا رَجُلٌ يُرِيدُ أَنْ يَصُدَّكُمْ عَمَّا كَانَ يَعْبُدُ آبَاؤُكُمْ وَقَالُوا مَا هَٰذَا إِلَّا إِفْكٌ مُفْتَرًى ۚ وَقَالَ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا لِلْحَقِّ لَمَّا جَاءَهُمْ إِنْ هَٰذَا إِلَّا سِحْرٌ مُبِينٌ

translation: even though We did not give them any scriptures to study, nor did We send them any warner before you.
arabic: وَمَا آتَيْنَاهُمْ مِنْ كُتُبٍ يَدْرُسُونَهَا ۖ وَمَا أَرْسَلْنَا إِلَيْهِمْ قَبْلَكَ مِنْ نَذِيرٍ

translation: Those who came before them also rejected [the truth], while these [Makkans] have not been given even one-tenth of what We had given those [earlier nations], yet they rejected My messengers; how severe was My response!
arabic: وَكَذَّبَ الَّذِينَ مِنْ قَبْلِهِمْ وَمَا بَلَغُوا مِعْشَارَ مَا آتَيْنَاهُمْ فَكَذَّبُوا رُسُلِي ۖ فَكَيْفَ كَانَ نَكِيرِ

translation: Say [O Prophet], “I only advise you to do one thing: stand up for Allah, in pairs and individually, then reflect. There is no madness in your companion[23]; he is but a warner to you ahead of a severe punishment.”
footnotes: [23] i.e., Muhammad (ﷺ).
arabic: ۞ قُلْ إِنَّمَا أَعِظُكُمْ بِوَاحِدَةٍ ۖ أَنْ تَقُومُوا لِلَّهِ مَثْنَىٰ وَفُرَادَىٰ ثُمَّ تَتَفَكَّرُوا ۚ مَا بِصَاحِبِكُمْ مِنْ جِنَّةٍ ۚ إِنْ هُوَ إِلَّا نَذِيرٌ لَكُمْ بَيْنَ يَدَيْ عَذَابٍ شَدِيدٍ

translation: Say, “If I had ever asked you for a reward, it is yours. My reward is only with Allah, and He is Witness over all things.”
arabic: قُلْ مَا سَأَلْتُكُمْ مِنْ أَجْرٍ فَهُوَ لَكُمْ ۖ إِنْ أَجْرِيَ إِلَّا عَلَى اللَّهِ ۖ وَهُوَ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَيْءٍ شَهِيدٌ

translation: Say, “My Lord hurls the Truth [against falsehood], and He is the All-Knower of the unseen.”
arabic: قُلْ إِنَّ رَبِّي يَقْذِفُ بِالْحَقِّ عَلَّامُ الْغُيُوبِ

translation: Say, “The Truth has come, and falsehood can neither initiate nor restore anything[24].”
footnotes: [24] i.e., the falsehood has been abolished.
arabic: قُلْ جَاءَ الْحَقُّ وَمَا يُبْدِئُ الْبَاطِلُ وَمَا يُعِيدُ

translation: Say, “If I go astray, the detriment of my straying is only upon myself; but if I am guided, it is because of what my Lord reveals to me. He is indeed All-Hearing, Ever Near.”
arabic: قُلْ إِنْ ضَلَلْتُ فَإِنَّمَا أَضِلُّ عَلَىٰ نَفْسِي ۖ وَإِنِ اهْتَدَيْتُ فَبِمَا يُوحِي إِلَيَّ رَبِّي ۚ إِنَّهُ سَمِيعٌ قَرِيبٌ

translation: If only you could see when they are stricken with terror, but there will be no escape, and they will be seized from a nearby place[25].
footnotes: [25] i.e., from the place of Judgment to the Hellfire.
arabic: وَلَوْ تَرَىٰ إِذْ فَزِعُوا فَلَا فَوْتَ وَأُخِذُوا مِنْ مَكَانٍ قَرِيبٍ

translation: They will say, “Now we believe in it,” but how could they attain faith from such a distant place[26],
footnotes: [26] For it is already too late to return to worldly life.
arabic: وَقَالُوا آمَنَّا بِهِ وَأَنَّىٰ لَهُمُ التَّنَاوُشُ مِنْ مَكَانٍ بَعِيدٍ

translation: while they disbelieved in it before, making far-fetched conjectures about the unseen[27]?
footnotes: [27] i.e., conjectures far from the truth; saying about the Prophet (ﷺ) that he is a magician, a soothsayer, a poet, etc.
arabic: وَقَدْ كَفَرُوا بِهِ مِنْ قَبْلُ ۖ وَيَقْذِفُونَ بِالْغَيْبِ مِنْ مَكَانٍ بَعِيدٍ

translation: A barrier will be placed between them and what they desire[28], as was done with the likes of them before, for they were indeed in a disquieting doubt.
footnotes: [28] i.e., the attainment of faith and admission into Paradise.
arabic: وَحِيلَ بَيْنَهُمْ وَبَيْنَ مَا يَشْتَهُونَ كَمَا فُعِلَ بِأَشْيَاعِهِمْ مِنْ قَبْلُ ۚ إِنَّهُمْ كَانُوا فِي شَكٍّ مُرِيبٍ

translation: All praise be to Allah, the Originator of the heavens and earth, Who made the angels messengers with two, three, or four wings. He increases in creation whatever He wills. Indeed, Allah is Most Capable of all things.
arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ فَاطِرِ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ جَاعِلِ الْمَلَائِكَةِ رُسُلًا أُولِي أَجْنِحَةٍ مَثْنَىٰ وَثُلَاثَ وَرُبَاعَ ۚ يَزِيدُ فِي الْخَلْقِ مَا يَشَاءُ ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيرٌ

translation: Whatever mercy Allah opens up for people, none can withhold it; and whatever He withholds, none can release it thereafter, for He is the All-Mighty, All-Wise.
arabic: مَا يَفْتَحِ اللَّهُ لِلنَّاسِ مِنْ رَحْمَةٍ فَلَا مُمْسِكَ لَهَا ۖ وَمَا يُمْسِكْ فَلَا مُرْسِلَ لَهُ مِنْ بَعْدِهِ ۚ وَهُوَ الْعَزِيزُ الْحَكِيمُ

translation: O people, remember Allah’s favor upon you. Is there any creator other than Allah who gives you provision from heaven and earth? None has the right to be worshiped except Him. How can you then be deluded?
arabic: يَا أَيُّهَا النَّاسُ اذْكُرُوا نِعْمَتَ اللَّهِ عَلَيْكُمْ ۚ هَلْ مِنْ خَالِقٍ غَيْرُ اللَّهِ يَرْزُقُكُمْ مِنَ السَّمَاءِ وَالْأَرْضِ ۚ لَا إِلَٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ ۖ فَأَنَّىٰ تُؤْفَكُونَ

translation: If they reject you, there were messengers rejected before you; it is to Allah that all matters will be returned.
arabic: وَإِنْ يُكَذِّبُوكَ فَقَدْ كُذِّبَتْ رُسُلٌ مِنْ قَبْلِكَ ۚ وَإِلَى اللَّهِ تُرْجَعُ الْأُمُورُ

translation: O people, indeed Allah’s promise is true, so do not let the life of this world deceive you, nor let the Chief Deceiver [Satan] deceive you concerning Allah.
arabic: يَا أَيُّهَا النَّاسُ إِنَّ وَعْدَ اللَّهِ حَقٌّ ۖ فَلَا تَغُرَّنَّكُمُ الْحَيَاةُ الدُّنْيَا ۖ وَلَا يَغُرَّنَّكُمْ بِاللَّهِ الْغَرُورُ

translation: Indeed, Satan is an enemy to you, so take him as an enemy. He only calls his followers to be among the inmates of the Blazing Fire.
arabic: إِنَّ الشَّيْطَانَ لَكُمْ عَدُوٌّ فَاتَّخِذُوهُ عَدُوًّا ۚ إِنَّمَا يَدْعُو حِزْبَهُ لِيَكُونُوا مِنْ أَصْحَابِ السَّعِيرِ

translation: Those who disbelieve will have a severe punishment, but those who believe and do righteous deeds will have forgiveness and a great reward.
arabic: الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا لَهُمْ عَذَابٌ شَدِيدٌ ۖ وَالَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَعَمِلُوا الصَّالِحَاتِ لَهُمْ مَغْفِرَةٌ وَأَجْرٌ كَبِيرٌ

translation: Is one whose evil deed is made appealing to him so he deems it good [like one who is rightly guided]? It is Allah who causes to stray whom He wills and guides whom He wills. So do not let yourself collapse in grief for them. Allah is All-Knowing of what they do.
arabic: أَفَمَنْ زُيِّنَ لَهُ سُوءُ عَمَلِهِ فَرَآهُ حَسَنًا ۖ فَإِنَّ اللَّهَ يُضِلُّ مَنْ يَشَاءُ وَيَهْدِي مَنْ يَشَاءُ ۖ فَلَا تَذْهَبْ نَفْسُكَ عَلَيْهِمْ حَسَرَاتٍ ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ عَلِيمٌ بِمَا يَصْنَعُونَ

translation: It is Allah Who sends the winds which stir up clouds, then We drive them to a dead land and revive therewith the earth after its death. Such will be the Resurrection.
arabic: وَاللَّهُ الَّذِي أَرْسَلَ الرِّيَاحَ فَتُثِيرُ سَحَابًا فَسُقْنَاهُ إِلَىٰ بَلَدٍ مَيِّتٍ فَأَحْيَيْنَا بِهِ الْأَرْضَ بَعْدَ مَوْتِهَا ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ النُّشُورُ

translation: Whoever seeks honor, then all honor belongs to Allah alone. To Him ascend good words, and righteous deeds raise them[1]. But those who plan evil deeds there will be a severe punishment for them, and the plans of such people will perish.
footnotes: [1] To Allah, i.e., righteous deeds are confirmation of what is uttered by the tongue.
arabic: مَنْ كَانَ يُرِيدُ الْعِزَّةَ فَلِلَّهِ الْعِزَّةُ جَمِيعًا ۚ إِلَيْهِ يَصْعَدُ الْكَلِمُ الطَّيِّبُ وَالْعَمَلُ الصَّالِحُ يَرْفَعُهُ ۚ وَالَّذِينَ يَمْكُرُونَ السَّيِّئَاتِ لَهُمْ عَذَابٌ شَدِيدٌ ۖ وَمَكْرُ أُولَٰئِكَ هُوَ يَبُورُ

translation: It is Allah Who created you from dust[2], then from a drop of semen, and then He made you into pairs[3]. No female conceives nor gives birth without His knowledge. None is given long life or cut short of his life except that it is in a Record[4]. That is surely easy for Allah.
footnotes:
[2] i.e., your father, Adam. [3] i.e., into males and females.
 [4] i.e., the Preserved Tablet (al-Lawh al-Mahfūzh).
arabic: وَاللَّهُ خَلَقَكُمْ مِنْ تُرَابٍ ثُمَّ مِنْ نُطْفَةٍ ثُمَّ جَعَلَكُمْ أَزْوَاجًا ۚ وَمَا تَحْمِلُ مِنْ أُنْثَىٰ وَلَا تَضَعُ إِلَّا بِعِلْمِهِ ۚ وَمَا يُعَمَّرُ مِنْ مُعَمَّرٍ وَلَا يُنْقَصُ مِنْ عُمُرِهِ إِلَّا فِي كِتَابٍ ۚ إِنَّ ذَٰلِكَ عَلَى اللَّهِ يَسِيرٌ

translation: The two bodies of water are not alike: one is fresh and palatable, pleasant to drink, and the other is salty and bitter. Yet from each you eat fresh meat and extract ornaments to wear. And you see the ships traverse their way through both, so that you may seek His bounty and so that you may give thanks.
arabic: وَمَا يَسْتَوِي الْبَحْرَانِ هَٰذَا عَذْبٌ فُرَاتٌ سَائِغٌ شَرَابُهُ وَهَٰذَا مِلْحٌ أُجَاجٌ ۖ وَمِنْ كُلٍّ تَأْكُلُونَ لَحْمًا طَرِيًّا وَتَسْتَخْرِجُونَ حِلْيَةً تَلْبَسُونَهَا ۖ وَتَرَى الْفُلْكَ فِيهِ مَوَاخِرَ لِتَبْتَغُوا مِنْ فَضْلِهِ وَلَعَلَّكُمْ تَشْكُرُونَ

translation: He merges the night into the day and the day into the night, and subjected the sun and the moon, each running its course for an appointed term. Such is Allah, your Lord. To Him belongs the dominion, whereas those whom you invoke besides Him do not own so much as the membrane of a date stone.
arabic: يُولِجُ اللَّيْلَ فِي النَّهَارِ وَيُولِجُ النَّهَارَ فِي اللَّيْلِ وَسَخَّرَ الشَّمْسَ وَالْقَمَرَ كُلٌّ يَجْرِي لِأَجَلٍ مُسَمًّى ۚ ذَٰلِكُمُ اللَّهُ رَبُّكُمْ لَهُ الْمُلْكُ ۚ وَالَّذِينَ تَدْعُونَ مِنْ دُونِهِ مَا يَمْلِكُونَ مِنْ قِطْمِيرٍ

translation: If you call upon them, they cannot hear your call, and even if they were to hear, they could not respond to you. On the Day of Resurrection they will disown your associating them as partners with Allah[5]. And none can inform you like the All-Aware.
footnotes: [5] Or your worship of them.
arabic: إِنْ تَدْعُوهُمْ لَا يَسْمَعُوا دُعَاءَكُمْ وَلَوْ سَمِعُوا مَا اسْتَجَابُوا لَكُمْ ۖ وَيَوْمَ الْقِيَامَةِ يَكْفُرُونَ بِشِرْكِكُمْ ۚ وَلَا يُنَبِّئُكَ مِثْلُ خَبِيرٍ

translation: O people, it is you who are in need of Allah, whereas Allah is the Self-Sufficient, the Praiseworthy.
arabic: ۞ يَا أَيُّهَا النَّاسُ أَنْتُمُ الْفُقَرَاءُ إِلَى اللَّهِ ۖ وَاللَّهُ هُوَ الْغَنِيُّ الْحَمِيدُ

translation: If He wills, He can eliminate you and bring in a new creation,
arabic: إِنْ يَشَأْ يُذْهِبْكُمْ وَيَأْتِ بِخَلْقٍ جَدِيدٍ

translation: for that is not difficult for Allah.
arabic: وَمَا ذَٰلِكَ عَلَى اللَّهِ بِعَزِيزٍ

translation: No bearer of burdens can bear the burden of another. If a heavily-laden soul calls for help to bear its burden, nothing of it will be carried, even if he is a close relative. You can only warn those who fear their Lord unseen[6] and establish prayer. Whoever purifies himself, he only does so for his own benefit. To Allah is the final return.
footnotes: [6] Without seeing Him or when they are in private.
arabic: وَلَا تَزِرُ وَازِرَةٌ وِزْرَ أُخْرَىٰ ۚ وَإِنْ تَدْعُ مُثْقَلَةٌ إِلَىٰ حِمْلِهَا لَا يُحْمَلْ مِنْهُ شَيْءٌ وَلَوْ كَانَ ذَا قُرْبَىٰ ۗ إِنَّمَا تُنْذِرُ الَّذِينَ يَخْشَوْنَ رَبَّهُمْ بِالْغَيْبِ وَأَقَامُوا الصَّلَاةَ ۚ وَمَنْ تَزَكَّىٰ فَإِنَّمَا يَتَزَكَّىٰ لِنَفْسِهِ ۚ وَإِلَى اللَّهِ الْمَصِيرُ

translation: The blind and the seeing are not equal[7],
footnotes: [7] It refers to believers and disbelievers.
arabic: وَمَا يَسْتَوِي الْأَعْمَىٰ وَالْبَصِيرُ

translation: nor are the depths of darkness and the light[8],
footnotes: [8] It refers to belief and disbelief.
arabic: وَلَا الظُّلُمَاتُ وَلَا النُّورُ

translation: nor the shade and the scorching wind[9].
footnotes: [9] It refers to Paradise and Hell.
arabic: وَلَا الظِّلُّ وَلَا الْحَرُورُ

translation: Nor are the living and the dead equal. Allah makes to hear whom He wills, but you cannot make to hear those who are in the graves[10].
footnotes: [10] It refers to believers and disbelievers.
arabic: وَمَا يَسْتَوِي الْأَحْيَاءُ وَلَا الْأَمْوَاتُ ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ يُسْمِعُ مَنْ يَشَاءُ ۖ وَمَا أَنْتَ بِمُسْمِعٍ مَنْ فِي الْقُبُورِ

translation: You are but a warner.
arabic: إِنْ أَنْتَ إِلَّا نَذِيرٌ

translation: We have sent you with the truth as a bearer of glad tidings and a warner. There has never been any community except that a warner came to it[11].
footnotes: [11] Among all prophets and messengers, only twenty-five are mentioned in the Qur’an.
arabic: إِنَّا أَرْسَلْنَاكَ بِالْحَقِّ بَشِيرًا وَنَذِيرًا ۚ وَإِنْ مِنْ أُمَّةٍ إِلَّا خَلَا فِيهَا نَذِيرٌ

translation: If they reject you, so did those who came before them. Their messengers came to them with clear proofs, divine scriptures[12], and an enlightening Book[13].
footnotes:
[12] i.e., the Torah, the Gospel, and the Psalms.
 [13] i.e., the Qur’an.
arabic: وَإِنْ يُكَذِّبُوكَ فَقَدْ كَذَّبَ الَّذِينَ مِنْ قَبْلِهِمْ جَاءَتْهُمْ رُسُلُهُمْ بِالْبَيِّنَاتِ وَبِالزُّبُرِ وَبِالْكِتَابِ الْمُنِيرِ

translation: Then I seized those who disbelieved. How severe was My response!
arabic: ثُمَّ أَخَذْتُ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا ۖ فَكَيْفَ كَانَ نَكِيرِ

translation: Do you not see that Allah sends down rain from the sky, then We bring forth thereby fruits of various colors? And in the mountains there are various tracts of white and red, of various colors, and raven black;
arabic: أَلَمْ تَرَ أَنَّ اللَّهَ أَنْزَلَ مِنَ السَّمَاءِ مَاءً فَأَخْرَجْنَا بِهِ ثَمَرَاتٍ مُخْتَلِفًا أَلْوَانُهَا ۚ وَمِنَ الْجِبَالِ جُدَدٌ بِيضٌ وَحُمْرٌ مُخْتَلِفٌ أَلْوَانُهَا وَغَرَابِيبُ سُودٌ

translation: just as humans, animals and livestock are of various colors. Only the people of knowledge among His slaves fear Allah. Indeed, Allah is All-Mighty, All-Forgiving.
arabic: وَمِنَ النَّاسِ وَالدَّوَابِّ وَالْأَنْعَامِ مُخْتَلِفٌ أَلْوَانُهُ كَذَٰلِكَ ۗ إِنَّمَا يَخْشَى اللَّهَ مِنْ عِبَادِهِ الْعُلَمَاءُ ۗ إِنَّ اللَّهَ عَزِيزٌ غَفُورٌ

translation: Those who recite the Book of Allah, establish prayer, and spend out of what We have provided for them, secretly and openly, hoping for a deal that will suffer no loss,
arabic: إِنَّ الَّذِينَ يَتْلُونَ كِتَابَ اللَّهِ وَأَقَامُوا الصَّلَاةَ وَأَنْفَقُوا مِمَّا رَزَقْنَاهُمْ سِرًّا وَعَلَانِيَةً يَرْجُونَ تِجَارَةً لَنْ تَبُورَ

translation: so that He will reward them in full and give them more out of His bounty[14]. He is All-Forgiving, Most Appreciative.
footnotes: [14] i.e., Allah gives much in return for little.
arabic: لِيُوَفِّيَهُمْ أُجُورَهُمْ وَيَزِيدَهُمْ مِنْ فَضْلِهِ ۚ إِنَّهُ غَفُورٌ شَكُورٌ

translation: The Book that We have revealed to you [O Prophet] is the truth, confirming that which came before it. Indeed, Allah is All-Aware and All-Seeing of His slaves.
arabic: وَالَّذِي أَوْحَيْنَا إِلَيْكَ مِنَ الْكِتَابِ هُوَ الْحَقُّ مُصَدِّقًا لِمَا بَيْنَ يَدَيْهِ ۗ إِنَّ اللَّهَ بِعِبَادِهِ لَخَبِيرٌ بَصِيرٌ

translation: Then We made to inherit the Book those whom We have chosen from among Our slaves[15]. But among them are some who wrong themselves, some follow a middle course, and some are foremost in good deeds with Allah’s permission. That is the great bounty.
footnotes: [15] i.e., the Prophet Muhammad’s (ﷺ) followers.
arabic: ثُمَّ أَوْرَثْنَا الْكِتَابَ الَّذِينَ اصْطَفَيْنَا مِنْ عِبَادِنَا ۖ فَمِنْهُمْ ظَالِمٌ لِنَفْسِهِ وَمِنْهُمْ مُقْتَصِدٌ وَمِنْهُمْ سَابِقٌ بِالْخَيْرَاتِ بِإِذْنِ اللَّهِ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ هُوَ الْفَضْلُ الْكَبِيرُ

translation: They will enter Gardens of Eternity; they will be adorned therein with bracelets of gold and pearls, and their garments will be of silk.
arabic: جَنَّاتُ عَدْنٍ يَدْخُلُونَهَا يُحَلَّوْنَ فِيهَا مِنْ أَسَاوِرَ مِنْ ذَهَبٍ وَلُؤْلُؤًا ۖ وَلِبَاسُهُمْ فِيهَا حَرِيرٌ

translation: And they will say, “All praise be to Allah Who has taken away from us all sorrow. Indeed, our Lord is All-Forgiving, Most Appreciative,
arabic: وَقَالُوا الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ الَّذِي أَذْهَبَ عَنَّا الْحَزَنَ ۖ إِنَّ رَبَّنَا لَغَفُورٌ شَكُورٌ

translation: He Who has caused us to settle – out of His grace – in the everlasting home, wherein no weariness or fatigue will touch us.”
arabic: الَّذِي أَحَلَّنَا دَارَ الْمُقَامَةِ مِنْ فَضْلِهِ لَا يَمَسُّنَا فِيهَا نَصَبٌ وَلَا يَمَسُّنَا فِيهَا لُغُوبٌ

translation: As for those who disbelieve, there will be the Fire of Hell; neither will they be sentenced to death, so that they may die, nor will its punishment be lightened for them. This is how We recompense every disbeliever.
arabic: وَالَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا لَهُمْ نَارُ جَهَنَّمَ لَا يُقْضَىٰ عَلَيْهِمْ فَيَمُوتُوا وَلَا يُخَفَّفُ عَنْهُمْ مِنْ عَذَابِهَا ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ نَجْزِي كُلَّ كَفُورٍ

translation: They will be screaming therein, “Our Lord, take us out; we will do righteous deeds, unlike what we used to do.” [They will be told], “Did We not give you long enough lives to take heed for anyone who wished to take heed? And the warner did come to you. So taste! The wrongdoers will have no helper.”
arabic: وَهُمْ يَصْطَرِخُونَ فِيهَا رَبَّنَا أَخْرِجْنَا نَعْمَلْ صَالِحًا غَيْرَ الَّذِي كُنَّا نَعْمَلُ ۚ أَوَلَمْ نُعَمِّرْكُمْ مَا يَتَذَكَّرُ فِيهِ مَنْ تَذَكَّرَ وَجَاءَكُمُ النَّذِيرُ ۖ فَذُوقُوا فَمَا لِلظَّالِمِينَ مِنْ نَصِيرٍ

translation: Allah is the Knower of the unseen in the heavens and earth. He is All-Knowing of what is in the hearts.
arabic: إِنَّ اللَّهَ عَالِمُ غَيْبِ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ ۚ إِنَّهُ عَلِيمٌ بِذَاتِ الصُّدُورِ

translation: It is He Who has made you successors on earth. Whoever disbelieves will bear the burden of his disbelief. Their disbelief only increases the disbelievers in contempt before their Lord, and their disbelief only increases the disbelievers in loss.
arabic: هُوَ الَّذِي جَعَلَكُمْ خَلَائِفَ فِي الْأَرْضِ ۚ فَمَنْ كَفَرَ فَعَلَيْهِ كُفْرُهُ ۖ وَلَا يَزِيدُ الْكَافِرِينَ كُفْرُهُمْ عِنْدَ رَبِّهِمْ إِلَّا مَقْتًا ۖ وَلَا يَزِيدُ الْكَافِرِينَ كُفْرُهُمْ إِلَّا خَسَارًا

translation: Say, “Tell me about your associate-gods whom you supplicate besides Allah. Show me what they created on earth, or do they have a share in the heavens? Or have We given them a Book so they have clear proof? No, the wrongdoers promise one another nothing but delusion[16].”
footnotes: [16] By giving their followers deceptive hopes that their false deities will intercede for them with Allah.
arabic: قُلْ أَرَأَيْتُمْ شُرَكَاءَكُمُ الَّذِينَ تَدْعُونَ مِنْ دُونِ اللَّهِ أَرُونِي مَاذَا خَلَقُوا مِنَ الْأَرْضِ أَمْ لَهُمْ شِرْكٌ فِي السَّمَاوَاتِ أَمْ آتَيْنَاهُمْ كِتَابًا فَهُمْ عَلَىٰ بَيِّنَتٍ مِنْهُ ۚ بَلْ إِنْ يَعِدُ الظَّالِمُونَ بَعْضُهُمْ بَعْضًا إِلَّا غُرُورًا

translation: Allah keeps the heavens and earth from vanishing. If they were to vanish, there is none to sustain them other than Him. He is Most Forbearing, All-Forgiving.
arabic: ۞ إِنَّ اللَّهَ يُمْسِكُ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضَ أَنْ تَزُولَا ۚ وَلَئِنْ زَالَتَا إِنْ أَمْسَكَهُمَا مِنْ أَحَدٍ مِنْ بَعْدِهِ ۚ إِنَّهُ كَانَ حَلِيمًا غَفُورًا

translation: They swore by Allah their most solemn oaths that if a warner came to them, they would surely be more guided than any other community. But when a warner came to them, it only added to their aversion –
arabic: وَأَقْسَمُوا بِاللَّهِ جَهْدَ أَيْمَانِهِمْ لَئِنْ جَاءَهُمْ نَذِيرٌ لَيَكُونُنَّ أَهْدَىٰ مِنْ إِحْدَى الْأُمَمِ ۖ فَلَمَّا جَاءَهُمْ نَذِيرٌ مَا زَادَهُمْ إِلَّا نُفُورًا

translation: due to their arrogance in the land and plotting evil, but evil plotting only backfires on its own people. Are they awaiting anything other than the fate of the earlier peoples? You will find no change in Allah’s way[17], and you will find no alteration in Allah’s way[18].
footnotes:
[17] In punishing those who deny the prophets.
 [18] In transferring punishment to others in place of them.
arabic: اسْتِكْبَارًا فِي الْأَرْضِ وَمَكْرَ السَّيِّئِ ۚ وَلَا يَحِيقُ الْمَكْرُ السَّيِّئُ إِلَّا بِأَهْلِهِ ۚ فَهَلْ يَنْظُرُونَ إِلَّا سُنَّتَ الْأَوَّلِينَ ۚ فَلَنْ تَجِدَ لِسُنَّتِ اللَّهِ تَبْدِيلًا ۖ وَلَنْ تَجِدَ لِسُنَّتِ اللَّهِ تَحْوِيلًا

translation: Have they not traveled in the land to see what was the end of those who came before them. They were more powerful than them? Allah is not such that something can escape Him in the heavens or on earth. He is indeed All-Knowing, Most Capable.
arabic: أَوَلَمْ يَسِيرُوا فِي الْأَرْضِ فَيَنْظُرُوا كَيْفَ كَانَ عَاقِبَةُ الَّذِينَ مِنْ قَبْلِهِمْ وَكَانُوا أَشَدَّ مِنْهُمْ قُوَّةً ۚ وَمَا كَانَ اللَّهُ لِيُعْجِزَهُ مِنْ شَيْءٍ فِي السَّمَاوَاتِ وَلَا فِي الْأَرْضِ ۚ إِنَّهُ كَانَ عَلِيمًا قَدِيرًا

translation: If Allah were to take people to task for what they did, He would not leave a single living being on earth, but He gives them respite for an appointed term. When their appointed time comes, then Allah is All-Seeing of His slaves.
arabic: وَلَوْ يُؤَاخِذُ اللَّهُ النَّاسَ بِمَا كَسَبُوا مَا تَرَكَ عَلَىٰ ظَهْرِهَا مِنْ دَابَّةٍ وَلَٰكِنْ يُؤَخِّرُهُمْ إِلَىٰ أَجَلٍ مُسَمًّى ۖ فَإِذَا جَاءَ أَجَلُهُمْ فَإِنَّ اللَّهَ كَانَ بِعِبَادِهِ بَصِيرًا

translation: Yā Sīn[1]
footnotes: [1] See footnote 2:1.
arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ يس

translation: By the Qur’an, full of wisdom,
arabic: وَالْقُرْآنِ الْحَكِيمِ

translation: You [O Muhammad] are indeed one of the messengers,
arabic: إِنَّكَ لَمِنَ الْمُرْسَلِينَ

translation: on a straight path,
arabic: عَلَىٰ صِرَاطٍ مُسْتَقِيمٍ

translation: [This is] a revelation from the All-Mighty, Most Merciful,
arabic: تَنْزِيلَ الْعَزِيزِ الرَّحِيمِ

translation: so that you warn a people whose forefathers were not warned, so they are heedless.
arabic: لِتُنْذِرَ قَوْمًا مَا أُنْذِرَ آبَاؤُهُمْ فَهُمْ غَافِلُونَ

translation: The decree [of punishment] has been passed against most of them, for they will not believe.
arabic: لَقَدْ حَقَّ الْقَوْلُ عَلَىٰ أَكْثَرِهِمْ فَهُمْ لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ

translation: [It is as if] We have placed shackles around their necks up to their chins, so their heads are forced to remain up,
arabic: إِنَّا جَعَلْنَا فِي أَعْنَاقِهِمْ أَغْلَالًا فَهِيَ إِلَى الْأَذْقَانِ فَهُمْ مُقْمَحُونَ

translation: and We have placed a barrier before them and a barrier behind them, and have blocked their vision so they cannot see[2].
footnotes: [2] Because of their obstinacy and persistence in disbelief.
arabic: وَجَعَلْنَا مِنْ بَيْنِ أَيْدِيهِمْ سَدًّا وَمِنْ خَلْفِهِمْ سَدًّا فَأَغْشَيْنَاهُمْ فَهُمْ لَا يُبْصِرُونَ

translation: It is the same to them whether you warn them or not, they will not believe.
arabic: وَسَوَاءٌ عَلَيْهِمْ أَأَنْذَرْتَهُمْ أَمْ لَمْ تُنْذِرْهُمْ لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ

translation: You can only warn one who follows the Reminder[3] and fears the Most Compassionate unseen. So give him glad tidings of forgiveness and a generous reward.
footnotes: [3] i.e., the Qur’an.
arabic: إِنَّمَا تُنْذِرُ مَنِ اتَّبَعَ الذِّكْرَ وَخَشِيَ الرَّحْمَٰنَ بِالْغَيْبِ ۖ فَبَشِّرْهُ بِمَغْفِرَةٍ وَأَجْرٍ كَرِيمٍ

translation: It is We Who give life to the dead, and record what they send forth and what they leave behind, and We keep an account of everything in a clear Record[4].
footnotes: [4] See footnote 35:11.
arabic: إِنَّا نَحْنُ نُحْيِي الْمَوْتَىٰ وَنَكْتُبُ مَا قَدَّمُوا وَآثَارَهُمْ ۚ وَكُلَّ شَيْءٍ أَحْصَيْنَاهُ فِي إِمَامٍ مُبِينٍ

translation: Give them an example of the People of the Town when the messengers came to it.
arabic: وَاضْرِبْ لَهُمْ مَثَلًا أَصْحَابَ الْقَرْيَةِ إِذْ جَاءَهَا الْمُرْسَلُونَ

translation: When We sent them two [messengers], but they rejected them, so We strengthened them with a third, and they said, “We are sent to you as messengers.”
arabic: إِذْ أَرْسَلْنَا إِلَيْهِمُ اثْنَيْنِ فَكَذَّبُوهُمَا فَعَزَّزْنَا بِثَالِثٍ فَقَالُوا إِنَّا إِلَيْكُمْ مُرْسَلُونَ

translation: They said, “You are no more than human beings like us, and the Most Compassionate has not sent down anything. You are simply lying.”
arabic: قَالُوا مَا أَنْتُمْ إِلَّا بَشَرٌ مِثْلُنَا وَمَا أَنْزَلَ الرَّحْمَٰنُ مِنْ شَيْءٍ إِنْ أَنْتُمْ إِلَّا تَكْذِبُونَ

translation: They said, “Our Lord knows that we are sent to you as messengers.
arabic: قَالُوا رَبُّنَا يَعْلَمُ إِنَّا إِلَيْكُمْ لَمُرْسَلُونَ

translation: Our duty is only to convey the message clearly.”
arabic: وَمَا عَلَيْنَا إِلَّا الْبَلَاغُ الْمُبِينُ

translation: The people said, “We consider you as an evil omen. If you do not desist, we will surely stone you, and we will inflict upon you a painful punishment.”
arabic: قَالُوا إِنَّا تَطَيَّرْنَا بِكُمْ ۖ لَئِنْ لَمْ تَنْتَهُوا لَنَرْجُمَنَّكُمْ وَلَيَمَسَّنَّكُمْ مِنَّا عَذَابٌ أَلِيمٌ

translation: The messengers said, “Your evil omen is with yourselves [because of your disbelief]. Is it[5] because you are admonished? Rather, you are a people who transgress all bounds.”
footnotes: [5] i.e., this threat.
arabic: قَالُوا طَائِرُكُمْ مَعَكُمْ ۚ أَئِنْ ذُكِّرْتُمْ ۚ بَلْ أَنْتُمْ قَوْمٌ مُسْرِفُونَ

translation: A man came from the farthest end of the city, rushing, and said, “O my people, follow the messengers.
arabic: وَجَاءَ مِنْ أَقْصَى الْمَدِينَةِ رَجُلٌ يَسْعَىٰ قَالَ يَا قَوْمِ اتَّبِعُوا الْمُرْسَلِينَ

translation: Follow those who ask no recompense of you, and who are guided.
arabic: اتَّبِعُوا مَنْ لَا يَسْأَلُكُمْ أَجْرًا وَهُمْ مُهْتَدُونَ

translation: Why should I not worship the One Who created me and to Whom you will all be brought back?
arabic: وَمَا لِيَ لَا أَعْبُدُ الَّذِي فَطَرَنِي وَإِلَيْهِ تُرْجَعُونَ

translation: Should I take besides Him other gods whose intercession cannot avail me in the least, nor can they come to my rescue, if the Most Compassionate wills to harm me?
arabic: أَأَتَّخِذُ مِنْ دُونِهِ آلِهَةً إِنْ يُرِدْنِ الرَّحْمَٰنُ بِضُرٍّ لَا تُغْنِ عَنِّي شَفَاعَتُهُمْ شَيْئًا وَلَا يُنْقِذُونِ

translation: Surely I would then be clearly misguided.
arabic: إِنِّي إِذًا لَفِي ضَلَالٍ مُبِينٍ

translation: I believe in your Lord, so listen to me.”
arabic: إِنِّي آمَنْتُ بِرَبِّكُمْ فَاسْمَعُونِ

translation: [But they killed him], so he was told[6], “Enter Paradise.” He said, “If only my people knew[7]
footnotes: [6] After he was martyred for the sake of Allah. [7] He said so after Allah admitted him into paradise and he saw the pleasures therein.
arabic: قِيلَ ادْخُلِ الْجَنَّةَ ۖ قَالَ يَا لَيْتَ قَوْمِي يَعْلَمُونَ

translation: of how my Lord has forgiven me, and made me among the honored ones.”
arabic: بِمَا غَفَرَ لِي رَبِّي وَجَعَلَنِي مِنَ الْمُكْرَمِينَ

translation: After his death, We did not send down any soldiers from heaven against his people, nor did We have to do so.
arabic: ۞ وَمَا أَنْزَلْنَا عَلَىٰ قَوْمِهِ مِنْ بَعْدِهِ مِنْ جُنْدٍ مِنَ السَّمَاءِ وَمَا كُنَّا مُنْزِلِينَ

translation: It was no more than a single blast, and immediately they were extinguished.
arabic: إِنْ كَانَتْ إِلَّا صَيْحَةً وَاحِدَةً فَإِذَا هُمْ خَامِدُونَ

translation: Alas for the humans! No messenger ever comes to them but they ridicule him.
arabic: يَا حَسْرَةً عَلَى الْعِبَادِ ۚ مَا يَأْتِيهِمْ مِنْ رَسُولٍ إِلَّا كَانُوا بِهِ يَسْتَهْزِئُونَ

translation: Do they not see how many generations We destroyed before them who will never come back to them[8]?
footnotes: [8] i.e., to the life of this world.
arabic: أَلَمْ يَرَوْا كَمْ أَهْلَكْنَا قَبْلَهُمْ مِنَ الْقُرُونِ أَنَّهُمْ إِلَيْهِمْ لَا يَرْجِعُونَ

translation: Yet all of them will be brought before Us.
arabic: وَإِنْ كُلٌّ لَمَّا جَمِيعٌ لَدَيْنَا مُحْضَرُونَ

translation: There is a sign for them in the dead land: We give it life and produce from it grain for them to eat.
arabic: وَآيَةٌ لَهُمُ الْأَرْضُ الْمَيْتَةُ أَحْيَيْنَاهَا وَأَخْرَجْنَا مِنْهَا حَبًّا فَمِنْهُ يَأْكُلُونَ

translation: And We have made therein gardens of palm trees and grapevines, and caused springs to gush forth,
arabic: وَجَعَلْنَا فِيهَا جَنَّاتٍ مِنْ نَخِيلٍ وَأَعْنَابٍ وَفَجَّرْنَا فِيهَا مِنَ الْعُيُونِ

translation: so that they may eat of its fruit that was not made by their hands[9]. Will they not then give thanks?
footnotes: [9] i.e., that which Allah has produced for them without labor on their part.
arabic: لِيَأْكُلُوا مِنْ ثَمَرِهِ وَمَا عَمِلَتْهُ أَيْدِيهِمْ ۖ أَفَلَا يَشْكُرُونَ

translation: Glory be to the One Who created all types of things[10] that the earth produces, and of themselves, and of things that they have no knowledge about.
footnotes: [10] i.e., all species, all things in pairs.
arabic: سُبْحَانَ الَّذِي خَلَقَ الْأَزْوَاجَ كُلَّهَا مِمَّا تُنْبِتُ الْأَرْضُ وَمِنْ أَنْفُسِهِمْ وَمِمَّا لَا يَعْلَمُونَ

translation: There is another sign for them in the night: We strip from it the daylight, and they are left in darkness.
arabic: وَآيَةٌ لَهُمُ اللَّيْلُ نَسْلَخُ مِنْهُ النَّهَارَ فَإِذَا هُمْ مُظْلِمُونَ

translation: The sun is running to its determined course. That is the design of the All-Mighty, All-Knowing.
arabic: وَالشَّمْسُ تَجْرِي لِمُسْتَقَرٍّ لَهَا ۚ ذَٰلِكَ تَقْدِيرُ الْعَزِيزِ الْعَلِيمِ

translation: As for the moon, We have determined phases for it, until it becomes like an old palm stalk.
arabic: وَالْقَمَرَ قَدَّرْنَاهُ مَنَازِلَ حَتَّىٰ عَادَ كَالْعُرْجُونِ الْقَدِيمِ

translation: It is not for the sun to catch up with the moon, nor for the night to outstrip the day. Each is floating in its own orbit.
arabic: لَا الشَّمْسُ يَنْبَغِي لَهَا أَنْ تُدْرِكَ الْقَمَرَ وَلَا اللَّيْلُ سَابِقُ النَّهَارِ ۚ وَكُلٌّ فِي فَلَكٍ يَسْبَحُونَ

translation: Another sign for them is that We carried their offspring[11] in the loaded Ark,
footnotes: [11] "Dhurriyyah" (lit., offspring); however, it is used here to denote ancestors (being the offspring of Noah) who were saved from the flood.
arabic: وَآيَةٌ لَهُمْ أَنَّا حَمَلْنَا ذُرِّيَّتَهُمْ فِي الْفُلْكِ الْمَشْحُونِ

translation: and We created for them similar things on which they ride.
arabic: وَخَلَقْنَا لَهُمْ مِنْ مِثْلِهِ مَا يَرْكَبُونَ

translation: If We willed, We could drown them, then there would be no one to respond to their cry, nor could they be rescued,
arabic: وَإِنْ نَشَأْ نُغْرِقْهُمْ فَلَا صَرِيخَ لَهُمْ وَلَا هُمْ يُنْقَذُونَ

translation: except by a mercy from Us, leaving them to enjoy for a while.
arabic: إِلَّا رَحْمَةً مِنَّا وَمَتَاعًا إِلَىٰ حِينٍ

translation: When it is said to them, “Beware of what is ahead of you and what is behind you[12], so that you may be shown mercy[13].”
footnotes:
[12] Of what awaits you in this life and in the Hereafter, or of the sins of the past and the future.
 [13] But they ignored the warning.
arabic: وَإِذَا قِيلَ لَهُمُ اتَّقُوا مَا بَيْنَ أَيْدِيكُمْ وَمَا خَلْفَكُمْ لَعَلَّكُمْ تُرْحَمُونَ

translation: No sign ever comes to them from their Lord except that they turn away from it.
arabic: وَمَا تَأْتِيهِمْ مِنْ آيَةٍ مِنْ آيَاتِ رَبِّهِمْ إِلَّا كَانُوا عَنْهَا مُعْرِضِينَ

translation: And when it is said to them, “Spend of what Allah has provided you with”, the disbelievers say to the believers, “Should we feed those whom Allah could feed if He willed? You are clearly misguided!”
arabic: وَإِذَا قِيلَ لَهُمْ أَنْفِقُوا مِمَّا رَزَقَكُمُ اللَّهُ قَالَ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا لِلَّذِينَ آمَنُوا أَنُطْعِمُ مَنْ لَوْ يَشَاءُ اللَّهُ أَطْعَمَهُ إِنْ أَنْتُمْ إِلَّا فِي ضَلَالٍ مُبِينٍ

translation: They say, “When will this promise come to pass, if you are truthful?”
arabic: وَيَقُولُونَ مَتَىٰ هَٰذَا الْوَعْدُ إِنْ كُنْتُمْ صَادِقِينَ

translation: They are not awaiting but a single Blast that will seize them while they are still disputing[14].
footnotes: [14] The first blast (lit., a cry or a shriek) of the Trumpet will take them by surprise on the Day of Judgment while they will be disputing in their worldly affairs.
arabic: مَا يَنْظُرُونَ إِلَّا صَيْحَةً وَاحِدَةً تَأْخُذُهُمْ وَهُمْ يَخِصِّمُونَ

translation: Then they will not be able to make a will, nor will they be able to return to their households.
arabic: فَلَا يَسْتَطِيعُونَ تَوْصِيَةً وَلَا إِلَىٰ أَهْلِهِمْ يَرْجِعُونَ

translation: The Trumpet will be blown[15] [again], and at once they will rush from their graves to their Lord.
footnotes: [15] i.e., the second blast or blow.
arabic: وَنُفِخَ فِي الصُّورِ فَإِذَا هُمْ مِنَ الْأَجْدَاثِ إِلَىٰ رَبِّهِمْ يَنْسِلُونَ

translation: They will say, “Woe to us! Who has resurrected us from our resting place?” [They will be told,] “This is what the Most Compassionate promised, and the messengers told the truth.”
arabic: قَالُوا يَا وَيْلَنَا مَنْ بَعَثَنَا مِنْ مَرْقَدِنَا ۜ ۗ هَٰذَا مَا وَعَدَ الرَّحْمَٰنُ وَصَدَقَ الْمُرْسَلُونَ

translation: It will only be a single Blast, and at once they will all be brought before Us.
arabic: إِنْ كَانَتْ إِلَّا صَيْحَةً وَاحِدَةً فَإِذَا هُمْ جَمِيعٌ لَدَيْنَا مُحْضَرُونَ

translation: On that Day no soul will be wronged in the least, nor will you be recompensed except for what you used to do.
arabic: فَالْيَوْمَ لَا تُظْلَمُ نَفْسٌ شَيْئًا وَلَا تُجْزَوْنَ إِلَّا مَا كُنْتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ

translation: Indeed, on that Day the people of Paradise will be busy enjoying themselves,
arabic: إِنَّ أَصْحَابَ الْجَنَّةِ الْيَوْمَ فِي شُغُلٍ فَاكِهُونَ

translation: they and their spouses will be reclining on couches in the shade.
arabic: هُمْ وَأَزْوَاجُهُمْ فِي ظِلَالٍ عَلَى الْأَرَائِكِ مُتَّكِئُونَ

translation: They will have therein fruits and all what they ask for[16].
footnotes: [16] i.e., wish or desire.
arabic: لَهُمْ فِيهَا فَاكِهَةٌ وَلَهُمْ مَا يَدَّعُونَ

translation: “Peace”: a word from a Most Merciful Lord.
arabic: سَلَامٌ قَوْلًا مِنْ رَبٍّ رَحِيمٍ

translation: “Stand apart [from the believers] this Day, O wicked ones!
arabic: وَامْتَازُوا الْيَوْمَ أَيُّهَا الْمُجْرِمُونَ

translation: Did I not command you, O children of Adam, not to worship Satan, for he is your sworn enemy,
arabic: ۞ أَلَمْ أَعْهَدْ إِلَيْكُمْ يَا بَنِي آدَمَ أَنْ لَا تَعْبُدُوا الشَّيْطَانَ ۖ إِنَّهُ لَكُمْ عَدُوٌّ مُبِينٌ

translation: but to worship Me? This is a straight path.
arabic: وَأَنِ اعْبُدُونِي ۚ هَٰذَا صِرَاطٌ مُسْتَقِيمٌ

translation: He had already misled great multitudes of you. Did you not then have sense?
arabic: وَلَقَدْ أَضَلَّ مِنْكُمْ جِبِلًّا كَثِيرًا ۖ أَفَلَمْ تَكُونُوا تَعْقِلُونَ

translation: This is the Hell that you were promised.
arabic: هَٰذِهِ جَهَنَّمُ الَّتِي كُنْتُمْ تُوعَدُونَ

translation: Burn in it Today for your disbelief[17].”
footnotes: [17] i.e., because you used to disbelieve.
arabic: اصْلَوْهَا الْيَوْمَ بِمَا كُنْتُمْ تَكْفُرُونَ

translation: Today We will seal up their mouths, and their hands will speak to Us, and their feet will testify to all what they used to do.
arabic: الْيَوْمَ نَخْتِمُ عَلَىٰ أَفْوَاهِهِمْ وَتُكَلِّمُنَا أَيْدِيهِمْ وَتَشْهَدُ أَرْجُلُهُمْ بِمَا كَانُوا يَكْسِبُونَ

translation: If We willed, We could have taken away their sight, so they would rush to find their way, but then how could they see?
arabic: وَلَوْ نَشَاءُ لَطَمَسْنَا عَلَىٰ أَعْيُنِهِمْ فَاسْتَبَقُوا الصِّرَاطَ فَأَنَّىٰ يُبْصِرُونَ

translation: And if We willed, We could have paralyzed them in their places[18], so they could neither move forward nor backward.
footnotes: [18] i.e., We could turn them into inanimate objects.
arabic: وَلَوْ نَشَاءُ لَمَسَخْنَاهُمْ عَلَىٰ مَكَانَتِهِمْ فَمَا اسْتَطَاعُوا مُضِيًّا وَلَا يَرْجِعُونَ

translation: Whomsoever We give a long life, We cause his strength to decline[19]. Do they not then understand?
footnotes: [19] Humans are born weak, then they reach their prime when they are young, then they grow physically and mentally weak when they are old.
arabic: وَمَنْ نُعَمِّرْهُ نُنَكِّسْهُ فِي الْخَلْقِ ۖ أَفَلَا يَعْقِلُونَ

translation: We have not taught him poetry, nor is it fitting for him. This is only a Reminder and a clear Qur’an
arabic: وَمَا عَلَّمْنَاهُ الشِّعْرَ وَمَا يَنْبَغِي لَهُ ۚ إِنْ هُوَ إِلَّا ذِكْرٌ وَقُرْآنٌ مُبِينٌ

translation: so that he may warn those who are truly alive[20] and establish the argument against the disbelievers.
footnotes: [20] In heart and mind, i.e., those who have faith.
arabic: لِيُنْذِرَ مَنْ كَانَ حَيًّا وَيَحِقَّ الْقَوْلُ عَلَى الْكَافِرِينَ

translation: Do they not see that We have created for them livestock made by Our Hands, and then they are their owners?
arabic: أَوَلَمْ يَرَوْا أَنَّا خَلَقْنَا لَهُمْ مِمَّا عَمِلَتْ أَيْدِينَا أَنْعَامًا فَهُمْ لَهَا مَالِكُونَ

translation: And We have made them subservient to them; some they ride, and from others they eat,
arabic: وَذَلَّلْنَاهَا لَهُمْ فَمِنْهَا رَكُوبُهُمْ وَمِنْهَا يَأْكُلُونَ

translation: and there are other benefits and drinks therein for them. Will they not then give thanks?
arabic: وَلَهُمْ فِيهَا مَنَافِعُ وَمَشَارِبُ ۖ أَفَلَا يَشْكُرُونَ

translation: Yet they have taken other gods besides Allah, hoping that they may be helped.
arabic: وَاتَّخَذُوا مِنْ دُونِ اللَّهِ آلِهَةً لَعَلَّهُمْ يُنْصَرُونَ

translation: They cannot help them, yet they serve them as their dedicated guards[21].
footnotes: [21] Or their idols or so-called gods will be assembled to witness the punishment of their worshipers on the Day of Judgment.
arabic: لَا يَسْتَطِيعُونَ نَصْرَهُمْ وَهُمْ لَهُمْ جُنْدٌ مُحْضَرُونَ

translation: Do not let their words grieve you. Surely We know what they conceal and what they reveal.
arabic: فَلَا يَحْزُنْكَ قَوْلُهُمْ ۘ إِنَّا نَعْلَمُ مَا يُسِرُّونَ وَمَا يُعْلِنُونَ

translation: Does man not see that We have created him from a sperm-drop, then[22] he becomes a clear adversary,
footnotes: [22] i.e., as soon as he becomes a self-sufficient being.
arabic: أَوَلَمْ يَرَ الْإِنْسَانُ أَنَّا خَلَقْنَاهُ مِنْ نُطْفَةٍ فَإِذَا هُوَ خَصِيمٌ مُبِينٌ

translation: producing arguments[23] against Us while forgetting his own creation[24]. He says, “Who can give life to the bones after they have crumbled to dust?”
footnotes:
[23] Trying to prove that there is no life after death.
 [24] That we created him from dead matter to such an extent that he became now a clear disputant before Us.
arabic: وَضَرَبَ لَنَا مَثَلًا وَنَسِيَ خَلْقَهُ ۖ قَالَ مَنْ يُحْيِي الْعِظَامَ وَهِيَ رَمِيمٌ

translation: Say, “The One Who created them in the first place will give life to them, for He has full knowledge of every created being;
arabic: قُلْ يُحْيِيهَا الَّذِي أَنْشَأَهَا أَوَّلَ مَرَّةٍ ۖ وَهُوَ بِكُلِّ خَلْقٍ عَلِيمٌ

translation: the One Who made for you fire out of the green tree, with which you kindle your fires[25].”
footnotes: [25] It alludes to the "markh" and "‘afār" trees in Arabia, whose green branches if struck against each other, it produces sparks.
arabic: الَّذِي جَعَلَ لَكُمْ مِنَ الشَّجَرِ الْأَخْضَرِ نَارًا فَإِذَا أَنْتُمْ مِنْهُ تُوقِدُونَ

translation: Is not the One Who created the heavens and earth able to create the like of these [people]? Yes indeed, for He is the Creator of all, the All-Knowing.
arabic: أَوَلَيْسَ الَّذِي خَلَقَ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضَ بِقَادِرٍ عَلَىٰ أَنْ يَخْلُقَ مِثْلَهُمْ ۚ بَلَىٰ وَهُوَ الْخَلَّاقُ الْعَلِيمُ

translation: Whenever He wills something to be, He only says to it, “Be”, and it is.
arabic: إِنَّمَا أَمْرُهُ إِذَا أَرَادَ شَيْئًا أَنْ يَقُولَ لَهُ كُنْ فَيَكُونُ

translation: So glory be to the One in Whose Hand is the dominion of everything, and to Him you will all be returned.
arabic: فَسُبْحَانَ الَّذِي بِيَدِهِ مَلَكُوتُ كُلِّ شَيْءٍ وَإِلَيْهِ تُرْجَعُونَ

translation: By those [angels] lined up in rows,
arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ وَالصَّافَّاتِ صَفًّا

translation: and those who drive [the clouds],
arabic: فَالزَّاجِرَاتِ زَجْرًا

translation: and those who recite Allah’s words[1],
footnotes: [1] Allah swears by three kinds of angels in these three above-mentioned verses to emphasize what comes in the next verse.
arabic: فَالتَّالِيَاتِ ذِكْرًا

translation: indeed, your God is One,
arabic: إِنَّ إِلَٰهَكُمْ لَوَاحِدٌ

translation: Lord of the heavens and earth and all that is between them, and Lord of the points of sunrise.
arabic: رَبُّ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا وَرَبُّ الْمَشَارِقِ

translation: We have adorned the sky with the beauty of the stars,
arabic: إِنَّا زَيَّنَّا السَّمَاءَ الدُّنْيَا بِزِينَةٍ الْكَوَاكِبِ

translation: and for safeguarding it against every rebellious devil,
arabic: وَحِفْظًا مِنْ كُلِّ شَيْطَانٍ مَارِدٍ

translation: so that they cannot eavesdrop on the highest assembly [of angels] and are pelted from every side[2]
footnotes: [2] By meteors.
arabic: لَا يَسَّمَّعُونَ إِلَى الْمَلَإِ الْأَعْلَىٰ وَيُقْذَفُونَ مِنْ كُلِّ جَانِبٍ

translation: to repel them; and for them there will be a perpetual punishment,
arabic: دُحُورًا ۖ وَلَهُمْ عَذَابٌ وَاصِبٌ

translation: except who stealthily snatches away some words, he will be pursued by a piercing flame.
arabic: إِلَّا مَنْ خَطِفَ الْخَطْفَةَ فَأَتْبَعَهُ شِهَابٌ ثَاقِبٌ

translation: So ask them, “Are they more difficult to create or other things We created? We created them[3] from sticky clay.
footnotes: [3] i.e., their father Adam.
arabic: فَاسْتَفْتِهِمْ أَهُمْ أَشَدُّ خَلْقًا أَمْ مَنْ خَلَقْنَا ۚ إِنَّا خَلَقْنَاهُمْ مِنْ طِينٍ لَازِبٍ

translation: Rather you are astonished, while they ridicule it,
arabic: بَلْ عَجِبْتَ وَيَسْخَرُونَ

translation: and when they are reminded, they pay no heed,
arabic: وَإِذَا ذُكِّرُوا لَا يَذْكُرُونَ

translation: and when they see a sign, they ridicule it,
arabic: وَإِذَا رَأَوْا آيَةً يَسْتَسْخِرُونَ

translation: and they say, “This is nothing but clear magic.
arabic: وَقَالُوا إِنْ هَٰذَا إِلَّا سِحْرٌ مُبِينٌ

translation: Is it that when we are dead and become dust and bones, will we really be raised up again,
arabic: أَإِذَا مِتْنَا وَكُنَّا تُرَابًا وَعِظَامًا أَإِنَّا لَمَبْعُوثُونَ

translation: and our forefathers too?”
arabic: أَوَآبَاؤُنَا الْأَوَّلُونَ

translation: Say, “Yes, and you will be disgraced.”
arabic: قُلْ نَعَمْ وَأَنْتُمْ دَاخِرُونَ

translation: It will only be a single Blast[4], and at once they will be looking around.
footnotes: [4] i.e., the second blow of the Trumpet.
arabic: فَإِنَّمَا هِيَ زَجْرَةٌ وَاحِدَةٌ فَإِذَا هُمْ يَنْظُرُونَ

translation: They will say, “Woe to us! This is the Day of Judgment!”
arabic: وَقَالُوا يَا وَيْلَنَا هَٰذَا يَوْمُ الدِّينِ

translation: [They will be told], “This is the Day of Decision that you used to deny.”
arabic: هَٰذَا يَوْمُ الْفَصْلِ الَّذِي كُنْتُمْ بِهِ تُكَذِّبُونَ

translation: [The angels will be told], “Gather all those who did wrong and their fellows[5], and whatever they used to worship
footnotes: [5] In wrongdoing or evil deeds.
arabic: ۞ احْشُرُوا الَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوا وَأَزْوَاجَهُمْ وَمَا كَانُوا يَعْبُدُونَ

translation: besides Allah, and lead them to the way of Hell,
arabic: مِنْ دُونِ اللَّهِ فَاهْدُوهُمْ إِلَىٰ صِرَاطِ الْجَحِيمِ

translation: and stop them, for they are to be questioned.”
arabic: وَقِفُوهُمْ ۖ إِنَّهُمْ مَسْئُولُونَ

translation: [They will be asked], “What is the matter with you, that you no longer help one another?”
arabic: مَا لَكُمْ لَا تَنَاصَرُونَ

translation: Rather on that Day they will surrender completely.
arabic: بَلْ هُمُ الْيَوْمَ مُسْتَسْلِمُونَ

translation: They will turn to one another, reproaching one another.
arabic: وَأَقْبَلَ بَعْضُهُمْ عَلَىٰ بَعْضٍ يَتَسَاءَلُونَ

translation: [The followers] will say, “It was you who used to delude us from the right way[6].”
footnotes: [6] Or you used to pressure us, or deceived us with false oaths, or claimed to have the truth.
arabic: قَالُوا إِنَّكُمْ كُنْتُمْ تَأْتُونَنَا عَنِ الْيَمِينِ

translation: [The misleaders] will say, “Rather, you yourselves were not believers,
arabic: قَالُوا بَلْ لَمْ تَكُونُوا مُؤْمِنِينَ

translation: and We had no power over you, rather you yourselves were a transgressing people.
arabic: وَمَا كَانَ لَنَا عَلَيْكُمْ مِنْ سُلْطَانٍ ۖ بَلْ كُنْتُمْ قَوْمًا طَاغِينَ

translation: Now the punishment of our Lord has come true against us; we will surely taste it.
arabic: فَحَقَّ عَلَيْنَا قَوْلُ رَبِّنَا ۖ إِنَّا لَذَائِقُونَ

translation: We did misguide you, for we ourselves were misguided”.
arabic: فَأَغْوَيْنَاكُمْ إِنَّا كُنَّا غَاوِينَ

translation: On that Day they will all share in the punishment.
arabic: فَإِنَّهُمْ يَوْمَئِذٍ فِي الْعَذَابِ مُشْتَرِكُونَ

translation: This is how We deal with the wicked,
arabic: إِنَّا كَذَٰلِكَ نَفْعَلُ بِالْمُجْرِمِينَ

translation: for whenever it was said to them, “None has the right to be worshiped except Allah,” they became arrogant,
arabic: إِنَّهُمْ كَانُوا إِذَا قِيلَ لَهُمْ لَا إِلَٰهَ إِلَّا اللَّهُ يَسْتَكْبِرُونَ

translation: and said, “Are we going to abandon our gods for a mad poet[7]?”
footnotes: [7] They mean the Prophet (ﷺ).
arabic: وَيَقُولُونَ أَئِنَّا لَتَارِكُو آلِهَتِنَا لِشَاعِرٍ مَجْنُونٍ

translation: Rather, he came with the truth and confirmed the messengers.
arabic: بَلْ جَاءَ بِالْحَقِّ وَصَدَّقَ الْمُرْسَلِينَ

translation: You will surely taste the painful punishment,
arabic: إِنَّكُمْ لَذَائِقُو الْعَذَابِ الْأَلِيمِ

translation: and you will only be recompensed for what you used to do,
arabic: وَمَا تُجْزَوْنَ إِلَّا مَا كُنْتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ

translation: except the chosen slaves of Allah.
arabic: إِلَّا عِبَادَ اللَّهِ الْمُخْلَصِينَ

translation: They will have a known provision,
arabic: أُولَٰئِكَ لَهُمْ رِزْقٌ مَعْلُومٌ

translation: fruits[8]; and they will be honored
footnotes: [8] i.e., everything delicious that they desire.
arabic: فَوَاكِهُ ۖ وَهُمْ مُكْرَمُونَ

translation: in Gardens of Bliss,
arabic: فِي جَنَّاتِ النَّعِيمِ

translation: facing one another[9] on couches.
footnotes: [9] It implies that they will not harbor ill feelings toward one another.
arabic: عَلَىٰ سُرُرٍ مُتَقَابِلِينَ

translation: They will be served with a cup of wine from a flowing stream,
arabic: يُطَافُ عَلَيْهِمْ بِكَأْسٍ مِنْ مَعِينٍ

translation: white and delicious for those who drink.
arabic: بَيْضَاءَ لَذَّةٍ لِلشَّارِبِينَ

translation: It will cause no harm, nor will they be intoxicated by it,
arabic: لَا فِيهَا غَوْلٌ وَلَا هُمْ عَنْهَا يُنْزَفُونَ

translation: and with them will be maidens of modest gaze[10] and beautiful eyes,
footnotes: [10] i.e., chaste and bashful, looking only at their mates.
arabic: وَعِنْدَهُمْ قَاصِرَاتُ الطَّرْفِ عِينٌ

translation: as if they were well-protected eggs[11].
footnotes: [11] Or pristine pearls.
arabic: كَأَنَّهُنَّ بَيْضٌ مَكْنُونٌ

translation: Then they will turn to one another asking[12].
footnotes: [12] Of their lives in the world and what led them to Paradise.
arabic: فَأَقْبَلَ بَعْضُهُمْ عَلَىٰ بَعْضٍ يَتَسَاءَلُونَ

translation: One of them will say, “I had a close friend [in the world]
arabic: قَالَ قَائِلٌ مِنْهُمْ إِنِّي كَانَ لِي قَرِينٌ

translation: who used to say[13], ‘Are you one of those who believe
footnotes: [13] Mockingly.
arabic: يَقُولُ أَإِنَّكَ لَمِنَ الْمُصَدِّقِينَ

translation: that when we die and become dust and bones, shall we be brought for judgment?’”
arabic: أَإِذَا مِتْنَا وَكُنَّا تُرَابًا وَعِظَامًا أَإِنَّا لَمَدِينُونَ

translation: He will say[14], “Do you wish to see [his fate]?”
footnotes: [14] To his companions in Paradise.
arabic: قَالَ هَلْ أَنْتُمْ مُطَّلِعُونَ

translation: So he will look down and see him[15] in the midst of the Blazing Fire.
footnotes: [15] His close friend who tried to dissuade him from faith.
arabic: فَاطَّلَعَ فَرَآهُ فِي سَوَاءِ الْجَحِيمِ

translation: He will say, “By Allah, you were about to ruin me.
arabic: قَالَ تَاللَّهِ إِنْ كِدْتَ لَتُرْدِينِ

translation: Were it not for the grace of my Lord, I would have been among those who are brought [to Hell].”
arabic: وَلَوْلَا نِعْمَةُ رَبِّي لَكُنْتُ مِنَ الْمُحْضَرِينَ

translation: [He will say to his fellow believers], “Are we not going to die anymore,
arabic: أَفَمَا نَحْنُ بِمَيِّتِينَ

translation: except for our first death, nor are we going to be punished?”
arabic: إِلَّا مَوْتَتَنَا الْأُولَىٰ وَمَا نَحْنُ بِمُعَذَّبِينَ

translation: This is indeed the supreme triumph!
arabic: إِنَّ هَٰذَا لَهُوَ الْفَوْزُ الْعَظِيمُ

translation: For such [reward] let the workers work.
arabic: لِمِثْلِ هَٰذَا فَلْيَعْمَلِ الْعَامِلُونَ

translation: Is this a better accommodation or the tree of Zaqqūm[16]?[17]
footnotes:
[16] The tree of cactus.
 [17] The disbelievers of Makkah derided the Prophet (ﷺ) when he warned them of this tree. They wondered how a tree could grow in Hellfire. So Allah revealed this verse.
arabic: أَذَٰلِكَ خَيْرٌ نُزُلًا أَمْ شَجَرَةُ الزَّقُّومِ

translation: We have made it a trial for the wrongdoers.
arabic: إِنَّا جَعَلْنَاهَا فِتْنَةً لِلظَّالِمِينَ

translation: It is a tree that grows in the bottom of the Blazing Fire;
arabic: إِنَّهَا شَجَرَةٌ تَخْرُجُ فِي أَصْلِ الْجَحِيمِ

translation: its fruits are like heads of devils.
arabic: طَلْعُهَا كَأَنَّهُ رُءُوسُ الشَّيَاطِينِ

translation: They will certainly eat from it, filling their bellies.
arabic: فَإِنَّهُمْ لَآكِلُونَ مِنْهَا فَمَالِئُونَ مِنْهَا الْبُطُونَ

translation: Then on top of that they will be given a mixture of scalding water,
arabic: ثُمَّ إِنَّ لَهُمْ عَلَيْهَا لَشَوْبًا مِنْ حَمِيمٍ

translation: then their final return will be to the Blazing Fire.
arabic: ثُمَّ إِنَّ مَرْجِعَهُمْ لَإِلَى الْجَحِيمِ

translation: For they found their forefathers astray,
arabic: إِنَّهُمْ أَلْفَوْا آبَاءَهُمْ ضَالِّينَ

translation: so they rushed to follow in their footsteps.
arabic: فَهُمْ عَلَىٰ آثَارِهِمْ يُهْرَعُونَ

translation: Indeed, most of the earlier people went astray before them,
arabic: وَلَقَدْ ضَلَّ قَبْلَهُمْ أَكْثَرُ الْأَوَّلِينَ

translation: even though We sent among them warners.
arabic: وَلَقَدْ أَرْسَلْنَا فِيهِمْ مُنْذِرِينَ

translation: Then see how was the end of those who were warned,
arabic: فَانْظُرْ كَيْفَ كَانَ عَاقِبَةُ الْمُنْذَرِينَ

translation: except the chosen slaves of Allah.
arabic: إِلَّا عِبَادَ اللَّهِ الْمُخْلَصِينَ

translation: Indeed, Noah called upon Us; how excellent are We at responding!
arabic: وَلَقَدْ نَادَانَا نُوحٌ فَلَنِعْمَ الْمُجِيبُونَ

translation: And We saved him and his household[18] from the great distress,
footnotes: [18] i.e., the believers in his household.
arabic: وَنَجَّيْنَاهُ وَأَهْلَهُ مِنَ الْكَرْبِ الْعَظِيمِ

translation: and made his offspring[19] the only survivors,
footnotes: [19] i.e., Noah’s offspring: Shem, Ham, and Japheth.
arabic: وَجَعَلْنَا ذُرِّيَّتَهُ هُمُ الْبَاقِينَ

translation: and We left for him [a favorable mention] among later generations:
arabic: وَتَرَكْنَا عَلَيْهِ فِي الْآخِرِينَ

translation: “Peace be upon Noah among all the nations.”
arabic: سَلَامٌ عَلَىٰ نُوحٍ فِي الْعَالَمِينَ

translation: This is how We reward those who do good.
arabic: إِنَّا كَذَٰلِكَ نَجْزِي الْمُحْسِنِينَ

translation: He was one of Our believing slaves.
arabic: إِنَّهُ مِنْ عِبَادِنَا الْمُؤْمِنِينَ

translation: Then we drowned the others.
arabic: ثُمَّ أَغْرَقْنَا الْآخَرِينَ

translation: Indeed, Abraham was one of those who followed his way.
arabic: ۞ وَإِنَّ مِنْ شِيعَتِهِ لَإِبْرَاهِيمَ

translation: When he came to his Lord with a sound heart,
arabic: إِذْ جَاءَ رَبَّهُ بِقَلْبٍ سَلِيمٍ

translation: and said to his father and his people, “What are you worshiping?
arabic: إِذْ قَالَ لِأَبِيهِ وَقَوْمِهِ مَاذَا تَعْبُدُونَ

translation: Is it false gods that you seek other than Allah?
arabic: أَئِفْكًا آلِهَةً دُونَ اللَّهِ تُرِيدُونَ

translation: Then what do you think of the Lord of the worlds?”
arabic: فَمَا ظَنُّكُمْ بِرَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ

translation: He then cast a glance at the stars[20],
footnotes: [20] His people had faith in astrology, so Abraham pretended to do the same to show them that he was not able to join them at their pagan feast and to remain in their temple of idols, while he was planning to destroy their idols.
arabic: فَنَظَرَ نَظْرَةً فِي النُّجُومِ

translation: and said, “I am sick[21].”
footnotes: [21] The Prophet (ﷺ) said: “Ibrahim (peace be upon him) did not lie except for three lies: His saying {I am sick} and his saying {Rather, the chief of them did this} and his saying about his wife, “She is my sister.” [Al-Bukhāri, Muslim]. Two of them were for the sake of Allah, and the third one was for the sake of his sister.
arabic: فَقَالَ إِنِّي سَقِيمٌ

translation: So they went away from him and left.
arabic: فَتَوَلَّوْا عَنْهُ مُدْبِرِينَ

translation: Then he turned to their gods and said, “Why do you not eat[22]?
footnotes: [22] The offerings placed before you.
arabic: فَرَاغَ إِلَىٰ آلِهَتِهِمْ فَقَالَ أَلَا تَأْكُلُونَ

translation: What is wrong with you that you do not speak?”
arabic: مَا لَكُمْ لَا تَنْطِقُونَ

translation: Then he turned upon them, striking them with his right hand.
arabic: فَرَاغَ عَلَيْهِمْ ضَرْبًا بِالْيَمِينِ

translation: Then his people came rushing towards him.
arabic: فَأَقْبَلُوا إِلَيْهِ يَزِفُّونَ

translation: He said, “Do you worship what you yourselves carve,
arabic: قَالَ أَتَعْبُدُونَ مَا تَنْحِتُونَ

translation: when it is Allah Who created you and all what you do?”
arabic: وَاللَّهُ خَلَقَكُمْ وَمَا تَعْمَلُونَ

translation: They said, “Build a pyre for him and throw him into the blazing fire.”
arabic: قَالُوا ابْنُوا لَهُ بُنْيَانًا فَأَلْقُوهُ فِي الْجَحِيمِ

translation: They contrived a plan against him, but We made them the lowest.
arabic: فَأَرَادُوا بِهِ كَيْدًا فَجَعَلْنَاهُمُ الْأَسْفَلِينَ

translation: He said, “I am going to my Lord; He will guide me.
arabic: وَقَالَ إِنِّي ذَاهِبٌ إِلَىٰ رَبِّي سَيَهْدِينِ

translation: My Lord, grant me righteous offspring.”
arabic: رَبِّ هَبْ لِي مِنَ الصَّالِحِينَ

translation: So We gave him glad tidings of a forbearing boy[23].
footnotes: [23] i.e., Ishmael
arabic: فَبَشَّرْنَاهُ بِغُلَامٍ حَلِيمٍ

translation: Then when he reached the age where he could work with him, Abraham said, “O my dear son, I have seen in a dream that I must sacrifice you. What do you think?” He said, “O my dear father, do as you are commanded. You will find me, if Allah wills, one of the steadfast.”
arabic: فَلَمَّا بَلَغَ مَعَهُ السَّعْيَ قَالَ يَا بُنَيَّ إِنِّي أَرَىٰ فِي الْمَنَامِ أَنِّي أَذْبَحُكَ فَانْظُرْ مَاذَا تَرَىٰ ۚ قَالَ يَا أَبَتِ افْعَلْ مَا تُؤْمَرُ ۖ سَتَجِدُنِي إِنْ شَاءَ اللَّهُ مِنَ الصَّابِرِينَ

translation: When they both submitted [to Allah’s command] and Abraham laid him on his forehead,
arabic: فَلَمَّا أَسْلَمَا وَتَلَّهُ لِلْجَبِينِ

translation: and We called out to him, “O Abraham,
arabic: وَنَادَيْنَاهُ أَنْ يَا إِبْرَاهِيمُ

translation: You have fulfilled the dream.” This is how We reward those who do good.
arabic: قَدْ صَدَّقْتَ الرُّؤْيَا ۚ إِنَّا كَذَٰلِكَ نَجْزِي الْمُحْسِنِينَ

translation: This was indeed a revealing test.
arabic: إِنَّ هَٰذَا لَهُوَ الْبَلَاءُ الْمُبِينُ

translation: And We ransomed him with a great sacrifice[24],
footnotes: [24] Allah Almighty sent a ram to be sacrificed in place of Ishmael.
arabic: وَفَدَيْنَاهُ بِذِبْحٍ عَظِيمٍ

translation: and We left for him [a favorable mention] among later generations:
arabic: وَتَرَكْنَا عَلَيْهِ فِي الْآخِرِينَ

translation: “Peace be upon Abraham.”
arabic: سَلَامٌ عَلَىٰ إِبْرَاهِيمَ

translation: This is how We reward those who do good.
arabic: كَذَٰلِكَ نَجْزِي الْمُحْسِنِينَ

translation: He was one of Our believing slaves.
arabic: إِنَّهُ مِنْ عِبَادِنَا الْمُؤْمِنِينَ

translation: And We gave him the glad tidings of Isaac[25], a prophet, and one of the righteous.
footnotes: [25] The birth of Isaac is mentioned after the story of sacrifice, which verifies that the firstborn son who was sacrificed was indeed Ishmael and not Isaac, contrary to what is claimed by the Jews and Christians. This is also supported by 11:71, where Sarah is told that she would give birth to Isaac, who would have a son by the name of Jacob.
arabic: وَبَشَّرْنَاهُ بِإِسْحَاقَ نَبِيًّا مِنَ الصَّالِحِينَ

translation: We blessed him[26] and Isaac, but among their offspring were some who did good and some who clearly wronged themselves.
footnotes: [26] Abraham or Ishmael.
arabic: وَبَارَكْنَا عَلَيْهِ وَعَلَىٰ إِسْحَاقَ ۚ وَمِنْ ذُرِّيَّتِهِمَا مُحْسِنٌ وَظَالِمٌ لِنَفْسِهِ مُبِينٌ

translation: Indeed, We bestowed Our favor upon Moses and Aaron,
arabic: وَلَقَدْ مَنَنَّا عَلَىٰ مُوسَىٰ وَهَارُونَ

translation: and We saved them and their people from the great distress[27],
footnotes: [27] Of enslavement at the hands of Pharaoh and his people, as well as of drowning.
arabic: وَنَجَّيْنَاهُمَا وَقَوْمَهُمَا مِنَ الْكَرْبِ الْعَظِيمِ

translation: and We helped them, so they were victorious,
arabic: وَنَصَرْنَاهُمْ فَكَانُوا هُمُ الْغَالِبِينَ

translation: and We gave them both the clear Scripture,
arabic: وَآتَيْنَاهُمَا الْكِتَابَ الْمُسْتَبِينَ

translation: and guided them to the straight path;
arabic: وَهَدَيْنَاهُمَا الصِّرَاطَ الْمُسْتَقِيمَ

translation: and We left for them [a favorable mention] among later generations:
arabic: وَتَرَكْنَا عَلَيْهِمَا فِي الْآخِرِينَ

translation: “Peace be upon Moses and Aaron.”
arabic: سَلَامٌ عَلَىٰ مُوسَىٰ وَهَارُونَ

translation: This is how We reward those who do good.
arabic: إِنَّا كَذَٰلِكَ نَجْزِي الْمُحْسِنِينَ

translation: They were truly of Our believing slaves.
arabic: إِنَّهُمَا مِنْ عِبَادِنَا الْمُؤْمِنِينَ

translation: Elijah was indeed one of the messengers.
arabic: وَإِنَّ إِلْيَاسَ لَمِنَ الْمُرْسَلِينَ

translation: When he said to his people: “Do you not fear Allah?
arabic: إِذْ قَالَ لِقَوْمِهِ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ

translation: Do you call upon Ba‘l[28] and ignore the Best of the Creators,
footnotes: [28] A great idol worshiped by the people.
arabic: أَتَدْعُونَ بَعْلًا وَتَذَرُونَ أَحْسَنَ الْخَالِقِينَ

translation: Allah, your Lord and the Lord of your forefathers?”
arabic: اللَّهَ رَبَّكُمْ وَرَبَّ آبَائِكُمُ الْأَوَّلِينَ

translation: But they rejected him, so they will surely be brought [for punishment],
arabic: فَكَذَّبُوهُ فَإِنَّهُمْ لَمُحْضَرُونَ

translation: except the chosen slaves of Allah.
arabic: إِلَّا عِبَادَ اللَّهِ الْمُخْلَصِينَ

translation: And We left for him [a favorable mention] among later generations:
arabic: وَتَرَكْنَا عَلَيْهِ فِي الْآخِرِينَ

translation: “Peace be upon Elias.”
arabic: سَلَامٌ عَلَىٰ إِلْ يَاسِينَ

translation: This is how We reward those who do good.
arabic: إِنَّا كَذَٰلِكَ نَجْزِي الْمُحْسِنِينَ

translation: He was one of Our believing slaves.
arabic: إِنَّهُ مِنْ عِبَادِنَا الْمُؤْمِنِينَ

translation: Lot was indeed one of the messengers.
arabic: وَإِنَّ لُوطًا لَمِنَ الْمُرْسَلِينَ

translation: When We saved him and all of his household,
arabic: إِذْ نَجَّيْنَاهُ وَأَهْلَهُ أَجْمَعِينَ

translation: except an old woman[29] who was among those who stayed behind.
footnotes: [29] Lot’s wife, who was not a believer.
arabic: إِلَّا عَجُوزًا فِي الْغَابِرِينَ

translation: Then We destroyed the rest.
arabic: ثُمَّ دَمَّرْنَا الْآخَرِينَ

translation: You [Makkans] pass by their ruins by day
arabic: وَإِنَّكُمْ لَتَمُرُّونَ عَلَيْهِمْ مُصْبِحِينَ

translation: and by night. Do you still not understand?
arabic: وَبِاللَّيْلِ ۗ أَفَلَا تَعْقِلُونَ

translation: Jonah was indeed one of the messengers.
arabic: وَإِنَّ يُونُسَ لَمِنَ الْمُرْسَلِينَ

translation: When he fled to the fully laden ship,
arabic: إِذْ أَبَقَ إِلَى الْفُلْكِ الْمَشْحُونِ

translation: then he cast lots[30] with them, but was among those who lost.
footnotes: [30] To determine who would be cast overboard in order to save the rest of the passengers; the ship was about to sink, for it was overloaded.
arabic: فَسَاهَمَ فَكَانَ مِنَ الْمُدْحَضِينَ

translation: The whale then swallowed him while he was blameworthy[31].
footnotes: [31] For leaving his people without Allah’s permission.
arabic: فَالْتَقَمَهُ الْحُوتُ وَهُوَ مُلِيمٌ

translation: Were it not for the fact that he was one of those who glorify Allah,
arabic: فَلَوْلَا أَنَّهُ كَانَ مِنَ الْمُسَبِّحِينَ

translation: he would have stayed in its belly until the Day of Resurrection[32].
footnotes: [32] The belly of the fish would have turned to be his grave.
arabic: لَلَبِثَ فِي بَطْنِهِ إِلَىٰ يَوْمِ يُبْعَثُونَ

translation: But We cast him ashore on a barren land while he was ill,
arabic: ۞ فَنَبَذْنَاهُ بِالْعَرَاءِ وَهُوَ سَقِيمٌ

translation: and caused a gourd vine[33] to grow over him.
footnotes: [33] For its cooling shade and as food for him.
arabic: وَأَنْبَتْنَا عَلَيْهِ شَجَرَةً مِنْ يَقْطِينٍ

translation: We sent him[34] to one hundred thousand people or more,
footnotes: [34] i.e., We sent him thereafter to his people.
arabic: وَأَرْسَلْنَاهُ إِلَىٰ مِائَةِ أَلْفٍ أَوْ يَزِيدُونَ

translation: and they believed, so We let them enjoy for a while.
arabic: فَآمَنُوا فَمَتَّعْنَاهُمْ إِلَىٰ حِينٍ

translation: So ask them, “Does your Lord have daughters while they have sons?”[35]
footnotes: [35] The pagans of Makkah claimed that angels were Allah’s daughters, while preferring sons for themselves.
arabic: فَاسْتَفْتِهِمْ أَلِرَبِّكَ الْبَنَاتُ وَلَهُمُ الْبَنُونَ

translation: Or did We create the angels as females while they were watching?
arabic: أَمْ خَلَقْنَا الْمَلَائِكَةَ إِنَاثًا وَهُمْ شَاهِدُونَ

translation: No indeed, it is one of their fabrications when they say,
arabic: أَلَا إِنَّهُمْ مِنْ إِفْكِهِمْ لَيَقُولُونَ

translation: “Allah has children,” and they are truly liars.
arabic: وَلَدَ اللَّهُ وَإِنَّهُمْ لَكَاذِبُونَ

translation: Did He choose daughters over sons[36]?
footnotes: [36] i.e., daughters that you hate over sons that you like?
arabic: أَصْطَفَى الْبَنَاتِ عَلَى الْبَنِينَ

translation: What is the matter with you? How do you judge?
arabic: مَا لَكُمْ كَيْفَ تَحْكُمُونَ

translation: Will you not then take heed?
arabic: أَفَلَا تَذَكَّرُونَ

translation: Do you have any compelling proof?
arabic: أَمْ لَكُمْ سُلْطَانٌ مُبِينٌ

translation: Then bring your scripture, if you are truthful.
arabic: فَأْتُوا بِكِتَابِكُمْ إِنْ كُنْتُمْ صَادِقِينَ

translation: They claim that there is a kinship between Him and the jinn[37], when the jinn themselves know that such people will surely be brought [for punishment].
footnotes: [37] It was claimed by some Arab pagans that angels are daughters of Allah through female jinn.
arabic: وَجَعَلُوا بَيْنَهُ وَبَيْنَ الْجِنَّةِ نَسَبًا ۚ وَلَقَدْ عَلِمَتِ الْجِنَّةُ إِنَّهُمْ لَمُحْضَرُونَ

translation: Glorified is Allah far above what they ascribe [to Him].
arabic: سُبْحَانَ اللَّهِ عَمَّا يَصِفُونَ

translation: But not the chosen slaves of Allah[38].
footnotes: [38] Who do not ascribe to Allah such false claims.
arabic: إِلَّا عِبَادَ اللَّهِ الْمُخْلَصِينَ

translation: So you and whatever you worship
arabic: فَإِنَّكُمْ وَمَا تَعْبُدُونَ

translation: none of you can lure anyone away from Him,
arabic: مَا أَنْتُمْ عَلَيْهِ بِفَاتِنِينَ

translation: except those who are destined to burn in the Blazing Fire[39].
footnotes: [39] Due to their disbelief and evil deeds.
arabic: إِلَّا مَنْ هُوَ صَالِ الْجَحِيمِ

translation: [The angels say][40], “There is none among us but has a known station[41]:
footnotes:
[40] Refuting the disbelievers’ false claims about them.
 [41] In worshiping Allah and obeying Him in our assigned tasks.
arabic: وَمَا مِنَّا إِلَّا لَهُ مَقَامٌ مَعْلُومٌ

translation: We are indeed those who stand lined up in rows,
arabic: وَإِنَّا لَنَحْنُ الصَّافُّونَ

translation: and we are indeed those who glorify Allah.”
arabic: وَإِنَّا لَنَحْنُ الْمُسَبِّحُونَ

translation: And [the pagans] used to say[42],
footnotes: [42] Before the revelation of the Qur’an.
arabic: وَإِنْ كَانُوا لَيَقُولُونَ

translation: “If only we had a scripture[43] like the previous people,
footnotes: [43] Such as the Torah and the Gospel.
arabic: لَوْ أَنَّ عِنْدَنَا ذِكْرًا مِنَ الْأَوَّلِينَ

translation: we would have surely been true slaves of Allah.”
arabic: لَكُنَّا عِبَادَ اللَّهِ الْمُخْلَصِينَ

translation: But they rejected it[44]; soon they will come to know.
footnotes: [44] i.e., their own message, the Qur’an.
arabic: فَكَفَرُوا بِهِ ۖ فَسَوْفَ يَعْلَمُونَ

translation: Our Word has already been given to Our slaves, the messengers,
arabic: وَلَقَدْ سَبَقَتْ كَلِمَتُنَا لِعِبَادِنَا الْمُرْسَلِينَ

translation: that it is surely they who will be given victory,
arabic: إِنَّهُمْ لَهُمُ الْمَنْصُورُونَ

translation: and that Our soldiers will surely be the victors.
arabic: وَإِنَّ جُنْدَنَا لَهُمُ الْغَالِبُونَ

translation: So turn away from them for a while.
arabic: فَتَوَلَّ عَنْهُمْ حَتَّىٰ حِينٍ

translation: Wait and see; soon they will see [their end].
arabic: وَأَبْصِرْهُمْ فَسَوْفَ يُبْصِرُونَ

translation: Do they really seek to hasten Our punishment?
arabic: أَفَبِعَذَابِنَا يَسْتَعْجِلُونَ

translation: When it[45] descends on their courtyard, how terrible will be the morning of those who were warned!
footnotes: [45] Allah’s punishment.
arabic: فَإِذَا نَزَلَ بِسَاحَتِهِمْ فَسَاءَ صَبَاحُ الْمُنْذَرِينَ

translation: And turn away from them for a while.
arabic: وَتَوَلَّ عَنْهُمْ حَتَّىٰ حِينٍ

translation: Wait and see; soon they will see [their end].
arabic: وَأَبْصِرْ فَسَوْفَ يُبْصِرُونَ

translation: Glory be to your Lord, the Lord of Might, far above what they ascribe [to Him],
arabic: سُبْحَانَ رَبِّكَ رَبِّ الْعِزَّةِ عَمَّا يَصِفُونَ

translation: and peace be upon the messengers,
arabic: وَسَلَامٌ عَلَى الْمُرْسَلِينَ

translation: and all praise be to Allah, the Lord of the worlds.
arabic: وَالْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ رَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ

translation: Sād[1]. By the Qur’an, full of reminder[2],
footnotes:
[1] See footnote 2:1.
 [2] The oath's completion is that the Qur’an is inimitable and thus Allah's miracle.
arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ ص ۚ وَالْقُرْآنِ ذِي الذِّكْرِ

translation: yet those who disbelieve are in arrogance and dissension.
arabic: بَلِ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا فِي عِزَّةٍ وَشِقَاقٍ

translation: How many generations have We destroyed before them, and they cried out when it was too late for deliverance.
arabic: كَمْ أَهْلَكْنَا مِنْ قَبْلِهِمْ مِنْ قَرْنٍ فَنَادَوْا وَلَاتَ حِينَ مَنَاصٍ

translation: They wonder that a warner has come to them from among themselves[3], and the disbelievers say, “This is a magician and a liar!
footnotes: [3] The disbelievers demanded that an angel be sent to them to convey the message of Allah, not a human like themselves.
arabic: وَعَجِبُوا أَنْ جَاءَهُمْ مُنْذِرٌ مِنْهُمْ ۖ وَقَالَ الْكَافِرُونَ هَٰذَا سَاحِرٌ كَذَّابٌ

translation: Has he made all gods into one God? Indeed, this is something strange!”
arabic: أَجَعَلَ الْآلِهَةَ إِلَٰهًا وَاحِدًا ۖ إِنَّ هَٰذَا لَشَيْءٌ عُجَابٌ

translation: The leaders among them departed, saying, “Carry on as you are, and stay faithful to your gods. Indeed, there is a motive behind it[4].
footnotes: [4] i.e., The Prophet (ﷺ) only wants to gain influence and prestige for himself.
arabic: وَانْطَلَقَ الْمَلَأُ مِنْهُمْ أَنِ امْشُوا وَاصْبِرُوا عَلَىٰ آلِهَتِكُمْ ۖ إِنَّ هَٰذَا لَشَيْءٌ يُرَادُ

translation: We have not heard of this in the last religion[5]. This is nothing but a fabrication.
footnotes: [5] It refers to Christianity or pagan Arab beliefs.
arabic: مَا سَمِعْنَا بِهَٰذَا فِي الْمِلَّةِ الْآخِرَةِ إِنْ هَٰذَا إِلَّا اخْتِلَاقٌ

translation: Has the Reminder been sent down to him from among us?” Rather, they are in doubt about My Reminder[6], for they have not yet tasted My punishment.
footnotes: [6] They do not question the Prophet's (ﷺ) honesty; rather, they question the Qur’an itself. See 6:33.
arabic: أَأُنْزِلَ عَلَيْهِ الذِّكْرُ مِنْ بَيْنِنَا ۚ بَلْ هُمْ فِي شَكٍّ مِنْ ذِكْرِي ۖ بَلْ لَمَّا يَذُوقُوا عَذَابِ

translation: Or do they possess the treasuries of the mercy of your Lord, the All-Mighty, the Bestower?
arabic: أَمْ عِنْدَهُمْ خَزَائِنُ رَحْمَةِ رَبِّكَ الْعَزِيزِ الْوَهَّابِ

translation: Or do they have the dominion of the heavens and earth and all that is between them? Then let them ascend by any means[7].
footnotes: [7] To manage the affairs of their dominion.
arabic: أَمْ لَهُمْ مُلْكُ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا ۖ فَلْيَرْتَقُوا فِي الْأَسْبَابِ

translation: This is only a small army[8] among several armies[9] that will soon be defeated.
footnotes:
[8] It alludes to the defeat of the pagans of Makkah at Badr.
 [9] i.e., the defeated armies of the past who rejected their messengers.
arabic: جُنْدٌ مَا هُنَالِكَ مَهْزُومٌ مِنَ الْأَحْزَابِ

translation: The people of Noah rejected [their messengers] before them, as did ‘Aad and Pharaoh, the owner of stakes[10];
footnotes: [10] It refers to the stakes by which he used to torture people, or the pyramids which are like stakes into the earth.
arabic: كَذَّبَتْ قَبْلَهُمْ قَوْمُ نُوحٍ وَعَادٌ وَفِرْعَوْنُ ذُو الْأَوْتَادِ

translation: and Thamūd and the people of Lot, and the dwellers of the Forest – such were the [denier] parties.
arabic: وَثَمُودُ وَقَوْمُ لُوطٍ وَأَصْحَابُ الْأَيْكَةِ ۚ أُولَٰئِكَ الْأَحْزَابُ

translation: Each of them rejected their messenger, therefore My punishment became inevitable.
arabic: إِنْ كُلٌّ إِلَّا كَذَّبَ الرُّسُلَ فَحَقَّ عِقَابِ

translation: They are only waiting for a single Blast that cannot be stopped[11].
footnotes: [11] Fawāq: "respite", more literally, "a period between two milkings of a she-camel," which also alludes to "return" or "repetition."
arabic: وَمَا يَنْظُرُ هَٰؤُلَاءِ إِلَّا صَيْحَةً وَاحِدَةً مَا لَهَا مِنْ فَوَاقٍ

translation: They say, “Our Lord, hasten for us our share [of punishment] before the Day of Reckoning.”
arabic: وَقَالُوا رَبَّنَا عَجِّلْ لَنَا قِطَّنَا قَبْلَ يَوْمِ الْحِسَابِ

translation: Bear with patience whatever they say, and remember Our slave David, the man of strength who constantly turned [to Allah].
arabic: اصْبِرْ عَلَىٰ مَا يَقُولُونَ وَاذْكُرْ عَبْدَنَا دَاوُودَ ذَا الْأَيْدِ ۖ إِنَّهُ أَوَّابٌ

translation: We subjected the mountains to join him in glorifying Allah in the evening and the morning,
arabic: إِنَّا سَخَّرْنَا الْجِبَالَ مَعَهُ يُسَبِّحْنَ بِالْعَشِيِّ وَالْإِشْرَاقِ

translation: and the birds, in their flocks; they all would echo his praise.
arabic: وَالطَّيْرَ مَحْشُورَةً ۖ كُلٌّ لَهُ أَوَّابٌ

translation: We strengthened his kingdom and gave him wisdom and sound judgment [and speech].
arabic: وَشَدَدْنَا مُلْكَهُ وَآتَيْنَاهُ الْحِكْمَةَ وَفَصْلَ الْخِطَابِ

translation: Has there come to you the story of the adversaries, when they climbed the wall of his chamber?
arabic: ۞ وَهَلْ أَتَاكَ نَبَأُ الْخَصْمِ إِذْ تَسَوَّرُوا الْمِحْرَابَ

translation: When they entered upon David, he was frightened. They said, “Do not be afraid. We are two adversaries: one of us has wronged the other, so judge between us with fairness, and do not be unjust, and guide us to the straight path.
arabic: إِذْ دَخَلُوا عَلَىٰ دَاوُودَ فَفَزِعَ مِنْهُمْ ۖ قَالُوا لَا تَخَفْ ۖ خَصْمَانِ بَغَىٰ بَعْضُنَا عَلَىٰ بَعْضٍ فَاحْكُمْ بَيْنَنَا بِالْحَقِّ وَلَا تُشْطِطْ وَاهْدِنَا إِلَىٰ سَوَاءِ الصِّرَاطِ

translation: This is my brother[12]. He has ninety-nine ewes while I have only one. He said, ‘Give her into my charge,’ and he overpowered me in speech.”
footnotes: [12] i.e., brother in faith, business partner, or biological brother.
arabic: إِنَّ هَٰذَا أَخِي لَهُ تِسْعٌ وَتِسْعُونَ نَعْجَةً وَلِيَ نَعْجَةٌ وَاحِدَةٌ فَقَالَ أَكْفِلْنِيهَا وَعَزَّنِي فِي الْخِطَابِ

translation: David said, “He has certainly wronged you by demanding that your ewe be added to his flock. Indeed, many partners oppress one another, except those who believe and do righteous deeds – and how few they are.” Then David realized that We were only testing him, so he asked his Lord for forgiveness[13], fell down bowing, and turned to Him in repentance.
footnotes: [13] For fear of the two men or the misjudgment he made.
arabic: قَالَ لَقَدْ ظَلَمَكَ بِسُؤَالِ نَعْجَتِكَ إِلَىٰ نِعَاجِهِ ۖ وَإِنَّ كَثِيرًا مِنَ الْخُلَطَاءِ لَيَبْغِي بَعْضُهُمْ عَلَىٰ بَعْضٍ إِلَّا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَعَمِلُوا الصَّالِحَاتِ وَقَلِيلٌ مَا هُمْ ۗ وَظَنَّ دَاوُودُ أَنَّمَا فَتَنَّاهُ فَاسْتَغْفَرَ رَبَّهُ وَخَرَّ رَاكِعًا وَأَنَابَ ۩

translation: So We forgave that for him, and he certainly has a place of nearness to Us and a good place of return.
arabic: فَغَفَرْنَا لَهُ ذَٰلِكَ ۖ وَإِنَّ لَهُ عِنْدَنَا لَزُلْفَىٰ وَحُسْنَ مَآبٍ

translation: “O David, We have made you a ruler on earth, so judge between people with justice, and do not follow your desires lest they lead you astray from Allah’s way. Those who go astray from Allah’s way will have a severe punishment because of their forgetting the Day of Reckoning.”
arabic: يَا دَاوُودُ إِنَّا جَعَلْنَاكَ خَلِيفَةً فِي الْأَرْضِ فَاحْكُمْ بَيْنَ النَّاسِ بِالْحَقِّ وَلَا تَتَّبِعِ الْهَوَىٰ فَيُضِلَّكَ عَنْ سَبِيلِ اللَّهِ ۚ إِنَّ الَّذِينَ يَضِلُّونَ عَنْ سَبِيلِ اللَّهِ لَهُمْ عَذَابٌ شَدِيدٌ بِمَا نَسُوا يَوْمَ الْحِسَابِ

translation: We have not created the heavens and earth and all that is between them in vain. That is the assumption of those who disbelieve. So woe to the disbelievers from the Fire!
arabic: وَمَا خَلَقْنَا السَّمَاءَ وَالْأَرْضَ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا بَاطِلًا ۚ ذَٰلِكَ ظَنُّ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا ۚ فَوَيْلٌ لِلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا مِنَ النَّارِ

translation: Should We make those who believe and do righteous deeds equal to those who spread corruption on earth? Or should We make the righteous equal to the wicked?
arabic: أَمْ نَجْعَلُ الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَعَمِلُوا الصَّالِحَاتِ كَالْمُفْسِدِينَ فِي الْأَرْضِ أَمْ نَجْعَلُ الْمُتَّقِينَ كَالْفُجَّارِ

translation: This is a blessed Book that We have sent down to you [O Prophet] so that they may reflect upon its verses, and so that people of understanding may take heed.
arabic: كِتَابٌ أَنْزَلْنَاهُ إِلَيْكَ مُبَارَكٌ لِيَدَّبَّرُوا آيَاتِهِ وَلِيَتَذَكَّرَ أُولُو الْأَلْبَابِ

translation: And to David We gave Solomon, an excellent and faithful slave who constantly turned [to Us].
arabic: وَوَهَبْنَا لِدَاوُودَ سُلَيْمَانَ ۚ نِعْمَ الْعَبْدُ ۖ إِنَّهُ أَوَّابٌ

translation: One evening, well-trained and swift horses of noble breed were presented before him.
arabic: إِذْ عُرِضَ عَلَيْهِ بِالْعَشِيِّ الصَّافِنَاتُ الْجِيَادُ

translation: He then said, “I gave preference to the love of fine things over the remembrance of my Lord,” until the sun went out of sight.
arabic: فَقَالَ إِنِّي أَحْبَبْتُ حُبَّ الْخَيْرِ عَنْ ذِكْرِ رَبِّي حَتَّىٰ تَوَارَتْ بِالْحِجَابِ

translation: [He ordered], “Bring them back to me,” and he began striking [their] shanks and necks[14].
footnotes: [14] With his sword as expiation, for it might have been permissible in their law, especially if it had been for the sake of Allah such as missing prayer or the like; this is a more correct view. However, Ibn Jarīr favored the view that Solomon began to rub down their legs and necks with the hand, not by the sword.
arabic: رُدُّوهَا عَلَيَّ ۖ فَطَفِقَ مَسْحًا بِالسُّوقِ وَالْأَعْنَاقِ

translation: Indeed, We tested Solomon and cast upon his throne a body, then he turned [to Allah][15].
footnotes: [15] The Prophet (ﷺ) said that one night Solomon said that each one of his wives would conceive a boy who would fight for the sake of Allah. He forgot to say ‘Allah willing,’ so only one of them gave birth to a deformed, dead baby. So Solomon sought Allah’s forgiveness. [Al-Bukhāri]
arabic: وَلَقَدْ فَتَنَّا سُلَيْمَانَ وَأَلْقَيْنَا عَلَىٰ كُرْسِيِّهِ جَسَدًا ثُمَّ أَنَابَ

translation: He said, “My Lord, forgive me and grant me a kingdom, the like of which will never be granted to anyone after me. You are indeed the Bestower.”
arabic: قَالَ رَبِّ اغْفِرْ لِي وَهَبْ لِي مُلْكًا لَا يَنْبَغِي لِأَحَدٍ مِنْ بَعْدِي ۖ إِنَّكَ أَنْتَ الْوَهَّابُ
