arabic: أَوَلَمْ يَرَوْا أَنَّ اللَّهَ الَّذِي خَلَقَ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضَ وَلَمْ يَعْيَ بِخَلْقِهِنَّ بِقَادِرٍ عَلَىٰ أَنْ يُحْيِيَ الْمَوْتَىٰ ۚ بَلَىٰ إِنَّهُ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيرٌ

translation: On the Day when the disbelievers are exposed to the Fire, [they will be asked], “Is this not the truth?” They will say, “Yes indeed, by our Lord.” He will say, “Then taste the punishment for your disbelief.”
arabic: وَيَوْمَ يُعْرَضُ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا عَلَى النَّارِ أَلَيْسَ هَٰذَا بِالْحَقِّ ۖ قَالُوا بَلَىٰ وَرَبِّنَا ۚ قَالَ فَذُوقُوا الْعَذَابَ بِمَا كُنْتُمْ تَكْفُرُونَ

translation: So be patient, as the Messengers of Firm Resolve[15] were patient, and do not seek to hasten [punishment] for them. On the Day when they see what they were warned of, it will be as if they had only stayed [in this world] for an hour of a day[16]. This is a warning. Will anyone be destroyed except the rebellious people?
footnotes:
[15] They are Noah, Abraham, Moses, Jesus, and Muhammad (may Allah's peace and blessings be upon them all).
 [16] i.e., for a short period of time.
arabic: فَاصْبِرْ كَمَا صَبَرَ أُولُو الْعَزْمِ مِنَ الرُّسُلِ وَلَا تَسْتَعْجِلْ لَهُمْ ۚ كَأَنَّهُمْ يَوْمَ يَرَوْنَ مَا يُوعَدُونَ لَمْ يَلْبَثُوا إِلَّا سَاعَةً مِنْ نَهَارٍ ۚ بَلَاغٌ ۚ فَهَلْ يُهْلَكُ إِلَّا الْقَوْمُ الْفَاسِقُونَ

translation: Those who disbelieve and prevent others from Allah’s way, He will render their deeds void.
arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا وَصَدُّوا عَنْ سَبِيلِ اللَّهِ أَضَلَّ أَعْمَالَهُمْ

translation: As for those who believe, do righteous deeds, and believe in what has been sent down to Muhammad – which is the truth from their Lord – He will absolve them of their sins and set their condition right.
arabic: وَالَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَعَمِلُوا الصَّالِحَاتِ وَآمَنُوا بِمَا نُزِّلَ عَلَىٰ مُحَمَّدٍ وَهُوَ الْحَقُّ مِنْ رَبِّهِمْ ۙ كَفَّرَ عَنْهُمْ سَيِّئَاتِهِمْ وَأَصْلَحَ بَالَهُمْ

translation: That is because the disbelievers follow falsehood, whereas the believers follow the truth from their Lord. This is how Allah explains to people their comparisons[1].
footnotes: [1] So that each party may know the outcome of its choice.
arabic: ذَٰلِكَ بِأَنَّ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا اتَّبَعُوا الْبَاطِلَ وَأَنَّ الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا اتَّبَعُوا الْحَقَّ مِنْ رَبِّهِمْ ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ يَضْرِبُ اللَّهُ لِلنَّاسِ أَمْثَالَهُمْ

translation: When you encounter the disbelievers [in battle], strike [their] necks until you have thoroughly subdued them, then bind the captives firmly[2]. Later [you may free them] as a favor[3] or for ransom until the war comes to an end[4]. That [is Our command], if Allah had willed, He could have subjected them to punishment, but [He ordered you to fight] to test some of you by means of others. Those who are killed in the way of Allah, He will never render their deeds void.
footnotes:
[2] i.e., seize those remaining fighters as captives.
 [3] i.e., release them without taking any ransom.
 [4] lit., until the war lays down its burdens, its armor.
arabic: فَإِذَا لَقِيتُمُ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا فَضَرْبَ الرِّقَابِ حَتَّىٰ إِذَا أَثْخَنْتُمُوهُمْ فَشُدُّوا الْوَثَاقَ فَإِمَّا مَنًّا بَعْدُ وَإِمَّا فِدَاءً حَتَّىٰ تَضَعَ الْحَرْبُ أَوْزَارَهَا ۚ ذَٰلِكَ وَلَوْ يَشَاءُ اللَّهُ لَانْتَصَرَ مِنْهُمْ وَلَٰكِنْ لِيَبْلُوَ بَعْضَكُمْ بِبَعْضٍ ۗ وَالَّذِينَ قُتِلُوا فِي سَبِيلِ اللَّهِ فَلَنْ يُضِلَّ أَعْمَالَهُمْ

translation: He will guide them, and will set their condition right,
arabic: سَيَهْدِيهِمْ وَيُصْلِحُ بَالَهُمْ

translation: and He will admit them to Paradise, which He has already made known to them[5].
footnotes: [5] The believers will recognize their mansions in Paradise just like they recognize their homes in the life of this world.
arabic: وَيُدْخِلُهُمُ الْجَنَّةَ عَرَّفَهَا لَهُمْ

translation: O you who believe, if you stand up for Allah, He will help you and make your steps firm[6].
footnotes: [6] i.e., if you stand up for Allah’s cause, His religion, and for His Prophet with your life and wealth, He will make your feet firm on the battlefield and grant you victory.
arabic: يَا أَيُّهَا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا إِنْ تَنْصُرُوا اللَّهَ يَنْصُرْكُمْ وَيُثَبِّتْ أَقْدَامَكُمْ

translation: As for those who disbelieve, how wretched will be their state! And He will render their deeds void.
arabic: وَالَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا فَتَعْسًا لَهُمْ وَأَضَلَّ أَعْمَالَهُمْ

translation: That is because they detest what Allah has sent down, so He rendered their deeds worthless.
arabic: ذَٰلِكَ بِأَنَّهُمْ كَرِهُوا مَا أَنْزَلَ اللَّهُ فَأَحْبَطَ أَعْمَالَهُمْ

translation: Have they not traveled through the land to see what was the end of those before them? Allah destroyed them utterly[7], and a similar end awaits the disbelievers.
footnotes: [7] i.e., Allah destroyed them and all their belongings of wealth, property, and offspring.
arabic: ۞ أَفَلَمْ يَسِيرُوا فِي الْأَرْضِ فَيَنْظُرُوا كَيْفَ كَانَ عَاقِبَةُ الَّذِينَ مِنْ قَبْلِهِمْ ۚ دَمَّرَ اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِمْ ۖ وَلِلْكَافِرِينَ أَمْثَالُهَا

translation: That is because Allah is the Protector of the believers whereas the disbelievers have no protector.
arabic: ذَٰلِكَ بِأَنَّ اللَّهَ مَوْلَى الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَأَنَّ الْكَافِرِينَ لَا مَوْلَىٰ لَهُمْ

translation: Allah will surely admit those who believe and do righteous deeds to gardens under which rivers flow. As for those who disbelieve, they enjoy themselves [in this world] and they eat as cattle eat[8]; their final abode is the Fire.
footnotes: [8] The disbelievers enjoy their life while they are oblivious of their consequences in the Hereafter, just like the cattle that graze in the pasture not knowing that they will probably be slaughtered soon.
arabic: إِنَّ اللَّهَ يُدْخِلُ الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَعَمِلُوا الصَّالِحَاتِ جَنَّاتٍ تَجْرِي مِنْ تَحْتِهَا الْأَنْهَارُ ۖ وَالَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا يَتَمَتَّعُونَ وَيَأْكُلُونَ كَمَا تَأْكُلُ الْأَنْعَامُ وَالنَّارُ مَثْوًى لَهُمْ

translation: How many towns We destroyed that were more powerful than your town that expelled you, and there was none to help them!
arabic: وَكَأَيِّنْ مِنْ قَرْيَةٍ هِيَ أَشَدُّ قُوَّةً مِنْ قَرْيَتِكَ الَّتِي أَخْرَجَتْكَ أَهْلَكْنَاهُمْ فَلَا نَاصِرَ لَهُمْ

translation: Are those who possess clear proof from their Lord like those whose evil deeds are made appealing to them and who follow their own desires?
arabic: أَفَمَنْ كَانَ عَلَىٰ بَيِّنَةٍ مِنْ رَبِّهِ كَمَنْ زُيِّنَ لَهُ سُوءُ عَمَلِهِ وَاتَّبَعُوا أَهْوَاءَهُمْ

translation: The likeness of Paradise promised to the righteous is that of a [garden which has] rivers of fresh water[9]; rivers of milk the taste of which never changes; rivers of wine delicious to drink; and rivers of pure honey. They will have therein all kinds of fruit and forgiveness from their Lord. Can they be like those who will abide in the Fire forever, and will be given boiling water to drink that tears apart their intestines?
footnotes: [9] Neither stagnant nor polluted.
arabic: مَثَلُ الْجَنَّةِ الَّتِي وُعِدَ الْمُتَّقُونَ ۖ فِيهَا أَنْهَارٌ مِنْ مَاءٍ غَيْرِ آسِنٍ وَأَنْهَارٌ مِنْ لَبَنٍ لَمْ يَتَغَيَّرْ طَعْمُهُ وَأَنْهَارٌ مِنْ خَمْرٍ لَذَّةٍ لِلشَّارِبِينَ وَأَنْهَارٌ مِنْ عَسَلٍ مُصَفًّى ۖ وَلَهُمْ فِيهَا مِنْ كُلِّ الثَّمَرَاتِ وَمَغْفِرَةٌ مِنْ رَبِّهِمْ ۖ كَمَنْ هُوَ خَالِدٌ فِي النَّارِ وَسُقُوا مَاءً حَمِيمًا فَقَطَّعَ أَمْعَاءَهُمْ

translation: Among these [hypocrites] are some who listen to you [O Prophet], but when they leave your presence, they say to those who were given knowledge[10], “What did he just say[11]?” It is they whose hearts Allah has sealed up and who follow their desires.
footnotes:
[10] From among the companions of the Prophet (ﷺ).
 [11] In an ignoring and indifferent manner.
arabic: وَمِنْهُمْ مَنْ يَسْتَمِعُ إِلَيْكَ حَتَّىٰ إِذَا خَرَجُوا مِنْ عِنْدِكَ قَالُوا لِلَّذِينَ أُوتُوا الْعِلْمَ مَاذَا قَالَ آنِفًا ۚ أُولَٰئِكَ الَّذِينَ طَبَعَ اللَّهُ عَلَىٰ قُلُوبِهِمْ وَاتَّبَعُوا أَهْوَاءَهُمْ

translation: As for those who follow guidance, He increases them in guidance and blesses them with righteousness[12].
footnotes: [12] Taqwā: It means piety, fear and consciousness of Allah, and care to avoid displeasing Him.
arabic: وَالَّذِينَ اهْتَدَوْا زَادَهُمْ هُدًى وَآتَاهُمْ تَقْوَاهُمْ

translation: Are they but waiting for the Hour to come upon them by surprise? Already [some of] its signs have appeared[13]. What good will it do them to take heed when it actually befalls them?
footnotes: [13] Such as the coming of Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ), and the splitting of the moon after the pagans of Makkah challenged the Prophet (ﷺ) which was fulfilled before their eyes, yet they denied that miracle.
arabic: فَهَلْ يَنْظُرُونَ إِلَّا السَّاعَةَ أَنْ تَأْتِيَهُمْ بَغْتَةً ۖ فَقَدْ جَاءَ أَشْرَاطُهَا ۚ فَأَنَّىٰ لَهُمْ إِذَا جَاءَتْهُمْ ذِكْرَاهُمْ

translation: Then know [O Prophet] that none has the right to be worshiped except Allah, and seek forgiveness for your sins[14] and for the [the sins of] the believing men and women, for Allah knows your movements and your places of rest.
footnotes: [14] See footnote 40:55. Since the Prophet (ﷺ) is urged to seek forgiveness, the believers are far greater in need of seeking Allah’s forgiveness.
arabic: فَاعْلَمْ أَنَّهُ لَا إِلَٰهَ إِلَّا اللَّهُ وَاسْتَغْفِرْ لِذَنْبِكَ وَلِلْمُؤْمِنِينَ وَالْمُؤْمِنَاتِ ۗ وَاللَّهُ يَعْلَمُ مُتَقَلَّبَكُمْ وَمَثْوَاكُمْ

translation: Those who believe say, “If only a Chapter were sent down [about fighting]? But when a precise Chapter is sent down and fighting[15] is mentioned therein, you see those in whose hearts is sickness looking at you like someone who is about to die. It would have been better for them[16]
footnotes:
[15] The believers longed for a Qur’anic revelation that would give them permission to fight their enemies.
 [16] It could also mean “Woe to them!” if disconnected from the next verse.
arabic: وَيَقُولُ الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا لَوْلَا نُزِّلَتْ سُورَةٌ ۖ فَإِذَا أُنْزِلَتْ سُورَةٌ مُحْكَمَةٌ وَذُكِرَ فِيهَا الْقِتَالُ ۙ رَأَيْتَ الَّذِينَ فِي قُلُوبِهِمْ مَرَضٌ يَنْظُرُونَ إِلَيْكَ نَظَرَ الْمَغْشِيِّ عَلَيْهِ مِنَ الْمَوْتِ ۖ فَأَوْلَىٰ لَهُمْ

translation: to obey and say good words. Once the fighting was ordained, it would be better for them to be truthful to Allah.
arabic: طَاعَةٌ وَقَوْلٌ مَعْرُوفٌ ۚ فَإِذَا عَزَمَ الْأَمْرُ فَلَوْ صَدَقُوا اللَّهَ لَكَانَ خَيْرًا لَهُمْ

translation: Then if you turn away[17], what else can be expected but that you will spread corruption in the land and sever your ties of kinship[18]?
footnotes:
[17] From Islam or from struggling in the way of Allah.
 [18] As you used to do in the pre-Islamic period of ignorance.
arabic: فَهَلْ عَسَيْتُمْ إِنْ تَوَلَّيْتُمْ أَنْ تُفْسِدُوا فِي الْأَرْضِ وَتُقَطِّعُوا أَرْحَامَكُمْ

translation: These are the ones whom Allah has cursed and has made them deaf and blinded their sight.
arabic: أُولَٰئِكَ الَّذِينَ لَعَنَهُمُ اللَّهُ فَأَصَمَّهُمْ وَأَعْمَىٰ أَبْصَارَهُمْ

translation: Do they not reflect upon the Qur’an, or are there locks upon their hearts?
arabic: أَفَلَا يَتَدَبَّرُونَ الْقُرْآنَ أَمْ عَلَىٰ قُلُوبٍ أَقْفَالُهَا

translation: Indeed, those who turn back [to disbelief] after guidance had become clear to them, it is Satan who has tempted them and deceived them with false hopes of a long life.
arabic: إِنَّ الَّذِينَ ارْتَدُّوا عَلَىٰ أَدْبَارِهِمْ مِنْ بَعْدِ مَا تَبَيَّنَ لَهُمُ الْهُدَى ۙ الشَّيْطَانُ سَوَّلَ لَهُمْ وَأَمْلَىٰ لَهُمْ

translation: That is because they say to those[19] who hate what Allah has sent down, “We will obey you in some matters[20].” But Allah knows their secret schemes.
footnotes:
[19] i.e., the Jews of Madīnah.
 [20] i.e., your hostility to the Prophet (ﷺ) and hindering people from participation in Jihad.
arabic: ذَٰلِكَ بِأَنَّهُمْ قَالُوا لِلَّذِينَ كَرِهُوا مَا نَزَّلَ اللَّهُ سَنُطِيعُكُمْ فِي بَعْضِ الْأَمْرِ ۖ وَاللَّهُ يَعْلَمُ إِسْرَارَهُمْ

translation: How will they feel when the angels take their souls, striking their faces and their backs?
arabic: فَكَيْفَ إِذَا تَوَفَّتْهُمُ الْمَلَائِكَةُ يَضْرِبُونَ وُجُوهَهُمْ وَأَدْبَارَهُمْ

translation: That is because they follow what incurs Allah’s wrath and they hate what pleases Him, so He will render their deeds worthless.
arabic: ذَٰلِكَ بِأَنَّهُمُ اتَّبَعُوا مَا أَسْخَطَ اللَّهَ وَكَرِهُوا رِضْوَانَهُ فَأَحْبَطَ أَعْمَالَهُمْ

translation: Do those in whose hearts is sickness think that Allah will never expose their malice?
arabic: أَمْ حَسِبَ الَّذِينَ فِي قُلُوبِهِمْ مَرَضٌ أَنْ لَنْ يُخْرِجَ اللَّهُ أَضْغَانَهُمْ

translation: If We willed, We could show them to you [O Prophet], so you would recognize them by their faces, but you will surely recognize them by the manner of their speech. And Allah knows all what you do.
arabic: وَلَوْ نَشَاءُ لَأَرَيْنَاكَهُمْ فَلَعَرَفْتَهُمْ بِسِيمَاهُمْ ۚ وَلَتَعْرِفَنَّهُمْ فِي لَحْنِ الْقَوْلِ ۚ وَاللَّهُ يَعْلَمُ أَعْمَالَكُمْ

translation: We will certainly test you so as to reveal those of you who struggle [in Allah’s way] and remain patient, and We will test the sincerity of your assertions.
arabic: وَلَنَبْلُوَنَّكُمْ حَتَّىٰ نَعْلَمَ الْمُجَاهِدِينَ مِنْكُمْ وَالصَّابِرِينَ وَنَبْلُوَ أَخْبَارَكُمْ

translation: Those who disbelieve and prevent others from Allah’s way, and oppose the Messenger after guidance had become clear to them, they will never harm Allah in the least, and He will render their deeds worthless.
arabic: إِنَّ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا وَصَدُّوا عَنْ سَبِيلِ اللَّهِ وَشَاقُّوا الرَّسُولَ مِنْ بَعْدِ مَا تَبَيَّنَ لَهُمُ الْهُدَىٰ لَنْ يَضُرُّوا اللَّهَ شَيْئًا وَسَيُحْبِطُ أَعْمَالَهُمْ

translation: O you who believe, obey Allah and obey the Messenger, and do not cause your deeds to be nullified.
arabic: ۞ يَا أَيُّهَا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا أَطِيعُوا اللَّهَ وَأَطِيعُوا الرَّسُولَ وَلَا تُبْطِلُوا أَعْمَالَكُمْ

translation: Those who disbelieve and prevent others from Allah’s way, and then die as disbelievers, Allah will never forgive them.
arabic: إِنَّ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا وَصَدُّوا عَنْ سَبِيلِ اللَّهِ ثُمَّ مَاتُوا وَهُمْ كُفَّارٌ فَلَنْ يَغْفِرَ اللَّهُ لَهُمْ

translation: Do not lose heart or call for peace, for you will have the upper hand and Allah is with you. And He will never detract [the reward of] your deeds.
arabic: فَلَا تَهِنُوا وَتَدْعُوا إِلَى السَّلْمِ وَأَنْتُمُ الْأَعْلَوْنَ وَاللَّهُ مَعَكُمْ وَلَنْ يَتِرَكُمْ أَعْمَالَكُمْ

translation: The life of this world is only play and amusement. But if you believe and fear Allah, He will give you your rewards, and He does not ask you for all your wealth[21].
footnotes: [21] He only asks you for zakah (obligatory charity).
arabic: إِنَّمَا الْحَيَاةُ الدُّنْيَا لَعِبٌ وَلَهْوٌ ۚ وَإِنْ تُؤْمِنُوا وَتَتَّقُوا يُؤْتِكُمْ أُجُورَكُمْ وَلَا يَسْأَلْكُمْ أَمْوَالَكُمْ

translation: If He were to ask you for it[22] and insist that you give it, you would greedily withhold, and He would expose your resentment [for spending].
footnotes: [22] i.e., all your wealth.
arabic: إِنْ يَسْأَلْكُمُوهَا فَيُحْفِكُمْ تَبْخَلُوا وَيُخْرِجْ أَضْغَانَكُمْ

translation: O you who are being called to spend in Allah’s way; among you are some who greedily withhold, but whoever withholds, he in fact withholds against himself, for Allah is the Self-Sufficient, whereas you are in need [of Him]. If you turn away, He will replace you with other people, then they will not be like you.
arabic: هَا أَنْتُمْ هَٰؤُلَاءِ تُدْعَوْنَ لِتُنْفِقُوا فِي سَبِيلِ اللَّهِ فَمِنْكُمْ مَنْ يَبْخَلُ ۖ وَمَنْ يَبْخَلْ فَإِنَّمَا يَبْخَلُ عَنْ نَفْسِهِ ۚ وَاللَّهُ الْغَنِيُّ وَأَنْتُمُ الْفُقَرَاءُ ۚ وَإِنْ تَتَوَلَّوْا يَسْتَبْدِلْ قَوْمًا غَيْرَكُمْ ثُمَّ لَا يَكُونُوا أَمْثَالَكُمْ

translation: Indeed, We have given you [O Prophet] a clear conquest[1],
footnotes: [1] This surah takes its name "Surah al-Fath" (Surah of Conquest) from the clear conquest mentioned in this verse. This treaty was signed in 6 A.H./628 C.E. Ibn Mas‘ūd said, "You [people] consider the conquest to be that of Makkah, but we consider it to be the Treaty of al-Hudaybiyyah." Al-Barā’ bin ‘Āzib said something similar to this as reported by Al-Bukhāri. Although the companions initially regarded this treaty as a setback, yet in effect, it helped promote the spread of Islam, as thousands of people from different tribes accepted Islam during that truce. This treaty was in fact a precursor to the conquest of Makkah two years later.
arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ إِنَّا فَتَحْنَا لَكَ فَتْحًا مُبِينًا

translation: so that Allah may forgive you your previous and future sins[2], complete His favor upon you, and guide you to a straight path,
footnotes: [2] i.e., sins before this conquest and sins after it. See footnote 40:55, 47:19.
arabic: لِيَغْفِرَ لَكَ اللَّهُ مَا تَقَدَّمَ مِنْ ذَنْبِكَ وَمَا تَأَخَّرَ وَيُتِمَّ نِعْمَتَهُ عَلَيْكَ وَيَهْدِيَكَ صِرَاطًا مُسْتَقِيمًا

translation: and so that Allah may help you with a mighty victory.
arabic: وَيَنْصُرَكَ اللَّهُ نَصْرًا عَزِيزًا

translation: It is He Who sent down tranquility into the hearts of the believers so that they may increase in faith along with their faith. To Allah belong the soldiers of the heavens and earth. And Allah is All-Knowing, All-Wise.
arabic: هُوَ الَّذِي أَنْزَلَ السَّكِينَةَ فِي قُلُوبِ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ لِيَزْدَادُوا إِيمَانًا مَعَ إِيمَانِهِمْ ۗ وَلِلَّهِ جُنُودُ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ ۚ وَكَانَ اللَّهُ عَلِيمًا حَكِيمًا

translation: So that He may admit the believing men and women to gardens under which rivers flow, abiding therein forever, and absolve them of their sins; that is a supreme triumph before Allah.
arabic: لِيُدْخِلَ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ وَالْمُؤْمِنَاتِ جَنَّاتٍ تَجْرِي مِنْ تَحْتِهَا الْأَنْهَارُ خَالِدِينَ فِيهَا وَيُكَفِّرَ عَنْهُمْ سَيِّئَاتِهِمْ ۚ وَكَانَ ذَٰلِكَ عِنْدَ اللَّهِ فَوْزًا عَظِيمًا

translation: And so that He may punish hypocrite men and women and polytheist men and women, who harbor about Allah evil thoughts[3]. An evil fate will befall them. Allah is angry with them and has cursed them and prepared for them Hell. What a terrible destination!
footnotes: [3] i.e., that Allah will not support His religion and His Prophet (ﷺ) and that the believers will end up with misfortune and defeat.
arabic: وَيُعَذِّبَ الْمُنَافِقِينَ وَالْمُنَافِقَاتِ وَالْمُشْرِكِينَ وَالْمُشْرِكَاتِ الظَّانِّينَ بِاللَّهِ ظَنَّ السَّوْءِ ۚ عَلَيْهِمْ دَائِرَةُ السَّوْءِ ۖ وَغَضِبَ اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِمْ وَلَعَنَهُمْ وَأَعَدَّ لَهُمْ جَهَنَّمَ ۖ وَسَاءَتْ مَصِيرًا

translation: To Allah belong the soldiers of the heavens and earth, and Allah is All-Mighty, All-Wise.
arabic: وَلِلَّهِ جُنُودُ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ ۚ وَكَانَ اللَّهُ عَزِيزًا حَكِيمًا

translation: Indeed, We have sent you [O prophet] as a witness, a bearer of glad tidings, and a warner,
arabic: إِنَّا أَرْسَلْنَاكَ شَاهِدًا وَمُبَشِّرًا وَنَذِيرًا

translation: so that you may believe in Allah and His Messenger, support and revere him, and glorify Him morning and evening.
arabic: لِتُؤْمِنُوا بِاللَّهِ وَرَسُولِهِ وَتُعَزِّرُوهُ وَتُوَقِّرُوهُ وَتُسَبِّحُوهُ بُكْرَةً وَأَصِيلًا

translation: Those who pledge allegiance to you [O Prophet] are indeed pledging allegiance to Allah; Allah’s Hand is over their hands[4]. Whoever breaks his pledge, he only breaks it to his own detriment, but whoever fulfills his covenant with Allah, He will give him a great reward.
footnotes: [4] i.e., Allah Almighty approved their pledge.
arabic: إِنَّ الَّذِينَ يُبَايِعُونَكَ إِنَّمَا يُبَايِعُونَ اللَّهَ يَدُ اللَّهِ فَوْقَ أَيْدِيهِمْ ۚ فَمَنْ نَكَثَ فَإِنَّمَا يَنْكُثُ عَلَىٰ نَفْسِهِ ۖ وَمَنْ أَوْفَىٰ بِمَا عَاهَدَ عَلَيْهُ اللَّهَ فَسَيُؤْتِيهِ أَجْرًا عَظِيمًا

translation: Those of the Bedouins who lagged behind will say to you, “We were preoccupied with our wealth and our families, so ask for forgiveness for us.” They say with their tongues what is not in their hearts. Say, “Then who can prevent Allah if He intends to harm or benefit you? Indeed, Allah is All-Aware of what you do.
arabic: سَيَقُولُ لَكَ الْمُخَلَّفُونَ مِنَ الْأَعْرَابِ شَغَلَتْنَا أَمْوَالُنَا وَأَهْلُونَا فَاسْتَغْفِرْ لَنَا ۚ يَقُولُونَ بِأَلْسِنَتِهِمْ مَا لَيْسَ فِي قُلُوبِهِمْ ۚ قُلْ فَمَنْ يَمْلِكُ لَكُمْ مِنَ اللَّهِ شَيْئًا إِنْ أَرَادَ بِكُمْ ضَرًّا أَوْ أَرَادَ بِكُمْ نَفْعًا ۚ بَلْ كَانَ اللَّهُ بِمَا تَعْمَلُونَ خَبِيرًا

translation: But you thought that the Messenger and the believers would never return to their families ever, and that was made appealing in your hearts. You harbored evil thoughts, for you are a doomed people.”
arabic: بَلْ ظَنَنْتُمْ أَنْ لَنْ يَنْقَلِبَ الرَّسُولُ وَالْمُؤْمِنُونَ إِلَىٰ أَهْلِيهِمْ أَبَدًا وَزُيِّنَ ذَٰلِكَ فِي قُلُوبِكُمْ وَظَنَنْتُمْ ظَنَّ السَّوْءِ وَكُنْتُمْ قَوْمًا بُورًا

translation: Whoever does not believe in Allah and His Messenger, We have certainly prepared for the disbelievers a Blazing Fire.
arabic: وَمَنْ لَمْ يُؤْمِنْ بِاللَّهِ وَرَسُولِهِ فَإِنَّا أَعْتَدْنَا لِلْكَافِرِينَ سَعِيرًا

translation: To Allah belongs the dominion of the heavens and earth. He forgives whom He wills and punishes whom He wills, and Allah is All-Forgiving, Most Merciful.
arabic: وَلِلَّهِ مُلْكُ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ ۚ يَغْفِرُ لِمَنْ يَشَاءُ وَيُعَذِّبُ مَنْ يَشَاءُ ۚ وَكَانَ اللَّهُ غَفُورًا رَحِيمًا

translation: Those who lagged behind will say when you set out to collect the spoils of war, “Let us follow you.” They wish to change the word of Allah[5]. Say, “You will never follow us; this is what Allah has already decreed.” They will then say, “Rather, you are jealous of us[6].” Rather, they do not understand but a little[7].
footnotes:
[5] Allah promised those of the believers who pledged allegiance at Hudaybiyah that the spoils of war obtained from the Jews of Khaybar be exclusively for them.
 [6] i.e., you only ask us not to go with you to the spoils of Khsybar to deprive us of our share.
 [7] i.e., they do not understand but the material aspects of life.
arabic: سَيَقُولُ الْمُخَلَّفُونَ إِذَا انْطَلَقْتُمْ إِلَىٰ مَغَانِمَ لِتَأْخُذُوهَا ذَرُونَا نَتَّبِعْكُمْ ۖ يُرِيدُونَ أَنْ يُبَدِّلُوا كَلَامَ اللَّهِ ۚ قُلْ لَنْ تَتَّبِعُونَا كَذَٰلِكُمْ قَالَ اللَّهُ مِنْ قَبْلُ ۖ فَسَيَقُولُونَ بَلْ تَحْسُدُونَنَا ۚ بَلْ كَانُوا لَا يَفْقَهُونَ إِلَّا قَلِيلًا

translation: Say to the Bedouins who lagged behind, “You will be called against a people of great might[8], whom you will fight unless they submit[9]. Then if you obey, Allah will give you a goodly reward, but if you turn away as you turned away before, He will afflict you with a painful punishment.
footnotes: [8] Referring to the two pagan Arab tribes: Hawāzin and Thaqīf. [9] i.e., accept Islam.
arabic: قُلْ لِلْمُخَلَّفِينَ مِنَ الْأَعْرَابِ سَتُدْعَوْنَ إِلَىٰ قَوْمٍ أُولِي بَأْسٍ شَدِيدٍ تُقَاتِلُونَهُمْ أَوْ يُسْلِمُونَ ۖ فَإِنْ تُطِيعُوا يُؤْتِكُمُ اللَّهُ أَجْرًا حَسَنًا ۖ وَإِنْ تَتَوَلَّوْا كَمَا تَوَلَّيْتُمْ مِنْ قَبْلُ يُعَذِّبْكُمْ عَذَابًا أَلِيمًا

translation: There is no blame on the blind, nor on the lame, nor on the sick [for remaining behind]. Whoever obeys Allah and His Messenger, He will admit him into gardens under which rivers flow. But whoever turns away, He will afflict him with a painful punishment.
arabic: لَيْسَ عَلَى الْأَعْمَىٰ حَرَجٌ وَلَا عَلَى الْأَعْرَجِ حَرَجٌ وَلَا عَلَى الْمَرِيضِ حَرَجٌ ۗ وَمَنْ يُطِعِ اللَّهَ وَرَسُولَهُ يُدْخِلْهُ جَنَّاتٍ تَجْرِي مِنْ تَحْتِهَا الْأَنْهَارُ ۖ وَمَنْ يَتَوَلَّ يُعَذِّبْهُ عَذَابًا أَلِيمًا

translation: Allah was much pleased with the believers when they pledged allegiance to you [O Prophet] under the tree. He knew what was in their hearts, so He sent down tranquility upon them and rewarded them with an imminent conquest[10],
footnotes: [10] The conquest of Khaybar occurred in 7 A.H./628 C.E, which preceded that of Makkah.
arabic: ۞ لَقَدْ رَضِيَ اللَّهُ عَنِ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ إِذْ يُبَايِعُونَكَ تَحْتَ الشَّجَرَةِ فَعَلِمَ مَا فِي قُلُوبِهِمْ فَأَنْزَلَ السَّكِينَةَ عَلَيْهِمْ وَأَثَابَهُمْ فَتْحًا قَرِيبًا

translation: and abundant spoils of war they will gain. And Allah is All-Mighty, All-Wise.
arabic: وَمَغَانِمَ كَثِيرَةً يَأْخُذُونَهَا ۗ وَكَانَ اللَّهُ عَزِيزًا حَكِيمًا

translation: Allah has promised you abundant spoils of war that you will gain, and He has hastened for you this [conquest][11], and He has restrained people’s hands from you, so that it may be a sign for the believers, and so that He may guide you to a straight path.
footnotes: [11] i.e., the spoils of Khaybar.
arabic: وَعَدَكُمُ اللَّهُ مَغَانِمَ كَثِيرَةً تَأْخُذُونَهَا فَعَجَّلَ لَكُمْ هَٰذِهِ وَكَفَّ أَيْدِيَ النَّاسِ عَنْكُمْ وَلِتَكُونَ آيَةً لِلْمُؤْمِنِينَ وَيَهْدِيَكُمْ صِرَاطًا مُسْتَقِيمًا

translation: And there are other [spoils] that you have not yet been able to gain, but Allah has full control over them[12], for Allah is Most Capable of all things.
footnotes: [12] i.e., Allah has prepared or decreed them for you.
arabic: وَأُخْرَىٰ لَمْ تَقْدِرُوا عَلَيْهَا قَدْ أَحَاطَ اللَّهُ بِهَا ۚ وَكَانَ اللَّهُ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيرًا

translation: If the disbelievers were to fight you, they would surely turn their backs, then they would not have any protector or helper.
arabic: وَلَوْ قَاتَلَكُمُ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا لَوَلَّوُا الْأَدْبَارَ ثُمَّ لَا يَجِدُونَ وَلِيًّا وَلَا نَصِيرًا

translation: Such was the way of Allah in the past, and you will not find any change in Allah’s way.
arabic: سُنَّةَ اللَّهِ الَّتِي قَدْ خَلَتْ مِنْ قَبْلُ ۖ وَلَنْ تَجِدَ لِسُنَّةِ اللَّهِ تَبْدِيلًا

translation: It is He Who restrained their hands from you and your hands from them near Makkah[13], after giving you the upper hand over them. And Allah is All-Seeing of what you do.
footnotes: [13] A group of pagans of Makkah who were around eighty people came to attack the Muslims in Hudaybiyyah on their way to Makkah, but Muslims were able to take them as captives, then released them.
arabic: وَهُوَ الَّذِي كَفَّ أَيْدِيَهُمْ عَنْكُمْ وَأَيْدِيَكُمْ عَنْهُمْ بِبَطْنِ مَكَّةَ مِنْ بَعْدِ أَنْ أَظْفَرَكُمْ عَلَيْهِمْ ۚ وَكَانَ اللَّهُ بِمَا تَعْمَلُونَ بَصِيرًا

translation: It is they who disbelieved and prevented you from the Sacred Mosque and detained the sacrificial animals[14] from reaching their place of sacrifice. If it had not been for the believing men and women whom you could not identify, you might have trampled over them, thus incurring guilt unknowingly, [We would have let you march to Makkah]. [This was] so that Allah may admit to His mercy whom He wills[15]. If they had been distinct [from the disbelievers], We would surely have inflicted on those who disbelieved among them a painful punishment.
footnotes:
[14] i.e., The Prophet (ﷺ) had brought along with him seventy camels to be sacrificed after completing the rituals of ‘Umrah (the minor pilgrimage).
 [15] Thus, not only the Muslims in Makkah who were not known to their fellow believers were safe, but also those pagans who later embraced Islam were safe too.
arabic: هُمُ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا وَصَدُّوكُمْ عَنِ الْمَسْجِدِ الْحَرَامِ وَالْهَدْيَ مَعْكُوفًا أَنْ يَبْلُغَ مَحِلَّهُ ۚ وَلَوْلَا رِجَالٌ مُؤْمِنُونَ وَنِسَاءٌ مُؤْمِنَاتٌ لَمْ تَعْلَمُوهُمْ أَنْ تَطَئُوهُمْ فَتُصِيبَكُمْ مِنْهُمْ مَعَرَّةٌ بِغَيْرِ عِلْمٍ ۖ لِيُدْخِلَ اللَّهُ فِي رَحْمَتِهِ مَنْ يَشَاءُ ۚ لَوْ تَزَيَّلُوا لَعَذَّبْنَا الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا مِنْهُمْ عَذَابًا أَلِيمًا

translation: When the disbelievers harbored pride in their hearts – the pride of ignorance[16] – then Allah sent down His tranquility upon His Messenger and upon the believers, and caused them to adhere to the word of piety[17], for they were more deserving and worthy of it. And Allah is All-Knowing of everything.
footnotes:
[16] This was when the pagans of Makkah prevented the Prophet (ﷺ) and the believers from entering the Sacred House to perform ‘Umrah for fear that Arabs would consider this a shame and insult to the pagans for allowing Muslims to enter Makkah.
 [17] That none has the right to be worshiped except Allan, and that Muhammad is His messenger (declaration of faith).
arabic: إِذْ جَعَلَ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا فِي قُلُوبِهِمُ الْحَمِيَّةَ حَمِيَّةَ الْجَاهِلِيَّةِ فَأَنْزَلَ اللَّهُ سَكِينَتَهُ عَلَىٰ رَسُولِهِ وَعَلَى الْمُؤْمِنِينَ وَأَلْزَمَهُمْ كَلِمَةَ التَّقْوَىٰ وَكَانُوا أَحَقَّ بِهَا وَأَهْلَهَا ۚ وَكَانَ اللَّهُ بِكُلِّ شَيْءٍ عَلِيمًا

translation: Indeed, Allah has fulfilled His Messenger’s dream in truth: that you will surely enter the Sacred Mosque if Allah wills, in peace and safety, and you will have your heads shaved or shortened[18], without any fear. He knew what you did not know, and He granted you prior to that an imminent conquest[19].
footnotes:
[18] Shaving or trimming hair is from the requirements upon completing the rites of pilgrimage.
 [19] Referring to the Treaty of Hudaybiyyah and subsequently the conquest of Khaybar prior to the fulfillment of the Prophet’s dream regarding entering Makkah for pilgrimage.
arabic: لَقَدْ صَدَقَ اللَّهُ رَسُولَهُ الرُّؤْيَا بِالْحَقِّ ۖ لَتَدْخُلُنَّ الْمَسْجِدَ الْحَرَامَ إِنْ شَاءَ اللَّهُ آمِنِينَ مُحَلِّقِينَ رُءُوسَكُمْ وَمُقَصِّرِينَ لَا تَخَافُونَ ۖ فَعَلِمَ مَا لَمْ تَعْلَمُوا فَجَعَلَ مِنْ دُونِ ذَٰلِكَ فَتْحًا قَرِيبًا

translation: It is He Who has sent His Messenger with guidance and the religion of truth, to make it prevail over all religions, and sufficient is Allah as a Witness.
arabic: هُوَ الَّذِي أَرْسَلَ رَسُولَهُ بِالْهُدَىٰ وَدِينِ الْحَقِّ لِيُظْهِرَهُ عَلَى الدِّينِ كُلِّهِ ۚ وَكَفَىٰ بِاللَّهِ شَهِيدًا

translation: Muhammad is the Messenger of Allah, and those who are with him are firm against the disbelievers[20] and compassionate among themselves. You see them bowing and prostrating [in prayer], seeking Allah’s grace and pleasure. Their distinguishing sign is on their faces from the effects of prostration. Such is their description in the Torah[21]. And their description in the Gospel is like that of a seed that sprouts its shoot, then makes it strong; then it grows thick and stands straight on its stem[22], which delights the sowers – so that He may enrage thereby the disbelievers. Allah has promised those among them who believe and do righteous deeds forgiveness and a great reward.
footnotes:
[20] It should be understood in its historical context. Muslims are urged here to be firm with the Arab disbelievers who were at war with Muslims. However, Muslims are encouraged to treat peaceful and non-combatant disbelievers with kindness and fairness. See 60:8-9.
 [21] The description of the Prophet (ﷺ) and his companions is mentioned in the previous scriptures. See Deuteronomy 33:1-3. [22] See Matthew 13:3-9, Mark 4:26-28.
arabic: مُحَمَّدٌ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ ۚ وَالَّذِينَ مَعَهُ أَشِدَّاءُ عَلَى الْكُفَّارِ رُحَمَاءُ بَيْنَهُمْ ۖ تَرَاهُمْ رُكَّعًا سُجَّدًا يَبْتَغُونَ فَضْلًا مِنَ اللَّهِ وَرِضْوَانًا ۖ سِيمَاهُمْ فِي وُجُوهِهِمْ مِنْ أَثَرِ السُّجُودِ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ مَثَلُهُمْ فِي التَّوْرَاةِ ۚ وَمَثَلُهُمْ فِي الْإِنْجِيلِ كَزَرْعٍ أَخْرَجَ شَطْأَهُ فَآزَرَهُ فَاسْتَغْلَظَ فَاسْتَوَىٰ عَلَىٰ سُوقِهِ يُعْجِبُ الزُّرَّاعَ لِيَغِيظَ بِهِمُ الْكُفَّارَ ۗ وَعَدَ اللَّهُ الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَعَمِلُوا الصَّالِحَاتِ مِنْهُمْ مَغْفِرَةً وَأَجْرًا عَظِيمًا

translation: O you who believe, do not decide [any matter of importance] before Allah and His Messenger[1], and fear Allah, for Allah is All-Hearing, All-Knowing.
footnotes: [1] Show complete obedience to Allah and the Prophet (ﷺ).
arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ يَا أَيُّهَا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا لَا تُقَدِّمُوا بَيْنَ يَدَيِ اللَّهِ وَرَسُولِهِ ۖ وَاتَّقُوا اللَّهَ ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ سَمِيعٌ عَلِيمٌ

translation: O you who believe, do not raise your voices above the voice of the Prophet, nor speak loudly to him as you speak loudly to one another[2], lest your deeds become worthless without you realizing it.
footnotes: [2] Or do not call him by his name as you call one another; do not call him, ‘O Muhammad.’ rather, call him, ‘O Prophet.’
arabic: يَا أَيُّهَا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا لَا تَرْفَعُوا أَصْوَاتَكُمْ فَوْقَ صَوْتِ النَّبِيِّ وَلَا تَجْهَرُوا لَهُ بِالْقَوْلِ كَجَهْرِ بَعْضِكُمْ لِبَعْضٍ أَنْ تَحْبَطَ أَعْمَالُكُمْ وَأَنْتُمْ لَا تَشْعُرُونَ

translation: Indeed, those who lower their voices in the presence of the Messenger of Allah are those whose hearts Allah has tested for righteousness; for them there is forgiveness and a great reward[3].
footnotes: [3] Once the Prophet (ﷺ) was taking a nap in the afternoon when a group of people from the tribe of Bani Tamīm came to see him. They started calling him out loud while standing outside the chambers of his wives.
arabic: إِنَّ الَّذِينَ يَغُضُّونَ أَصْوَاتَهُمْ عِنْدَ رَسُولِ اللَّهِ أُولَٰئِكَ الَّذِينَ امْتَحَنَ اللَّهُ قُلُوبَهُمْ لِلتَّقْوَىٰ ۚ لَهُمْ مَغْفِرَةٌ وَأَجْرٌ عَظِيمٌ

translation: As for those who call out to you [O Prophet] from behind the chambers, most of them have no understanding.
arabic: إِنَّ الَّذِينَ يُنَادُونَكَ مِنْ وَرَاءِ الْحُجُرَاتِ أَكْثَرُهُمْ لَا يَعْقِلُونَ

translation: If they had been patient until you came out to them, it would have been better for them. But Allah is All-Forgiving, Most Merciful.
arabic: وَلَوْ أَنَّهُمْ صَبَرُوا حَتَّىٰ تَخْرُجَ إِلَيْهِمْ لَكَانَ خَيْرًا لَهُمْ ۚ وَاللَّهُ غَفُورٌ رَحِيمٌ

translation: O you who believe, if an evildoer brings you some news, verify it, lest you harm a people unknowingly, then you become regretful for what you did[4].
footnotes: [4] The Prophet (ﷺ) sent Al-Walīd ibn ‘Uqbah ibn Abi Mu‘ait to collect zakah (alms-tax) from the tribe of Bani Al-Mustaliq. They went out to receive Al-Walīd but he thought that they wanted to harm him. So, he quickly came back to the Prophet (ﷺ) with the bad news, so he wanted to punish them. After a while, a delegation from Bani Al-Mustaliq came to clear the misunderstanding.
arabic: يَا أَيُّهَا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا إِنْ جَاءَكُمْ فَاسِقٌ بِنَبَإٍ فَتَبَيَّنُوا أَنْ تُصِيبُوا قَوْمًا بِجَهَالَةٍ فَتُصْبِحُوا عَلَىٰ مَا فَعَلْتُمْ نَادِمِينَ

translation: Know that the Messenger of Allah is among you. If he were to obey you in many matters, you would surely suffer[5]. But Allah has endeared faith to you and made it pleasing to your hearts, and has made disbelief, wickedness, and disobedience hateful to you. Such are the rightly guided,
footnotes: [5] Things would be difficult for you.
arabic: وَاعْلَمُوا أَنَّ فِيكُمْ رَسُولَ اللَّهِ ۚ لَوْ يُطِيعُكُمْ فِي كَثِيرٍ مِنَ الْأَمْرِ لَعَنِتُّمْ وَلَٰكِنَّ اللَّهَ حَبَّبَ إِلَيْكُمُ الْإِيمَانَ وَزَيَّنَهُ فِي قُلُوبِكُمْ وَكَرَّهَ إِلَيْكُمُ الْكُفْرَ وَالْفُسُوقَ وَالْعِصْيَانَ ۚ أُولَٰئِكَ هُمُ الرَّاشِدُونَ

translation: by Allah’s grace and favor. And Allah is All-Knowing, All-Wise.
arabic: فَضْلًا مِنَ اللَّهِ وَنِعْمَةً ۚ وَاللَّهُ عَلِيمٌ حَكِيمٌ

translation: If two groups of the believers fight one another, make peace between them. If one of them transgresses against the other, fight against the transgressing group until they submit to the rule of Allah. Then if they submit, make peace between them with fairness, and be just, for Allah loves those who are just.
arabic: وَإِنْ طَائِفَتَانِ مِنَ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ اقْتَتَلُوا فَأَصْلِحُوا بَيْنَهُمَا ۖ فَإِنْ بَغَتْ إِحْدَاهُمَا عَلَى الْأُخْرَىٰ فَقَاتِلُوا الَّتِي تَبْغِي حَتَّىٰ تَفِيءَ إِلَىٰ أَمْرِ اللَّهِ ۚ فَإِنْ فَاءَتْ فَأَصْلِحُوا بَيْنَهُمَا بِالْعَدْلِ وَأَقْسِطُوا ۖ إِنَّ اللَّهَ يُحِبُّ الْمُقْسِطِينَ

translation: The believers are but brothers, so make peace between your brothers. And fear Allah, so that you may be shown mercy.
arabic: إِنَّمَا الْمُؤْمِنُونَ إِخْوَةٌ فَأَصْلِحُوا بَيْنَ أَخَوَيْكُمْ ۚ وَاتَّقُوا اللَّهَ لَعَلَّكُمْ تُرْحَمُونَ

translation: O you who believe, let not some men ridicule others, for it may be that they are better than them; nor let some women ridicule others, for it may be that they are better than them. Do not speak ill of one another, nor call one another by [offensive] nicknames. How evil is the name of wickedness after having faith! And whoever does not repent, it is they who are the wrongdoers.
arabic: يَا أَيُّهَا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا لَا يَسْخَرْ قَوْمٌ مِنْ قَوْمٍ عَسَىٰ أَنْ يَكُونُوا خَيْرًا مِنْهُمْ وَلَا نِسَاءٌ مِنْ نِسَاءٍ عَسَىٰ أَنْ يَكُنَّ خَيْرًا مِنْهُنَّ ۖ وَلَا تَلْمِزُوا أَنْفُسَكُمْ وَلَا تَنَابَزُوا بِالْأَلْقَابِ ۖ بِئْسَ الِاسْمُ الْفُسُوقُ بَعْدَ الْإِيمَانِ ۚ وَمَنْ لَمْ يَتُبْ فَأُولَٰئِكَ هُمُ الظَّالِمُونَ

translation: O you who believe, avoid much suspicion, for some suspicions are sin. Do not spy on one another, nor backbite one another. Would any of you like to eat the flesh of his dead brother[6]? You would surely abhor it. So fear Allah. Indeed, Allah is Accepting of Repentance, Most Merciful.
footnotes: [6] Backbiting people is likened to eating their dead bodies, for the dead do not feel the pain if their flesh is eaten; likewise, the one who is absent does not feel the pain of backbiting. So, backbiting someone is like eating his flesh while he is dead.
arabic: يَا أَيُّهَا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا اجْتَنِبُوا كَثِيرًا مِنَ الظَّنِّ إِنَّ بَعْضَ الظَّنِّ إِثْمٌ ۖ وَلَا تَجَسَّسُوا وَلَا يَغْتَبْ بَعْضُكُمْ بَعْضًا ۚ أَيُحِبُّ أَحَدُكُمْ أَنْ يَأْكُلَ لَحْمَ أَخِيهِ مَيْتًا فَكَرِهْتُمُوهُ ۚ وَاتَّقُوا اللَّهَ ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ تَوَّابٌ رَحِيمٌ

translation: O people, We have created you from a male and a female and made you into nations and tribes so that you may recognize one another. Indeed, the most noble of you before Allah is the most righteous[7] among you. Indeed, Allah is All-Knowing, All-Aware.
footnotes: [7] Lit., "the one who has the most taqwā among you," i.e., consciousness, piety, and fear of Allah.
arabic: يَا أَيُّهَا النَّاسُ إِنَّا خَلَقْنَاكُمْ مِنْ ذَكَرٍ وَأُنْثَىٰ وَجَعَلْنَاكُمْ شُعُوبًا وَقَبَائِلَ لِتَعَارَفُوا ۚ إِنَّ أَكْرَمَكُمْ عِنْدَ اللَّهِ أَتْقَاكُمْ ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ عَلِيمٌ خَبِيرٌ

translation: The Bedouins say, “We have believed.” Say, “You have not believed, but say, ‘We have submitted,’ for faith has not yet entered your hearts[8]. But if you obey Allah and His Messenger, He will not detract anything from the reward of your deeds. Indeed, Allah is All-Forgiving, Most Merciful.”
footnotes: [8] There is a distinction between Islam and Imān (faith). Imān is a higher degree than Islam. This distinction is mentioned in an authentic Hadīth of the Prophet (ﷺ), known as the Hadīth of Gabriel.
arabic: ۞ قَالَتِ الْأَعْرَابُ آمَنَّا ۖ قُلْ لَمْ تُؤْمِنُوا وَلَٰكِنْ قُولُوا أَسْلَمْنَا وَلَمَّا يَدْخُلِ الْإِيمَانُ فِي قُلُوبِكُمْ ۖ وَإِنْ تُطِيعُوا اللَّهَ وَرَسُولَهُ لَا يَلِتْكُمْ مِنْ أَعْمَالِكُمْ شَيْئًا ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ غَفُورٌ رَحِيمٌ

translation: Indeed, the believers are those who believe in Allah and His Messenger, then they do not have doubt, but fight with their wealth and their lives in the way of Allah. It is they who are the truthful.
arabic: إِنَّمَا الْمُؤْمِنُونَ الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا بِاللَّهِ وَرَسُولِهِ ثُمَّ لَمْ يَرْتَابُوا وَجَاهَدُوا بِأَمْوَالِهِمْ وَأَنْفُسِهِمْ فِي سَبِيلِ اللَّهِ ۚ أُولَٰئِكَ هُمُ الصَّادِقُونَ

translation: Say, “Do you inform Allah of your faith, when Allah knows all that is in the heavens and all that is on earth? And Allah is All-Knowing of everything.”
arabic: قُلْ أَتُعَلِّمُونَ اللَّهَ بِدِينِكُمْ وَاللَّهُ يَعْلَمُ مَا فِي السَّمَاوَاتِ وَمَا فِي الْأَرْضِ ۚ وَاللَّهُ بِكُلِّ شَيْءٍ عَلِيمٌ

translation: They think that they have done you a favor by embracing Islam. Say, “Do not consider your Islam as a favor to me. Rather, it is Allah Who has done you a favor by guiding you to faith, if you are truthful.
arabic: يَمُنُّونَ عَلَيْكَ أَنْ أَسْلَمُوا ۖ قُلْ لَا تَمُنُّوا عَلَيَّ إِسْلَامَكُمْ ۖ بَلِ اللَّهُ يَمُنُّ عَلَيْكُمْ أَنْ هَدَاكُمْ لِلْإِيمَانِ إِنْ كُنْتُمْ صَادِقِينَ

translation: Indeed, Allah knows all that is unseen of the heavens and earth, and Allah is All-Seeing of what you do.”
arabic: إِنَّ اللَّهَ يَعْلَمُ غَيْبَ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ ۚ وَاللَّهُ بَصِيرٌ بِمَا تَعْمَلُونَ

translation: Qāf[1]. By the Glorious Qur’an!
footnotes: [1] See footnote 2:1.
arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ ق ۚ وَالْقُرْآنِ الْمَجِيدِ

translation: But they wonder that a warner has come to them from among themselves, so the disbelievers say, “This is something strange!
arabic: بَلْ عَجِبُوا أَنْ جَاءَهُمْ مُنْذِرٌ مِنْهُمْ فَقَالَ الْكَافِرُونَ هَٰذَا شَيْءٌ عَجِيبٌ

translation: What! Is it when we die and become dust [will we return to life]? That is a far-fetched return.”
arabic: أَإِذَا مِتْنَا وَكُنَّا تُرَابًا ۖ ذَٰلِكَ رَجْعٌ بَعِيدٌ

translation: We certainly know what the earth consumes of them [after their death], and with Us is a Preserved Record[2].
footnotes: [2] Or a Record that preserves everything.
arabic: قَدْ عَلِمْنَا مَا تَنْقُصُ الْأَرْضُ مِنْهُمْ ۖ وَعِنْدَنَا كِتَابٌ حَفِيظٌ

translation: Rather they rejected the truth when it came to them, so they are in a state of confusion[3].
footnotes: [3] They are in confusion concerning the Qur’an, claiming that it is poetry, magic, or ancient fables. They are also in confusion concerning the Prophet (ﷺ), claiming that he is a poet, a fabricator, or insane.
arabic: بَلْ كَذَّبُوا بِالْحَقِّ لَمَّا جَاءَهُمْ فَهُمْ فِي أَمْرٍ مَرِيجٍ

translation: Have they not then looked at the sky above them – how We built it and adorned it [with stars], and it has no rifts?
arabic: أَفَلَمْ يَنْظُرُوا إِلَى السَّمَاءِ فَوْقَهُمْ كَيْفَ بَنَيْنَاهَا وَزَيَّنَّاهَا وَمَا لَهَا مِنْ فُرُوجٍ

translation: And We have spread out the earth and set therein firm mountains, and caused to grow therein plants of every pleasant kind,
arabic: وَالْأَرْضَ مَدَدْنَاهَا وَأَلْقَيْنَا فِيهَا رَوَاسِيَ وَأَنْبَتْنَا فِيهَا مِنْ كُلِّ زَوْجٍ بَهِيجٍ

translation: as a source of insight and a reminder to every slave who turns [to Allah].
arabic: تَبْصِرَةً وَذِكْرَىٰ لِكُلِّ عَبْدٍ مُنِيبٍ

translation: And We send down from the sky blessed rain, with which We cause to grow gardens and grain for harvest,
arabic: وَنَزَّلْنَا مِنَ السَّمَاءِ مَاءً مُبَارَكًا فَأَنْبَتْنَا بِهِ جَنَّاتٍ وَحَبَّ الْحَصِيدِ

translation: and towering palm trees having clustered fruit,
arabic: وَالنَّخْلَ بَاسِقَاتٍ لَهَا طَلْعٌ نَضِيدٌ

translation: as a provision for people, and We revive thereby a dead land; likewise will be the resurrection.
arabic: رِزْقًا لِلْعِبَادِ ۖ وَأَحْيَيْنَا بِهِ بَلْدَةً مَيْتًا ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ الْخُرُوجُ

translation: The people of Noah rejected [the truth] before them[4], as well as the companions of the Well[5] and Thamūd,
footnotes:
[4] i.e., before the pagans of Makkah.
 [5] i.e., people of prophet Shu‘ayb or other people. See footnote 25:38.
arabic: كَذَّبَتْ قَبْلَهُمْ قَوْمُ نُوحٍ وَأَصْحَابُ الرَّسِّ وَثَمُودُ

translation: and so did ‘Ād, Pharaoh, the people of Lot,
arabic: وَعَادٌ وَفِرْعَوْنُ وَإِخْوَانُ لُوطٍ

translation: and the dwellers of the Forest[6], and the people of Tubba‘[7]. All of them rejected the messengers, so My warning was fulfilled.
footnotes:
[6] i.e., the people of Shu‘ayb (عليه السلام).
 [7] Tubba‘ al-Himyari, an ancient righteous Yemeni king. See 44:37.
arabic: وَأَصْحَابُ الْأَيْكَةِ وَقَوْمُ تُبَّعٍ ۚ كُلٌّ كَذَّبَ الرُّسُلَ فَحَقَّ وَعِيدِ

translation: Were We wearied by their first creation? No indeed, yet they are in confusion concerning the second creation.
arabic: أَفَعَيِينَا بِالْخَلْقِ الْأَوَّلِ ۚ بَلْ هُمْ فِي لَبْسٍ مِنْ خَلْقٍ جَدِيدٍ

translation: We have created man and know what his soul whispers within him, for We are closer to him than his jugular vein[8].
footnotes: [8] i.e., We have absolute knowledge of everything about him, or Our angels are closer to him, as mentioned in the next verse.
arabic: وَلَقَدْ خَلَقْنَا الْإِنْسَانَ وَنَعْلَمُ مَا تُوَسْوِسُ بِهِ نَفْسُهُ ۖ وَنَحْنُ أَقْرَبُ إِلَيْهِ مِنْ حَبْلِ الْوَرِيدِ

translation: When the two angel scribes, constantly accompanying him[9], one on the right, and the other on the left[10].
footnotes:
[9] Recording each word and deed.
 [10] There are two angle scribes: one on the right of each person, recording the good deeds, while the other on the left, recording evil deeds. They accompany humans all the time, except when one is intimate with their spouse or uses the bathroom.
arabic: إِذْ يَتَلَقَّى الْمُتَلَقِّيَانِ عَنِ الْيَمِينِ وَعَنِ الشِّمَالِ قَعِيدٌ

translation: Not a single word he utters but there is with him a vigilant watcher, ready [to record it].
arabic: مَا يَلْفِظُ مِنْ قَوْلٍ إِلَّا لَدَيْهِ رَقِيبٌ عَتِيدٌ

translation: The throes of death will come with the truth[11]. This is what you were trying to avoid.
footnotes: [11] When a disbeliever or a heedless person is in death throes, he will realize that resurrection and reckoning are true.
arabic: وَجَاءَتْ سَكْرَةُ الْمَوْتِ بِالْحَقِّ ۖ ذَٰلِكَ مَا كُنْتَ مِنْهُ تَحِيدُ

translation: And the Trumpet will be blown[12]; that is the Day of [the given] warning.
footnotes: [12] i.e., the second blow that will bring all back to life for judgment.
arabic: وَنُفِخَ فِي الصُّورِ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ يَوْمُ الْوَعِيدِ

translation: Everyone will come, accompanied by an angel to drive him and another to testify[13].
footnotes: [13] i.e., one driving him for Judgment and another as a witness for his deeds.
arabic: وَجَاءَتْ كُلُّ نَفْسٍ مَعَهَا سَائِقٌ وَشَهِيدٌ

translation: “You were heedless of this; now We have removed your veil[14], so your vision is sharp Today.”
footnotes: [14] Of heedlessness by seeing the punishment and hardships.
arabic: لَقَدْ كُنْتَ فِي غَفْلَةٍ مِنْ هَٰذَا فَكَشَفْنَا عَنْكَ غِطَاءَكَ فَبَصَرُكَ الْيَوْمَ حَدِيدٌ

translation: His angel-companion will say, “Here is the record ready with me.”
arabic: وَقَالَ قَرِينُهُ هَٰذَا مَا لَدَيَّ عَتِيدٌ

translation: [It will be said to the two angels], “Throw into Hell every obstinate disbeliever,
arabic: أَلْقِيَا فِي جَهَنَّمَ كُلَّ كَفَّارٍ عَنِيدٍ

translation: every withholder of good, transgressor, and doubter,
arabic: مَنَّاعٍ لِلْخَيْرِ مُعْتَدٍ مُرِيبٍ

translation: who set up with Allah another god. Throw him into the severe punishment.”
arabic: الَّذِي جَعَلَ مَعَ اللَّهِ إِلَٰهًا آخَرَ فَأَلْقِيَاهُ فِي الْعَذَابِ الشَّدِيدِ

translation: His [devil] companion will say, “Our Lord, I did not mislead him, but he himself was far astray.”
arabic: ۞ قَالَ قَرِينُهُ رَبَّنَا مَا أَطْغَيْتُهُ وَلَٰكِنْ كَانَ فِي ضَلَالٍ بَعِيدٍ

translation: Allah will say, “Do not argue in My presence, for I had already given you the warning.
arabic: قَالَ لَا تَخْتَصِمُوا لَدَيَّ وَقَدْ قَدَّمْتُ إِلَيْكُمْ بِالْوَعِيدِ

translation: My Word cannot be changed, nor am I unjust to My slaves.”
arabic: مَا يُبَدَّلُ الْقَوْلُ لَدَيَّ وَمَا أَنَا بِظَلَّامٍ لِلْعَبِيدِ

translation: [Beware of] the Day when We will say to Hell, “Have you reached your fill?” It will say, “Are there any more?”
arabic: يَوْمَ نَقُولُ لِجَهَنَّمَ هَلِ امْتَلَأْتِ وَتَقُولُ هَلْ مِنْ مَزِيدٍ

translation: Paradise will be brought near to the righteous, not far off.
arabic: وَأُزْلِفَتِ الْجَنَّةُ لِلْمُتَّقِينَ غَيْرَ بَعِيدٍ

translation: [It will be said], “This is what you were promised; this is for everyone who constantly turned [to Allah] and was dutiful,
arabic: هَٰذَا مَا تُوعَدُونَ لِكُلِّ أَوَّابٍ حَفِيظٍ

translation: who feared the Most Compassionate unseen[15], and came with a devoted heart.
footnotes: [15] Or while he is in private.
arabic: مَنْ خَشِيَ الرَّحْمَٰنَ بِالْغَيْبِ وَجَاءَ بِقَلْبٍ مُنِيبٍ

translation: Enter it in peace. This is the Day of eternity.”
arabic: ادْخُلُوهَا بِسَلَامٍ ۖ ذَٰلِكَ يَوْمُ الْخُلُودِ

translation: They will have therein all what they wish for, and We have yet more[16].
footnotes: [16] Of unimaginable pleasures such as looking at the Face of Allah Almighty. See 10:26 and 75:22-23.
arabic: لَهُمْ مَا يَشَاءُونَ فِيهَا وَلَدَيْنَا مَزِيدٌ

translation: How many nations We destroyed before these [Makkans] who were stronger than them in might! They sought refuge in the land. Did they find any escape?
arabic: وَكَمْ أَهْلَكْنَا قَبْلَهُمْ مِنْ قَرْنٍ هُمْ أَشَدُّ مِنْهُمْ بَطْشًا فَنَقَّبُوا فِي الْبِلَادِ هَلْ مِنْ مَحِيصٍ

translation: Indeed, in that is a reminder for anyone who has a [mindful] heart or lends an attentive ear.
arabic: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَذِكْرَىٰ لِمَنْ كَانَ لَهُ قَلْبٌ أَوْ أَلْقَى السَّمْعَ وَهُوَ شَهِيدٌ

translation: Indeed, We created the heavens and earth and all that is between them in six days, and no weariness touched Us[17].
footnotes: [17] It is believed that this verse came in response to the Jews who claimed that after the Lord made the heavens and the earth in six days, He rested on the seventh day. See Exodus 31:17.
arabic: وَلَقَدْ خَلَقْنَا السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضَ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا فِي سِتَّةِ أَيَّامٍ وَمَا مَسَّنَا مِنْ لُغُوبٍ

translation: So bear patiently [O Prophet] what they say, and glorify the praise of your Lord before sunrise and before sunset[18].
footnotes: [18] This and the following verse refer to the times of the five daily prayers; before the sun rises and sets (i.e., the Fajr, Zuhr, and ‘Asr prayers).
arabic: فَاصْبِرْ عَلَىٰ مَا يَقُولُونَ وَسَبِّحْ بِحَمْدِ رَبِّكَ قَبْلَ طُلُوعِ الشَّمْسِ وَقَبْلَ الْغُرُوبِ

translation: And glorify Him in the night[19] and after the prayers.
footnotes: [19] The night (the Maghrib, ‘Isha’ prayers).
arabic: وَمِنَ اللَّيْلِ فَسَبِّحْهُ وَأَدْبَارَ السُّجُودِ

translation: And listen! On the Day when the Caller will call out from a nearby place[20],
footnotes: [20] The angel who will blow the second trumpet for the Resurrection.
arabic: وَاسْتَمِعْ يَوْمَ يُنَادِ الْمُنَادِ مِنْ مَكَانٍ قَرِيبٍ

translation: the Day when they will hear the Blast [of the second Trumpet] in truth[21]. That is the Day of Resurrection.
footnotes: [21] See footnote below 50:20.
arabic: يَوْمَ يَسْمَعُونَ الصَّيْحَةَ بِالْحَقِّ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ يَوْمُ الْخُرُوجِ

translation: Indeed, it is We Who give life and cause death, and to Us is the final return.
arabic: إِنَّا نَحْنُ نُحْيِي وَنُمِيتُ وَإِلَيْنَا الْمَصِيرُ

translation: On the Day when the earth will be rent asunder for them as they hasten forth [from their graves]; that is an easy gathering for Us.
arabic: يَوْمَ تَشَقَّقُ الْأَرْضُ عَنْهُمْ سِرَاعًا ۚ ذَٰلِكَ حَشْرٌ عَلَيْنَا يَسِيرٌ

translation: We know best what they say, and you are not there to compel them to believe. But remind with the Qur’an those who fear My warning.
arabic: نَحْنُ أَعْلَمُ بِمَا يَقُولُونَ ۖ وَمَا أَنْتَ عَلَيْهِمْ بِجَبَّارٍ ۖ فَذَكِّرْ بِالْقُرْآنِ مَنْ يَخَافُ وَعِيدِ

translation: By the winds that scatter [dust],
arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ وَالذَّارِيَاتِ ذَرْوًا

translation: and by the clouds carrying loads of water,
arabic: فَالْحَامِلَاتِ وِقْرًا

translation: and by the ships that sail with ease,
arabic: فَالْجَارِيَاتِ يُسْرًا

translation: and by the angels who distribute [blessings] by His command.
arabic: فَالْمُقَسِّمَاتِ أَمْرًا

translation: Indeed, what you are promised is true,
arabic: إِنَّمَا تُوعَدُونَ لَصَادِقٌ

translation: and the Judgment will surely come to pass.
arabic: وَإِنَّ الدِّينَ لَوَاقِعٌ

translation: By the heaven with its pathways[1],
footnotes: [1] i.e., tracks or orbits.
arabic: وَالسَّمَاءِ ذَاتِ الْحُبُكِ

translation: Indeed, you [Makkans] have conflicting views[2].
footnotes: [2] Concerning the Prophet (ﷺ) and the Qur’an.
arabic: إِنَّكُمْ لَفِي قَوْلٍ مُخْتَلِفٍ

translation: He who is diverted from it is destined to be diverted.
arabic: يُؤْفَكُ عَنْهُ مَنْ أُفِكَ

translation: Doomed[3] are those who base their beliefs on conjecture.
footnotes: [3] May they be destroyed.
arabic: قُتِلَ الْخَرَّاصُونَ

translation: those who are steeped in ignorance heedlessly.
arabic: الَّذِينَ هُمْ فِي غَمْرَةٍ سَاهُونَ

translation: They ask [mockingly], “When is the Day of Judgment?”
arabic: يَسْأَلُونَ أَيَّانَ يَوْمُ الدِّينِ

translation: It is the Day when they will be punished by the Fire.
arabic: يَوْمَ هُمْ عَلَى النَّارِ يُفْتَنُونَ

translation: [It will be said], “Taste your punishment! This is what you were seeking to hasten.”
arabic: ذُوقُوا فِتْنَتَكُمْ هَٰذَا الَّذِي كُنْتُمْ بِهِ تَسْتَعْجِلُونَ

translation: Indeed, the righteous will be in gardens and springs,
arabic: إِنَّ الْمُتَّقِينَ فِي جَنَّاتٍ وَعُيُونٍ

translation: receiving what their Lord will give them, for they were indeed doers of good beforehand.
arabic: آخِذِينَ مَا آتَاهُمْ رَبُّهُمْ ۚ إِنَّهُمْ كَانُوا قَبْلَ ذَٰلِكَ مُحْسِنِينَ

translation: They used to sleep only a little at night[4],
footnotes: [4] i.e., spending most of the night in prayer, reciting the Qur’an, and in supplication.
arabic: كَانُوا قَلِيلًا مِنَ اللَّيْلِ مَا يَهْجَعُونَ

translation: and before dawn they would seek forgiveness[5],
footnotes: [5] Supererogatory prayers and supplications are recommended before dawn.
arabic: وَبِالْأَسْحَارِ هُمْ يَسْتَغْفِرُونَ

translation: and in their wealth, there was a share for the beggar and the destitute.
arabic: وَفِي أَمْوَالِهِمْ حَقٌّ لِلسَّائِلِ وَالْمَحْرُومِ

translation: On earth there are signs for those who are certain in faith,
arabic: وَفِي الْأَرْضِ آيَاتٌ لِلْمُوقِنِينَ

translation: and also within yourselves. Do you not see?
arabic: وَفِي أَنْفُسِكُمْ ۚ أَفَلَا تُبْصِرُونَ

translation: And in the heaven is your provision and all that you are promised.
arabic: وَفِي السَّمَاءِ رِزْقُكُمْ وَمَا تُوعَدُونَ

translation: By the Lord of the heaven and earth, this [resurrection] is certainly as true as the fact that you can speak.
arabic: فَوَرَبِّ السَّمَاءِ وَالْأَرْضِ إِنَّهُ لَحَقٌّ مِثْلَ مَا أَنَّكُمْ تَنْطِقُونَ

translation: Has there come to you the story of Abraham’s honored guests[6]?
footnotes: [6] Honorable angels with Allah.
arabic: هَلْ أَتَاكَ حَدِيثُ ضَيْفِ إِبْرَاهِيمَ الْمُكْرَمِينَ

translation: When they came to him and said, “Peace.” He said, “Upon you be peace.” [saying to himself] “Unknown people!”
arabic: إِذْ دَخَلُوا عَلَيْهِ فَقَالُوا سَلَامًا ۖ قَالَ سَلَامٌ قَوْمٌ مُنْكَرُونَ

translation: Then he went quickly to his household, and came with a fat [roasted] calf,
arabic: فَرَاغَ إِلَىٰ أَهْلِهِ فَجَاءَ بِعِجْلٍ سَمِينٍ

translation: and placed it before them and said, “Will you not eat?”
arabic: فَقَرَّبَهُ إِلَيْهِمْ قَالَ أَلَا تَأْكُلُونَ

translation: He felt apprehensive about them[7]. They said, “Do not be afraid,” and gave him glad tidings of a knowledgeable son.
footnotes: [7] In their culture, if a guest refused to eat the food provided, it was considered a sign of ill will. See footnote 11:70.
arabic: فَأَوْجَسَ مِنْهُمْ خِيفَةً ۖ قَالُوا لَا تَخَفْ ۖ وَبَشَّرُوهُ بِغُلَامٍ عَلِيمٍ

translation: His wife cried out loud, and struck her face [in astonishment] and said, “[I am] a barren old woman!”
arabic: فَأَقْبَلَتِ امْرَأَتُهُ فِي صَرَّةٍ فَصَكَّتْ وَجْهَهَا وَقَالَتْ عَجُوزٌ عَقِيمٌ

translation: They said, “This is what your Lord said. Indeed, He is the All-Wise, the All-Knowing.”
arabic: قَالُوا كَذَٰلِكِ قَالَ رَبُّكِ ۖ إِنَّهُ هُوَ الْحَكِيمُ الْعَلِيمُ

translation: Abraham said, “Then what is your mission, O messengers?”
arabic: ۞ قَالَ فَمَا خَطْبُكُمْ أَيُّهَا الْمُرْسَلُونَ

translation: They said, “We have been sent to a wicked people,
arabic: قَالُوا إِنَّا أُرْسِلْنَا إِلَىٰ قَوْمٍ مُجْرِمِينَ

translation: to send down upon them stones of clay,
arabic: لِنُرْسِلَ عَلَيْهِمْ حِجَارَةً مِنْ طِينٍ

translation: marked by your Lord for the transgressors.”
arabic: مُسَوَّمَةً عِنْدَ رَبِّكَ لِلْمُسْرِفِينَ

translation: We brought out those believers who were there,
arabic: فَأَخْرَجْنَا مَنْ كَانَ فِيهَا مِنَ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ

translation: but We only found in it one Muslim household[8].
footnotes: [8] Lot's family except his wife.
arabic: فَمَا وَجَدْنَا فِيهَا غَيْرَ بَيْتٍ مِنَ الْمُسْلِمِينَ

translation: And We left there a sign[9] for those who fear the painful punishment.
footnotes: [9] i.e., the ruins of Sodom or the Dead Sea in Palestine, as a lesson for people.
arabic: وَتَرَكْنَا فِيهَا آيَةً لِلَّذِينَ يَخَافُونَ الْعَذَابَ الْأَلِيمَ

translation: And [there is a sign in the story of] Moses when We sent him to Pharaoh with compelling proofs,
arabic: وَفِي مُوسَىٰ إِذْ أَرْسَلْنَاهُ إِلَىٰ فِرْعَوْنَ بِسُلْطَانٍ مُبِينٍ

translation: But he and his supporters turned away, and he said about [Moses], “A magician or a madman!”
arabic: فَتَوَلَّىٰ بِرُكْنِهِ وَقَالَ سَاحِرٌ أَوْ مَجْنُونٌ

translation: So We seized him and his soldiers and cast them into the sea while he was blameworthy[10].
footnotes: [10] For his disbelief and arrogance.
arabic: فَأَخَذْنَاهُ وَجُنُودَهُ فَنَبَذْنَاهُمْ فِي الْيَمِّ وَهُوَ مُلِيمٌ

translation: And [there is a sign in the story of] ‘Ād, when We sent against them the devastating barren wind[11].
footnotes: [11] Devoid of all goodness such as carrying rain or fertilizing trees.
arabic: وَفِي عَادٍ إِذْ أَرْسَلْنَا عَلَيْهِمُ الرِّيحَ الْعَقِيمَ

translation: It spared nothing it came upon except that it reduced it to ruin and decay.
arabic: مَا تَذَرُ مِنْ شَيْءٍ أَتَتْ عَلَيْهِ إِلَّا جَعَلَتْهُ كَالرَّمِيمِ

translation: And [there is a sign in the story of] Thamūd, when they were told, “Enjoy yourselves for a while[12].”
footnotes: [12] i.e., only three days. See 11:65.
arabic: وَفِي ثَمُودَ إِذْ قِيلَ لَهُمْ تَمَتَّعُوا حَتَّىٰ حِينٍ

translation: But they rebelled against the command of their Lord, so the thunderbolt seized them, while they were looking on.
arabic: فَعَتَوْا عَنْ أَمْرِ رَبِّهِمْ فَأَخَذَتْهُمُ الصَّاعِقَةُ وَهُمْ يَنْظُرُونَ

translation: They could not withstand it, nor could they ward it off.
arabic: فَمَا اسْتَطَاعُوا مِنْ قِيَامٍ وَمَا كَانُوا مُنْتَصِرِينَ

translation: And the people of Noah [were also destroyed] before them. They were indeed a rebellious people.
arabic: وَقَوْمَ نُوحٍ مِنْ قَبْلُ ۖ إِنَّهُمْ كَانُوا قَوْمًا فَاسِقِينَ

translation: We built the heaven with might[13], and We are indeed expanding it.
footnotes: [13] ’Ayd does not mean "hands" here. This is not from the verses of Allah's attributes, for Allah Almighty did not add it to Himself, i.e., He did not say, "My ’ayd, or Our ’ayd".
arabic: وَالسَّمَاءَ بَنَيْنَاهَا بِأَيْدٍ وَإِنَّا لَمُوسِعُونَ

translation: And We spread out the earth. How well did We smooth it out[14]!
footnotes: [14] The earth was spread out to accommodate the creatures. Its spherical shape is mentioned in 39:5.
arabic: وَالْأَرْضَ فَرَشْنَاهَا فَنِعْمَ الْمَاهِدُونَ

translation: And We have created everything in pairs[15], so that you may take heed.
footnotes: [15] Such as day and night, male and female, light and darkness, sweet and bitter, hot and cold, etc.
arabic: وَمِنْ كُلِّ شَيْءٍ خَلَقْنَا زَوْجَيْنِ لَعَلَّكُمْ تَذَكَّرُونَ

translation: So flee to Allah[16]. Indeed, I am a clear warner to you from Him.
footnotes: [16] From His punishment to His reward by shunning disbelief and sin and by obeying Him.
arabic: فَفِرُّوا إِلَى اللَّهِ ۖ إِنِّي لَكُمْ مِنْهُ نَذِيرٌ مُبِينٌ

translation: And do not set up another god with Allah. Indeed, I am a clear warner to you from Him.”
arabic: وَلَا تَجْعَلُوا مَعَ اللَّهِ إِلَٰهًا آخَرَ ۖ إِنِّي لَكُمْ مِنْهُ نَذِيرٌ مُبِينٌ

translation: Likewise, no messenger came to those before them without being told: “A magician, or a madman!”
arabic: كَذَٰلِكَ مَا أَتَى الَّذِينَ مِنْ قَبْلِهِمْ مِنْ رَسُولٍ إِلَّا قَالُوا سَاحِرٌ أَوْ مَجْنُونٌ

translation: Did they suggest this to one another[17]? Rather they are transgressing people.
footnotes: [17] i.e., Did the previous disbelievers pass on these false allegations to the pagans of Makkah so they repeat their words?
arabic: أَتَوَاصَوْا بِهِ ۚ بَلْ هُمْ قَوْمٌ طَاغُونَ

translation: So turn away from them [O Prophet], for you are not to blame[18].
footnotes: [18] After you have delivered the message.
arabic: فَتَوَلَّ عَنْهُمْ فَمَا أَنْتَ بِمَلُومٍ

translation: But keep reminding them, for reminder benefits the believers.
arabic: وَذَكِّرْ فَإِنَّ الذِّكْرَىٰ تَنْفَعُ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ

translation: I have not created the jinn and mankind except to worship Me.
arabic: وَمَا خَلَقْتُ الْجِنَّ وَالْإِنْسَ إِلَّا لِيَعْبُدُونِ

translation: I seek no provision from them, nor do I want them to feed Me.
arabic: مَا أُرِيدُ مِنْهُمْ مِنْ رِزْقٍ وَمَا أُرِيدُ أَنْ يُطْعِمُونِ

translation: Indeed, it is Allah Who is the All-Provider[19], Lord of Power, the Mighty.
footnotes: [19] He Provides His creatures with everything they need. Among His provisions is guidance.
arabic: إِنَّ اللَّهَ هُوَ الرَّزَّاقُ ذُو الْقُوَّةِ الْمَتِينُ

translation: Indeed, those who do wrong will have a share [of punishment] like that of their predecessors, so let them not ask Me to hasten it.
arabic: فَإِنَّ لِلَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوا ذَنُوبًا مِثْلَ ذَنُوبِ أَصْحَابِهِمْ فَلَا يَسْتَعْجِلُونِ

translation: So woe to those who disbelieve from [the punishment of] the Day which they are promised.
arabic: فَوَيْلٌ لِلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا مِنْ يَوْمِهِمُ الَّذِي يُوعَدُونَ

translation: By the mount of Tūr[1],
footnotes: [1] Where Allah Almighty communicated with Moses (عليه السلام).
arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ وَالطُّورِ

translation: and by the Book inscribed[2]
footnotes: [2] i.e., the Qur’an.
arabic: وَكِتَابٍ مَسْطُورٍ

translation: on an unrolled parchment[3],
footnotes: [3] i.e., a spread-out scroll.
arabic: فِي رَقٍّ مَنْشُورٍ

translation: and by the much-frequented House[4],
footnotes: [4] Which is frequented by angels or the Ka‘bah in Makkah which is frequented by pilgrims.
arabic: وَالْبَيْتِ الْمَعْمُورِ

translation: and by the canopy raised high,
arabic: وَالسَّقْفِ الْمَرْفُوعِ

translation: and by the sea set on fire[5].
footnotes: [5] On the Day of Resurrection, or "by the overflowed sea."
arabic: وَالْبَحْرِ الْمَسْجُورِ

translation: The punishment of your Lord will surely come to pass;
arabic: إِنَّ عَذَابَ رَبِّكَ لَوَاقِعٌ

translation: there is none who can avert it.
arabic: مَا لَهُ مِنْ دَافِعٍ

translation: On the Day when the heaven will convulse violently[6],
footnotes: [6] The heavens will be shaken violently, indicating the occurrence of the Hour. The word "maur" originally means turning round, rotating, swinging, swaying, etc.
arabic: يَوْمَ تَمُورُ السَّمَاءُ مَوْرًا

translation: and the mountains will move a horrible movement[7].
footnotes: [7] They will turn into dust, moving as clouds.
arabic: وَتَسِيرُ الْجِبَالُ سَيْرًا

translation: Then woe to the deniers on that Day,
arabic: فَوَيْلٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ لِلْمُكَذِّبِينَ

translation: those who amuse themselves in falsehood.
arabic: الَّذِينَ هُمْ فِي خَوْضٍ يَلْعَبُونَ

translation: On the Day when they will be shoved into the Fire forcefully,
arabic: يَوْمَ يُدَعُّونَ إِلَىٰ نَارِ جَهَنَّمَ دَعًّا

translation: [They will be told,] “This is the Fire which you used to deny.
arabic: هَٰذِهِ النَّارُ الَّتِي كُنْتُمْ بِهَا تُكَذِّبُونَ

translation: Is this [punishment] magic, or do you not see?
arabic: أَفَسِحْرٌ هَٰذَا أَمْ أَنْتُمْ لَا تُبْصِرُونَ

translation: Burn in it, whether you bear it patiently or impatiently, it makes no difference to you[8]; you are recompensed only for what you used to do.”
footnotes: [8] He who is patient during afflictions in the life of this world will be rewarded. As for the Hereafter, suffering patiently in Hell will not bring any reward or benefit.
arabic: اصْلَوْهَا فَاصْبِرُوا أَوْ لَا تَصْبِرُوا سَوَاءٌ عَلَيْكُمْ ۖ إِنَّمَا تُجْزَوْنَ مَا كُنْتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ

translation: Indeed, the righteous will be in gardens and bliss,
arabic: إِنَّ الْمُتَّقِينَ فِي جَنَّاتٍ وَنَعِيمٍ

translation: enjoying what their Lord has given them, and their Lord protected them from the punishment of the Blazing Fire.
arabic: فَاكِهِينَ بِمَا آتَاهُمْ رَبُّهُمْ وَوَقَاهُمْ رَبُّهُمْ عَذَابَ الْجَحِيمِ

translation: “Eat and drink pleasantly for what you used to do,
arabic: كُلُوا وَاشْرَبُوا هَنِيئًا بِمَا كُنْتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ

translation: reclining on couches all lined up”. And We will marry them to houris with wide beautiful eyes.
arabic: مُتَّكِئِينَ عَلَىٰ سُرُرٍ مَصْفُوفَةٍ ۖ وَزَوَّجْنَاهُمْ بِحُورٍ عِينٍ

translation: As for those who believe and their offspring follow them in faith, We will cause their offspring to join them, and will not detract anything from [the reward of] their deeds. Everyone will be accountable for what he earned[9].
footnotes: [9] i.e., None will be held responsible for the burden of another.
arabic: وَالَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَاتَّبَعَتْهُمْ ذُرِّيَّتُهُمْ بِإِيمَانٍ أَلْحَقْنَا بِهِمْ ذُرِّيَّتَهُمْ وَمَا أَلَتْنَاهُمْ مِنْ عَمَلِهِمْ مِنْ شَيْءٍ ۚ كُلُّ امْرِئٍ بِمَا كَسَبَ رَهِينٌ

translation: And We will provide them with whatever fruit and meat they desire.
arabic: وَأَمْدَدْنَاهُمْ بِفَاكِهَةٍ وَلَحْمٍ مِمَّا يَشْتَهُونَ

translation: They will pass around to one another a glass [of pure wine] which does not lead to idle talk or sin.
arabic: يَتَنَازَعُونَ فِيهَا كَأْسًا لَا لَغْوٌ فِيهَا وَلَا تَأْثِيمٌ

translation: They will be served by their servant boys, as if they were well-protected pearls.
arabic: ۞ وَيَطُوفُ عَلَيْهِمْ غِلْمَانٌ لَهُمْ كَأَنَّهُمْ لُؤْلُؤٌ مَكْنُونٌ

translation: They will turn to one another with questions[10].
footnotes: [10] They will probably ask one another about their worldly lives and what led them to Paradise.
arabic: وَأَقْبَلَ بَعْضُهُمْ عَلَىٰ بَعْضٍ يَتَسَاءَلُونَ

translation: They will say, “Before this, we used to be in awe [of Allah] when we were living among our people.
arabic: قَالُوا إِنَّا كُنَّا قَبْلُ فِي أَهْلِنَا مُشْفِقِينَ

translation: Therefore Allah conferred favor upon us and protected us from the punishment of the Scorching Fire.
arabic: فَمَنَّ اللَّهُ عَلَيْنَا وَوَقَانَا عَذَابَ السَّمُومِ

translation: Indeed, we used to call upon Him before. He is indeed the Most Kind, the Most Merciful.”
arabic: إِنَّا كُنَّا مِنْ قَبْلُ نَدْعُوهُ ۖ إِنَّهُ هُوَ الْبَرُّ الرَّحِيمُ

translation: So keep exhorting [O Prophet], for you are not, by the grace of your Lord, a soothsayer or a madman.
arabic: فَذَكِّرْ فَمَا أَنْتَ بِنِعْمَتِ رَبِّكَ بِكَاهِنٍ وَلَا مَجْنُونٍ

translation: Or do they say: “He is a poet for whom we await a misfortune[11]”?
footnotes: [11] i.e., inevitable death or so.
arabic: أَمْ يَقُولُونَ شَاعِرٌ نَتَرَبَّصُ بِهِ رَيْبَ الْمَنُونِ

translation: Say, “Wait, I too am waiting with you.”
arabic: قُلْ تَرَبَّصُوا فَإِنِّي مَعَكُمْ مِنَ الْمُتَرَبِّصِينَ

translation: Do their minds[12] prompt them to say such things, or are they transgressing people?
footnotes: [12] The leaders of pagans in Makkah claimed to be of great minds. Here it questions their intelligence, arguing that a man cannot be a madman and a poet at the same time.
arabic: أَمْ تَأْمُرُهُمْ أَحْلَامُهُمْ بِهَٰذَا ۚ أَمْ هُمْ قَوْمٌ طَاغُونَ

translation: Or do they say, “He has made this [Qur’an] up”? Rather, they are not willing to believe.
arabic: أَمْ يَقُولُونَ تَقَوَّلَهُ ۚ بَلْ لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ

translation: Then let them produce a discourse like this, if they are truthful[13].
footnotes: [13] Arab pagans were challenged to produce the like of this Quran, ten surahs, or one surah, but the challenge has never been met until the present day. See 2:23, 11:13, 52:34.
arabic: فَلْيَأْتُوا بِحَدِيثٍ مِثْلِهِ إِنْ كَانُوا صَادِقِينَ

translation: Were they created by none, or were they the creators [of themselves]?
arabic: أَمْ خُلِقُوا مِنْ غَيْرِ شَيْءٍ أَمْ هُمُ الْخَالِقُونَ

translation: Or did they create the heavens and earth? Rather, they are not certain in faith.
arabic: أَمْ خَلَقُوا السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضَ ۚ بَلْ لَا يُوقِنُونَ

translation: Or do they possess the treasures of your Lord, or do they have full control [of everything]?
arabic: أَمْ عِنْدَهُمْ خَزَائِنُ رَبِّكَ أَمْ هُمُ الْمُصَيْطِرُونَ

translation: Or do they have a stairway [to the heaven] by which they eavesdrop? Then let those who eavesdrop produce a compelling proof.
arabic: أَمْ لَهُمْ سُلَّمٌ يَسْتَمِعُونَ فِيهِ ۖ فَلْيَأْتِ مُسْتَمِعُهُمْ بِسُلْطَانٍ مُبِينٍ

translation: Or does He have daughters while you have sons[14]?
footnotes: [14] See footnote 37:149.
arabic: أَمْ لَهُ الْبَنَاتُ وَلَكُمُ الْبَنُونَ

translation: Or are you asking them [O Prophet] for a reward so they are overburdened by debt?
arabic: أَمْ تَسْأَلُهُمْ أَجْرًا فَهُمْ مِنْ مَغْرَمٍ مُثْقَلُونَ

translation: Or do they have [the knowledge of] the unseen so they are writing it down?
arabic: أَمْ عِنْدَهُمُ الْغَيْبُ فَهُمْ يَكْتُبُونَ

translation: Or do they intend a plot [against the Prophet]? But the plot of the disbelievers will rebound against themselves.
arabic: أَمْ يُرِيدُونَ كَيْدًا ۖ فَالَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا هُمُ الْمَكِيدُونَ

translation: Or do they have a god other than Allah? Glory be to Allah far above what they associate with Him.
arabic: أَمْ لَهُمْ إِلَٰهٌ غَيْرُ اللَّهِ ۚ سُبْحَانَ اللَّهِ عَمَّا يُشْرِكُونَ

translation: If they were to see pieces of the sky falling down[15], they would still say, “[This is only] a mass of clouds.”
footnotes: [15] As a sign of the punishment that they requested.
arabic: وَإِنْ يَرَوْا كِسْفًا مِنَ السَّمَاءِ سَاقِطًا يَقُولُوا سَحَابٌ مَرْكُومٌ

translation: So leave them alone until they encounter their Day in which they will be struck down[16],
footnotes: [16] i.e., they will be punished on the Day of Judgment.
arabic: فَذَرْهُمْ حَتَّىٰ يُلَاقُوا يَوْمَهُمُ الَّذِي فِيهِ يُصْعَقُونَ

translation: the Day their plots will not avail them in the least, nor will they be helped.
arabic: يَوْمَ لَا يُغْنِي عَنْهُمْ كَيْدُهُمْ شَيْئًا وَلَا هُمْ يُنْصَرُونَ

translation: And for the wrongdoers, there will be another punishment before that[17], but most of them do not know.
footnotes: [17] In this world such as famine, droughts, or defeat at the battle, or punishment in the grave.
arabic: وَإِنَّ لِلَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوا عَذَابًا دُونَ ذَٰلِكَ وَلَٰكِنَّ أَكْثَرَهُمْ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ

translation: Be patient [O Prophet] with your Lord’s decree, for indeed you are under Our [Watchful] Eyes. And glorify the praises of your Lord when you rise.
arabic: وَاصْبِرْ لِحُكْمِ رَبِّكَ فَإِنَّكَ بِأَعْيُنِنَا ۖ وَسَبِّحْ بِحَمْدِ رَبِّكَ حِينَ تَقُومُ

translation: And glorify Him at night and when the stars fade away[18].
footnotes: [18] i.e., the early hours of the morning when the stars set; the time of the Fajr Prayer.
arabic: وَمِنَ اللَّيْلِ فَسَبِّحْهُ وَإِدْبَارَ النُّجُومِ

translation: By the star when it sets,
arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ وَالنَّجْمِ إِذَا هَوَىٰ

translation: Your companion [i.e., the Prophet] has neither strayed nor is he deluded.
arabic: مَا ضَلَّ صَاحِبُكُمْ وَمَا غَوَىٰ

translation: Nor does he speak out of his own desire.
arabic: وَمَا يَنْطِقُ عَنِ الْهَوَىٰ

translation: It is but a revelation sent down [to him].
arabic: إِنْ هُوَ إِلَّا وَحْيٌ يُوحَىٰ

translation: He was taught by [an angel of] mighty power[1],
footnotes: [1] i.e., the angel Gabriel.
arabic: عَلَّمَهُ شَدِيدُ الْقُوَىٰ

translation: and of great perfection[2], who manifested himself [in his true form][3]
footnotes:
[2] i.e., the strength of body and mind.
 [3] Archangel Gabriel appeared to the Prophet (ﷺ) only twice in his angelic form: once at the outset of the Prophet’s mission (as he manifested himself, filling the horizon, so the Prophet (ﷺ) lost his consciousness), and another time during the Prophet’s ascension to the seventh heaven where he directly received from Allah the order to pray five times a day. See 17:1.
arabic: ذُو مِرَّةٍ فَاسْتَوَىٰ

translation: when he was on the higher horizon[4].
footnotes: [4] i.e., above the eastern horizon in the sky where the sun rises.
arabic: وَهُوَ بِالْأُفُقِ الْأَعْلَىٰ

translation: Then he approached [the Prophet] and descended,
arabic: ثُمَّ دَنَا فَتَدَلَّىٰ

translation: until he was only two bow-lengths away or even closer.
arabic: فَكَانَ قَابَ قَوْسَيْنِ أَوْ أَدْنَىٰ

translation: Then he revealed to His slave[5] what he had to reveal.
footnotes: [5] i.e., the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ).
arabic: فَأَوْحَىٰ إِلَىٰ عَبْدِهِ مَا أَوْحَىٰ

translation: The [Prophet’s] heart[6] did not deny what he saw.
footnotes: [6] i.e., his mind or perception.
arabic: مَا كَذَبَ الْفُؤَادُ مَا رَأَىٰ

translation: Do you dispute with him concerning what he saw?
arabic: أَفَتُمَارُونَهُ عَلَىٰ مَا يَرَىٰ

translation: He certainly saw him a second time[7]
footnotes: [7] i.e., During his ascent (al-Mi‘rāj) to the heavens, he saw Gabriel in his true angelic form.
arabic: وَلَقَدْ رَآهُ نَزْلَةً أُخْرَىٰ

translation: at the Lote Tree of the Utmost Boundary [in the seventh heaven]
arabic: عِنْدَ سِدْرَةِ الْمُنْتَهَىٰ

translation: near which is the Garden of Abode,
arabic: عِنْدَهَا جَنَّةُ الْمَأْوَىٰ

translation: when the Lote Tree was overwhelmed with [divine] splendors.
arabic: إِذْ يَغْشَى السِّدْرَةَ مَا يَغْشَىٰ

translation: His gaze did not wander, nor did it look beyond the limit.
arabic: مَا زَاغَ الْبَصَرُ وَمَا طَغَىٰ

translation: He certainly saw some of the greatest signs of his Lord.
arabic: لَقَدْ رَأَىٰ مِنْ آيَاتِ رَبِّهِ الْكُبْرَىٰ

translation: Have you [O disbelievers] thought about [the idols of] Lāt and ‘Uzzā,
arabic: أَفَرَأَيْتُمُ اللَّاتَ وَالْعُزَّىٰ

translation: and Manāt, the third one as well[8]?
footnotes: [8] These were three well-known idols or goddesses worshiped by Arab pagans before the advent of Islam.
arabic: وَمَنَاةَ الثَّالِثَةَ الْأُخْرَىٰ

translation: Do you choose for yourselves males and for Him females?
arabic: أَلَكُمُ الذَّكَرُ وَلَهُ الْأُنْثَىٰ

translation: That is then an unfair division!
arabic: تِلْكَ إِذًا قِسْمَةٌ ضِيزَىٰ

translation: These [idols] are no more than names you and your forefathers have made up[9], for which Allah has not sent down any authority. They follow nothing but conjecture and what their souls desire, although there has come to them guidance from their Lord.
footnotes: [9] i.e., You have considered them gods while in fact, they are not.
arabic: إِنْ هِيَ إِلَّا أَسْمَاءٌ سَمَّيْتُمُوهَا أَنْتُمْ وَآبَاؤُكُمْ مَا أَنْزَلَ اللَّهُ بِهَا مِنْ سُلْطَانٍ ۚ إِنْ يَتَّبِعُونَ إِلَّا الظَّنَّ وَمَا تَهْوَى الْأَنْفُسُ ۖ وَلَقَدْ جَاءَهُمْ مِنْ رَبِّهِمُ الْهُدَىٰ

translation: Is it that man can get whatever he wishes for[10]?
footnotes: [10] The pagans worshiped these idols wishing that they would intercede for them on the Day of Resurrection. See 39:3.
arabic: أَمْ لِلْإِنْسَانِ مَا تَمَنَّىٰ

translation: Rather, to Allah belongs the Hereafter and this world.
arabic: فَلِلَّهِ الْآخِرَةُ وَالْأُولَىٰ

translation: How many angels there are in the heavens whose intercession will be of no avail except after Allah’s permission to whom He wills and pleases.
arabic: ۞ وَكَمْ مِنْ مَلَكٍ فِي السَّمَاوَاتِ لَا تُغْنِي شَفَاعَتُهُمْ شَيْئًا إِلَّا مِنْ بَعْدِ أَنْ يَأْذَنَ اللَّهُ لِمَنْ يَشَاءُ وَيَرْضَىٰ

translation: Indeed, those who do not believe in the Hereafter give the angels female names.
arabic: إِنَّ الَّذِينَ لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ بِالْآخِرَةِ لَيُسَمُّونَ الْمَلَائِكَةَ تَسْمِيَةَ الْأُنْثَىٰ

translation: They have no knowledge about it. They only follow conjecture, but conjecture is of no avail against the truth.
arabic: وَمَا لَهُمْ بِهِ مِنْ عِلْمٍ ۖ إِنْ يَتَّبِعُونَ إِلَّا الظَّنَّ ۖ وَإِنَّ الظَّنَّ لَا يُغْنِي مِنَ الْحَقِّ شَيْئًا

translation: So pay no heed to those who turn away from Our message[11] and who only seek the life of this world.
footnotes: [11] i.e., the Qur’an.
arabic: فَأَعْرِضْ عَنْ مَنْ تَوَلَّىٰ عَنْ ذِكْرِنَا وَلَمْ يُرِدْ إِلَّا الْحَيَاةَ الدُّنْيَا

translation: That is the limit of their knowledge. Indeed, your Lord knows best who has strayed from His Way, and He knows best who is guided.
arabic: ذَٰلِكَ مَبْلَغُهُمْ مِنَ الْعِلْمِ ۚ إِنَّ رَبَّكَ هُوَ أَعْلَمُ بِمَنْ ضَلَّ عَنْ سَبِيلِهِ وَهُوَ أَعْلَمُ بِمَنِ اهْتَدَىٰ

translation: To Allah belongs all that is in the heavens and all that is on earth, so that He may recompense the evildoers for what they did, and reward those who do good with the best reward[12],
footnotes: [12] i.e., Paradise.
arabic: وَلِلَّهِ مَا فِي السَّمَاوَاتِ وَمَا فِي الْأَرْضِ لِيَجْزِيَ الَّذِينَ أَسَاءُوا بِمَا عَمِلُوا وَيَجْزِيَ الَّذِينَ أَحْسَنُوا بِالْحُسْنَى

translation: those who avoid major sins and shameful acts, except for minor lapses. Indeed, your Lord is ample in forgiveness. He knows you best, as He created you from the earth[13] and when you were fetuses in the wombs of your mothers[14]. So do not claim purity for yourselves, for He knows best who is truly righteous.
footnotes:
[13] i.e., created your father, Adam.
 [14] See footnote 31:34.
arabic: الَّذِينَ يَجْتَنِبُونَ كَبَائِرَ الْإِثْمِ وَالْفَوَاحِشَ إِلَّا اللَّمَمَ ۚ إِنَّ رَبَّكَ وَاسِعُ الْمَغْفِرَةِ ۚ هُوَ أَعْلَمُ بِكُمْ إِذْ أَنْشَأَكُمْ مِنَ الْأَرْضِ وَإِذْ أَنْتُمْ أَجِنَّةٌ فِي بُطُونِ أُمَّهَاتِكُمْ ۖ فَلَا تُزَكُّوا أَنْفُسَكُمْ ۖ هُوَ أَعْلَمُ بِمَنِ اتَّقَىٰ

translation: Have you seen the one who turned away [from Islam],
arabic: أَفَرَأَيْتَ الَّذِي تَوَلَّىٰ

translation: who gave a little, and then stopped?
arabic: وَأَعْطَىٰ قَلِيلًا وَأَكْدَىٰ

translation: Does he have knowledge of the unseen, so he has insight[15]?
footnotes: [15] i.e., the knowledge that his wealth will be exhausted if he spends on the poor, while Allah has promised that it nourishes wealth.
arabic: أَعِنْدَهُ عِلْمُ الْغَيْبِ فَهُوَ يَرَىٰ

translation: Or has he not been informed of what is in the Scriptures of Moses,
arabic: أَمْ لَمْ يُنَبَّأْ بِمَا فِي صُحُفِ مُوسَىٰ

translation: and of Abraham, who fulfilled his duty?
arabic: وَإِبْرَاهِيمَ الَّذِي وَفَّىٰ

translation: That no bearer of burden will bear the burden of another,
arabic: أَلَّا تَزِرُ وَازِرَةٌ وِزْرَ أُخْرَىٰ

translation: and that man will not receive except what he strives for,
arabic: وَأَنْ لَيْسَ لِلْإِنْسَانِ إِلَّا مَا سَعَىٰ

translation: and that his efforts will be examined,
arabic: وَأَنَّ سَعْيَهُ سَوْفَ يُرَىٰ

translation: then he will be recompensed in full,
arabic: ثُمَّ يُجْزَاهُ الْجَزَاءَ الْأَوْفَىٰ

translation: and that to your Lord is the final return,
arabic: وَأَنَّ إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ الْمُنْتَهَىٰ

translation: and that He is the One Who makes people laugh and weep[16],
footnotes: [16] i.e., brings happiness or sadness to people.
arabic: وَأَنَّهُ هُوَ أَضْحَكَ وَأَبْكَىٰ

translation: and that He is the One Who causes death and gives life,
arabic: وَأَنَّهُ هُوَ أَمَاتَ وَأَحْيَا

translation: and that He created the pairs, male and female,
arabic: وَأَنَّهُ خَلَقَ الزَّوْجَيْنِ الذَّكَرَ وَالْأُنْثَىٰ

translation: from a drop of sperm when it is emitted,
arabic: مِنْ نُطْفَةٍ إِذَا تُمْنَىٰ

translation: and it is upon Him to bring about the second creation.
arabic: وَأَنَّ عَلَيْهِ النَّشْأَةَ الْأُخْرَىٰ

translation: And He is the One Who enriches and bestows wealth,
arabic: وَأَنَّهُ هُوَ أَغْنَىٰ وَأَقْنَىٰ

translation: and that He is the Lord of Sirius[17].
footnotes: [17] i.e., a star worshiped by some pagans before Islam.
arabic: وَأَنَّهُ هُوَ رَبُّ الشِّعْرَىٰ

translation: And that He destroyed the earlier ‘Ād[18],
footnotes: [18] i.e., the people of Prophet Hūd.
arabic: وَأَنَّهُ أَهْلَكَ عَادًا الْأُولَىٰ

translation: and Thamūd[19], sparing none,
footnotes: [19] i.e., the people of Prophet Sālih, who are called second Ād.
arabic: وَثَمُودَ فَمَا أَبْقَىٰ

translation: and [He destroyed] the people of Noah before them; they were indeed more wicked and more rebellious.
arabic: وَقَوْمَ نُوحٍ مِنْ قَبْلُ ۖ إِنَّهُمْ كَانُوا هُمْ أَظْلَمَ وَأَطْغَىٰ

translation: And He toppled the cities[20] upside down,
footnotes: [20] Of Sodom and Gomorrah whose dwellers defied Prophet Lot (عليه السلام).
arabic: وَالْمُؤْتَفِكَةَ أَهْوَىٰ

translation: and they were utterly covered [by stones][21].
footnotes: [21] They were rained by stones.
arabic: فَغَشَّاهَا مَا غَشَّىٰ

translation: Then which of the favors of your Lord do you doubt?
arabic: فَبِأَيِّ آلَاءِ رَبِّكَ تَتَمَارَىٰ

translation: This [Prophet] is a warner like the earlier warners.
arabic: هَٰذَا نَذِيرٌ مِنَ النُّذُرِ الْأُولَىٰ

translation: The imminent Hour has drawn near,
arabic: أَزِفَتِ الْآزِفَةُ

translation: none but Allah can disclose it.
arabic: لَيْسَ لَهَا مِنْ دُونِ اللَّهِ كَاشِفَةٌ

translation: Do you find this discourse astonishing,
arabic: أَفَمِنْ هَٰذَا الْحَدِيثِ تَعْجَبُونَ

translation: and you laugh [at it] and not weep,
arabic: وَتَضْحَكُونَ وَلَا تَبْكُونَ

translation: while heedlessly lost in amusement?
arabic: وَأَنْتُمْ سَامِدُونَ

translation: So prostrate to Allah and worship [Him].
arabic: فَاسْجُدُوا لِلَّهِ وَاعْبُدُوا ۩
