translation: The Hour has drawn near and the moon has split asunder[1].
footnotes: [1] The Quraysh pagans challenged the Prophet (ﷺ) to split the moon in two so that they believe in him. The moon was split as they requested and then re-joined, and the incident was reported by several eyewitnesses in different parts of the land; however, they still refused to believe, considering it magic.
arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ اقْتَرَبَتِ السَّاعَةُ وَانْشَقَّ الْقَمَرُ

translation: Whenever they see a sign[2], they turn away and say, “Same old magic!”
footnotes: [2] The prophets were given signs or miracles as a proof that they were commissioned by Allah. Moses (عليه السلام) was given the miracles of staff and a bright hand. Jesus (عليه السلام) would give life to the dead and heal the blind and the leper. Muhammad (ﷺ) was given the Qur’an, a literary miracle, challenging the masters of Arabic eloquence. Nonetheless, he (ﷺ) performed other miracles such as splitting the moon, increasing food and water, and healing some ailments.
arabic: وَإِنْ يَرَوْا آيَةً يُعْرِضُوا وَيَقُولُوا سِحْرٌ مُسْتَمِرٌّ

translation: They deny [the truth] and follow their desires, but every matter will reach its inevitable end.
arabic: وَكَذَّبُوا وَاتَّبَعُوا أَهْوَاءَهُمْ ۚ وَكُلُّ أَمْرٍ مُسْتَقِرٌّ

translation: There have already come to them stories [of destroyed nations] that are sufficient to deter them,
arabic: وَلَقَدْ جَاءَهُمْ مِنَ الْأَنْبَاءِ مَا فِيهِ مُزْدَجَرٌ

translation: which contain extensive wisdom, but the warnings are of no avail.
arabic: حِكْمَةٌ بَالِغَةٌ ۖ فَمَا تُغْنِ النُّذُرُ

translation: So turn away from them [O Prophet]. On the Day when the caller[3] will summon them to a horrific event[4],
footnotes: [3] Isrāfīl, the angel assigned to blow the Trumpet and call all for resurrection. [4] i.e., Judgment Day.
arabic: فَتَوَلَّ عَنْهُمْ ۘ يَوْمَ يَدْعُ الدَّاعِ إِلَىٰ شَيْءٍ نُكُرٍ

translation: with eyes downcast, they will come out of the graves like scattered locusts,
arabic: خُشَّعًا أَبْصَارُهُمْ يَخْرُجُونَ مِنَ الْأَجْدَاثِ كَأَنَّهُمْ جَرَادٌ مُنْتَشِرٌ

translation: rushing headlong towards the caller. The disbelievers will say, “This is a hard Day!”
arabic: مُهْطِعِينَ إِلَى الدَّاعِ ۖ يَقُولُ الْكَافِرُونَ هَٰذَا يَوْمٌ عَسِرٌ

translation: The people of Noah rejected [the truth] before them; they rejected Our slave and said, “He is a madman,” and he was intimidated.
arabic: ۞ كَذَّبَتْ قَبْلَهُمْ قَوْمُ نُوحٍ فَكَذَّبُوا عَبْدَنَا وَقَالُوا مَجْنُونٌ وَازْدُجِرَ

translation: So he called upon his Lord, “I am overpowered, so help me!”
arabic: فَدَعَا رَبَّهُ أَنِّي مَغْلُوبٌ فَانْتَصِرْ

translation: So We opened the gates of the sky with water pouring down in torrents,
arabic: فَفَتَحْنَا أَبْوَابَ السَّمَاءِ بِمَاءٍ مُنْهَمِرٍ

translation: and We caused the earth to burst forth with springs, then the waters met for a preordained purpose.
arabic: وَفَجَّرْنَا الْأَرْضَ عُيُونًا فَالْتَقَى الْمَاءُ عَلَىٰ أَمْرٍ قَدْ قُدِرَ

translation: We carried him on an [Ark made] of planks and nails,
arabic: وَحَمَلْنَاهُ عَلَىٰ ذَاتِ أَلْوَاحٍ وَدُسُرٍ

translation: sailing under Our [Watchful] Eyes; as a reward for the one [they] denied.
arabic: تَجْرِي بِأَعْيُنِنَا جَزَاءً لِمَنْ كَانَ كُفِرَ

translation: We have certainly left it[5] as a sign; is there anyone to take heed?
footnotes: [5] i.e., the punishment, the Flood, or the Ark.
arabic: وَلَقَدْ تَرَكْنَاهَا آيَةً فَهَلْ مِنْ مُدَّكِرٍ

translation: Then how were My punishment and My warnings[6]?
footnotes: [6] As a warning to those who came after them.
arabic: فَكَيْفَ كَانَ عَذَابِي وَنُذُرِ

translation: We have certainly made the Qur’an easy to understand and remember; is there anyone to take heed?
arabic: وَلَقَدْ يَسَّرْنَا الْقُرْآنَ لِلذِّكْرِ فَهَلْ مِنْ مُدَّكِرٍ

translation: ‘Ād disbelieved. Then how were My punishment and My warnings?
arabic: كَذَّبَتْ عَادٌ فَكَيْفَ كَانَ عَذَابِي وَنُذُرِ

translation: We sent against them a furious wind[7] on a day of continuous misfortune,
footnotes: [7] i.e., a tumultuous and screaming wind.
arabic: إِنَّا أَرْسَلْنَا عَلَيْهِمْ رِيحًا صَرْصَرًا فِي يَوْمِ نَحْسٍ مُسْتَمِرٍّ

translation: sweeping people away[8], as if they were trunks of uprooted palm trees.
footnotes: [8] i.e., extracting them from the earth.
arabic: تَنْزِعُ النَّاسَ كَأَنَّهُمْ أَعْجَازُ نَخْلٍ مُنْقَعِرٍ

translation: Then how were My punishment and My warnings?
arabic: فَكَيْفَ كَانَ عَذَابِي وَنُذُرِ

translation: We have certainly made the Qur’an easy to understand and remember; is there anyone to take heed?
arabic: وَلَقَدْ يَسَّرْنَا الْقُرْآنَ لِلذِّكْرِ فَهَلْ مِنْ مُدَّكِرٍ

translation: Thamūd rejected the warnings,
arabic: كَذَّبَتْ ثَمُودُ بِالنُّذُرِ

translation: They said, “Shall we follow a single human being[9] from among us? Then we would surely be in error and insanity!
footnotes: [9] i.e., Prophet Sālih (عليه السلام).
arabic: فَقَالُوا أَبَشَرًا مِنَّا وَاحِدًا نَتَّبِعُهُ إِنَّا إِذًا لَفِي ضَلَالٍ وَسُعُرٍ

translation: Has the revelation been sent down upon him out of all of us? Rather, he is an insolent liar.”
arabic: أَأُلْقِيَ الذِّكْرُ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ بَيْنِنَا بَلْ هُوَ كَذَّابٌ أَشِرٌ

translation: Tomorrow they will know who the insolent liar is.
arabic: سَيَعْلَمُونَ غَدًا مَنِ الْكَذَّابُ الْأَشِرُ

translation: We are sending the she-camel as a test for them, so watch them [O Sālih] and be patient,
arabic: إِنَّا مُرْسِلُو النَّاقَةِ فِتْنَةً لَهُمْ فَارْتَقِبْهُمْ وَاصْطَبِرْ

translation: and tell them that the water is to be shared between them[10]; each should take its drink in turn.
footnotes: [10] i.e., one day for the tribe of Thamūd and one day for the she-camel.
arabic: وَنَبِّئْهُمْ أَنَّ الْمَاءَ قِسْمَةٌ بَيْنَهُمْ ۖ كُلُّ شِرْبٍ مُحْتَضَرٌ

translation: But they called their companion[11], and he undertook the task[12] and hamstrung her.
footnotes:
[11] i.e., the worst among them.
 [12] Or took his sword.
arabic: فَنَادَوْا صَاحِبَهُمْ فَتَعَاطَىٰ فَعَقَرَ

translation: Then how [terrible] My punishment and My warnings were!
arabic: فَكَيْفَ كَانَ عَذَابِي وَنُذُرِ

translation: We sent against them a single blast, leaving them like trampled hedge-building twigs[13].
footnotes: [13] The people of Thamūd were crushed like trampled and trodden twigs and pieces of bush lying around an enclosure for cattle.
arabic: إِنَّا أَرْسَلْنَا عَلَيْهِمْ صَيْحَةً وَاحِدَةً فَكَانُوا كَهَشِيمِ الْمُحْتَظِرِ

translation: We have certainly made the Qur’an easy to understand and remember; is there anyone to take heed?
arabic: وَلَقَدْ يَسَّرْنَا الْقُرْآنَ لِلذِّكْرِ فَهَلْ مِنْ مُدَّكِرٍ

translation: The people of Lot rejected the warnings.
arabic: كَذَّبَتْ قَوْمُ لُوطٍ بِالنُّذُرِ

translation: We sent against them a storm of pebbles, except the family of Lot whom We saved before dawn,
arabic: إِنَّا أَرْسَلْنَا عَلَيْهِمْ حَاصِبًا إِلَّا آلَ لُوطٍ ۖ نَجَّيْنَاهُمْ بِسَحَرٍ

translation: as a blessing from Us. Thus do We reward those who give thanks.
arabic: نِعْمَةً مِنْ عِنْدِنَا ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ نَجْزِي مَنْ شَكَرَ

translation: He had already warned them of Our punishing assault, but they doubted the warnings.
arabic: وَلَقَدْ أَنْذَرَهُمْ بَطْشَتَنَا فَتَمَارَوْا بِالنُّذُرِ

translation: They even demanded that he let them have their way with his angel-guests[14], so We blinded their eyes, [saying], “Taste My punishment and My warnings!”
footnotes: [14] Whom Allah sent in the form of handsome young men.
arabic: وَلَقَدْ رَاوَدُوهُ عَنْ ضَيْفِهِ فَطَمَسْنَا أَعْيُنَهُمْ فَذُوقُوا عَذَابِي وَنُذُرِ

translation: By the early morning a lasting torment overtook them.
arabic: وَلَقَدْ صَبَّحَهُمْ بُكْرَةً عَذَابٌ مُسْتَقِرٌّ

translation: Taste My punishment and My warnings!
arabic: فَذُوقُوا عَذَابِي وَنُذُرِ

translation: We have certainly made the Qur’an easy to understand and remember; is there anyone to take heed?
arabic: وَلَقَدْ يَسَّرْنَا الْقُرْآنَ لِلذِّكْرِ فَهَلْ مِنْ مُدَّكِرٍ

translation: Indeed, warnings came to the people of Pharaoh.
arabic: وَلَقَدْ جَاءَ آلَ فِرْعَوْنَ النُّذُرُ

translation: But they rejected all of Our signs, so We seized them with the grip of the All-Mighty, Most Powerful.
arabic: كَذَّبُوا بِآيَاتِنَا كُلِّهَا فَأَخَذْنَاهُمْ أَخْذَ عَزِيزٍ مُقْتَدِرٍ

translation: Are your disbelievers [O Makkans] superior to those[15] or have you been granted immunity in divine Scriptures?
footnotes: [15] i.e., those destroyed peoples.
arabic: أَكُفَّارُكُمْ خَيْرٌ مِنْ أُولَٰئِكُمْ أَمْ لَكُمْ بَرَاءَةٌ فِي الزُّبُرِ

translation: Or do they say, “We are a united front, bound to prevail.”?
arabic: أَمْ يَقُولُونَ نَحْنُ جَمِيعٌ مُنْتَصِرٌ

translation: Soon their united front will be defeated, and they will flee[16].
footnotes: [16] This foretold event was fulfilled in the Battle of Badr.
arabic: سَيُهْزَمُ الْجَمْعُ وَيُوَلُّونَ الدُّبُرَ

translation: But the Hour is their appointed time, and the Hour is more catastrophic and more bitter.
arabic: بَلِ السَّاعَةُ مَوْعِدُهُمْ وَالسَّاعَةُ أَدْهَىٰ وَأَمَرُّ

translation: Indeed, the wicked are in error and madness[17].
footnotes: [17] Or "in the blazes of fire."
arabic: إِنَّ الْمُجْرِمِينَ فِي ضَلَالٍ وَسُعُرٍ

translation: On the Day when they will be dragged into the Fire on their faces, [they will be told], “Taste the agony of Hell[18]!”
footnotes: [18] "Saqar" is one of the names of Hell.
arabic: يَوْمَ يُسْحَبُونَ فِي النَّارِ عَلَىٰ وُجُوهِهِمْ ذُوقُوا مَسَّ سَقَرَ

translation: We have surely created everything in a determined measure[19].
footnotes: [19] Or perfectly preordained.
arabic: إِنَّا كُلَّ شَيْءٍ خَلَقْنَاهُ بِقَدَرٍ

translation: Our command is but a single word[20], which is fulfilled in the blink of an eye.
footnotes: [20] Our command when We want something, We only say, "Be," and it is.
arabic: وَمَا أَمْرُنَا إِلَّا وَاحِدَةٌ كَلَمْحٍ بِالْبَصَرِ

translation: We have destroyed many like you [O Makkans][21]; is there anyone to take heed?
footnotes: [21] In rejecting Allah's messengers.
arabic: وَلَقَدْ أَهْلَكْنَا أَشْيَاعَكُمْ فَهَلْ مِنْ مُدَّكِرٍ

translation: Everything they did is in the written records,
arabic: وَكُلُّ شَيْءٍ فَعَلُوهُ فِي الزُّبُرِ

translation: and everything, small or big, is written down.
arabic: وَكُلُّ صَغِيرٍ وَكَبِيرٍ مُسْتَطَرٌ

translation: Indeed, the righteous will be in gardens and rivers[22],
footnotes: [22] Rivers of water, honey, milk, and wine. See 47:15.
arabic: إِنَّ الْمُتَّقِينَ فِي جَنَّاتٍ وَنَهَرٍ

translation: seated in honor in the presence of the Most Powerful Sovereign.
arabic: فِي مَقْعَدِ صِدْقٍ عِنْدَ مَلِيكٍ مُقْتَدِرٍ

translation: The Most Compassionate,
arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ الرَّحْمَٰنُ

translation: has taught the Qur’an,
arabic: عَلَّمَ الْقُرْآنَ

translation: He created man,
arabic: خَلَقَ الْإِنْسَانَ

translation: and taught him speech.
arabic: عَلَّمَهُ الْبَيَانَ

translation: The sun and the moon follow their precise courses,
arabic: الشَّمْسُ وَالْقَمَرُ بِحُسْبَانٍ

translation: and the stars[1] and trees prostrate [to Allah][2].
footnotes:
[1] "Najm" is also a vegetation without a trunk, stalk, or stem.
 [2] i.e., they obediently submit to the laws of Allah. See 22:18.
arabic: وَالنَّجْمُ وَالشَّجَرُ يَسْجُدَانِ

translation: He raised the heaven and enjoined justice
arabic: وَالسَّمَاءَ رَفَعَهَا وَوَضَعَ الْمِيزَانَ

translation: so that you may not transgress the limits of justice.
arabic: أَلَّا تَطْغَوْا فِي الْمِيزَانِ

translation: Therefore establish weights in justice, and do not give short measure.
arabic: وَأَقِيمُوا الْوَزْنَ بِالْقِسْطِ وَلَا تُخْسِرُوا الْمِيزَانَ

translation: He has spread out the earth for all creatures,
arabic: وَالْأَرْضَ وَضَعَهَا لِلْأَنَامِ

translation: in which there are fruits and palm trees with date stalks,
arabic: فِيهَا فَاكِهَةٌ وَالنَّخْلُ ذَاتُ الْأَكْمَامِ

translation: and grain having chaff, and fragrant plants.
arabic: وَالْحَبُّ ذُو الْعَصْفِ وَالرَّيْحَانُ

translation: Then which of the favors of your Lord will you[3] deny?
footnotes: [3] i.e., men and jinn.
arabic: فَبِأَيِّ آلَاءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

translation: He created man from dry clay like pottery,
arabic: خَلَقَ الْإِنْسَانَ مِنْ صَلْصَالٍ كَالْفَخَّارِ

translation: and He created the jinn from a smokeless flame of fire.
arabic: وَخَلَقَ الْجَانَّ مِنْ مَارِجٍ مِنْ نَارٍ

translation: Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny?
arabic: فَبِأَيِّ آلَاءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

translation: [He is] Lord of the two sunrises and Lord of the two sunsets[4].
footnotes: [4] i.e., the points of sunrise in the east and sunset in the west in both summer and winter.
arabic: رَبُّ الْمَشْرِقَيْنِ وَرَبُّ الْمَغْرِبَيْنِ

translation: Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny?
arabic: فَبِأَيِّ آلَاءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

translation: He merges the two seas meeting together[5],
footnotes: [5] Two bodies of water or two sea waters of fresh and salty water.
arabic: مَرَجَ الْبَحْرَيْنِ يَلْتَقِيَانِ

translation: yet between them is a barrier so that they do not cross[6].
footnotes: [6] See footnote 25:53.
arabic: بَيْنَهُمَا بَرْزَخٌ لَا يَبْغِيَانِ

translation: Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny?
arabic: فَبِأَيِّ آلَاءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

translation: Out of both of them emerge pearls and coral.
arabic: يَخْرُجُ مِنْهُمَا اللُّؤْلُؤُ وَالْمَرْجَانُ

translation: Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny?
arabic: فَبِأَيِّ آلَاءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

translation: To Him belong the sailing ships raised up in the sea like mountains.
arabic: وَلَهُ الْجَوَارِ الْمُنْشَآتُ فِي الْبَحْرِ كَالْأَعْلَامِ

translation: Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny?
arabic: فَبِأَيِّ آلَاءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

translation: Everyone on earth will perish,
arabic: كُلُّ مَنْ عَلَيْهَا فَانٍ

translation: but there will remain the Face of your Lord[7], full of Majesty and Honor.
footnotes: [7] i.e., your Lord Himself.
arabic: وَيَبْقَىٰ وَجْهُ رَبِّكَ ذُو الْجَلَالِ وَالْإِكْرَامِ

translation: Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny?
arabic: فَبِأَيِّ آلَاءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

translation: All those in the heavens and earth ask of Him; every day He is engaged in some matters[8].
footnotes: [8] Such as giving life and causing death, enriching some and impoverishing others, elevating some and debasing others, etc.
arabic: يَسْأَلُهُ مَنْ فِي السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ ۚ كُلَّ يَوْمٍ هُوَ فِي شَأْنٍ

translation: Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny?
arabic: فَبِأَيِّ آلَاءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

translation: We will attend to you, O two multitudes [of men and jinn].
arabic: سَنَفْرُغُ لَكُمْ أَيُّهَ الثَّقَلَانِ

translation: Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny?
arabic: فَبِأَيِّ آلَاءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

translation: O assembly of jinn and mankind, if you are able to pass beyond the realms of the heavens and earth, then pass; you cannot pass without [Our] authority.
arabic: يَا مَعْشَرَ الْجِنِّ وَالْإِنْسِ إِنِ اسْتَطَعْتُمْ أَنْ تَنْفُذُوا مِنْ أَقْطَارِ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ فَانْفُذُوا ۚ لَا تَنْفُذُونَ إِلَّا بِسُلْطَانٍ

translation: Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny?
arabic: فَبِأَيِّ آلَاءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

translation: There will be sent against you a flame of fire and smoke[9], and you will not be able to defend yourselves.
footnotes: [9] It could also mean liquefied brass or copper.
arabic: يُرْسَلُ عَلَيْكُمَا شُوَاظٌ مِنْ نَارٍ وَنُحَاسٌ فَلَا تَنْتَصِرَانِ

translation: Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny?
arabic: فَبِأَيِّ آلَاءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

translation: When the heaven is split asunder and becomes crimson like [burnt] oil[10].
footnotes: [10] Or like tanned skin or molten brass.
arabic: فَإِذَا انْشَقَّتِ السَّمَاءُ فَكَانَتْ وَرْدَةً كَالدِّهَانِ

translation: Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny?
arabic: فَبِأَيِّ آلَاءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

translation: On that Day no human or jinn will be asked about his sin[11].
footnotes: [11] For Allah knows their sins; they will only be interrogated as a form of punishment.
arabic: فَيَوْمَئِذٍ لَا يُسْأَلُ عَنْ ذَنْبِهِ إِنْسٌ وَلَا جَانٌّ

translation: Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny?
arabic: فَبِأَيِّ آلَاءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

translation: The wicked will be known by their marks and will be seized by their forelocks and their feet.
arabic: يُعْرَفُ الْمُجْرِمُونَ بِسِيمَاهُمْ فَيُؤْخَذُ بِالنَّوَاصِي وَالْأَقْدَامِ

translation: Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny?
arabic: فَبِأَيِّ آلَاءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

translation: [They will be told] “This is the Hell that the wicked used to deny.”
arabic: هَٰذِهِ جَهَنَّمُ الَّتِي يُكَذِّبُ بِهَا الْمُجْرِمُونَ

translation: They will go round between it and scalding water.
arabic: يَطُوفُونَ بَيْنَهَا وَبَيْنَ حَمِيمٍ آنٍ

translation: Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny[12]?
footnotes: [12] Warning of the punishment in Hell is listed here as a favor as a reminder that the believers should be cautious of it and be saved of it on the Day of Judgment.
arabic: فَبِأَيِّ آلَاءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

translation: For those who fear of standing before their Lord[13] will be two Gardens.
footnotes: [13] On the Day of Judgment.
arabic: وَلِمَنْ خَافَ مَقَامَ رَبِّهِ جَنَّتَانِ

translation: Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny?
arabic: فَبِأَيِّ آلَاءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

translation: Shaded by spreading branches.
arabic: ذَوَاتَا أَفْنَانٍ

translation: Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny?
arabic: فَبِأَيِّ آلَاءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

translation: In each there are two flowing springs.
arabic: فِيهِمَا عَيْنَانِ تَجْرِيَانِ

translation: Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny?
arabic: فَبِأَيِّ آلَاءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

translation: In each there are two kinds of every fruit.
arabic: فِيهِمَا مِنْ كُلِّ فَاكِهَةٍ زَوْجَانِ

translation: Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny?
arabic: فَبِأَيِّ آلَاءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

translation: They will recline on couches lined with rich brocade, with the fruits of both gardens within reach.
arabic: مُتَّكِئِينَ عَلَىٰ فُرُشٍ بَطَائِنُهَا مِنْ إِسْتَبْرَقٍ ۚ وَجَنَى الْجَنَّتَيْنِ دَانٍ

translation: Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny?
arabic: فَبِأَيِّ آلَاءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

translation: In them there will be maidens of restrained gaze[14], untouched[15] before them by any man or jinn.
footnotes:
[14] To their own mates, being chaste and modest.
 [15] Lit., the maidens have not been caused to bleed by loss of virginity.
arabic: فِيهِنَّ قَاصِرَاتُ الطَّرْفِ لَمْ يَطْمِثْهُنَّ إِنْسٌ قَبْلَهُمْ وَلَا جَانٌّ

translation: Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny?
arabic: فَبِأَيِّ آلَاءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

translation: As if they were rubies and pearls[16].
footnotes: [16] In purity and beauty.
arabic: كَأَنَّهُنَّ الْيَاقُوتُ وَالْمَرْجَانُ

translation: Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny?
arabic: فَبِأَيِّ آلَاءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

translation: Is the reward for goodness anything but goodness?
arabic: هَلْ جَزَاءُ الْإِحْسَانِ إِلَّا الْإِحْسَانُ

translation: Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny?
arabic: فَبِأَيِّ آلَاءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

translation: And besides these two there will be two other gardens.
arabic: وَمِنْ دُونِهِمَا جَنَّتَانِ

translation: Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny?
arabic: فَبِأَيِّ آلَاءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

translation: Both of the deepest green.
arabic: مُدْهَامَّتَانِ

translation: Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny?
arabic: فَبِأَيِّ آلَاءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

translation: In each there are two gushing springs.
arabic: فِيهِمَا عَيْنَانِ نَضَّاخَتَانِ

translation: Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny?
arabic: فَبِأَيِّ آلَاءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

translation: In each there are fruits, palm trees, and pomegranates.
arabic: فِيهِمَا فَاكِهَةٌ وَنَخْلٌ وَرُمَّانٌ

translation: Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny?
arabic: فَبِأَيِّ آلَاءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

translation: In them there are beautiful noble women.
arabic: فِيهِنَّ خَيْرَاتٌ حِسَانٌ

translation: Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny?
arabic: فَبِأَيِّ آلَاءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

translation: Maidens with gorgeous eyes, reserved in pavilions.
arabic: حُورٌ مَقْصُورَاتٌ فِي الْخِيَامِ

translation: Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny?
arabic: فَبِأَيِّ آلَاءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

translation: No human or jinn has ever touched them before.
arabic: لَمْ يَطْمِثْهُنَّ إِنْسٌ قَبْلَهُمْ وَلَا جَانٌّ

translation: Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny?
arabic: فَبِأَيِّ آلَاءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

translation: [They will be] reclining on green cushions and splendid carpets.
arabic: مُتَّكِئِينَ عَلَىٰ رَفْرَفٍ خُضْرٍ وَعَبْقَرِيٍّ حِسَانٍ

translation: Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny?
arabic: فَبِأَيِّ آلَاءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

translation: Blessed is the Name of your Lord, the Lord of Majesty and Honor.
arabic: تَبَارَكَ اسْمُ رَبِّكَ ذِي الْجَلَالِ وَالْإِكْرَامِ

translation: When the Inevitable Event comes to pass,
arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ إِذَا وَقَعَتِ الْوَاقِعَةُ

translation: there will be none to deny its occurrence;
arabic: لَيْسَ لِوَقْعَتِهَا كَاذِبَةٌ

translation: it will bring some low and raise others up[1].
footnotes: [1] According to their deeds rather than wealth and social position, as is the case in this world. The righteous will be elevated in Paradise and the wicked will be debased in Hell.
arabic: خَافِضَةٌ رَافِعَةٌ

translation: When the earth is shaken violently,
arabic: إِذَا رُجَّتِ الْأَرْضُ رَجًّا

translation: and the mountains crushed to pieces,
arabic: وَبُسَّتِ الْجِبَالُ بَسًّا

translation: and turn to scattered dust,
arabic: فَكَانَتْ هَبَاءً مُنْبَثًّا

translation: then you are sorted into three groups:
arabic: وَكُنْتُمْ أَزْوَاجًا ثَلَاثَةً

translation: the people of the right – how blessed will be the people of the right[2]!
footnotes: [2] i.e., those who receive their record of deeds in the right hand and are destined for Paradise.
arabic: فَأَصْحَابُ الْمَيْمَنَةِ مَا أَصْحَابُ الْمَيْمَنَةِ

translation: The people of the left – how miserable will be the people of the left[3]!
footnotes: [3] i.e., those who receive their record of deeds in the left hand and are destined for Hell.
arabic: وَأَصْحَابُ الْمَشْأَمَةِ مَا أَصْحَابُ الْمَشْأَمَةِ

translation: And the forerunners [in faith] are the forerunners [in Paradise].
arabic: وَالسَّابِقُونَ السَّابِقُونَ

translation: They are the nearest ones [to Allah],
arabic: أُولَٰئِكَ الْمُقَرَّبُونَ

translation: in Gardens of Bliss,
arabic: فِي جَنَّاتِ النَّعِيمِ

translation: many from the early generations,
arabic: ثُلَّةٌ مِنَ الْأَوَّلِينَ

translation: and a few from the later generations.
arabic: وَقَلِيلٌ مِنَ الْآخِرِينَ

translation: [They will be seated] on jeweled couches,
arabic: عَلَىٰ سُرُرٍ مَوْضُونَةٍ

translation: reclining on them, facing one another.
arabic: مُتَّكِئِينَ عَلَيْهَا مُتَقَابِلِينَ

translation: They will be served by immortal youths
arabic: يَطُوفُ عَلَيْهِمْ وِلْدَانٌ مُخَلَّدُونَ

translation: with cups, pitchers, and glasses [of wine] from a flowing spring,
arabic: بِأَكْوَابٍ وَأَبَارِيقَ وَكَأْسٍ مِنْ مَعِينٍ

translation: which will neither cause any headache nor intoxication,
arabic: لَا يُصَدَّعُونَ عَنْهَا وَلَا يُنْزِفُونَ

translation: along with fruits of their choice,
arabic: وَفَاكِهَةٍ مِمَّا يَتَخَيَّرُونَ

translation: and flesh of birds that they may desire.
arabic: وَلَحْمِ طَيْرٍ مِمَّا يَشْتَهُونَ

translation: And [they will have] maidens with wide gorgeous eyes,
arabic: وَحُورٌ عِينٌ

translation: like pristine pearls,
arabic: كَأَمْثَالِ اللُّؤْلُؤِ الْمَكْنُونِ

translation: as a reward for what they used to do.
arabic: جَزَاءً بِمَا كَانُوا يَعْمَلُونَ

translation: They will not hear therein any idle talk or sinful speech,
arabic: لَا يَسْمَعُونَ فِيهَا لَغْوًا وَلَا تَأْثِيمًا

translation: except the words of peace, peace[4].
footnotes: [4] i.e., only exchanging greetings of peace.
arabic: إِلَّا قِيلًا سَلَامًا سَلَامًا

translation: The people of the right – how blessed will be the people of the right!
arabic: وَأَصْحَابُ الْيَمِينِ مَا أَصْحَابُ الْيَمِينِ

translation: [They will be] in the midst of thornless lote trees,
arabic: فِي سِدْرٍ مَخْضُودٍ

translation: and clusters of bananas,
arabic: وَطَلْحٍ مَنْضُودٍ

translation: and extended shade,
arabic: وَظِلٍّ مَمْدُودٍ

translation: and flowing water,
arabic: وَمَاءٍ مَسْكُوبٍ

translation: and abundant fruit –
arabic: وَفَاكِهَةٍ كَثِيرَةٍ

translation: neither ceasing nor restricted –
arabic: لَا مَقْطُوعَةٍ وَلَا مَمْنُوعَةٍ

translation: and elevated mattresses [on beds].
arabic: وَفُرُشٍ مَرْفُوعَةٍ

translation: Indeed, We have perfectly created them [i.e., their spouses],
arabic: إِنَّا أَنْشَأْنَاهُنَّ إِنْشَاءً

translation: and have made them virgins,
arabic: فَجَعَلْنَاهُنَّ أَبْكَارًا

translation: loving and of equal age,
arabic: عُرُبًا أَتْرَابًا

translation: for the people of the right,
arabic: لِأَصْحَابِ الْيَمِينِ

translation: many from the earlier generations,
arabic: ثُلَّةٌ مِنَ الْأَوَّلِينَ

translation: and many from the later generations.
arabic: وَثُلَّةٌ مِنَ الْآخِرِينَ

translation: And the people of the left – how wretched will be the people of the left!
arabic: وَأَصْحَابُ الشِّمَالِ مَا أَصْحَابُ الشِّمَالِ

translation: [They will be] in scorching wind and scalding water,
arabic: فِي سَمُومٍ وَحَمِيمٍ

translation: in the shade of black smoke,
arabic: وَظِلٍّ مِنْ يَحْمُومٍ

translation: neither cool nor refreshing.
arabic: لَا بَارِدٍ وَلَا كَرِيمٍ

translation: Indeed, they used to be in luxuries before,
arabic: إِنَّهُمْ كَانُوا قَبْلَ ذَٰلِكَ مُتْرَفِينَ

translation: and persisted in the gravest sin[5].
footnotes: [5] i.e., Shirk (associating partners with Allah) or disbelief.
arabic: وَكَانُوا يُصِرُّونَ عَلَى الْحِنْثِ الْعَظِيمِ

translation: They used to say, "When we die and become dust and bones, will we really be raised again?
arabic: وَكَانُوا يَقُولُونَ أَئِذَا مِتْنَا وَكُنَّا تُرَابًا وَعِظَامًا أَإِنَّا لَمَبْعُوثُونَ

translation: And our forefathers as well?”
arabic: أَوَآبَاؤُنَا الْأَوَّلُونَ

translation: Say, [O Prophet], “Indeed, the former and later generations
arabic: قُلْ إِنَّ الْأَوَّلِينَ وَالْآخِرِينَ

translation: will be gathered on a predetermined Day.
arabic: لَمَجْمُوعُونَ إِلَىٰ مِيقَاتِ يَوْمٍ مَعْلُومٍ

translation: Then you, O misguided deniers,
arabic: ثُمَّ إِنَّكُمْ أَيُّهَا الضَّالُّونَ الْمُكَذِّبُونَ

translation: will surely eat from the tree of zaqqūm[6],
footnotes: [6] See footnote 44:43-46.
arabic: لَآكِلُونَ مِنْ شَجَرٍ مِنْ زَقُّومٍ

translation: filling your bellies with it,
arabic: فَمَالِئُونَ مِنْهَا الْبُطُونَ

translation: and drinking scalding water on top of it,
arabic: فَشَارِبُونَ عَلَيْهِ مِنَ الْحَمِيمِ

translation: drinking like thirsty camels do.”
arabic: فَشَارِبُونَ شُرْبَ الْهِيمِ

translation: This will be their welcome on the Day of Judgment.
arabic: هَٰذَا نُزُلُهُمْ يَوْمَ الدِّينِ

translation: It is We Who created you; why do you not then believe [in resurrection]?
arabic: نَحْنُ خَلَقْنَاكُمْ فَلَوْلَا تُصَدِّقُونَ

translation: Have you thought about the semen that you emit?
arabic: أَفَرَأَيْتُمْ مَا تُمْنُونَ

translation: Is it you who create it, or is it We Who are the Creators?
arabic: أَأَنْتُمْ تَخْلُقُونَهُ أَمْ نَحْنُ الْخَالِقُونَ

translation: We have ordained death among you, and nothing can overcome us
arabic: نَحْنُ قَدَّرْنَا بَيْنَكُمُ الْمَوْتَ وَمَا نَحْنُ بِمَسْبُوقِينَ

translation: from transforming you and recreating you in forms that you do not know[7].
footnotes: [7] Or "from replacing you by others like yourselves [in this life] and creating you [in the Hereafter] in that which you do not know."
arabic: عَلَىٰ أَنْ نُبَدِّلَ أَمْثَالَكُمْ وَنُنْشِئَكُمْ فِي مَا لَا تَعْلَمُونَ

translation: You are well aware of the first creation; why do you not then take heed?
arabic: وَلَقَدْ عَلِمْتُمُ النَّشْأَةَ الْأُولَىٰ فَلَوْلَا تَذَكَّرُونَ

translation: Have you thought about what you sow?
arabic: أَفَرَأَيْتُمْ مَا تَحْرُثُونَ

translation: Is it you who cause it to grow, or is it We Who make it grow?
arabic: أَأَنْتُمْ تَزْرَعُونَهُ أَمْ نَحْنُ الزَّارِعُونَ

translation: If We willed, We could reduce your harvest to rubble, leaving you to wonder and lament,
arabic: لَوْ نَشَاءُ لَجَعَلْنَاهُ حُطَامًا فَظَلْتُمْ تَفَكَّهُونَ

translation: “We suffered loss,
arabic: إِنَّا لَمُغْرَمُونَ

translation: rather, we are deprived.”
arabic: بَلْ نَحْنُ مَحْرُومُونَ

translation: Have you thought about the water that you drink?
arabic: أَفَرَأَيْتُمُ الْمَاءَ الَّذِي تَشْرَبُونَ

translation: Is it you who bring it down from the clouds, or is it We Who bring it down?
arabic: أَأَنْتُمْ أَنْزَلْتُمُوهُ مِنَ الْمُزْنِ أَمْ نَحْنُ الْمُنْزِلُونَ

translation: If We willed, We could make it salty; will you not then give thanks?
arabic: لَوْ نَشَاءُ جَعَلْنَاهُ أُجَاجًا فَلَوْلَا تَشْكُرُونَ

translation: Have you thought about the fire that you kindle?
arabic: أَفَرَأَيْتُمُ النَّارَ الَّتِي تُورُونَ

translation: Is it you who produced its trees[8], or is it We Who produced it?
footnotes: [8] Referring to Arabian trees, markh and ‘afār, which produce fire when their green branches are rubbed against each other.
arabic: أَأَنْتُمْ أَنْشَأْتُمْ شَجَرَتَهَا أَمْ نَحْنُ الْمُنْشِئُونَ

translation: We made it a reminder [of the Hellfire] and a benefit for the travelers[9].
footnotes: [9] By which they ignite fire. Travelers are mentioned in particular because it is of special convenience to them, although it is of use for all people in general.
arabic: نَحْنُ جَعَلْنَاهَا تَذْكِرَةً وَمَتَاعًا لِلْمُقْوِينَ

translation: So glorify the Name of your Lord, the Most Great.
arabic: فَسَبِّحْ بِاسْمِ رَبِّكَ الْعَظِيمِ

translation: I do swear[10] by the positions of the stars –
footnotes: [10] The negative article "la" (nay) means: The truth is not what is said or thought by disbelievers or others. The oath refutes certain objections of the disbelievers with regard to the Qur’an.
arabic: ۞ فَلَا أُقْسِمُ بِمَوَاقِعِ النُّجُومِ

translation: and this is indeed a great oath, if only you knew –
arabic: وَإِنَّهُ لَقَسَمٌ لَوْ تَعْلَمُونَ عَظِيمٌ

translation: that this is indeed a noble Qur’an,
arabic: إِنَّهُ لَقُرْآنٌ كَرِيمٌ

translation: in a well-preserved Record[11],
footnotes: [11] i.e., the Preserved Tablet.
arabic: فِي كِتَابٍ مَكْنُونٍ

translation: that none can touch except the purified ones[12] –
footnotes: [12] i.e., angels. It refutes the claim of the pagans that the Qur’an was sent down by devils. (See 26:210-212). Based on this verse, many Muslim jurists held that one should perform ablution prior to reading the Qur’an.
arabic: لَا يَمَسُّهُ إِلَّا الْمُطَهَّرُونَ

translation: a revelation from the Lord of the worlds.
arabic: تَنْزِيلٌ مِنْ رَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ

translation: Do you take this discourse lightly,
arabic: أَفَبِهَٰذَا الْحَدِيثِ أَنْتُمْ مُدْهِنُونَ

translation: and instead [of thanking Allah] for the provision you are given, you show ingratitude?
arabic: وَتَجْعَلُونَ رِزْقَكُمْ أَنَّكُمْ تُكَذِّبُونَ

translation: Then why [are you helpless] when the soul reaches the throat,
arabic: فَلَوْلَا إِذَا بَلَغَتِ الْحُلْقُومَ

translation: while you are looking on,
arabic: وَأَنْتُمْ حِينَئِذٍ تَنْظُرُونَ

translation: when We are closer[13] to him than you, but you do not see?
footnotes: [13] We are closer to him in terms of Knowledge and Power; Our angels are closer in person.
arabic: وَنَحْنُ أَقْرَبُ إِلَيْهِ مِنْكُمْ وَلَٰكِنْ لَا تُبْصِرُونَ

translation: If you are not subject to retribution, then why do you not
arabic: فَلَوْلَا إِنْ كُنْتُمْ غَيْرَ مَدِينِينَ

translation: bring that [soul] back, if you are truthful?
arabic: تَرْجِعُونَهَا إِنْ كُنْتُمْ صَادِقِينَ

translation: If that dying person is one of those who will be brought near to Allah,
arabic: فَأَمَّا إِنْ كَانَ مِنَ الْمُقَرَّبِينَ

translation: then [he will have] comfort, fragrance[14], and a Garden of Bliss.
footnotes: [14] lit., fragrant basil. Paradise is described in the Qur’an as being pleasant to the eye, the heart, and the ear. Here it also emphasizes the scent.
arabic: فَرَوْحٌ وَرَيْحَانٌ وَجَنَّتُ نَعِيمٍ

translation: If he is one of the people of the right,
arabic: وَأَمَّا إِنْ كَانَ مِنْ أَصْحَابِ الْيَمِينِ

translation: [He will be told], “Peace be to you, for being one of the people of the right.”
arabic: فَسَلَامٌ لَكَ مِنْ أَصْحَابِ الْيَمِينِ

translation: But if he is one of the misguided deniers,
arabic: وَأَمَّا إِنْ كَانَ مِنَ الْمُكَذِّبِينَ الضَّالِّينَ

translation: then he will be welcomed with scalding water,
arabic: فَنُزُلٌ مِنْ حَمِيمٍ

translation: and he will burn in Blazing Fire.
arabic: وَتَصْلِيَةُ جَحِيمٍ

translation: This is indeed the absolute truth.
arabic: إِنَّ هَٰذَا لَهُوَ حَقُّ الْيَقِينِ

translation: So glorify the name of your Lord, the Most Great.
arabic: فَسَبِّحْ بِاسْمِ رَبِّكَ الْعَظِيمِ

translation: All that is in the heavens and earth glorifies[1] Allah, for He is the All-Mighty, the All-Wise.
footnotes: [1] By praising and exalting Him far above any deficiency or imperfection.
arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ سَبَّحَ لِلَّهِ مَا فِي السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ ۖ وَهُوَ الْعَزِيزُ الْحَكِيمُ

translation: To Him belongs the dominion of the heavens and earth; He gives life and causes death, and He is Most Capable of all things.
arabic: لَهُ مُلْكُ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ ۖ يُحْيِي وَيُمِيتُ ۖ وَهُوَ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيرٌ

translation: He is the First[2] and the Last[3], the Manifest[4] and the Hidden[5], and He is All-Knowing of everything.
footnotes: [2] Before Whom nothing existed; the foremost; the uppermost. [3] Eternal after Whom nothing remains. [4] High, nothing is above Him. [5] Nothing is nearer than Him by way of His knowledge; concealed from our physical senses.
arabic: هُوَ الْأَوَّلُ وَالْآخِرُ وَالظَّاهِرُ وَالْبَاطِنُ ۖ وَهُوَ بِكُلِّ شَيْءٍ عَلِيمٌ

translation: It is He Who created the heavens and earth in six days, and then rose over the Throne. He knows all that goes into the earth and all that comes out of it, and all that descends from the heaven and all that ascends to it. He is with you[6] wherever you are, and Allah is All-Seeing of what you do.
footnotes: [6] By His Knowledge - observing and witnessing all.
arabic: هُوَ الَّذِي خَلَقَ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضَ فِي سِتَّةِ أَيَّامٍ ثُمَّ اسْتَوَىٰ عَلَى الْعَرْشِ ۚ يَعْلَمُ مَا يَلِجُ فِي الْأَرْضِ وَمَا يَخْرُجُ مِنْهَا وَمَا يَنْزِلُ مِنَ السَّمَاءِ وَمَا يَعْرُجُ فِيهَا ۖ وَهُوَ مَعَكُمْ أَيْنَ مَا كُنْتُمْ ۚ وَاللَّهُ بِمَا تَعْمَلُونَ بَصِيرٌ

translation: To Him belongs the dominion of the heavens and earth, and to Allah will return all matters.
arabic: لَهُ مُلْكُ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ ۚ وَإِلَى اللَّهِ تُرْجَعُ الْأُمُورُ

translation: He causes the night to merge into the day and the day to merge into the night, and He is All-Knowing of what is in the hearts.
arabic: يُولِجُ اللَّيْلَ فِي النَّهَارِ وَيُولِجُ النَّهَارَ فِي اللَّيْلِ ۚ وَهُوَ عَلِيمٌ بِذَاتِ الصُّدُورِ

translation: Believe in Allah and His Messenger, and spend [in Allah’s cause] out of what He has entrusted you with. For those among you who believe and spend[7], there will be a great reward.
footnotes: [7] In the way of Allah.
arabic: آمِنُوا بِاللَّهِ وَرَسُولِهِ وَأَنْفِقُوا مِمَّا جَعَلَكُمْ مُسْتَخْلَفِينَ فِيهِ ۖ فَالَّذِينَ آمَنُوا مِنْكُمْ وَأَنْفَقُوا لَهُمْ أَجْرٌ كَبِيرٌ

translation: Why is it that you do not believe in Allah when the Messenger is calling you to believe in your Lord, and He has already taken a covenant from you[8], if you will ever believe?
arabic: وَمَا لَكُمْ لَا تُؤْمِنُونَ بِاللَّهِ ۙ وَالرَّسُولُ يَدْعُوكُمْ لِتُؤْمِنُوا بِرَبِّكُمْ وَقَدْ أَخَذَ مِيثَاقَكُمْ إِنْ كُنْتُمْ مُؤْمِنِينَ

translation: It is He Who sends down clear verses to His slave to bring you out of the depths of darkness into the light. Indeed, Allah is Ever Gracious and Most Merciful to you.
arabic: هُوَ الَّذِي يُنَزِّلُ عَلَىٰ عَبْدِهِ آيَاتٍ بَيِّنَاتٍ لِيُخْرِجَكُمْ مِنَ الظُّلُمَاتِ إِلَى النُّورِ ۚ وَإِنَّ اللَّهَ بِكُمْ لَرَءُوفٌ رَحِيمٌ

translation: Why is it that you do not spend in the cause of Allah, when Allah alone will inherit the heavens and earth? Those of you who spent and fought before the conquest [of Makkah and those who did not] are not equal. They are much greater in rank than those who spent and fought afterward[9]. Yet Allah has promised each a fine reward, and Allah is All-Aware of what you do.
footnotes: [9] Muslims were perceived as weak before the conquest of Makkah. Therefore, those believers who donated and fought in times of weakness and hardship deserve more rewards than those who did so when Muslims were victors and had an upper hand against the enemies.
arabic: وَمَا لَكُمْ أَلَّا تُنْفِقُوا فِي سَبِيلِ اللَّهِ وَلِلَّهِ مِيرَاثُ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ ۚ لَا يَسْتَوِي مِنْكُمْ مَنْ أَنْفَقَ مِنْ قَبْلِ الْفَتْحِ وَقَاتَلَ ۚ أُولَٰئِكَ أَعْظَمُ دَرَجَةً مِنَ الَّذِينَ أَنْفَقُوا مِنْ بَعْدُ وَقَاتَلُوا ۚ وَكُلًّا وَعَدَ اللَّهُ الْحُسْنَىٰ ۚ وَاللَّهُ بِمَا تَعْمَلُونَ خَبِيرٌ

translation: Who is there to lend Allah a goodly loan, so He will multiply it for him, and for him there will be a generous reward[10]?
footnotes: [10] i.e., Paradise.
arabic: مَنْ ذَا الَّذِي يُقْرِضُ اللَّهَ قَرْضًا حَسَنًا فَيُضَاعِفَهُ لَهُ وَلَهُ أَجْرٌ كَرِيمٌ

translation: [Remember] the Day when you will see the believing men and women, with their light streaming ahead of them and on their right. [They will be told], “Glad tidings for you Today: gardens under which rivers flow, abiding therein forever.” That is the supreme triumph.
arabic: يَوْمَ تَرَى الْمُؤْمِنِينَ وَالْمُؤْمِنَاتِ يَسْعَىٰ نُورُهُمْ بَيْنَ أَيْدِيهِمْ وَبِأَيْمَانِهِمْ بُشْرَاكُمُ الْيَوْمَ جَنَّاتٌ تَجْرِي مِنْ تَحْتِهَا الْأَنْهَارُ خَالِدِينَ فِيهَا ۚ ذَٰلِكَ هُوَ الْفَوْزُ الْعَظِيمُ

translation: On that Day the hypocrite men and women will say to those who believe, “Wait for us, so that we may have some of your light.” It will be said, “Go back and seek light elsewhere[11].” Then a wall will be placed between them, which will have a gate[12], on the inside of which there will be mercy and on the outside there will be punishment.
footnotes: [11] i.e., the worldly life from where the light was acquired. [12] This wall is said to be the barrier between Paradise and Hell, which is called Al-A‘rāf (the heights). See 7:46-49.
arabic: يَوْمَ يَقُولُ الْمُنَافِقُونَ وَالْمُنَافِقَاتُ لِلَّذِينَ آمَنُوا انْظُرُونَا نَقْتَبِسْ مِنْ نُورِكُمْ قِيلَ ارْجِعُوا وَرَاءَكُمْ فَالْتَمِسُوا نُورًا فَضُرِبَ بَيْنَهُمْ بِسُورٍ لَهُ بَابٌ بَاطِنُهُ فِيهِ الرَّحْمَةُ وَظَاهِرُهُ مِنْ قِبَلِهِ الْعَذَابُ

translation: The hypocrites will call out to the believers, “Were we not with you?” They will say, “Yes, but you allowed yourselves[13] to succumb to temptations, you awaited [some misfortune to befall us], you doubted, and you were deceived by false hopes, until Allah’s decree came to pass. Thus the deceiver [i.e., Satan] deceived you concerning Allah.
footnotes: [13] By hypocrisy.
arabic: يُنَادُونَهُمْ أَلَمْ نَكُنْ مَعَكُمْ ۖ قَالُوا بَلَىٰ وَلَٰكِنَّكُمْ فَتَنْتُمْ أَنْفُسَكُمْ وَتَرَبَّصْتُمْ وَارْتَبْتُمْ وَغَرَّتْكُمُ الْأَمَانِيُّ حَتَّىٰ جَاءَ أَمْرُ اللَّهِ وَغَرَّكُمْ بِاللَّهِ الْغَرُورُ

translation: So this Day no ransom will be accepted from you or from the disbelievers. Your abode is the Fire; it is a fitting place for you – what a wretched destination!”
arabic: فَالْيَوْمَ لَا يُؤْخَذُ مِنْكُمْ فِدْيَةٌ وَلَا مِنَ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا ۚ مَأْوَاكُمُ النَّارُ ۖ هِيَ مَوْلَاكُمْ ۖ وَبِئْسَ الْمَصِيرُ

translation: Has the time not yet come for those who believe that their hearts should be humbled at the remembrance of Allah and the truth that has been revealed? And that they should not be like those who were given the Scripture before, whose hearts grew hard after the passage of a long time, and many of them were evildoers.
arabic: ۞ أَلَمْ يَأْنِ لِلَّذِينَ آمَنُوا أَنْ تَخْشَعَ قُلُوبُهُمْ لِذِكْرِ اللَّهِ وَمَا نَزَلَ مِنَ الْحَقِّ وَلَا يَكُونُوا كَالَّذِينَ أُوتُوا الْكِتَابَ مِنْ قَبْلُ فَطَالَ عَلَيْهِمُ الْأَمَدُ فَقَسَتْ قُلُوبُهُمْ ۖ وَكَثِيرٌ مِنْهُمْ فَاسِقُونَ

translation: Know that Allah revives the earth after its death[14]. We have made the signs clear to you so that you may understand.
footnotes: [14] Similarly, it is easy for Allah to soften the hearts and guide after misguidance.
arabic: اعْلَمُوا أَنَّ اللَّهَ يُحْيِي الْأَرْضَ بَعْدَ مَوْتِهَا ۚ قَدْ بَيَّنَّا لَكُمُ الْآيَاتِ لَعَلَّكُمْ تَعْقِلُونَ

translation: Indeed, those men and women who give in charity and lend to Allah a goodly loan, it will be multiplied for them, and for them there will be a generous reward[15].
footnotes: [15] i.e., Paradise.
arabic: إِنَّ الْمُصَّدِّقِينَ وَالْمُصَّدِّقَاتِ وَأَقْرَضُوا اللَّهَ قَرْضًا حَسَنًا يُضَاعَفُ لَهُمْ وَلَهُمْ أَجْرٌ كَرِيمٌ

translation: Those who believe in Allah and His messengers, it is they who are the people of the truth. And the martyrs will have their reward and their light with their Lord. As for those who disbelieve and reject Our verses, they are the people of the Blazing Fire.
arabic: وَالَّذِينَ آمَنُوا بِاللَّهِ وَرُسُلِهِ أُولَٰئِكَ هُمُ الصِّدِّيقُونَ ۖ وَالشُّهَدَاءُ عِنْدَ رَبِّهِمْ لَهُمْ أَجْرُهُمْ وَنُورُهُمْ ۖ وَالَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا وَكَذَّبُوا بِآيَاتِنَا أُولَٰئِكَ أَصْحَابُ الْجَحِيمِ

translation: Know that the life of this world is no more than play, amusement, adornment, boasting among yourselves, and competition in wealth and children. It is like plants that flourish after rain, pleasing the sowers, then they wither and you see them turning yellow, and then they crumble. And in the Hereafter there will be severe punishment, or forgiveness from Allah and His pleasure. For the life of this world is no more than a fleeting enjoyment.
arabic: اعْلَمُوا أَنَّمَا الْحَيَاةُ الدُّنْيَا لَعِبٌ وَلَهْوٌ وَزِينَةٌ وَتَفَاخُرٌ بَيْنَكُمْ وَتَكَاثُرٌ فِي الْأَمْوَالِ وَالْأَوْلَادِ ۖ كَمَثَلِ غَيْثٍ أَعْجَبَ الْكُفَّارَ نَبَاتُهُ ثُمَّ يَهِيجُ فَتَرَاهُ مُصْفَرًّا ثُمَّ يَكُونُ حُطَامًا ۖ وَفِي الْآخِرَةِ عَذَابٌ شَدِيدٌ وَمَغْفِرَةٌ مِنَ اللَّهِ وَرِضْوَانٌ ۚ وَمَا الْحَيَاةُ الدُّنْيَا إِلَّا مَتَاعُ الْغُرُورِ

translation: Race one another towards forgiveness from your Lord and Paradise the width of which is like the width of the heaven and earth, prepared for those who believe in Allah and His messengers. That is the bounty of Allah which He gives to whom He wills, for Allah is the Lord of great bounty.
arabic: سَابِقُوا إِلَىٰ مَغْفِرَةٍ مِنْ رَبِّكُمْ وَجَنَّةٍ عَرْضُهَا كَعَرْضِ السَّمَاءِ وَالْأَرْضِ أُعِدَّتْ لِلَّذِينَ آمَنُوا بِاللَّهِ وَرُسُلِهِ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ فَضْلُ اللَّهِ يُؤْتِيهِ مَنْ يَشَاءُ ۚ وَاللَّهُ ذُو الْفَضْلِ الْعَظِيمِ

translation: No calamity befalls the earth or yourselves but it is already written in a Record[16] before We bring it into existence. That is indeed easy for Allah –
footnotes: [16] i.e., the Preserved Tablet.
arabic: مَا أَصَابَ مِنْ مُصِيبَةٍ فِي الْأَرْضِ وَلَا فِي أَنْفُسِكُمْ إِلَّا فِي كِتَابٍ مِنْ قَبْلِ أَنْ نَبْرَأَهَا ۚ إِنَّ ذَٰلِكَ عَلَى اللَّهِ يَسِيرٌ

translation: so that you may not grieve over what you have missed, nor exult over what He has given you, for Allah does not love anyone who is conceited and boastful –
arabic: لِكَيْلَا تَأْسَوْا عَلَىٰ مَا فَاتَكُمْ وَلَا تَفْرَحُوا بِمَا آتَاكُمْ ۗ وَاللَّهُ لَا يُحِبُّ كُلَّ مُخْتَالٍ فَخُورٍ

translation: those who are stingy and promote stinginess among people. And those who turn away[17], then Allah is the Self-Sufficient, the Praiseworthy.
footnotes: [17] Refuse to spend in the way of Allah or refuse obedience to Him.
arabic: الَّذِينَ يَبْخَلُونَ وَيَأْمُرُونَ النَّاسَ بِالْبُخْلِ ۗ وَمَنْ يَتَوَلَّ فَإِنَّ اللَّهَ هُوَ الْغَنِيُّ الْحَمِيدُ

translation: We have sent Our messengers with clear proofs, and sent down with them the Scripture and the criteria of justice, so that the people may uphold justice. And We sent down iron, in which there is great might and benefits for people, so that Allah may make known those who help His cause and His messengers without seeing Him. Indeed, Allah is All-Powerful, All-Mighty.
arabic: لَقَدْ أَرْسَلْنَا رُسُلَنَا بِالْبَيِّنَاتِ وَأَنْزَلْنَا مَعَهُمُ الْكِتَابَ وَالْمِيزَانَ لِيَقُومَ النَّاسُ بِالْقِسْطِ ۖ وَأَنْزَلْنَا الْحَدِيدَ فِيهِ بَأْسٌ شَدِيدٌ وَمَنَافِعُ لِلنَّاسِ وَلِيَعْلَمَ اللَّهُ مَنْ يَنْصُرُهُ وَرُسُلَهُ بِالْغَيْبِ ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ قَوِيٌّ عَزِيزٌ

translation: We sent Noah and Abraham, and gave prophethood and Scripture to their offspring: some among them are guided, but most of them are evildoers.
arabic: وَلَقَدْ أَرْسَلْنَا نُوحًا وَإِبْرَاهِيمَ وَجَعَلْنَا فِي ذُرِّيَّتِهِمَا النُّبُوَّةَ وَالْكِتَابَ ۖ فَمِنْهُمْ مُهْتَدٍ ۖ وَكَثِيرٌ مِنْهُمْ فَاسِقُونَ

translation: Then We sent Our messengers in their footsteps, and We sent after them Jesus, son of Mary; We gave him the Gospel and instilled kindness and mercy in the hearts of those who followed him. As for monasticism, they invented it – We did not prescribe it for them – seeking thereby Allah’s pleasure, yet they did not observe it faithfully. So We gave those who believed among them their reward, but most of them are evildoers.
arabic: ثُمَّ قَفَّيْنَا عَلَىٰ آثَارِهِمْ بِرُسُلِنَا وَقَفَّيْنَا بِعِيسَى ابْنِ مَرْيَمَ وَآتَيْنَاهُ الْإِنْجِيلَ وَجَعَلْنَا فِي قُلُوبِ الَّذِينَ اتَّبَعُوهُ رَأْفَةً وَرَحْمَةً وَرَهْبَانِيَّةً ابْتَدَعُوهَا مَا كَتَبْنَاهَا عَلَيْهِمْ إِلَّا ابْتِغَاءَ رِضْوَانِ اللَّهِ فَمَا رَعَوْهَا حَقَّ رِعَايَتِهَا ۖ فَآتَيْنَا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا مِنْهُمْ أَجْرَهُمْ ۖ وَكَثِيرٌ مِنْهُمْ فَاسِقُونَ

translation: O you who believe, fear Allah and believe in His Messenger; He will give you a double share of His mercy and will give you a light by which you walk, and forgive you, for Allah is All-Forgiving, Most Merciful.
arabic: يَا أَيُّهَا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا اتَّقُوا اللَّهَ وَآمِنُوا بِرَسُولِهِ يُؤْتِكُمْ كِفْلَيْنِ مِنْ رَحْمَتِهِ وَيَجْعَلْ لَكُمْ نُورًا تَمْشُونَ بِهِ وَيَغْفِرْ لَكُمْ ۚ وَاللَّهُ غَفُورٌ رَحِيمٌ

translation: [This is] so that the People of the Book may know that they have no power over anything of Allah’s bounty and that all bounty is in the Hands of Allah; He gives it to whom He wills, for Allah is the Lord of great bounty.
arabic: لِئَلَّا يَعْلَمَ أَهْلُ الْكِتَابِ أَلَّا يَقْدِرُونَ عَلَىٰ شَيْءٍ مِنْ فَضْلِ اللَّهِ ۙ وَأَنَّ الْفَضْلَ بِيَدِ اللَّهِ يُؤْتِيهِ مَنْ يَشَاءُ ۚ وَاللَّهُ ذُو الْفَضْلِ الْعَظِيمِ

translation: Indeed, Allah has heard the words of the woman who was arguing with you [O Prophet] concerning her husband and was complaining to Allah. Allah has heard the discussion between the two of you, for Allah is All-Hearing, All-Seeing[1].
footnotes: [1] Khawlah bint Tha‘labah and her husband Aws ibn As-Sāmit had a disagreement. She came to the Prophet (ﷺ) and said that her husband made her unlawful to himself as the zahr (back) of his mother, which was a famous type of divorce in Arabia, called zihār. He (ﷺ) told her that he had not received any revelation in this regard. Finally, this Madinian surah was revealed, and abolished this ancient practice.
arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ قَدْ سَمِعَ اللَّهُ قَوْلَ الَّتِي تُجَادِلُكَ فِي زَوْجِهَا وَتَشْتَكِي إِلَى اللَّهِ وَاللَّهُ يَسْمَعُ تَحَاوُرَكُمَا ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ سَمِيعٌ بَصِيرٌ

translation: As for those among you who divorce their wives by likening them to their mothers[2], they are not their mothers; their mothers are none but those who gave birth to them. They utter words that are abhorrent and false, but Allah is Most Pardoning, Most Forgiving.
footnotes: [2] By saying to one's wife, "You are to me like the back of my mother," meaning unlawful to approach, which was abolished by the revelation of these verses.
arabic: الَّذِينَ يُظَاهِرُونَ مِنْكُمْ مِنْ نِسَائِهِمْ مَا هُنَّ أُمَّهَاتِهِمْ ۖ إِنْ أُمَّهَاتُهُمْ إِلَّا اللَّائِي وَلَدْنَهُمْ ۚ وَإِنَّهُمْ لَيَقُولُونَ مُنْكَرًا مِنَ الْقَوْلِ وَزُورًا ۚ وَإِنَّ اللَّهَ لَعَفُوٌّ غَفُورٌ

translation: But those who divorce their wives by likening them to their mothers then retract what they said, they must free a slave before they are intimate with each other. This is what you are admonished, and Allah is All-Aware of what you do.
arabic: وَالَّذِينَ يُظَاهِرُونَ مِنْ نِسَائِهِمْ ثُمَّ يَعُودُونَ لِمَا قَالُوا فَتَحْرِيرُ رَقَبَةٍ مِنْ قَبْلِ أَنْ يَتَمَاسَّا ۚ ذَٰلِكُمْ تُوعَظُونَ بِهِ ۚ وَاللَّهُ بِمَا تَعْمَلُونَ خَبِيرٌ

translation: But whoever cannot afford this must fast for two consecutive months[3] before the couple have intimate relations with each other. But if he is unable to do that, he must feed sixty needy people. This is so that you may truly believe in Allah and His Messenger. These are the limits ordained by Allah, and for the disbelievers there will be a painful punishment.
footnotes: [3] See footnote 4:92.
arabic: فَمَنْ لَمْ يَجِدْ فَصِيَامُ شَهْرَيْنِ مُتَتَابِعَيْنِ مِنْ قَبْلِ أَنْ يَتَمَاسَّا ۖ فَمَنْ لَمْ يَسْتَطِعْ فَإِطْعَامُ سِتِّينَ مِسْكِينًا ۚ ذَٰلِكَ لِتُؤْمِنُوا بِاللَّهِ وَرَسُولِهِ ۚ وَتِلْكَ حُدُودُ اللَّهِ ۗ وَلِلْكَافِرِينَ عَذَابٌ أَلِيمٌ

translation: Indeed, those who oppose Allah and His Messenger will be debased, just as those who came before them were debased, for We have surely sent down clear signs. And for the disbelievers there will be a humiliating punishment.
arabic: إِنَّ الَّذِينَ يُحَادُّونَ اللَّهَ وَرَسُولَهُ كُبِتُوا كَمَا كُبِتَ الَّذِينَ مِنْ قَبْلِهِمْ ۚ وَقَدْ أَنْزَلْنَا آيَاتٍ بَيِّنَاتٍ ۚ وَلِلْكَافِرِينَ عَذَابٌ مُهِينٌ

translation: On the Day when Allah will resurrect them all together and will inform them of what they did; Allah has kept their complete record, while they have forgotten it. For Allah is a Witness over all things.
arabic: يَوْمَ يَبْعَثُهُمُ اللَّهُ جَمِيعًا فَيُنَبِّئُهُمْ بِمَا عَمِلُوا ۚ أَحْصَاهُ اللَّهُ وَنَسُوهُ ۚ وَاللَّهُ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَيْءٍ شَهِيدٌ

translation: Do you not see that Allah knows all that is in the heavens and all that is on earth? No secret consultation takes place between three, but He is their fourth, or between five, but He is their sixth, or between fewer or more than that, but He is with them wherever they may be[4]. Then He will inform them of what they did on the Day of Resurrection. Indeed, Allah is All-Knowing of everything.
footnotes: [4] He is with them by His knowledge.
arabic: أَلَمْ تَرَ أَنَّ اللَّهَ يَعْلَمُ مَا فِي السَّمَاوَاتِ وَمَا فِي الْأَرْضِ ۖ مَا يَكُونُ مِنْ نَجْوَىٰ ثَلَاثَةٍ إِلَّا هُوَ رَابِعُهُمْ وَلَا خَمْسَةٍ إِلَّا هُوَ سَادِسُهُمْ وَلَا أَدْنَىٰ مِنْ ذَٰلِكَ وَلَا أَكْثَرَ إِلَّا هُوَ مَعَهُمْ أَيْنَ مَا كَانُوا ۖ ثُمَّ يُنَبِّئُهُمْ بِمَا عَمِلُوا يَوْمَ الْقِيَامَةِ ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ بِكُلِّ شَيْءٍ عَلِيمٌ

translation: Have you not seen those who were forbidden from holding secret talks, yet they go back to do what they were forbidden from, conspiring in sin and aggression, and in disobedience to the Messenger? When they come to you, they greet you[5] other than the way Allah greets you, and they say to one another, “Why does Allah not punish us for what we say?” Sufficient is Hell for them; they will enter it. What a terrible destination!
footnotes: [5] This is referring to the Jews who used to play with words while addressing the Prophet (ﷺ) to ridicule him, saying "Asāmu ‘alaikum" (death be upon you) instead of "Asalamu ‘alaikum" (peace be upon you).
arabic: أَلَمْ تَرَ إِلَى الَّذِينَ نُهُوا عَنِ النَّجْوَىٰ ثُمَّ يَعُودُونَ لِمَا نُهُوا عَنْهُ وَيَتَنَاجَوْنَ بِالْإِثْمِ وَالْعُدْوَانِ وَمَعْصِيَتِ الرَّسُولِ وَإِذَا جَاءُوكَ حَيَّوْكَ بِمَا لَمْ يُحَيِّكَ بِهِ اللَّهُ وَيَقُولُونَ فِي أَنْفُسِهِمْ لَوْلَا يُعَذِّبُنَا اللَّهُ بِمَا نَقُولُ ۚ حَسْبُهُمْ جَهَنَّمُ يَصْلَوْنَهَا ۖ فَبِئْسَ الْمَصِيرُ

translation: O you who believe, when you hold secret counsel, do not do so in sin and aggression, and in disobedience to the Messenger, rather do so in righteousness and piety. And fear Allah, to Whom you will be gathered.
arabic: يَا أَيُّهَا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا إِذَا تَنَاجَيْتُمْ فَلَا تَتَنَاجَوْا بِالْإِثْمِ وَالْعُدْوَانِ وَمَعْصِيَتِ الرَّسُولِ وَتَنَاجَوْا بِالْبِرِّ وَالتَّقْوَىٰ ۖ وَاتَّقُوا اللَّهَ الَّذِي إِلَيْهِ تُحْشَرُونَ

translation: Secret talks are only prompted by Satan to grieve the believers, but he cannot harm them[6] in the least except with Allah’s permission. So let the believers put their trust in Allah.
footnotes: [6] Referring to the sinful type of secret talks, as mentioned in the previous verses, or two persons speaking in private in the presence of a third, leading him to assume that he is the subject of their talk.
arabic: إِنَّمَا النَّجْوَىٰ مِنَ الشَّيْطَانِ لِيَحْزُنَ الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَلَيْسَ بِضَارِّهِمْ شَيْئًا إِلَّا بِإِذْنِ اللَّهِ ۚ وَعَلَى اللَّهِ فَلْيَتَوَكَّلِ الْمُؤْمِنُونَ

translation: O you who believe, when you are told to make room in your gatherings, then make room; Allah will give you abundance[7]. And when you are told to rise, then rise; Allah will raise in ranks those who believed from among you and those who are given knowledge. And Allah is All-Aware of what you do.
footnotes: [7] In this life or in the Hereafter.
arabic: يَا أَيُّهَا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا إِذَا قِيلَ لَكُمْ تَفَسَّحُوا فِي الْمَجَالِسِ فَافْسَحُوا يَفْسَحِ اللَّهُ لَكُمْ ۖ وَإِذَا قِيلَ انْشُزُوا فَانْشُزُوا يَرْفَعِ اللَّهُ الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا مِنْكُمْ وَالَّذِينَ أُوتُوا الْعِلْمَ دَرَجَاتٍ ۚ وَاللَّهُ بِمَا تَعْمَلُونَ خَبِيرٌ

translation: O you who believe, when you consult the Messenger in private, give something in charity before your consultation; that is better for you and more conducive to purity. But if you do not have the means, then Allah is All-Forgiving, Most Merciful.
arabic: يَا أَيُّهَا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا إِذَا نَاجَيْتُمُ الرَّسُولَ فَقَدِّمُوا بَيْنَ يَدَيْ نَجْوَاكُمْ صَدَقَةً ۚ ذَٰلِكَ خَيْرٌ لَكُمْ وَأَطْهَرُ ۚ فَإِنْ لَمْ تَجِدُوا فَإِنَّ اللَّهَ غَفُورٌ رَحِيمٌ

translation: Are you afraid of giving charities before your consultations with him? If you are unable to do so, and Allah has pardoned you, then establish prayer and give zakah, and obey Allah and His Messenger. And Allah is All-Aware of what you do.
arabic: أَأَشْفَقْتُمْ أَنْ تُقَدِّمُوا بَيْنَ يَدَيْ نَجْوَاكُمْ صَدَقَاتٍ ۚ فَإِذْ لَمْ تَفْعَلُوا وَتَابَ اللَّهُ عَلَيْكُمْ فَأَقِيمُوا الصَّلَاةَ وَآتُوا الزَّكَاةَ وَأَطِيعُوا اللَّهَ وَرَسُولَهُ ۚ وَاللَّهُ خَبِيرٌ بِمَا تَعْمَلُونَ

translation: Do you not see those [hypocrites] who take as allies people who have incurred Allah’s wrath? They are neither of you nor of them, and they swear falsely while they know.
arabic: ۞ أَلَمْ تَرَ إِلَى الَّذِينَ تَوَلَّوْا قَوْمًا غَضِبَ اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِمْ مَا هُمْ مِنْكُمْ وَلَا مِنْهُمْ وَيَحْلِفُونَ عَلَى الْكَذِبِ وَهُمْ يَعْلَمُونَ

translation: Allah has prepared for them a severe punishment. Evil is indeed what they do.
arabic: أَعَدَّ اللَّهُ لَهُمْ عَذَابًا شَدِيدًا ۖ إِنَّهُمْ سَاءَ مَا كَانُوا يَعْمَلُونَ

translation: They have taken their oaths as a shield, in order to hinder people from the way of Allah. For them there will be a humiliating punishment.
arabic: اتَّخَذُوا أَيْمَانَهُمْ جُنَّةً فَصَدُّوا عَنْ سَبِيلِ اللَّهِ فَلَهُمْ عَذَابٌ مُهِينٌ

translation: Neither their wealth nor their children will avail them anything against Allah. They are the people of the Fire; they will abide therein forever.
arabic: لَنْ تُغْنِيَ عَنْهُمْ أَمْوَالُهُمْ وَلَا أَوْلَادُهُمْ مِنَ اللَّهِ شَيْئًا ۚ أُولَٰئِكَ أَصْحَابُ النَّارِ ۖ هُمْ فِيهَا خَالِدُونَ

translation: On the Day when Allah will raise them all, they will swear to Him as they swear to you, thinking that they have something to stand on[8]. Indeed, it is they who are the liars.
footnotes: [8] Thinking that their lies will be believed and that they will escape punishment.
arabic: يَوْمَ يَبْعَثُهُمُ اللَّهُ جَمِيعًا فَيَحْلِفُونَ لَهُ كَمَا يَحْلِفُونَ لَكُمْ ۖ وَيَحْسَبُونَ أَنَّهُمْ عَلَىٰ شَيْءٍ ۚ أَلَا إِنَّهُمْ هُمُ الْكَاذِبُونَ

translation: Satan has taken hold of them and has thus caused them to forget the remembrance of Allah. They are the party of Satan. Indeed, the party of Satan will be the losers.
arabic: اسْتَحْوَذَ عَلَيْهِمُ الشَّيْطَانُ فَأَنْسَاهُمْ ذِكْرَ اللَّهِ ۚ أُولَٰئِكَ حِزْبُ الشَّيْطَانِ ۚ أَلَا إِنَّ حِزْبَ الشَّيْطَانِ هُمُ الْخَاسِرُونَ

translation: Indeed, those who oppose Allah and His Messenger, they are among the most debased.
arabic: إِنَّ الَّذِينَ يُحَادُّونَ اللَّهَ وَرَسُولَهُ أُولَٰئِكَ فِي الْأَذَلِّينَ

translation: Allah has decreed, “I and My messengers will surely prevail.” Indeed, Allah is All-Powerful, All-Mighty.
arabic: كَتَبَ اللَّهُ لَأَغْلِبَنَّ أَنَا وَرُسُلِي ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ قَوِيٌّ عَزِيزٌ

translation: You will not find any people who believe in Allah and the Last Day taking as allies those who oppose Allah and His Messenger, even if they were their parents, their children, their brothers, or their kindred. It is they in whose hearts Allah has instilled faith and strengthened them with a spirit[9] from Him. He will admit them to gardens under which rivers flow, abiding therein forever. Allah is pleased with them and they are pleased with Allah. They are the party of Allah. Indeed, it is the party of Allah that will be successful.
footnotes: [9] Spirit here means His revelation, light, or His help.
arabic: لَا تَجِدُ قَوْمًا يُؤْمِنُونَ بِاللَّهِ وَالْيَوْمِ الْآخِرِ يُوَادُّونَ مَنْ حَادَّ اللَّهَ وَرَسُولَهُ وَلَوْ كَانُوا آبَاءَهُمْ أَوْ أَبْنَاءَهُمْ أَوْ إِخْوَانَهُمْ أَوْ عَشِيرَتَهُمْ ۚ أُولَٰئِكَ كَتَبَ فِي قُلُوبِهِمُ الْإِيمَانَ وَأَيَّدَهُمْ بِرُوحٍ مِنْهُ ۖ وَيُدْخِلُهُمْ جَنَّاتٍ تَجْرِي مِنْ تَحْتِهَا الْأَنْهَارُ خَالِدِينَ فِيهَا ۚ رَضِيَ اللَّهُ عَنْهُمْ وَرَضُوا عَنْهُ ۚ أُولَٰئِكَ حِزْبُ اللَّهِ ۚ أَلَا إِنَّ حِزْبَ اللَّهِ هُمُ الْمُفْلِحُونَ

translation: All that is in the heavens and all that is on earth glorifies Allah, for He is the All-Mighty, the All-Wise.
arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ سَبَّحَ لِلَّهِ مَا فِي السَّمَاوَاتِ وَمَا فِي الْأَرْضِ ۖ وَهُوَ الْعَزِيزُ الْحَكِيمُ

translation: It is He Who expelled the disbelievers of the People of the Book[1] from their homes as the first banishment[2]. You did not think that they would leave, and they thought that their fortresses would protect them from Allah. But [the punishment of] Allah came upon them from where they did not expect and He cast dread in their hearts, destroying their homes with their own hands[3] and the hands of the believers. So take a lesson, O you people of insight.
footnotes:
[1] It refers to the Jews of Banū Nadīr, who broke their pact with the Prophet (ﷺ).
 [2] This was the first time ever that they were gathered and expelled from Madinah to the Levant.
 [3] In order that the believers do not benefit from their homes.
arabic: هُوَ الَّذِي أَخْرَجَ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا مِنْ أَهْلِ الْكِتَابِ مِنْ دِيَارِهِمْ لِأَوَّلِ الْحَشْرِ ۚ مَا ظَنَنْتُمْ أَنْ يَخْرُجُوا ۖ وَظَنُّوا أَنَّهُمْ مَانِعَتُهُمْ حُصُونُهُمْ مِنَ اللَّهِ فَأَتَاهُمُ اللَّهُ مِنْ حَيْثُ لَمْ يَحْتَسِبُوا ۖ وَقَذَفَ فِي قُلُوبِهِمُ الرُّعْبَ ۚ يُخْرِبُونَ بُيُوتَهُمْ بِأَيْدِيهِمْ وَأَيْدِي الْمُؤْمِنِينَ فَاعْتَبِرُوا يَا أُولِي الْأَبْصَارِ

translation: Had Allah not decreed exile for them, He would have surely punished them in this world. And in the Hereafter, there will be for them the punishment of the Fire.
arabic: وَلَوْلَا أَنْ كَتَبَ اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِمُ الْجَلَاءَ لَعَذَّبَهُمْ فِي الدُّنْيَا ۖ وَلَهُمْ فِي الْآخِرَةِ عَذَابُ النَّارِ

translation: That is because they opposed Allah and His Messenger. And whoever opposes Allah, Allah is truly severe in punishment.
arabic: ذَٰلِكَ بِأَنَّهُمْ شَاقُّوا اللَّهَ وَرَسُولَهُ ۖ وَمَنْ يُشَاقِّ اللَّهَ فَإِنَّ اللَّهَ شَدِيدُ الْعِقَابِ

translation: Whatever palm trees you cut down[4] or left standing on their trunks[5], it was by Allah’s Will, so that He might disgrace the evildoers[6].
footnotes:
[4] To enrage the enemies of Allah.
 [5] To benefit from them.
 [6] When the Muslim army was about to enter the fort of Banū Nadīr, they cut down some of their palm trees, so the Jews were terrified and alleged that this was corruption. So the Muslims disagreed about it; some of them said not to cut the trees, for these are gains that Allah has bestowed upon us, while some others said that we cut them off to enrage them. Hence, this verse was revealed to appease both parties of the Muslims, proclaiming that all this happened by the will of Allah. They were treated as such for their betrayal as they broke their pact with the Prophet (ﷺ).
arabic: مَا قَطَعْتُمْ مِنْ لِينَةٍ أَوْ تَرَكْتُمُوهَا قَائِمَةً عَلَىٰ أُصُولِهَا فَبِإِذْنِ اللَّهِ وَلِيُخْزِيَ الْفَاسِقِينَ

translation: Whatever gains Allah has bestowed upon His Messenger from them, you did not spur on any horses or camels for that[7], but Allah gives authority to His messengers over whom He wills, and Allah is Most Capable of all things.
footnotes: [7] i.e., they went through no hardship (i.e., war) to gain it.
arabic: وَمَا أَفَاءَ اللَّهُ عَلَىٰ رَسُولِهِ مِنْهُمْ فَمَا أَوْجَفْتُمْ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ خَيْلٍ وَلَا رِكَابٍ وَلَٰكِنَّ اللَّهَ يُسَلِّطُ رُسُلَهُ عَلَىٰ مَنْ يَشَاءُ ۚ وَاللَّهُ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيرٌ

translation: Whatever gains Allah has bestowed upon His Messenger from the people of the towns belongs to Allah and the Messenger, and to his close relatives[8], orphans, the needy, and stranded wayfarers[9], so that wealth should not circulate only among those of you who are rich. Whatever the Messenger gives you, accept it, and whatever he forbids you, refrain from it. And fear Allah; indeed, Allah is severe in punishment.
footnotes:
[8] Those of Banū Hāshim and Banū Muttalib, the close relatives of the Prophet (ﷺ), as compensation for them being prohibited from accepting zakah.
 [9] This ruling concerning properties abandoned by disbelievers without engaging in war varies from that in Surat al-Anfāl, verse 41, which refers to spoils of war in which four-fifths is distributed among those believers who participated in the war.
arabic: مَا أَفَاءَ اللَّهُ عَلَىٰ رَسُولِهِ مِنْ أَهْلِ الْقُرَىٰ فَلِلَّهِ وَلِلرَّسُولِ وَلِذِي الْقُرْبَىٰ وَالْيَتَامَىٰ وَالْمَسَاكِينِ وَابْنِ السَّبِيلِ كَيْ لَا يَكُونَ دُولَةً بَيْنَ الْأَغْنِيَاءِ مِنْكُمْ ۚ وَمَا آتَاكُمُ الرَّسُولُ فَخُذُوهُ وَمَا نَهَاكُمْ عَنْهُ فَانْتَهُوا ۚ وَاتَّقُوا اللَّهَ ۖ إِنَّ اللَّهَ شَدِيدُ الْعِقَابِ

translation: For the poor emigrants [there is a due share] who were driven out of their homes and their properties, seeking Allah’s bounty and pleasure, and helping the cause of Allah and His Messenger. It is they who are the truthful.
arabic: لِلْفُقَرَاءِ الْمُهَاجِرِينَ الَّذِينَ أُخْرِجُوا مِنْ دِيَارِهِمْ وَأَمْوَالِهِمْ يَبْتَغُونَ فَضْلًا مِنَ اللَّهِ وَرِضْوَانًا وَيَنْصُرُونَ اللَّهَ وَرَسُولَهُ ۚ أُولَٰئِكَ هُمُ الصَّادِقُونَ

translation: As for those who were settled in the city [of Madinah][10] and embraced Islam before them, they love those who migrated to them and find no covetous desire in their hearts for what they were given. Rather they give them preference over themselves even though they may be in dire need. Whoever is protected from the covetousness of their souls, it is they who are successful.
footnotes: [10] Referring to the dwellers of Madinah, Ansār (the Helpers) who helped the believers and the Islamic cause since the inception of the Prophet’s mission.
arabic: وَالَّذِينَ تَبَوَّءُوا الدَّارَ وَالْإِيمَانَ مِنْ قَبْلِهِمْ يُحِبُّونَ مَنْ هَاجَرَ إِلَيْهِمْ وَلَا يَجِدُونَ فِي صُدُورِهِمْ حَاجَةً مِمَّا أُوتُوا وَيُؤْثِرُونَ عَلَىٰ أَنْفُسِهِمْ وَلَوْ كَانَ بِهِمْ خَصَاصَةٌ ۚ وَمَنْ يُوقَ شُحَّ نَفْسِهِ فَأُولَٰئِكَ هُمُ الْمُفْلِحُونَ

translation: And those who came after them say, “Our Lord, forgive us and our brethren who preceded us in faith, and do not let there be any ill feelings in our hearts towards those who believe. Our Lord, indeed, You are All-Gracious, Most Merciful.”
arabic: وَالَّذِينَ جَاءُوا مِنْ بَعْدِهِمْ يَقُولُونَ رَبَّنَا اغْفِرْ لَنَا وَلِإِخْوَانِنَا الَّذِينَ سَبَقُونَا بِالْإِيمَانِ وَلَا تَجْعَلْ فِي قُلُوبِنَا غِلًّا لِلَّذِينَ آمَنُوا رَبَّنَا إِنَّكَ رَءُوفٌ رَحِيمٌ

translation: Have you not seen the hypocrites who say to their fellow disbelievers from the People of the Book[11], “If you are expelled, we will surely leave with you, and we will never obey anyone concerning you, and if you are attacked, we will surely come to your aid.” But Allah bears witness that they are truly liars.
footnotes: [11] i.e., the Jews of Banu Nadīr.
arabic: ۞ أَلَمْ تَرَ إِلَى الَّذِينَ نَافَقُوا يَقُولُونَ لِإِخْوَانِهِمُ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا مِنْ أَهْلِ الْكِتَابِ لَئِنْ أُخْرِجْتُمْ لَنَخْرُجَنَّ مَعَكُمْ وَلَا نُطِيعُ فِيكُمْ أَحَدًا أَبَدًا وَإِنْ قُوتِلْتُمْ لَنَنْصُرَنَّكُمْ وَاللَّهُ يَشْهَدُ إِنَّهُمْ لَكَاذِبُونَ

translation: If they are expelled, they will not leave with them, and if they are attacked, they will not come to their aid. Even if they come to their help, they will certainly turn and flee, then they will not be helped.
arabic: لَئِنْ أُخْرِجُوا لَا يَخْرُجُونَ مَعَهُمْ وَلَئِنْ قُوتِلُوا لَا يَنْصُرُونَهُمْ وَلَئِنْ نَصَرُوهُمْ لَيُوَلُّنَّ الْأَدْبَارَ ثُمَّ لَا يُنْصَرُونَ

translation: Indeed, your fear in their hearts is greater than their fear of Allah. That is because they are a people devoid of understanding.
arabic: لَأَنْتُمْ أَشَدُّ رَهْبَةً فِي صُدُورِهِمْ مِنَ اللَّهِ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ بِأَنَّهُمْ قَوْمٌ لَا يَفْقَهُونَ

translation: They will not fight you all together but in fortified towns or from behind walls. Their valor among themselves is great; you think they are united, but their hearts are divided. That is because they are people who do not understand.
arabic: لَا يُقَاتِلُونَكُمْ جَمِيعًا إِلَّا فِي قُرًى مُحَصَّنَةٍ أَوْ مِنْ وَرَاءِ جُدُرٍ ۚ بَأْسُهُمْ بَيْنَهُمْ شَدِيدٌ ۚ تَحْسَبُهُمْ جَمِيعًا وَقُلُوبُهُمْ شَتَّىٰ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ بِأَنَّهُمْ قَوْمٌ لَا يَعْقِلُونَ

translation: They are like those who were shortly before them[12], who tasted the evil consequence of their deeds, and for them there will be a painful punishment.
footnotes: [12] Referring to the defeat of the pagans of Makkah at the Battle of Badr or the exile of the Jews of Banu Qaynuqā‘.
arabic: كَمَثَلِ الَّذِينَ مِنْ قَبْلِهِمْ قَرِيبًا ۖ ذَاقُوا وَبَالَ أَمْرِهِمْ وَلَهُمْ عَذَابٌ أَلِيمٌ

translation: They are like Satan when he says to man, “Disbelieve,” then when he disbelieves, he says, “I have nothing to do with you. I surely fear Allah, the Lord of the worlds.”
arabic: كَمَثَلِ الشَّيْطَانِ إِذْ قَالَ لِلْإِنْسَانِ اكْفُرْ فَلَمَّا كَفَرَ قَالَ إِنِّي بَرِيءٌ مِنْكَ إِنِّي أَخَافُ اللَّهَ رَبَّ الْعَالَمِينَ

translation: So they will both end up in the Fire, abiding therein forever. That is the recompense of the wrongdoers.
arabic: فَكَانَ عَاقِبَتَهُمَا أَنَّهُمَا فِي النَّارِ خَالِدَيْنِ فِيهَا ۚ وَذَٰلِكَ جَزَاءُ الظَّالِمِينَ

translation: O you who believe, fear Allah, and let every soul consider what it has sent forth for tomorrow[13]. And fear Allah. Indeed, Allah is All-Aware of what you do.
footnotes: [13] i.e., for the Hereafter.
arabic: يَا أَيُّهَا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا اتَّقُوا اللَّهَ وَلْتَنْظُرْ نَفْسٌ مَا قَدَّمَتْ لِغَدٍ ۖ وَاتَّقُوا اللَّهَ ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ خَبِيرٌ بِمَا تَعْمَلُونَ

translation: Do not be like those who forgot Allah, so He made them forget themselves. It is they who are the evildoers.
arabic: وَلَا تَكُونُوا كَالَّذِينَ نَسُوا اللَّهَ فَأَنْسَاهُمْ أَنْفُسَهُمْ ۚ أُولَٰئِكَ هُمُ الْفَاسِقُونَ

translation: The people of Hell and the people of Paradise are not equal. It is the people of Paradise who will triumph.
arabic: لَا يَسْتَوِي أَصْحَابُ النَّارِ وَأَصْحَابُ الْجَنَّةِ ۚ أَصْحَابُ الْجَنَّةِ هُمُ الْفَائِزُونَ

translation: Had We sent down this Qur’an upon a mountain, you would have seen it humbled and break asunder out of awe of Allah[14]. Such are the similitudes We set forth for people so that they may reflect.
footnotes: [14] i.e., The disbelievers’ hearts are harder than the mountains in regard to the Qur’an.
arabic: لَوْ أَنْزَلْنَا هَٰذَا الْقُرْآنَ عَلَىٰ جَبَلٍ لَرَأَيْتَهُ خَاشِعًا مُتَصَدِّعًا مِنْ خَشْيَةِ اللَّهِ ۚ وَتِلْكَ الْأَمْثَالُ نَضْرِبُهَا لِلنَّاسِ لَعَلَّهُمْ يَتَفَكَّرُونَ

translation: He is Allah; none has the right to be worshiped except Him, Knower of the unseen and the seen; He is the Most Compassionate, the Most Merciful.
arabic: هُوَ اللَّهُ الَّذِي لَا إِلَٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ ۖ عَالِمُ الْغَيْبِ وَالشَّهَادَةِ ۖ هُوَ الرَّحْمَٰنُ الرَّحِيمُ

translation: He is Allah; none has the right to be worshiped except Him, the Sovereign[15], the Most Holy[16], the Most Perfect[17], the Granter of Security[18], the Watcher over all, the All-Mighty, the Compeller[19], the Supreme[20]. Glory be to Allah far above what they associate with Him.
footnotes:
[15] i.e., the Owner of everything in existence.
 [16] i.e., Transcendent above any imperfection and attributes related to His creation.
 [17] Lit., "Free" from any fault. It also means, "Peace" or "Soundness."
 [18] And grants safety; reassurance; bestows faith.
 [19] Who compels the creation according to His will. Also, "the Amender" or "the Rectifier" Who restores, or sets something right once again.
 [20] i.e., the Complete and Perfect in His essence, attributes, and actions.
arabic: هُوَ اللَّهُ الَّذِي لَا إِلَٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ الْمَلِكُ الْقُدُّوسُ السَّلَامُ الْمُؤْمِنُ الْمُهَيْمِنُ الْعَزِيزُ الْجَبَّارُ الْمُتَكَبِّرُ ۚ سُبْحَانَ اللَّهِ عَمَّا يُشْرِكُونَ

translation: He is Allah, the Creator[21], the Maker[22], the Fashioner[23]. He has the most beautiful names. All that is in the heavens and earth glorifies Him, for He is the All-Mighty, the All-Wise.
footnotes:
[21] i.e., the Creator of everything. [22] i.e., the Inventor of everything.
 [23] i.e., He Who gave everything its form.
arabic: هُوَ اللَّهُ الْخَالِقُ الْبَارِئُ الْمُصَوِّرُ ۖ لَهُ الْأَسْمَاءُ الْحُسْنَىٰ ۚ يُسَبِّحُ لَهُ مَا فِي السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ ۖ وَهُوَ الْعَزِيزُ الْحَكِيمُ

translation: O you who believe, do not take My enemies and your enemies as allies, offering them friendship even though they rejected the truth that has come to you, and they have driven out the Messenger and yourselves [from Makkah] simply because you believe in Allah, your Lord – if you have emigrated[1] to struggle in My cause and seek My pleasure. How can you disclose secrets [of the believers], showing them friendship, when I know best all that you conceal and all that you reveal? Whoever among you does that has truly strayed from the straight path.
footnotes: [1] From Makkah.
arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ يَا أَيُّهَا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا لَا تَتَّخِذُوا عَدُوِّي وَعَدُوَّكُمْ أَوْلِيَاءَ تُلْقُونَ إِلَيْهِمْ بِالْمَوَدَّةِ وَقَدْ كَفَرُوا بِمَا جَاءَكُمْ مِنَ الْحَقِّ يُخْرِجُونَ الرَّسُولَ وَإِيَّاكُمْ ۙ أَنْ تُؤْمِنُوا بِاللَّهِ رَبِّكُمْ إِنْ كُنْتُمْ خَرَجْتُمْ جِهَادًا فِي سَبِيلِي وَابْتِغَاءَ مَرْضَاتِي ۚ تُسِرُّونَ إِلَيْهِمْ بِالْمَوَدَّةِ وَأَنَا أَعْلَمُ بِمَا أَخْفَيْتُمْ وَمَا أَعْلَنْتُمْ ۚ وَمَنْ يَفْعَلْهُ مِنْكُمْ فَقَدْ ضَلَّ سَوَاءَ السَّبِيلِ

translation: If they gain the upper hand over you, they would be your [open] enemies and would stretch their hands and tongues towards you to harm you, and they wish that you too would disbelieve.
arabic: إِنْ يَثْقَفُوكُمْ يَكُونُوا لَكُمْ أَعْدَاءً وَيَبْسُطُوا إِلَيْكُمْ أَيْدِيَهُمْ وَأَلْسِنَتَهُمْ بِالسُّوءِ وَوَدُّوا لَوْ تَكْفُرُونَ

translation: Neither your relatives nor your children will benefit you on the Day of Resurrection; He will judge between you, and Allah is All-Seeing of what you do.
arabic: لَنْ تَنْفَعَكُمْ أَرْحَامُكُمْ وَلَا أَوْلَادُكُمْ ۚ يَوْمَ الْقِيَامَةِ يَفْصِلُ بَيْنَكُمْ ۚ وَاللَّهُ بِمَا تَعْمَلُونَ بَصِيرٌ

translation: Indeed, you have a good example[2] in Abraham and those with him, when they said to their people, “We dissociate ourselves from you and whatever you worship besides Allah. We renounce you, and the enmity and hatred have arisen between us and you forever until you believe in Allah alone”, except for Abraham when he said to his father, “I will seek forgiveness for you, but I cannot protect you from Allah in the least.” “Our Lord, in You we put our trust and to You we turn, and to You is the final return.”
footnotes: [2] To be followed.
arabic: قَدْ كَانَتْ لَكُمْ أُسْوَةٌ حَسَنَةٌ فِي إِبْرَاهِيمَ وَالَّذِينَ مَعَهُ إِذْ قَالُوا لِقَوْمِهِمْ إِنَّا بُرَآءُ مِنْكُمْ وَمِمَّا تَعْبُدُونَ مِنْ دُونِ اللَّهِ كَفَرْنَا بِكُمْ وَبَدَا بَيْنَنَا وَبَيْنَكُمُ الْعَدَاوَةُ وَالْبَغْضَاءُ أَبَدًا حَتَّىٰ تُؤْمِنُوا بِاللَّهِ وَحْدَهُ إِلَّا قَوْلَ إِبْرَاهِيمَ لِأَبِيهِ لَأَسْتَغْفِرَنَّ لَكَ وَمَا أَمْلِكُ لَكَ مِنَ اللَّهِ مِنْ شَيْءٍ ۖ رَبَّنَا عَلَيْكَ تَوَكَّلْنَا وَإِلَيْكَ أَنَبْنَا وَإِلَيْكَ الْمَصِيرُ

translation: Our Lord, do not make us subject to the persecution of those who disbelieve; and forgive us, our Lord. Indeed, You are the All-Mighty, the All-Wise.”
arabic: رَبَّنَا لَا تَجْعَلْنَا فِتْنَةً لِلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا وَاغْفِرْ لَنَا رَبَّنَا ۖ إِنَّكَ أَنْتَ الْعَزِيزُ الْحَكِيمُ

translation: You certainly have a good example in them, for those who look forward with hope to Allah and the Last Day. But whoever turns away, Allah is indeed the Self-Sufficient, the Praiseworthy.
arabic: لَقَدْ كَانَ لَكُمْ فِيهِمْ أُسْوَةٌ حَسَنَةٌ لِمَنْ كَانَ يَرْجُو اللَّهَ وَالْيَوْمَ الْآخِرَ ۚ وَمَنْ يَتَوَلَّ فَإِنَّ اللَّهَ هُوَ الْغَنِيُّ الْحَمِيدُ

translation: It may be that Allah will bring about affection between you and those of them whom you hold as enemies. Allah is Most Capable[3], and Allah is All-Forgiving, Most Merciful.
footnotes: [3] To accomplish this or whatever He wills.
arabic: ۞ عَسَى اللَّهُ أَنْ يَجْعَلَ بَيْنَكُمْ وَبَيْنَ الَّذِينَ عَادَيْتُمْ مِنْهُمْ مَوَدَّةً ۚ وَاللَّهُ قَدِيرٌ ۚ وَاللَّهُ غَفُورٌ رَحِيمٌ

translation: Allah does not forbid you from being kind and just to those who did not fight against you nor did they drive you out of your homes. Indeed, Allah loves those who are just.
arabic: لَا يَنْهَاكُمُ اللَّهُ عَنِ الَّذِينَ لَمْ يُقَاتِلُوكُمْ فِي الدِّينِ وَلَمْ يُخْرِجُوكُمْ مِنْ دِيَارِكُمْ أَنْ تَبَرُّوهُمْ وَتُقْسِطُوا إِلَيْهِمْ ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ يُحِبُّ الْمُقْسِطِينَ

translation: Allah only forbids you from taking as allies those who fought against you on account of your religion and drove you out of your homes or helped others in driving you out. Whoever takes them as allies, it is they who are the wrongdoers.
arabic: إِنَّمَا يَنْهَاكُمُ اللَّهُ عَنِ الَّذِينَ قَاتَلُوكُمْ فِي الدِّينِ وَأَخْرَجُوكُمْ مِنْ دِيَارِكُمْ وَظَاهَرُوا عَلَىٰ إِخْرَاجِكُمْ أَنْ تَوَلَّوْهُمْ ۚ وَمَنْ يَتَوَلَّهُمْ فَأُولَٰئِكَ هُمُ الظَّالِمُونَ

translation: O you who believe, when the believing women come to you as migrants, test their sincerity, although Allah knows best about their faith. Then if you find them to be believers, do not send them back to the disbelievers; they are not lawful [wives] for them, nor are they lawful [husbands] for them. But give the disbelievers whatever [dowries] they have spent[4]. And there is no blame on you if you marry them, as long as you give them their dowries. Do not hold on to the marriage ties with the disbelieving women[5]; ask for repayment of whatever [dowries] you have spent, and let the disbelievers ask for repayment of whatever [dowries] they have spent[6]. This is the ruling of Allah that He judges between you, and Allah is All-Knowing, All-Wise.
footnotes:
[4] i.e., compensate for their loss. [5] i.e., do not stop them from joining the disbelievers.
 [6] If a disbelieving wife opted to join the disbelievers, a Muslim husband could demand in return the equivalent of her dowries. Similarly, the disbelievers had a similar right if a believing woman joined the Muslims. This and the following verses were revealed after the Treaty of al-Hudaybiyyah.
arabic: يَا أَيُّهَا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا إِذَا جَاءَكُمُ الْمُؤْمِنَاتُ مُهَاجِرَاتٍ فَامْتَحِنُوهُنَّ ۖ اللَّهُ أَعْلَمُ بِإِيمَانِهِنَّ ۖ فَإِنْ عَلِمْتُمُوهُنَّ مُؤْمِنَاتٍ فَلَا تَرْجِعُوهُنَّ إِلَى الْكُفَّارِ ۖ لَا هُنَّ حِلٌّ لَهُمْ وَلَا هُمْ يَحِلُّونَ لَهُنَّ ۖ وَآتُوهُمْ مَا أَنْفَقُوا ۚ وَلَا جُنَاحَ عَلَيْكُمْ أَنْ تَنْكِحُوهُنَّ إِذَا آتَيْتُمُوهُنَّ أُجُورَهُنَّ ۚ وَلَا تُمْسِكُوا بِعِصَمِ الْكَوَافِرِ وَاسْأَلُوا مَا أَنْفَقْتُمْ وَلْيَسْأَلُوا مَا أَنْفَقُوا ۚ ذَٰلِكُمْ حُكْمُ اللَّهِ ۖ يَحْكُمُ بَيْنَكُمْ ۚ وَاللَّهُ عَلِيمٌ حَكِيمٌ

translation: If any of your wives desert you and join the disbelievers [without returning your dowries], and later you take spoils from them, then give to those whose wives have deserted them the equivalent of what they had spent. And fear Allah, in Whom you believe.
arabic: وَإِنْ فَاتَكُمْ شَيْءٌ مِنْ أَزْوَاجِكُمْ إِلَى الْكُفَّارِ فَعَاقَبْتُمْ فَآتُوا الَّذِينَ ذَهَبَتْ أَزْوَاجُهُمْ مِثْلَ مَا أَنْفَقُوا ۚ وَاتَّقُوا اللَّهَ الَّذِي أَنْتُمْ بِهِ مُؤْمِنُونَ

translation: O Prophet, when the believing women come to you, pledging to you that they will not associate anything with Allah, that they will not steal, that they will not commit fornication, that they will not kill their children, that they will not falsely attribute [illegitimate] children to their husbands between their arms and their legs[7], that they will not disobey you in what is right, then accept their pledge and ask Allah to forgive them. Indeed, Allah is All-Forgiving, Most Merciful.
footnotes: [7] It is alluding to falsely attributing a child, whether adopted or born of adultery, to the husband.
arabic: يَا أَيُّهَا النَّبِيُّ إِذَا جَاءَكَ الْمُؤْمِنَاتُ يُبَايِعْنَكَ عَلَىٰ أَنْ لَا يُشْرِكْنَ بِاللَّهِ شَيْئًا وَلَا يَسْرِقْنَ وَلَا يَزْنِينَ وَلَا يَقْتُلْنَ أَوْلَادَهُنَّ وَلَا يَأْتِينَ بِبُهْتَانٍ يَفْتَرِينَهُ بَيْنَ أَيْدِيهِنَّ وَأَرْجُلِهِنَّ وَلَا يَعْصِينَكَ فِي مَعْرُوفٍ ۙ فَبَايِعْهُنَّ وَاسْتَغْفِرْ لَهُنَّ اللَّهَ ۖ إِنَّ اللَّهَ غَفُورٌ رَحِيمٌ

translation: O you who believe, do not take as allies a people whom Allah is displeased with. They have lost hope in the Hereafter, just as the disbelievers have lost hope in those who are in the graves.
arabic: يَا أَيُّهَا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا لَا تَتَوَلَّوْا قَوْمًا غَضِبَ اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِمْ قَدْ يَئِسُوا مِنَ الْآخِرَةِ كَمَا يَئِسَ الْكُفَّارُ مِنْ أَصْحَابِ الْقُبُورِ

translation: All that is in the heavens and all that is on earth glorifies Allah, for He is the All-Mighty, the All-Wise.
arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ سَبَّحَ لِلَّهِ مَا فِي السَّمَاوَاتِ وَمَا فِي الْأَرْضِ ۖ وَهُوَ الْعَزِيزُ الْحَكِيمُ

translation: O you who believe, why do you say what you do not do?
arabic: يَا أَيُّهَا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا لِمَ تَقُولُونَ مَا لَا تَفْعَلُونَ

translation: It is most loathsome to Allah that you say what you do not do.
arabic: كَبُرَ مَقْتًا عِنْدَ اللَّهِ أَنْ تَقُولُوا مَا لَا تَفْعَلُونَ

translation: Indeed, Allah loves those who fight in His way in firm ranks, as if they were a solid structure.
arabic: إِنَّ اللَّهَ يُحِبُّ الَّذِينَ يُقَاتِلُونَ فِي سَبِيلِهِ صَفًّا كَأَنَّهُمْ بُنْيَانٌ مَرْصُوصٌ

translation: And [remember] when Moses said to his people, “O my people, why do you hurt me when you know that I am a messenger of Allah to you?” So when they chose to deviate, Allah caused their hearts to deviate, for Allah does not guide the rebellious people.
arabic: وَإِذْ قَالَ مُوسَىٰ لِقَوْمِهِ يَا قَوْمِ لِمَ تُؤْذُونَنِي وَقَدْ تَعْلَمُونَ أَنِّي رَسُولُ اللَّهِ إِلَيْكُمْ ۖ فَلَمَّا زَاغُوا أَزَاغَ اللَّهُ قُلُوبَهُمْ ۚ وَاللَّهُ لَا يَهْدِي الْقَوْمَ الْفَاسِقِينَ
