translation: And [remember] when Jesus, son of Mary, said, “O Children of Israel, I am truly a messenger of Allah to you, confirming the Torah which came before me, and giving glad tidings of a messenger after me whose name will be Ahmad[1].” But when he came to them with clear proofs, they said, “This is clear magic.”
footnotes: [1] Another name of Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ). Both are derived from "hamd" which means praise. Some scholars believe that this verse refers to John 14:16, where Jesus says: “And I will ask the Father, and he will give you another Paraclete, to be with you forever.” Paraclete in Greek means ‘the praised one.’ Prophet Muhammad's (ﷺ) name is mentioned several times in the Gospel of Barnabas, which the Christian authorities deem as apocryphal Bible.
arabic: وَإِذْ قَالَ عِيسَى ابْنُ مَرْيَمَ يَا بَنِي إِسْرَائِيلَ إِنِّي رَسُولُ اللَّهِ إِلَيْكُمْ مُصَدِّقًا لِمَا بَيْنَ يَدَيَّ مِنَ التَّوْرَاةِ وَمُبَشِّرًا بِرَسُولٍ يَأْتِي مِنْ بَعْدِي اسْمُهُ أَحْمَدُ ۖ فَلَمَّا جَاءَهُمْ بِالْبَيِّنَاتِ قَالُوا هَٰذَا سِحْرٌ مُبِينٌ

translation: Who could be more wrong than the one who fabricates lies against Allah when invited to Islam? And Allah does not guide the wrongdoing people.
arabic: وَمَنْ أَظْلَمُ مِمَّنِ افْتَرَىٰ عَلَى اللَّهِ الْكَذِبَ وَهُوَ يُدْعَىٰ إِلَى الْإِسْلَامِ ۚ وَاللَّهُ لَا يَهْدِي الْقَوْمَ الظَّالِمِينَ

translation: They wish to extinguish the light of Allah with their mouths, but Allah will complete His light, even though the disbelievers dislike it.
arabic: يُرِيدُونَ لِيُطْفِئُوا نُورَ اللَّهِ بِأَفْوَاهِهِمْ وَاللَّهُ مُتِمُّ نُورِهِ وَلَوْ كَرِهَ الْكَافِرُونَ

translation: It is He Who has sent His Messenger with guidance and the religion of truth, so that He may make it prevail over all religions, even though the polytheists may dislike it.
arabic: هُوَ الَّذِي أَرْسَلَ رَسُولَهُ بِالْهُدَىٰ وَدِينِ الْحَقِّ لِيُظْهِرَهُ عَلَى الدِّينِ كُلِّهِ وَلَوْ كَرِهَ الْمُشْرِكُونَ

translation: O you who believe, shall I tell you about a trade that will save you from a painful punishment?
arabic: يَا أَيُّهَا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا هَلْ أَدُلُّكُمْ عَلَىٰ تِجَارَةٍ تُنْجِيكُمْ مِنْ عَذَابٍ أَلِيمٍ

translation: It is to believe in Allah and His Messenger and to struggle in the way of Allah with your wealth and your lives. That is better for you, if only you knew.
arabic: تُؤْمِنُونَ بِاللَّهِ وَرَسُولِهِ وَتُجَاهِدُونَ فِي سَبِيلِ اللَّهِ بِأَمْوَالِكُمْ وَأَنْفُسِكُمْ ۚ ذَٰلِكُمْ خَيْرٌ لَكُمْ إِنْ كُنْتُمْ تَعْلَمُونَ

translation: He will forgive you your sins and admit you to gardens under which rivers flow, and pleasant dwellings in Gardens of Eternity. That is the supreme triumph.
arabic: يَغْفِرْ لَكُمْ ذُنُوبَكُمْ وَيُدْخِلْكُمْ جَنَّاتٍ تَجْرِي مِنْ تَحْتِهَا الْأَنْهَارُ وَمَسَاكِنَ طَيِّبَةً فِي جَنَّاتِ عَدْنٍ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ الْفَوْزُ الْعَظِيمُ

translation: And [He will grant you] another favor that you love: help from Allah [against your enemies] and an imminent conquest. Give glad tidings to the believers.
arabic: وَأُخْرَىٰ تُحِبُّونَهَا ۖ نَصْرٌ مِنَ اللَّهِ وَفَتْحٌ قَرِيبٌ ۗ وَبَشِّرِ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ

translation: O you who believe, be supporters of Allah’s cause, as Jesus, son of Mary, said to the disciples, “Who will be my supporters for Allah’s cause?” The disciples said, “We are the supporters of Allah’s cause.” Then a group of the Children of Israel believed and another disbelieved. We then supported those who believed against their enemies, so they prevailed.
arabic: يَا أَيُّهَا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا كُونُوا أَنْصَارَ اللَّهِ كَمَا قَالَ عِيسَى ابْنُ مَرْيَمَ لِلْحَوَارِيِّينَ مَنْ أَنْصَارِي إِلَى اللَّهِ ۖ قَالَ الْحَوَارِيُّونَ نَحْنُ أَنْصَارُ اللَّهِ ۖ فَآمَنَتْ طَائِفَةٌ مِنْ بَنِي إِسْرَائِيلَ وَكَفَرَتْ طَائِفَةٌ ۖ فَأَيَّدْنَا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا عَلَىٰ عَدُوِّهِمْ فَأَصْبَحُوا ظَاهِرِينَ

translation: All that is in the heavens and all that is on earth glorifies Allah, the Sovereign, the Most Holy, the All-Mighty, the All-Wise.
arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ يُسَبِّحُ لِلَّهِ مَا فِي السَّمَاوَاتِ وَمَا فِي الْأَرْضِ الْمَلِكِ الْقُدُّوسِ الْعَزِيزِ الْحَكِيمِ

translation: It is He Who has sent among the unlettered [Arabs] a messenger from among themselves, reciting to them His verses and purifying them, and teaching them the Book and Wisdom [i.e., Sunnah], although before that they were clearly misguided.
arabic: هُوَ الَّذِي بَعَثَ فِي الْأُمِّيِّينَ رَسُولًا مِنْهُمْ يَتْلُو عَلَيْهِمْ آيَاتِهِ وَيُزَكِّيهِمْ وَيُعَلِّمُهُمُ الْكِتَابَ وَالْحِكْمَةَ وَإِنْ كَانُوا مِنْ قَبْلُ لَفِي ضَلَالٍ مُبِينٍ

translation: And [he is also sent] to others of them who have not yet joined them, and He is the All-Mighty, the All-Wise.
arabic: وَآخَرِينَ مِنْهُمْ لَمَّا يَلْحَقُوا بِهِمْ ۚ وَهُوَ الْعَزِيزُ الْحَكِيمُ

translation: That is the bounty of Allah that He gives to whom He wills, for Allah is the Lord of great bounty.
arabic: ذَٰلِكَ فَضْلُ اللَّهِ يُؤْتِيهِ مَنْ يَشَاءُ ۚ وَاللَّهُ ذُو الْفَضْلِ الْعَظِيمِ

translation: The similitude of those who were given the Torah but failed to uphold it[1], is like that of a donkey laden with books[2]. How terrible is the similitude of those who reject the verses of Allah! And Allah does not guide the wrongdoing people.
footnotes:
[1] i.e., did not put its teachings into practice.
 [2] i.e., They carry the physical burden of the books but are unaware of their contents and do not benefit from them.
arabic: مَثَلُ الَّذِينَ حُمِّلُوا التَّوْرَاةَ ثُمَّ لَمْ يَحْمِلُوهَا كَمَثَلِ الْحِمَارِ يَحْمِلُ أَسْفَارًا ۚ بِئْسَ مَثَلُ الْقَوْمِ الَّذِينَ كَذَّبُوا بِآيَاتِ اللَّهِ ۚ وَاللَّهُ لَا يَهْدِي الْقَوْمَ الظَّالِمِينَ

translation: Say, “O you who are Jews, if you claim that you alone are Allah’s allies apart from all other people, then wish for death, if you are truthful.
arabic: قُلْ يَا أَيُّهَا الَّذِينَ هَادُوا إِنْ زَعَمْتُمْ أَنَّكُمْ أَوْلِيَاءُ لِلَّهِ مِنْ دُونِ النَّاسِ فَتَمَنَّوُا الْمَوْتَ إِنْ كُنْتُمْ صَادِقِينَ

translation: But they will never wish for it because of what their hands have sent forth[3]. And Allah is All-Knowing of the wrongdoers.
footnotes: [3] Such as disobedience to Allah, distorting of the scriptures, killing of the prophets, claiming to have killed Jesus, accusing Mary of adultery, devouring peoples' wealth unlawfully and usury, etc. See 4:153-158.
arabic: وَلَا يَتَمَنَّوْنَهُ أَبَدًا بِمَا قَدَّمَتْ أَيْدِيهِمْ ۚ وَاللَّهُ عَلِيمٌ بِالظَّالِمِينَ

translation: Say, “The death from which you run away will surely overcome you, then you will be brought back to the Knower of the unseen and the seen, and He will inform you of what you used to do.”
arabic: قُلْ إِنَّ الْمَوْتَ الَّذِي تَفِرُّونَ مِنْهُ فَإِنَّهُ مُلَاقِيكُمْ ۖ ثُمَّ تُرَدُّونَ إِلَىٰ عَالِمِ الْغَيْبِ وَالشَّهَادَةِ فَيُنَبِّئُكُمْ بِمَا كُنْتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ

translation: O you who believe, when the call for prayer is made on Friday, then hasten to the remembrance of Allah and leave off trading. That is better for you, if only you knew.
arabic: يَا أَيُّهَا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا إِذَا نُودِيَ لِلصَّلَاةِ مِنْ يَوْمِ الْجُمُعَةِ فَاسْعَوْا إِلَىٰ ذِكْرِ اللَّهِ وَذَرُوا الْبَيْعَ ۚ ذَٰلِكُمْ خَيْرٌ لَكُمْ إِنْ كُنْتُمْ تَعْلَمُونَ

translation: When the prayer is over, disperse in the land and seek from the bounty of Allah, and remember Allah much so that you may be successful.
arabic: فَإِذَا قُضِيَتِ الصَّلَاةُ فَانْتَشِرُوا فِي الْأَرْضِ وَابْتَغُوا مِنْ فَضْلِ اللَّهِ وَاذْكُرُوا اللَّهَ كَثِيرًا لَعَلَّكُمْ تُفْلِحُونَ

translation: When they see some merchandise or amusement, they rush towards it and leave you standing. Say, “That which is with Allah is better than amusement and merchandise, and Allah is the Best of Providers.”
arabic: وَإِذَا رَأَوْا تِجَارَةً أَوْ لَهْوًا انْفَضُّوا إِلَيْهَا وَتَرَكُوكَ قَائِمًا ۚ قُلْ مَا عِنْدَ اللَّهِ خَيْرٌ مِنَ اللَّهْوِ وَمِنَ التِّجَارَةِ ۚ وَاللَّهُ خَيْرُ الرَّازِقِينَ

translation: When the hypocrites come to you, they say, “We bear witness that you are indeed the Messenger of Allah” And Allah knows that you are indeed His Messenger, and Allah bears witness that the hypocrites are truly liars.
arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ إِذَا جَاءَكَ الْمُنَافِقُونَ قَالُوا نَشْهَدُ إِنَّكَ لَرَسُولُ اللَّهِ ۗ وَاللَّهُ يَعْلَمُ إِنَّكَ لَرَسُولُهُ وَاللَّهُ يَشْهَدُ إِنَّ الْمُنَافِقِينَ لَكَاذِبُونَ

translation: They have taken their oaths as a shield in order to hinder people from the way of Allah. Evil indeed is what they do!
arabic: اتَّخَذُوا أَيْمَانَهُمْ جُنَّةً فَصَدُّوا عَنْ سَبِيلِ اللَّهِ ۚ إِنَّهُمْ سَاءَ مَا كَانُوا يَعْمَلُونَ

translation: That is because they believed, then disbelieved; therefore their hearts have been sealed, so they do not understand.
arabic: ذَٰلِكَ بِأَنَّهُمْ آمَنُوا ثُمَّ كَفَرُوا فَطُبِعَ عَلَىٰ قُلُوبِهِمْ فَهُمْ لَا يَفْقَهُونَ

translation: When you see them, their outward appearance pleases you, and when they speak, you listen to what they say. But they are like planks of wood leaned [against the wall][1]. They deem every cry to be against them. They are the enemy, so beware of them. May Allah destroy them; how are they deluded?
footnotes: [1] They are like bodies with empty minds and hearts.
arabic: ۞ وَإِذَا رَأَيْتَهُمْ تُعْجِبُكَ أَجْسَامُهُمْ ۖ وَإِنْ يَقُولُوا تَسْمَعْ لِقَوْلِهِمْ ۖ كَأَنَّهُمْ خُشُبٌ مُسَنَّدَةٌ ۖ يَحْسَبُونَ كُلَّ صَيْحَةٍ عَلَيْهِمْ ۚ هُمُ الْعَدُوُّ فَاحْذَرْهُمْ ۚ قَاتَلَهُمُ اللَّهُ ۖ أَنَّىٰ يُؤْفَكُونَ

translation: When it is said to them, “Come, so that the Messenger of Allah may seek forgiveness for you”, they shake their heads, and you see them turning away in arrogance.
arabic: وَإِذَا قِيلَ لَهُمْ تَعَالَوْا يَسْتَغْفِرْ لَكُمْ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ لَوَّوْا رُءُوسَهُمْ وَرَأَيْتَهُمْ يَصُدُّونَ وَهُمْ مُسْتَكْبِرُونَ

translation: It is the same to them whether you seek forgiveness for them or not, Allah will never forgive them. Indeed, Allah does not guide the wicked people.
arabic: سَوَاءٌ عَلَيْهِمْ أَسْتَغْفَرْتَ لَهُمْ أَمْ لَمْ تَسْتَغْفِرْ لَهُمْ لَنْ يَغْفِرَ اللَّهُ لَهُمْ ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ لَا يَهْدِي الْقَوْمَ الْفَاسِقِينَ

translation: They are those who say, “Do not spend on those who are with Allah’s Messenger so that they may desert him. But to Allah belong the treasures of the heavens and earth, but the hypocrites do not understand.
arabic: هُمُ الَّذِينَ يَقُولُونَ لَا تُنْفِقُوا عَلَىٰ مَنْ عِنْدَ رَسُولِ اللَّهِ حَتَّىٰ يَنْفَضُّوا ۗ وَلِلَّهِ خَزَائِنُ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ وَلَٰكِنَّ الْمُنَافِقِينَ لَا يَفْقَهُونَ

translation: They[2] say, “When we return to Madinah, the mightier will surely expel the weaker therefrom.” In fact, all might belongs to Allah and to His Messenger, and to the believers, but the hypocrites do not know.
footnotes: [2] Referring to the notorious head of the hypocrites in Madinah, Abdullah ibn ’Ubayy, who uttered such words about the Prophet (عليه السلام) and his Companions.
arabic: يَقُولُونَ لَئِنْ رَجَعْنَا إِلَى الْمَدِينَةِ لَيُخْرِجَنَّ الْأَعَزُّ مِنْهَا الْأَذَلَّ ۚ وَلِلَّهِ الْعِزَّةُ وَلِرَسُولِهِ وَلِلْمُؤْمِنِينَ وَلَٰكِنَّ الْمُنَافِقِينَ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ

translation: O you who believe, do not let your wealth and your children distract you from Allah’s remembrance. For whoever does that, it is they who are the losers.
arabic: يَا أَيُّهَا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا لَا تُلْهِكُمْ أَمْوَالُكُمْ وَلَا أَوْلَادُكُمْ عَنْ ذِكْرِ اللَّهِ ۚ وَمَنْ يَفْعَلْ ذَٰلِكَ فَأُولَٰئِكَ هُمُ الْخَاسِرُونَ

translation: And spend from what We have provided for you before death comes to one of you, then he would say, “My Lord, If only You had delayed me for a short while, so that I would give in charity and be one of the righteous.”
arabic: وَأَنْفِقُوا مِنْ مَا رَزَقْنَاكُمْ مِنْ قَبْلِ أَنْ يَأْتِيَ أَحَدَكُمُ الْمَوْتُ فَيَقُولَ رَبِّ لَوْلَا أَخَّرْتَنِي إِلَىٰ أَجَلٍ قَرِيبٍ فَأَصَّدَّقَ وَأَكُنْ مِنَ الصَّالِحِينَ

translation: But Allah will never delay a soul when its appointed time comes, and Allah is All-Aware of what you do.
arabic: وَلَنْ يُؤَخِّرَ اللَّهُ نَفْسًا إِذَا جَاءَ أَجَلُهَا ۚ وَاللَّهُ خَبِيرٌ بِمَا تَعْمَلُونَ

translation: All that is in the heavens and all that is in the earth glorifies Allah. To Him belongs the dominion, and to Him belongs all praise, and He is Most Capable of all things.
arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ يُسَبِّحُ لِلَّهِ مَا فِي السَّمَاوَاتِ وَمَا فِي الْأَرْضِ ۖ لَهُ الْمُلْكُ وَلَهُ الْحَمْدُ ۖ وَهُوَ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيرٌ

translation: It is He Who created you, yet some of you are disbelievers and some of you are believers. And Allah is All-Seeing of what you do.
arabic: هُوَ الَّذِي خَلَقَكُمْ فَمِنْكُمْ كَافِرٌ وَمِنْكُمْ مُؤْمِنٌ ۚ وَاللَّهُ بِمَا تَعْمَلُونَ بَصِيرٌ

translation: He created the heavens and earth for a true purpose, He shaped you and perfected your form. And to Him is the final return.
arabic: خَلَقَ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضَ بِالْحَقِّ وَصَوَّرَكُمْ فَأَحْسَنَ صُوَرَكُمْ ۖ وَإِلَيْهِ الْمَصِيرُ

translation: He knows all that is in the heavens and earth, and He knows whatever you conceal and whatever you reveal. And Allah is All-Knowing of what is in the hearts.
arabic: يَعْلَمُ مَا فِي السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ وَيَعْلَمُ مَا تُسِرُّونَ وَمَا تُعْلِنُونَ ۚ وَاللَّهُ عَلِيمٌ بِذَاتِ الصُّدُورِ

translation: Has there not come to you the stories of those who disbelieved before you? They tasted the evil consequence of their deeds, and for them there will be a painful punishment.
arabic: أَلَمْ يَأْتِكُمْ نَبَأُ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا مِنْ قَبْلُ فَذَاقُوا وَبَالَ أَمْرِهِمْ وَلَهُمْ عَذَابٌ أَلِيمٌ

translation: That is because their messengers came to them with clear proofs, but they said, “How can a human guide us?” Thus they disbelieved and turned away, but Allah had no need for them, for Allah is Self-Sufficient, Praiseworthy.
arabic: ذَٰلِكَ بِأَنَّهُ كَانَتْ تَأْتِيهِمْ رُسُلُهُمْ بِالْبَيِّنَاتِ فَقَالُوا أَبَشَرٌ يَهْدُونَنَا فَكَفَرُوا وَتَوَلَّوْا ۚ وَاسْتَغْنَى اللَّهُ ۚ وَاللَّهُ غَنِيٌّ حَمِيدٌ

translation: The disbelievers claim that they will never be resurrected. Say, “Yes, by my Lord, you will surely be resurrected, then you will surely be informed of what you did. And that is easy for Allah.”
arabic: زَعَمَ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا أَنْ لَنْ يُبْعَثُوا ۚ قُلْ بَلَىٰ وَرَبِّي لَتُبْعَثُنَّ ثُمَّ لَتُنَبَّؤُنَّ بِمَا عَمِلْتُمْ ۚ وَذَٰلِكَ عَلَى اللَّهِ يَسِيرٌ

translation: So believe in Allah and His Messenger, and in the Light [i.e., the Qur’an] that We have sent down. And Allah is All-Aware of what you do.
arabic: فَآمِنُوا بِاللَّهِ وَرَسُولِهِ وَالنُّورِ الَّذِي أَنْزَلْنَا ۚ وَاللَّهُ بِمَا تَعْمَلُونَ خَبِيرٌ

translation: When He will gather you for the Gathering Day; that is the Day of great loss[1]. But whoever believes in Allah and does righteous deeds, He will absolve them of their bad deeds and will admit them to gardens under which rivers flow, abiding therein forever. That is the supreme triumph.
footnotes: [1] "At-Taghābun" denotes being outdone by others in acquiring something valuable. On the Day of Judgment, the disbelievers will suffer the great loss of Paradise to the believers.
arabic: يَوْمَ يَجْمَعُكُمْ لِيَوْمِ الْجَمْعِ ۖ ذَٰلِكَ يَوْمُ التَّغَابُنِ ۗ وَمَنْ يُؤْمِنْ بِاللَّهِ وَيَعْمَلْ صَالِحًا يُكَفِّرْ عَنْهُ سَيِّئَاتِهِ وَيُدْخِلْهُ جَنَّاتٍ تَجْرِي مِنْ تَحْتِهَا الْأَنْهَارُ خَالِدِينَ فِيهَا أَبَدًا ۚ ذَٰلِكَ الْفَوْزُ الْعَظِيمُ

translation: As for those who disbelieve and reject Our verses, they will be the people of the Fire, abiding therein forever. What a terrible destination!
arabic: وَالَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا وَكَذَّبُوا بِآيَاتِنَا أُولَٰئِكَ أَصْحَابُ النَّارِ خَالِدِينَ فِيهَا ۖ وَبِئْسَ الْمَصِيرُ

translation: No calamity befalls except with Allah’s permission. Whoever believes in Allah, He will guide his heart. And Allah is All-Knowing of everything.
arabic: مَا أَصَابَ مِنْ مُصِيبَةٍ إِلَّا بِإِذْنِ اللَّهِ ۗ وَمَنْ يُؤْمِنْ بِاللَّهِ يَهْدِ قَلْبَهُ ۚ وَاللَّهُ بِكُلِّ شَيْءٍ عَلِيمٌ

translation: Obey Allah and obey the Messenger, but if you turn away, then the duty of Our Messenger is only to convey the message clearly.
arabic: وَأَطِيعُوا اللَّهَ وَأَطِيعُوا الرَّسُولَ ۚ فَإِنْ تَوَلَّيْتُمْ فَإِنَّمَا عَلَىٰ رَسُولِنَا الْبَلَاغُ الْمُبِينُ

translation: Allah, none has the right to be worshiped except Him. So in Allah let the believers put their trust.
arabic: اللَّهُ لَا إِلَٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ ۚ وَعَلَى اللَّهِ فَلْيَتَوَكَّلِ الْمُؤْمِنُونَ

translation: O you who believe, indeed, among your wives and your children are some who are enemies[2] to you, so beware of them. But if you pardon and overlook, and forgive, then Allah is indeed All-Forgiving, Most Merciful.
footnotes: [2] Some early Muslims were prevented from emigrating to Madinah by their spouses and children, so they were deprived of the honor of joining the Prophet (ﷺ) and the believers in Jihad and other meritorious deeds.
arabic: يَا أَيُّهَا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا إِنَّ مِنْ أَزْوَاجِكُمْ وَأَوْلَادِكُمْ عَدُوًّا لَكُمْ فَاحْذَرُوهُمْ ۚ وَإِنْ تَعْفُوا وَتَصْفَحُوا وَتَغْفِرُوا فَإِنَّ اللَّهَ غَفُورٌ رَحِيمٌ

translation: Your wealth and your children are but a trial, and with Allah is a great reward.
arabic: إِنَّمَا أَمْوَالُكُمْ وَأَوْلَادُكُمْ فِتْنَةٌ ۚ وَاللَّهُ عِنْدَهُ أَجْرٌ عَظِيمٌ

translation: So fear Allah as much as you can, listen and obey, and spend in charity; that is better for your souls. Whoever is protected from the stinginess of his soul, it is they who are successful.
arabic: فَاتَّقُوا اللَّهَ مَا اسْتَطَعْتُمْ وَاسْمَعُوا وَأَطِيعُوا وَأَنْفِقُوا خَيْرًا لِأَنْفُسِكُمْ ۗ وَمَنْ يُوقَ شُحَّ نَفْسِهِ فَأُولَٰئِكَ هُمُ الْمُفْلِحُونَ

translation: If you lend Allah a goodly loan, He will multiply it for you and forgive you, for Allah is Most Appreciative[3], Most Forbearing,
footnotes: [3] Who gives much in return for a little work.
arabic: إِنْ تُقْرِضُوا اللَّهَ قَرْضًا حَسَنًا يُضَاعِفْهُ لَكُمْ وَيَغْفِرْ لَكُمْ ۚ وَاللَّهُ شَكُورٌ حَلِيمٌ

translation: Knower of the unseen and the seen, the All-Mighty, the All-Wise.
arabic: عَالِمُ الْغَيْبِ وَالشَّهَادَةِ الْعَزِيزُ الْحَكِيمُ

translation: O Prophet, when you [believers] divorce women, divorce them with concern to their waiting period and keep an accurate count of the waiting period[1], and fear Allah, your Lord. Do not force them out of their houses, nor should they leave unless they commit a clear shameful act. Such are the limits ordained by Allah. Whoever transgresses the limits ordained by Allah has truly wronged himself. You never know, perhaps Allah will bring about a change [of heart] later[2].
footnotes:
[1] A wife should only be divorced after the completion of her monthly cycle and before sexual intercourse after purity, or else during a confirmed pregnancy. Her waiting period (‘iddah) begins with the pronouncement of divorce. See 2:228-233.
 [2] Such as regret for divorcing or renewed desire for the wife.
arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ يَا أَيُّهَا النَّبِيُّ إِذَا طَلَّقْتُمُ النِّسَاءَ فَطَلِّقُوهُنَّ لِعِدَّتِهِنَّ وَأَحْصُوا الْعِدَّةَ ۖ وَاتَّقُوا اللَّهَ رَبَّكُمْ ۖ لَا تُخْرِجُوهُنَّ مِنْ بُيُوتِهِنَّ وَلَا يَخْرُجْنَ إِلَّا أَنْ يَأْتِينَ بِفَاحِشَةٍ مُبَيِّنَةٍ ۚ وَتِلْكَ حُدُودُ اللَّهِ ۚ وَمَنْ يَتَعَدَّ حُدُودَ اللَّهِ فَقَدْ ظَلَمَ نَفْسَهُ ۚ لَا تَدْرِي لَعَلَّ اللَّهَ يُحْدِثُ بَعْدَ ذَٰلِكَ أَمْرًا

translation: Then when they have approached the end of their waiting period, either retain them honorably or part with them honorably[3]. Call two just men from among yourselves as witnesses, and give true testimony for the sake of Allah. This is an exhortation for those who believe in Allah and the Last Day. Whoever fears Allah, He will make a way out for him[4],
footnotes:
[3] A husband may return to his wife after the first or the second divorce (revocable divorce) or at the end of her waiting period with dignity. If he divorces her a third time, the marriage is terminated at the end of her third waiting period (Irrevocable divorce). The wife will have to marry and get divorced by another man before she can remarry her ex-husband. See 2:230.
 [4] i.e., relief from distress and inconvenience.
arabic: فَإِذَا بَلَغْنَ أَجَلَهُنَّ فَأَمْسِكُوهُنَّ بِمَعْرُوفٍ أَوْ فَارِقُوهُنَّ بِمَعْرُوفٍ وَأَشْهِدُوا ذَوَيْ عَدْلٍ مِنْكُمْ وَأَقِيمُوا الشَّهَادَةَ لِلَّهِ ۚ ذَٰلِكُمْ يُوعَظُ بِهِ مَنْ كَانَ يُؤْمِنُ بِاللَّهِ وَالْيَوْمِ الْآخِرِ ۚ وَمَنْ يَتَّقِ اللَّهَ يَجْعَلْ لَهُ مَخْرَجًا

translation: and He will provide for him from where he does not expect. Whoever puts his trust in Allah, He is sufficient for him. Indeed, Allah will surely accomplish His purpose, for Allah has set a destiny for everything.
arabic: وَيَرْزُقْهُ مِنْ حَيْثُ لَا يَحْتَسِبُ ۚ وَمَنْ يَتَوَكَّلْ عَلَى اللَّهِ فَهُوَ حَسْبُهُ ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ بَالِغُ أَمْرِهِ ۚ قَدْ جَعَلَ اللَّهُ لِكُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدْرًا

translation: As for those women from among you who reached their menopause, in case you doubt, their waiting period is three months, as well as of those who have not yet menstruated. As for pregnant women, their waiting period ends with delivery[5]. And whoever fears Allah, He will make his matters easy for him.
footnotes: [5] This ruling for the waiting period of pregnant women applies also in case the husband dies.
arabic: وَاللَّائِي يَئِسْنَ مِنَ الْمَحِيضِ مِنْ نِسَائِكُمْ إِنِ ارْتَبْتُمْ فَعِدَّتُهُنَّ ثَلَاثَةُ أَشْهُرٍ وَاللَّائِي لَمْ يَحِضْنَ ۚ وَأُولَاتُ الْأَحْمَالِ أَجَلُهُنَّ أَنْ يَضَعْنَ حَمْلَهُنَّ ۚ وَمَنْ يَتَّقِ اللَّهَ يَجْعَلْ لَهُ مِنْ أَمْرِهِ يُسْرًا

translation: This is the commandment of Allah that He has sent down to you. Whoever fears Allah, He will absolve him of his bad deeds and will reward him immensely.
arabic: ذَٰلِكَ أَمْرُ اللَّهِ أَنْزَلَهُ إِلَيْكُمْ ۚ وَمَنْ يَتَّقِ اللَّهَ يُكَفِّرْ عَنْهُ سَيِّئَاتِهِ وَيُعْظِمْ لَهُ أَجْرًا

translation: Let them live where you live [during their waiting period], according to your means, and do not harass them to make their stay unbearable[6]. If they are pregnant, maintain them until they deliver, and if they suckle your child, compensate them, and graciously settle the question of compensation by mutual understanding. But if you fail to reach an agreement, then another woman may suckle the child.
footnotes: [6] By compelling them to leave or to ransom themselves.
arabic: أَسْكِنُوهُنَّ مِنْ حَيْثُ سَكَنْتُمْ مِنْ وُجْدِكُمْ وَلَا تُضَارُّوهُنَّ لِتُضَيِّقُوا عَلَيْهِنَّ ۚ وَإِنْ كُنَّ أُولَاتِ حَمْلٍ فَأَنْفِقُوا عَلَيْهِنَّ حَتَّىٰ يَضَعْنَ حَمْلَهُنَّ ۚ فَإِنْ أَرْضَعْنَ لَكُمْ فَآتُوهُنَّ أُجُورَهُنَّ ۖ وَأْتَمِرُوا بَيْنَكُمْ بِمَعْرُوفٍ ۖ وَإِنْ تَعَاسَرْتُمْ فَسَتُرْضِعُ لَهُ أُخْرَىٰ

translation: Let the wealthy man spend according to his means. As for the one with limited resources, he should spend according to whatever Allah has given him. Allah does not burden any soul beyond what He has given him. Allah will bring about ease after hardship.
arabic: لِيُنْفِقْ ذُو سَعَةٍ مِنْ سَعَتِهِ ۖ وَمَنْ قُدِرَ عَلَيْهِ رِزْقُهُ فَلْيُنْفِقْ مِمَّا آتَاهُ اللَّهُ ۚ لَا يُكَلِّفُ اللَّهُ نَفْسًا إِلَّا مَا آتَاهَا ۚ سَيَجْعَلُ اللَّهُ بَعْدَ عُسْرٍ يُسْرًا

translation: And [imagine] how many towns rebelled against the commandments of their Lord and His messengers, so We called them to a severe account and punished them with a horrendous punishment.
arabic: وَكَأَيِّنْ مِنْ قَرْيَةٍ عَتَتْ عَنْ أَمْرِ رَبِّهَا وَرُسُلِهِ فَحَاسَبْنَاهَا حِسَابًا شَدِيدًا وَعَذَّبْنَاهَا عَذَابًا نُكْرًا

translation: Thus they tasted the evil consequence of their deeds, and the outcome of their deeds was a total loss.
arabic: فَذَاقَتْ وَبَالَ أَمْرِهَا وَكَانَ عَاقِبَةُ أَمْرِهَا خُسْرًا

translation: Allah has prepared for them a severe punishment. So fear Allah O people of understanding who have faith. Allah has sent down to you a Reminder[7],
footnotes: [7] i.e., the Qur’an or the Prophet (ﷺ), for he is mentioned in the next verse.
arabic: أَعَدَّ اللَّهُ لَهُمْ عَذَابًا شَدِيدًا ۖ فَاتَّقُوا اللَّهَ يَا أُولِي الْأَلْبَابِ الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا ۚ قَدْ أَنْزَلَ اللَّهُ إِلَيْكُمْ ذِكْرًا

translation: a Messenger who recites to you the clear verses of Allah, so that He may bring those who believe and do righteous deeds out of the depths of darkness into the light. Whoever believes in Allah and does righteous deeds, He will admit him to gardens under which rivers flow, abiding therein forever. Allah has prepared for him a good provision.
arabic: رَسُولًا يَتْلُو عَلَيْكُمْ آيَاتِ اللَّهِ مُبَيِّنَاتٍ لِيُخْرِجَ الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَعَمِلُوا الصَّالِحَاتِ مِنَ الظُّلُمَاتِ إِلَى النُّورِ ۚ وَمَنْ يُؤْمِنْ بِاللَّهِ وَيَعْمَلْ صَالِحًا يُدْخِلْهُ جَنَّاتٍ تَجْرِي مِنْ تَحْتِهَا الْأَنْهَارُ خَالِدِينَ فِيهَا أَبَدًا ۖ قَدْ أَحْسَنَ اللَّهُ لَهُ رِزْقًا

translation: Allah is the One who has created seven heavens, and likewise for the earth[8]. The Command descends between them so that you may know that Allah is Most Capable of all things and that Allah has encompassed everything in knowledge.
footnotes: [8] i.e., seven earths.
arabic: اللَّهُ الَّذِي خَلَقَ سَبْعَ سَمَاوَاتٍ وَمِنَ الْأَرْضِ مِثْلَهُنَّ يَتَنَزَّلُ الْأَمْرُ بَيْنَهُنَّ لِتَعْلَمُوا أَنَّ اللَّهَ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيرٌ وَأَنَّ اللَّهَ قَدْ أَحَاطَ بِكُلِّ شَيْءٍ عِلْمًا

translation: O Prophet, why do you prohibit [yourself from] what Allah has made lawful to you, seeking to please your wives? Allah is All-Forgiving, Most Merciful.
arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ يَا أَيُّهَا النَّبِيُّ لِمَ تُحَرِّمُ مَا أَحَلَّ اللَّهُ لَكَ ۖ تَبْتَغِي مَرْضَاتَ أَزْوَاجِكَ ۚ وَاللَّهُ غَفُورٌ رَحِيمٌ

translation: Allah has ordained for you the way to absolve yourselves from your oaths[1]. Allah is your Guardian, and He is the All-Knowing, the All-Wise.
footnotes: [1] By way of expiation. This is when one is unable to fulfill an oath or has taken an oath that is not pleasing to Allah. See 5:89.
arabic: قَدْ فَرَضَ اللَّهُ لَكُمْ تَحِلَّةَ أَيْمَانِكُمْ ۚ وَاللَّهُ مَوْلَاكُمْ ۖ وَهُوَ الْعَلِيمُ الْحَكِيمُ

translation: And [remember] when the Prophet told one of his wives something in secret. Then when she disclosed it [to another wife], and Allah made it known to him, he told [the disclosing wife] part of what was disclosed and overlooked a part. When he informed her of that, she said, “Who informed you of this?” He said, “I was informed by the All-Knowing, the All-Aware.
arabic: وَإِذْ أَسَرَّ النَّبِيُّ إِلَىٰ بَعْضِ أَزْوَاجِهِ حَدِيثًا فَلَمَّا نَبَّأَتْ بِهِ وَأَظْهَرَهُ اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ عَرَّفَ بَعْضَهُ وَأَعْرَضَ عَنْ بَعْضٍ ۖ فَلَمَّا نَبَّأَهَا بِهِ قَالَتْ مَنْ أَنْبَأَكَ هَٰذَا ۖ قَالَ نَبَّأَنِيَ الْعَلِيمُ الْخَبِيرُ

translation: You both had better turn to Allah in repentance, for your hearts have faltered. But if you insist on conspiring against him, then indeed Allah is his Protector, as well as Gabriel and the righteous believers, and moreover, the angels are his supporters.
arabic: إِنْ تَتُوبَا إِلَى اللَّهِ فَقَدْ صَغَتْ قُلُوبُكُمَا ۖ وَإِنْ تَظَاهَرَا عَلَيْهِ فَإِنَّ اللَّهَ هُوَ مَوْلَاهُ وَجِبْرِيلُ وَصَالِحُ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ ۖ وَالْمَلَائِكَةُ بَعْدَ ذَٰلِكَ ظَهِيرٌ

translation: Perhaps, if he were to divorce you all, his Lord would replace you with better wives who are submissive to Allah, who are believers, obedient, repentant, devout in worship and fasting[2] – previously married and virgins.
footnotes: [2] i.e., emigrating for Allah's cause, or given to fasting.
arabic: عَسَىٰ رَبُّهُ إِنْ طَلَّقَكُنَّ أَنْ يُبْدِلَهُ أَزْوَاجًا خَيْرًا مِنْكُنَّ مُسْلِمَاتٍ مُؤْمِنَاتٍ قَانِتَاتٍ تَائِبَاتٍ عَابِدَاتٍ سَائِحَاتٍ ثَيِّبَاتٍ وَأَبْكَارًا

translation: O you who believe, protect yourselves and your families from a Fire whose fuel is people and stones, and is overseen by rigorous and stern angels, who never disobey whatever Allah commands and do whatever they are commanded.
arabic: يَا أَيُّهَا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا قُوا أَنْفُسَكُمْ وَأَهْلِيكُمْ نَارًا وَقُودُهَا النَّاسُ وَالْحِجَارَةُ عَلَيْهَا مَلَائِكَةٌ غِلَاظٌ شِدَادٌ لَا يَعْصُونَ اللَّهَ مَا أَمَرَهُمْ وَيَفْعَلُونَ مَا يُؤْمَرُونَ

translation: “O you who disbelieve, make no excuses this Day. You will only be recompensed for what you used to do.”
arabic: يَا أَيُّهَا الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا لَا تَعْتَذِرُوا الْيَوْمَ ۖ إِنَّمَا تُجْزَوْنَ مَا كُنْتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ

translation: O you who believe, turn to Allah in sincere repentance. It may be that your Lord will absolve you of your bad deeds and admit you to gardens under which rivers flow, on the Day when Allah will not disgrace the Prophet and those who believed with him. Their light will stream ahead of them and on their right. They will say, “Our Lord, complete our light for us and forgive us, for You are Most Capable of all things.”
arabic: يَا أَيُّهَا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا تُوبُوا إِلَى اللَّهِ تَوْبَةً نَصُوحًا عَسَىٰ رَبُّكُمْ أَنْ يُكَفِّرَ عَنْكُمْ سَيِّئَاتِكُمْ وَيُدْخِلَكُمْ جَنَّاتٍ تَجْرِي مِنْ تَحْتِهَا الْأَنْهَارُ يَوْمَ لَا يُخْزِي اللَّهُ النَّبِيَّ وَالَّذِينَ آمَنُوا مَعَهُ ۖ نُورُهُمْ يَسْعَىٰ بَيْنَ أَيْدِيهِمْ وَبِأَيْمَانِهِمْ يَقُولُونَ رَبَّنَا أَتْمِمْ لَنَا نُورَنَا وَاغْفِرْ لَنَا ۖ إِنَّكَ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيرٌ

translation: O Prophet, strive [i.e., fight] against the disbelievers and the hypocrites, and be harsh with them. Their abode will be Hell. What a terrible destination!
arabic: يَا أَيُّهَا النَّبِيُّ جَاهِدِ الْكُفَّارَ وَالْمُنَافِقِينَ وَاغْلُظْ عَلَيْهِمْ ۚ وَمَأْوَاهُمْ جَهَنَّمُ ۖ وَبِئْسَ الْمَصِيرُ

translation: Allah sets forth an example for the disbelievers: the wife of Noah and the wife of Lot, who were under two of Our righteous slaves, but they betrayed them[3]. Their husbands could not avail them anything against Allah, and they both were told, “Enter the Fire along with those who enter!”
footnotes: [3] In the matter of religion, for they both were disbelievers.
arabic: ضَرَبَ اللَّهُ مَثَلًا لِلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا امْرَأَتَ نُوحٍ وَامْرَأَتَ لُوطٍ ۖ كَانَتَا تَحْتَ عَبْدَيْنِ مِنْ عِبَادِنَا صَالِحَيْنِ فَخَانَتَاهُمَا فَلَمْ يُغْنِيَا عَنْهُمَا مِنَ اللَّهِ شَيْئًا وَقِيلَ ادْخُلَا النَّارَ مَعَ الدَّاخِلِينَ

translation: And Allah sets forth an example for the believers: the wife of Pharaoh, who said, “My Lord, build for me a house in Paradise near You, save me from Pharaoh and his [evil] deeds, and save me from the wrongdoing people.”
arabic: وَضَرَبَ اللَّهُ مَثَلًا لِلَّذِينَ آمَنُوا امْرَأَتَ فِرْعَوْنَ إِذْ قَالَتْ رَبِّ ابْنِ لِي عِنْدَكَ بَيْتًا فِي الْجَنَّةِ وَنَجِّنِي مِنْ فِرْعَوْنَ وَعَمَلِهِ وَنَجِّنِي مِنَ الْقَوْمِ الظَّالِمِينَ

translation: Also [the example of] Mary, daughter of ‘Imrān who guarded her chastity, so We breathed into her through Our angel [Gabriel][4], and she firmly believed in the words of her Lord and His Scriptures and was one of the obedient.
footnotes: [4] Gabriel breathed into the garment of Mary so she conceived Jesus.
arabic: وَمَرْيَمَ ابْنَتَ عِمْرَانَ الَّتِي أَحْصَنَتْ فَرْجَهَا فَنَفَخْنَا فِيهِ مِنْ رُوحِنَا وَصَدَّقَتْ بِكَلِمَاتِ رَبِّهَا وَكُتُبِهِ وَكَانَتْ مِنَ الْقَانِتِينَ

translation: Blessed is He in Whose Hand is the dominion, and He is Most Capable of all things.
arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ تَبَارَكَ الَّذِي بِيَدِهِ الْمُلْكُ وَهُوَ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيرٌ

translation: Who created death and life to test you as to which of you is best in deeds, and He is the All-Mighty, the Most Forgiving.
arabic: الَّذِي خَلَقَ الْمَوْتَ وَالْحَيَاةَ لِيَبْلُوَكُمْ أَيُّكُمْ أَحْسَنُ عَمَلًا ۚ وَهُوَ الْعَزِيزُ الْغَفُورُ

translation: Who created seven heavens one above another; you will not see any imperfection[1] in the creation of the Most Compassionate. Look again; can you see any flaw?
footnotes: [1] All parts of the universe are well connected and in perfect harmony and coordination. There is no indiscipline, disorder and discordance in the universe, and nothing is disjointed and out of proportion in the creation of Allah. As for birth defects, genetic mutations and other things that we see in the world are part of this great creation, for perfection cannot be noticed except if the opposite is seen, also as a test for humans.
arabic: الَّذِي خَلَقَ سَبْعَ سَمَاوَاتٍ طِبَاقًا ۖ مَا تَرَىٰ فِي خَلْقِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ مِنْ تَفَاوُتٍ ۖ فَارْجِعِ الْبَصَرَ هَلْ تَرَىٰ مِنْ فُطُورٍ

translation: Then look again and again; your sight will turn back to you humbled and weary.
arabic: ثُمَّ ارْجِعِ الْبَصَرَ كَرَّتَيْنِ يَنْقَلِبْ إِلَيْكَ الْبَصَرُ خَاسِئًا وَهُوَ حَسِيرٌ

translation: We have adorned the lowest heaven with lamps and have made them as missiles to stone the devils[2], and We have prepared for them the punishment of the Blazing Fire.
footnotes: [2] Preventing them thereby from eavesdropping in the heavens. See 72:8-10.
arabic: وَلَقَدْ زَيَّنَّا السَّمَاءَ الدُّنْيَا بِمَصَابِيحَ وَجَعَلْنَاهَا رُجُومًا لِلشَّيَاطِينِ ۖ وَأَعْتَدْنَا لَهُمْ عَذَابَ السَّعِيرِ

translation: For those who disbelieve in their Lord there will be the punishment of Hell. What a terrible destination!
arabic: وَلِلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا بِرَبِّهِمْ عَذَابُ جَهَنَّمَ ۖ وَبِئْسَ الْمَصِيرُ

translation: When they are thrown in it, they will hear its roaring as it boils up,
arabic: إِذَا أُلْقُوا فِيهَا سَمِعُوا لَهَا شَهِيقًا وَهِيَ تَفُورُ

translation: almost bursting in fury. Every time a group is thrown in it, its keepers will ask them, “Did there not come to you a warner?”
arabic: تَكَادُ تَمَيَّزُ مِنَ الْغَيْظِ ۖ كُلَّمَا أُلْقِيَ فِيهَا فَوْجٌ سَأَلَهُمْ خَزَنَتُهَا أَلَمْ يَأْتِكُمْ نَذِيرٌ

translation: They will say, “Yes, a warner did come to us, but we denied and said, ‘Allah has not sent down anything; you are greatly misguided.’”
arabic: قَالُوا بَلَىٰ قَدْ جَاءَنَا نَذِيرٌ فَكَذَّبْنَا وَقُلْنَا مَا نَزَّلَ اللَّهُ مِنْ شَيْءٍ إِنْ أَنْتُمْ إِلَّا فِي ضَلَالٍ كَبِيرٍ

translation: And they will say, “If only we had listened or understood, we would not be among the dwellers of the Blazing Fire.”
arabic: وَقَالُوا لَوْ كُنَّا نَسْمَعُ أَوْ نَعْقِلُ مَا كُنَّا فِي أَصْحَابِ السَّعِيرِ

translation: Thus they will confess their sins. So away[3] with the dwellers of the Blazing Fire!
footnotes: [3] Away from all good and from the mercy of Allah.
arabic: فَاعْتَرَفُوا بِذَنْبِهِمْ فَسُحْقًا لِأَصْحَابِ السَّعِيرِ

translation: Indeed, those who fear their Lord unseen will have forgiveness and a great reward.
arabic: إِنَّ الَّذِينَ يَخْشَوْنَ رَبَّهُمْ بِالْغَيْبِ لَهُمْ مَغْفِرَةٌ وَأَجْرٌ كَبِيرٌ

translation: Whether you speak secretly or openly, He is All-Knowing of that which is in the hearts.
arabic: وَأَسِرُّوا قَوْلَكُمْ أَوِ اجْهَرُوا بِهِ ۖ إِنَّهُ عَلِيمٌ بِذَاتِ الصُّدُورِ

translation: Does He not know His Own creation[4], when He is the Most Subtle, the All-Aware?
footnotes: [4] Or does He not know those whom He created?
arabic: أَلَا يَعْلَمُ مَنْ خَلَقَ وَهُوَ اللَّطِيفُ الْخَبِيرُ

translation: It is He Who made the earth smooth[5] for you, so travel through its regions and eat from His provisions. And to Him is the resurrection.
footnotes: [5] i.e., subservient and stable.
arabic: هُوَ الَّذِي جَعَلَ لَكُمُ الْأَرْضَ ذَلُولًا فَامْشُوا فِي مَنَاكِبِهَا وَكُلُوا مِنْ رِزْقِهِ ۖ وَإِلَيْهِ النُّشُورُ

translation: Do you feel secure that He Who is above heaven will not cause the earth to sink with you, and then suddenly convulse[6]?
footnotes: [6] In a circular motion.
arabic: أَأَمِنْتُمْ مَنْ فِي السَّمَاءِ أَنْ يَخْسِفَ بِكُمُ الْأَرْضَ فَإِذَا هِيَ تَمُورُ

translation: Do you feel secure that He Who is in heaven will not send against you a storm of stones? Only then would you know how [serious] My warning was!
arabic: أَمْ أَمِنْتُمْ مَنْ فِي السَّمَاءِ أَنْ يُرْسِلَ عَلَيْكُمْ حَاصِبًا ۖ فَسَتَعْلَمُونَ كَيْفَ نَذِيرِ

translation: Those who came before them rejected [the messengers]; then how severe was My response!
arabic: وَلَقَدْ كَذَّبَ الَّذِينَ مِنْ قَبْلِهِمْ فَكَيْفَ كَانَ نَكِيرِ

translation: Do they not see the birds above them, spreading out and folding in their wings? None holds them up except the Most Compassionate. He is indeed All-Seeing of everything.
arabic: أَوَلَمْ يَرَوْا إِلَى الطَّيْرِ فَوْقَهُمْ صَافَّاتٍ وَيَقْبِضْنَ ۚ مَا يُمْسِكُهُنَّ إِلَّا الرَّحْمَٰنُ ۚ إِنَّهُ بِكُلِّ شَيْءٍ بَصِيرٌ

translation: Which is your army that can come to your aid against the Most Compassionate? The disbelievers are in utter delusion.
arabic: أَمَّنْ هَٰذَا الَّذِي هُوَ جُنْدٌ لَكُمْ يَنْصُرُكُمْ مِنْ دُونِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ ۚ إِنِ الْكَافِرُونَ إِلَّا فِي غُرُورٍ

translation: Who is there to give you provision if He withholds His provision? Yet they persist in arrogance and aversion.
arabic: أَمَّنْ هَٰذَا الَّذِي يَرْزُقُكُمْ إِنْ أَمْسَكَ رِزْقَهُ ۚ بَلْ لَجُّوا فِي عُتُوٍّ وَنُفُورٍ

translation: Who is better guided: the one who walks stumbling and falling on his face or the one who walks upright on a straight path?
arabic: أَفَمَنْ يَمْشِي مُكِبًّا عَلَىٰ وَجْهِهِ أَهْدَىٰ أَمَّنْ يَمْشِي سَوِيًّا عَلَىٰ صِرَاطٍ مُسْتَقِيمٍ

translation: Say, “It is He Who brought you into being and gave you hearing, sight, and hearts; little do you give thanks.”
arabic: قُلْ هُوَ الَّذِي أَنْشَأَكُمْ وَجَعَلَ لَكُمُ السَّمْعَ وَالْأَبْصَارَ وَالْأَفْئِدَةَ ۖ قَلِيلًا مَا تَشْكُرُونَ

translation: Say, “It is He Who has dispersed you throughout the earth, and to Him you will be gathered.”
arabic: قُلْ هُوَ الَّذِي ذَرَأَكُمْ فِي الْأَرْضِ وَإِلَيْهِ تُحْشَرُونَ

translation: They say: “When will this promise come to pass, if you are truthful?”
arabic: وَيَقُولُونَ مَتَىٰ هَٰذَا الْوَعْدُ إِنْ كُنْتُمْ صَادِقِينَ

translation: Say, “That knowledge is with Allah alone, and I am only a clear warner.”
arabic: قُلْ إِنَّمَا الْعِلْمُ عِنْدَ اللَّهِ وَإِنَّمَا أَنَا نَذِيرٌ مُبِينٌ

translation: Then when they see it[7] approaching closer, the faces of the disbelievers will be distressed, and it will be said, “This is what you were asking for[8].”
footnotes:
[7] The punishment on the Day of Judgment of which they were warned.
 [8] As they were challenging their prophets, saying, "Bring upon us the punishment, if you are truthful."
arabic: فَلَمَّا رَأَوْهُ زُلْفَةً سِيئَتْ وُجُوهُ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا وَقِيلَ هَٰذَا الَّذِي كُنْتُمْ بِهِ تَدَّعُونَ

translation: Say, “What do you think[9], if Allah causes me and those who are with me to die or shows us mercy, who will save the disbelievers from a painful punishment?”
footnotes: [9] i.e., Inform me.
arabic: قُلْ أَرَأَيْتُمْ إِنْ أَهْلَكَنِيَ اللَّهُ وَمَنْ مَعِيَ أَوْ رَحِمَنَا فَمَنْ يُجِيرُ الْكَافِرِينَ مِنْ عَذَابٍ أَلِيمٍ

translation: Say, “He is the Most Compassionate; we believe in Him and put our trust in Him. You will come to know who is clearly misguided.”
arabic: قُلْ هُوَ الرَّحْمَٰنُ آمَنَّا بِهِ وَعَلَيْهِ تَوَكَّلْنَا ۖ فَسَتَعْلَمُونَ مَنْ هُوَ فِي ضَلَالٍ مُبِينٍ

translation: Say, “What do you think, if your water were to sink deep into the earth, who can bring you flowing water?”
arabic: قُلْ أَرَأَيْتُمْ إِنْ أَصْبَحَ مَاؤُكُمْ غَوْرًا فَمَنْ يَأْتِيكُمْ بِمَاءٍ مَعِينٍ

translation: Nūn[1]. By the pen and what they [i.e., the angels] write [in the Records of deeds],
footnotes: [1] See footnote 2:1.
arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ ن ۚ وَالْقَلَمِ وَمَا يَسْطُرُونَ

translation: By the grace of your Lord [O Prophet], you are not a madman.
arabic: مَا أَنْتَ بِنِعْمَةِ رَبِّكَ بِمَجْنُونٍ

translation: You will surely have a never-ending reward.
arabic: وَإِنَّ لَكَ لَأَجْرًا غَيْرَ مَمْنُونٍ

translation: Indeed, you are of a great moral character.
arabic: وَإِنَّكَ لَعَلَىٰ خُلُقٍ عَظِيمٍ

translation: Soon you will see and they will see,
arabic: فَسَتُبْصِرُ وَيُبْصِرُونَ

translation: which of you is afflicted with madness.
arabic: بِأَيْيِكُمُ الْمَفْتُونُ

translation: Indeed, your Lord alone knows best who has strayed from His way and those who are rightly guided.
arabic: إِنَّ رَبَّكَ هُوَ أَعْلَمُ بِمَنْ ضَلَّ عَنْ سَبِيلِهِ وَهُوَ أَعْلَمُ بِالْمُهْتَدِينَ

translation: So do not obey the deniers.
arabic: فَلَا تُطِعِ الْمُكَذِّبِينَ

translation: They wish that you would compromise so they would too compromise.
arabic: وَدُّوا لَوْ تُدْهِنُ فَيُدْهِنُونَ

translation: And do not obey every disgraceful swearer,
arabic: وَلَا تُطِعْ كُلَّ حَلَّافٍ مَهِينٍ

translation: backbiter, gossip-monger,
arabic: هَمَّازٍ مَشَّاءٍ بِنَمِيمٍ

translation: withholder of good, transgressor, sinful,
arabic: مَنَّاعٍ لِلْخَيْرِ مُعْتَدٍ أَثِيمٍ

translation: coarse, and furthermore, an illegitimate child[2].
footnotes: [2] i.e., falsely claiming a particular lineage. It refers to Al-Walīd ibn al-Mughīrah (See also 74:11-25) or possibly Al-Akhnas ibn Shurayq.
arabic: عُتُلٍّ بَعْدَ ذَٰلِكَ زَنِيمٍ

translation: Simply because he has wealth and children,
arabic: أَنْ كَانَ ذَا مَالٍ وَبَنِينَ

translation: When Our verses are recited to him, he says, “Ancient fables!”
arabic: إِذَا تُتْلَىٰ عَلَيْهِ آيَاتُنَا قَالَ أَسَاطِيرُ الْأَوَّلِينَ

translation: We will soon brand him on the snout[3].
footnotes: [3] Lit., "trunk," meaning the nose of an elephant or pig. These verses refer to Al-Walīd ibn al-Mughīrah, a leader of the pagans of Makkah and a staunch enemy of Islam. He called the Prophet (ﷺ) a madman, so the Qur’an responded by mentioning ten of Al-Walīd’s qualities. (See 53:33-35 and 74:11-26). Two of those qualities were not known to him: the fact that he was an illegitimate child and that his nose would be chopped off years later at the Battle of Badr. Khālid ibn al-Walīd and two of his brothers embraced Islam.
arabic: سَنَسِمُهُ عَلَى الْخُرْطُومِ

translation: Indeed, We have tested them [i.e., the Makkans] as We tested the people of the garden when they swore to harvest its fruits in the early morning,
arabic: إِنَّا بَلَوْنَاهُمْ كَمَا بَلَوْنَا أَصْحَابَ الْجَنَّةِ إِذْ أَقْسَمُوا لَيَصْرِمُنَّهَا مُصْبِحِينَ

translation: and made no exception [by saying: if Allah wills][4].
footnotes: [4] Or without leaving some for the poor.
arabic: وَلَا يَسْتَثْنُونَ

translation: Then it was struck by an affliction from your Lord while they were asleep,
arabic: فَطَافَ عَلَيْهَا طَائِفٌ مِنْ رَبِّكَ وَهُمْ نَائِمُونَ

translation: and it turned to ashes [as black as night].
arabic: فَأَصْبَحَتْ كَالصَّرِيمِ

translation: Then in the early morning they called out to one another:
arabic: فَتَنَادَوْا مُصْبِحِينَ

translation: “Go early to your garden if you really wish to harvest.”
arabic: أَنِ اغْدُوا عَلَىٰ حَرْثِكُمْ إِنْ كُنْتُمْ صَارِمِينَ

translation: So they set out, whispering to one another,
arabic: فَانْطَلَقُوا وَهُمْ يَتَخَافَتُونَ

translation: “Not a single poor person should enter your garden today.”
arabic: أَنْ لَا يَدْخُلَنَّهَا الْيَوْمَ عَلَيْكُمْ مِسْكِينٌ

translation: And they left early, fully determined to stick to their plan[5].
footnotes: [5] To implement their plan, fully confident of their ability.
arabic: وَغَدَوْا عَلَىٰ حَرْدٍ قَادِرِينَ

translation: But when they saw the garden, they said, “We must have lost our way!
arabic: فَلَمَّا رَأَوْهَا قَالُوا إِنَّا لَضَالُّونَ

translation: Rather, we have been deprived.”
arabic: بَلْ نَحْنُ مَحْرُومُونَ

translation: The best among them said, “Did I not say to you to glorify Allah[6]?”
footnotes: [6] i.e., remember Him by saying, "...if Allah wills." Or "praise" and "thank" Allah for His bounty.
arabic: قَالَ أَوْسَطُهُمْ أَلَمْ أَقُلْ لَكُمْ لَوْلَا تُسَبِّحُونَ

translation: They said, “Glory be to our Lord! We were truly wrongdoers.”
arabic: قَالُوا سُبْحَانَ رَبِّنَا إِنَّا كُنَّا ظَالِمِينَ

translation: Then they turned to one another, throwing blame.
arabic: فَأَقْبَلَ بَعْضُهُمْ عَلَىٰ بَعْضٍ يَتَلَاوَمُونَ

translation: They said, “Woe to us! We were surely transgressors.
arabic: قَالُوا يَا وَيْلَنَا إِنَّا كُنَّا طَاغِينَ

translation: Our Lord may give us something better than this. We certainly turn to our Lord in hope[7].”
footnotes: [7] Of His forgiveness and bounty.
arabic: عَسَىٰ رَبُّنَا أَنْ يُبْدِلَنَا خَيْرًا مِنْهَا إِنَّا إِلَىٰ رَبِّنَا رَاغِبُونَ

translation: Such is the punishment [in this world]; but the punishment of the Hereafter is far worse, if only they knew.
arabic: كَذَٰلِكَ الْعَذَابُ ۖ وَلَعَذَابُ الْآخِرَةِ أَكْبَرُ ۚ لَوْ كَانُوا يَعْلَمُونَ

translation: Indeed, the righteous will have gardens of bliss with their Lord.
arabic: إِنَّ لِلْمُتَّقِينَ عِنْدَ رَبِّهِمْ جَنَّاتِ النَّعِيمِ

translation: Should We then treat Muslims like the wicked?
arabic: أَفَنَجْعَلُ الْمُسْلِمِينَ كَالْمُجْرِمِينَ

translation: What is the matter with you that you make such a judgment?
arabic: مَا لَكُمْ كَيْفَ تَحْكُمُونَ

translation: Or do you have a scripture in which you read
arabic: أَمْ لَكُمْ كِتَابٌ فِيهِ تَدْرُسُونَ

translation: that you will be given whatever you choose?
arabic: إِنَّ لَكُمْ فِيهِ لَمَا تَخَيَّرُونَ

translation: Or do you have a solemn promise binding upon Us until the Day of Resurrection, that you will have whatever you decide for yourselves?
arabic: أَمْ لَكُمْ أَيْمَانٌ عَلَيْنَا بَالِغَةٌ إِلَىٰ يَوْمِ الْقِيَامَةِ ۙ إِنَّ لَكُمْ لَمَا تَحْكُمُونَ

translation: Ask them which of them can guarantee that.
arabic: سَلْهُمْ أَيُّهُمْ بِذَٰلِكَ زَعِيمٌ

translation: Or do they have associate-gods? Then let them bring forth their associate-gods[8], if they are truthful.
footnotes: [8] whom they took as partners with Allah.
arabic: أَمْ لَهُمْ شُرَكَاءُ فَلْيَأْتُوا بِشُرَكَائِهِمْ إِنْ كَانُوا صَادِقِينَ

translation: On the Day when the Shin [of Allah] will be uncovered[9], and they are invited to prostrate, but they will not be able to do so.
footnotes: [9] i.e., It is a Day that everyone will find before him great difficulty. According to a long and authentic Hadīth of Abu Sa‘īd al-Khudrī, "the Shin" refers to that of Allah Almighty, before which every believer will prostrate on the Day of Judgment when the disbelievers and hypocrites will not be able to prostrate. The text of the Hadith is as follows: "... Then the Lord will uncover His Shank, so they will prostrate to Him...".
arabic: يَوْمَ يُكْشَفُ عَنْ سَاقٍ وَيُدْعَوْنَ إِلَى السُّجُودِ فَلَا يَسْتَطِيعُونَ

translation: Their eyes will be downcast, overwhelmed with humiliation, for they were invited to prostrate when they were capable[10] [but they refused].
footnotes: [10] During the life of this world.
arabic: خَاشِعَةً أَبْصَارُهُمْ تَرْهَقُهُمْ ذِلَّةٌ ۖ وَقَدْ كَانُوا يُدْعَوْنَ إِلَى السُّجُودِ وَهُمْ سَالِمُونَ

translation: So leave to Me those who reject this message [O Prophet]. We will gradually lead them to their ruin in ways that they do not perceive[11].
footnotes: [11] Allah will increase favors upon them in this life as a trial, so they will increase sin, which will lead to their destruction.
arabic: فَذَرْنِي وَمَنْ يُكَذِّبُ بِهَٰذَا الْحَدِيثِ ۖ سَنَسْتَدْرِجُهُمْ مِنْ حَيْثُ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ

translation: I will give them respite, but My plan is firm.
arabic: وَأُمْلِي لَهُمْ ۚ إِنَّ كَيْدِي مَتِينٌ

translation: Or are you asking them for a reward, so they find it too burdensome?
arabic: أَمْ تَسْأَلُهُمْ أَجْرًا فَهُمْ مِنْ مَغْرَمٍ مُثْقَلُونَ

translation: Or do they have knowledge of the unseen, so they write it down?
arabic: أَمْ عِنْدَهُمُ الْغَيْبُ فَهُمْ يَكْتُبُونَ

translation: So be patient with the decree of your Lord, and do not be like the man of the Whale [i.e., Jonah], when he cried out in anguish[12].
footnotes: [12] While inside the belly of the whale. See 21:87 and 37:139-148.
arabic: فَاصْبِرْ لِحُكْمِ رَبِّكَ وَلَا تَكُنْ كَصَاحِبِ الْحُوتِ إِذْ نَادَىٰ وَهُوَ مَكْظُومٌ

translation: Had it not been for the grace that he received from his Lord, he would have surely been thrown onto the barren shore, blameworthy[13].
footnotes: [13] Instead, Allah accepted his repentance and provided for him means of recovery. See 37:139-148.
arabic: لَوْلَا أَنْ تَدَارَكَهُ نِعْمَةٌ مِنْ رَبِّهِ لَنُبِذَ بِالْعَرَاءِ وَهُوَ مَذْمُومٌ

translation: But his Lord chose him and made him one of the righteous.
arabic: فَاجْتَبَاهُ رَبُّهُ فَجَعَلَهُ مِنَ الصَّالِحِينَ

translation: The disbelievers would almost strike you down with their malicious gazes when they hear the Reminder, and they say, “He is certainly mad.”
arabic: وَإِنْ يَكَادُ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا لَيُزْلِقُونَكَ بِأَبْصَارِهِمْ لَمَّا سَمِعُوا الذِّكْرَ وَيَقُولُونَ إِنَّهُ لَمَجْنُونٌ

translation: But it is nothing other than a reminder to the whole world.
arabic: وَمَا هُوَ إِلَّا ذِكْرٌ لِلْعَالَمِينَ

translation: The Inevitable Hour!
arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ الْحَاقَّةُ

translation: What is the Inevitable Hour?
arabic: مَا الْحَاقَّةُ

translation: How do you know what the Inevitable Hour is?
arabic: وَمَا أَدْرَاكَ مَا الْحَاقَّةُ

translation: Thamūd and ‘Ād denied the Striking Calamity of the Hour[1].
footnotes: [1] The Striking Calamity is one of the names of the Day of Judgment.
arabic: كَذَّبَتْ ثَمُودُ وَعَادٌ بِالْقَارِعَةِ

translation: As for Thamūd, they were destroyed by a dreadful blast.
arabic: فَأَمَّا ثَمُودُ فَأُهْلِكُوا بِالطَّاغِيَةِ

translation: And as for ‘Ād, they were destroyed by a furious windstorm[2]
footnotes: [2] Or by a cold windstorm.
arabic: وَأَمَّا عَادٌ فَأُهْلِكُوا بِرِيحٍ صَرْصَرٍ عَاتِيَةٍ

translation: which He unleashed against them for seven successive nights and eight days, so you would see the people lying dead as if they were hollow trunks of palm trees.
arabic: سَخَّرَهَا عَلَيْهِمْ سَبْعَ لَيَالٍ وَثَمَانِيَةَ أَيَّامٍ حُسُومًا فَتَرَى الْقَوْمَ فِيهَا صَرْعَىٰ كَأَنَّهُمْ أَعْجَازُ نَخْلٍ خَاوِيَةٍ

translation: Do you see any trace of them now?
arabic: فَهَلْ تَرَىٰ لَهُمْ مِنْ بَاقِيَةٍ

translation: Also, Pharaoh and those who came before him, and the overturned cities [of Lot] committed the grave sin,
arabic: وَجَاءَ فِرْعَوْنُ وَمَنْ قَبْلَهُ وَالْمُؤْتَفِكَاتُ بِالْخَاطِئَةِ

translation: each disobeying the messenger of their Lord, so He seized them with a severe punishment.
arabic: فَعَصَوْا رَسُولَ رَبِّهِمْ فَأَخَذَهُمْ أَخْذَةً رَابِيَةً

translation: Indeed, when the floodwater overflowed, We carried you [O humans] in the sailing Ark[3],
footnotes: [3] Which was made by Noah with Allah's command.
arabic: إِنَّا لَمَّا طَغَى الْمَاءُ حَمَلْنَاكُمْ فِي الْجَارِيَةِ

translation: so that We might make it a reminder for you, and that attentive ears may take heed.
arabic: لِنَجْعَلَهَا لَكُمْ تَذْكِرَةً وَتَعِيَهَا أُذُنٌ وَاعِيَةٌ

translation: Then when the Trumpet is blown with a single blast,
arabic: فَإِذَا نُفِخَ فِي الصُّورِ نَفْخَةٌ وَاحِدَةٌ

translation: and the earth and mountains are lifted up and crushed with a single blow,
arabic: وَحُمِلَتِ الْأَرْضُ وَالْجِبَالُ فَدُكَّتَا دَكَّةً وَاحِدَةً

translation: on that Day the Inevitable Event will occur.
arabic: فَيَوْمَئِذٍ وَقَعَتِ الْوَاقِعَةُ

translation: And the sky will split asunder and will be frail[4] on that day,
footnotes: [4] i.e., weak and unstable.
arabic: وَانْشَقَّتِ السَّمَاءُ فَهِيَ يَوْمَئِذٍ وَاهِيَةٌ

translation: with the angels on all its sides, and on that Day, eight [mighty angels] will bear the Throne of your Lord above them.
arabic: وَالْمَلَكُ عَلَىٰ أَرْجَائِهَا ۚ وَيَحْمِلُ عَرْشَ رَبِّكَ فَوْقَهُمْ يَوْمَئِذٍ ثَمَانِيَةٌ

translation: On that day, you will be brought forth [before Allah], and none of your secrets will remain hidden.
arabic: يَوْمَئِذٍ تُعْرَضُونَ لَا تَخْفَىٰ مِنْكُمْ خَافِيَةٌ

translation: As for the one who is given his Record in his right hand, he will say, “Here is my Record, read it!
arabic: فَأَمَّا مَنْ أُوتِيَ كِتَابَهُ بِيَمِينِهِ فَيَقُولُ هَاؤُمُ اقْرَءُوا كِتَابِيَهْ

translation: I was sure that I would meet my reckoning.”
arabic: إِنِّي ظَنَنْتُ أَنِّي مُلَاقٍ حِسَابِيَهْ

translation: So he will be in a pleasant life,
arabic: فَهُوَ فِي عِيشَةٍ رَاضِيَةٍ

translation: in a lofty garden,
arabic: فِي جَنَّةٍ عَالِيَةٍ

translation: with clustered fruit within his reach.
arabic: قُطُوفُهَا دَانِيَةٌ

translation: [They will be told,] “Eat and drink joyfully for what you did[5] in the days gone by.”
footnotes: [5] Lit., "advanced" anticipating the reward in the Hereafter.
arabic: كُلُوا وَاشْرَبُوا هَنِيئًا بِمَا أَسْلَفْتُمْ فِي الْأَيَّامِ الْخَالِيَةِ

translation: As for the one who is given his Record in his left hand, he will say, “Would that I had not been given my Record,
arabic: وَأَمَّا مَنْ أُوتِيَ كِتَابَهُ بِشِمَالِهِ فَيَقُولُ يَا لَيْتَنِي لَمْ أُوتَ كِتَابِيَهْ

translation: nor had I known anything of my reckoning!
arabic: وَلَمْ أَدْرِ مَا حِسَابِيَهْ

translation: Would that it [i.e., death] had been the end of me[6]!
footnotes: [6] Rather than a gateway to eternal life.
arabic: يَا لَيْتَهَا كَانَتِ الْقَاضِيَةَ

translation: My wealth has been of no avail to me.
arabic: مَا أَغْنَىٰ عَنِّي مَالِيَهْ ۜ

translation: My authority has vanished[7].”
footnotes: [7] i.e., I have no valid argument or authority today.
arabic: هَلَكَ عَنِّي سُلْطَانِيَهْ

translation: [It will be said,] “Seize him and shackle him,
arabic: خُذُوهُ فَغُلُّوهُ

translation: then make him burn in the Blazing Fire,
arabic: ثُمَّ الْجَحِيمَ صَلُّوهُ

translation: then tie him up with a chain of seventy cubits long.
arabic: ثُمَّ فِي سِلْسِلَةٍ ذَرْعُهَا سَبْعُونَ ذِرَاعًا فَاسْلُكُوهُ

translation: For he did not believe in Allah, the Most Great,
arabic: إِنَّهُ كَانَ لَا يُؤْمِنُ بِاللَّهِ الْعَظِيمِ

translation: nor did he encourage feeding the needy.
arabic: وَلَا يَحُضُّ عَلَىٰ طَعَامِ الْمِسْكِينِ

translation: So Today he will have no close friend here,
arabic: فَلَيْسَ لَهُ الْيَوْمَ هَاهُنَا حَمِيمٌ

translation: nor any food except the discharge of wounds,
arabic: وَلَا طَعَامٌ إِلَّا مِنْ غِسْلِينٍ

translation: none will eat it except the sinners.”
arabic: لَا يَأْكُلُهُ إِلَّا الْخَاطِئُونَ

translation: I swear by what you can see.
arabic: فَلَا أُقْسِمُ بِمَا تُبْصِرُونَ

translation: and what you cannot see!
arabic: وَمَا لَا تُبْصِرُونَ

translation: Indeed, this is the word of a noble Messenger[8],
footnotes: [8] i.e., recited by Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ).
arabic: إِنَّهُ لَقَوْلُ رَسُولٍ كَرِيمٍ

translation: and it is not the word of a poet; little do you believe!
arabic: وَمَا هُوَ بِقَوْلِ شَاعِرٍ ۚ قَلِيلًا مَا تُؤْمِنُونَ

translation: Nor is it the word of a soothsayer; little do you take heed!
arabic: وَلَا بِقَوْلِ كَاهِنٍ ۚ قَلِيلًا مَا تَذَكَّرُونَ

translation: It is a revelation from the Lord of the worlds.
arabic: تَنْزِيلٌ مِنْ رَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ

translation: If he had falsely attributed something to Us,
arabic: وَلَوْ تَقَوَّلَ عَلَيْنَا بَعْضَ الْأَقَاوِيلِ

translation: We would have surely seized him by the right hand[9],
footnotes: [9] Or "by [Our] Right Hand," i.e., Allah would have surely exacted revenge with might and power.
arabic: لَأَخَذْنَا مِنْهُ بِالْيَمِينِ

translation: then severed his aorta[10],
footnotes: [10] i.e., his life artery of the heart; causing immediate death.
arabic: ثُمَّ لَقَطَعْنَا مِنْهُ الْوَتِينَ

translation: and none of you could have rescued him.
arabic: فَمَا مِنْكُمْ مِنْ أَحَدٍ عَنْهُ حَاجِزِينَ

translation: This [Qur’an] is indeed a reminder for those who are righteous.
arabic: وَإِنَّهُ لَتَذْكِرَةٌ لِلْمُتَّقِينَ

translation: And We surely know that some of you will be deniers,
arabic: وَإِنَّا لَنَعْلَمُ أَنَّ مِنْكُمْ مُكَذِّبِينَ

translation: and it[11] will certainly be a source of regret for the disbelievers.
footnotes: [11] i.e., denying this Qur’an.
arabic: وَإِنَّهُ لَحَسْرَةٌ عَلَى الْكَافِرِينَ

translation: And this[12] is indeed the absolute truth.
footnotes: [12] i.e., this Qur’an.
arabic: وَإِنَّهُ لَحَقُّ الْيَقِينِ

translation: So glorify the name of your Lord, the Most Great.
arabic: فَسَبِّحْ بِاسْمِ رَبِّكَ الْعَظِيمِ

translation: A challenger asked for a punishment bound to come[1]
footnotes: [1] In the Hereafter. The pagans of Makkah had challenged the Prophet (ﷺ) in ridicule by asking Allah to bring upon them His punishment. See 8:32.
arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ سَأَلَ سَائِلٌ بِعَذَابٍ وَاقِعٍ

translation: upon the disbelievers, which none can avert,
arabic: لِلْكَافِرِينَ لَيْسَ لَهُ دَافِعٌ

translation: from Allah, Lord of the pathways of ascent,
arabic: مِنَ اللَّهِ ذِي الْمَعَارِجِ

translation: by which the angels and the Spirit[2] will ascend to Him on a Day[3] the length of which is fifty thousand years.
footnotes:
[2] i.e., the angel Gabriel.
 [3] The Day of Judgment will be an extremely long day.
arabic: تَعْرُجُ الْمَلَائِكَةُ وَالرُّوحُ إِلَيْهِ فِي يَوْمٍ كَانَ مِقْدَارُهُ خَمْسِينَ أَلْفَ سَنَةٍ

translation: So be patient [O Prophet] with beautiful patience.
arabic: فَاصْبِرْ صَبْرًا جَمِيلًا

translation: Indeed, they see this [punishment] far off,
arabic: إِنَّهُمْ يَرَوْنَهُ بَعِيدًا

translation: but We see it to be close at hand.
arabic: وَنَرَاهُ قَرِيبًا

translation: On the Day when the sky will be like molten brass[4]
footnotes: [4] Or "murky oil."
arabic: يَوْمَ تَكُونُ السَّمَاءُ كَالْمُهْلِ

translation: and the mountains will be like dyed wool[5],
footnotes: [5] While disintegrating.
arabic: وَتَكُونُ الْجِبَالُ كَالْعِهْنِ

translation: and no close friend will ask about another,
arabic: وَلَا يَسْأَلُ حَمِيمٌ حَمِيمًا

translation: even though they will see one another. The wicked will wish he could ransom himself from the punishment of that Day by offering his children,
arabic: يُبَصَّرُونَهُمْ ۚ يَوَدُّ الْمُجْرِمُ لَوْ يَفْتَدِي مِنْ عَذَابِ يَوْمِئِذٍ بِبَنِيهِ

translation: and his wife and his brother,
arabic: وَصَاحِبَتِهِ وَأَخِيهِ

translation: and his kindred who stood by him,
arabic: وَفَصِيلَتِهِ الَّتِي تُؤْوِيهِ

translation: and everyone on earth, just to save himself.
arabic: وَمَنْ فِي الْأَرْضِ جَمِيعًا ثُمَّ يُنْجِيهِ

translation: By no means![6] It is a raging Flame,
footnotes: [6] An emphatic denial, meaning "It will never be."
arabic: كَلَّا ۖ إِنَّهَا لَظَىٰ

translation: that will strip off the scalps[7].
footnotes: [7] Referring to the skin of the head or of the body extremities, which will be burned away by severe heat and flames.
arabic: نَزَّاعَةً لِلشَّوَىٰ

translation: It will call everyone who turned their backs and disobeyed,
arabic: تَدْعُو مَنْ أَدْبَرَ وَتَوَلَّىٰ

translation: and amassed and hoarded wealth.
arabic: وَجَمَعَ فَأَوْعَىٰ

translation: Indeed, man was created impatient:
arabic: ۞ إِنَّ الْإِنْسَانَ خُلِقَ هَلُوعًا

translation: when evil befalls him, he bewails,
arabic: إِذَا مَسَّهُ الشَّرُّ جَزُوعًا

translation: but when good fortune comes his way, he becomes tight-fisted –
arabic: وَإِذَا مَسَّهُ الْخَيْرُ مَنُوعًا

translation: except those who pray,
arabic: إِلَّا الْمُصَلِّينَ

translation: who are steadfast in their prayers;
arabic: الَّذِينَ هُمْ عَلَىٰ صَلَاتِهِمْ دَائِمُونَ

translation: and who give a due share[8] of their wealth
footnotes: [8] i.e., obligatory charity; zakah.
arabic: وَالَّذِينَ فِي أَمْوَالِهِمْ حَقٌّ مَعْلُومٌ

translation: to the beggar and the dispossessed;
arabic: لِلسَّائِلِ وَالْمَحْرُومِ

translation: and who firmly believe in the Day of Judgment;
arabic: وَالَّذِينَ يُصَدِّقُونَ بِيَوْمِ الدِّينِ

translation: and those who fear the punishment of their Lord –
arabic: وَالَّذِينَ هُمْ مِنْ عَذَابِ رَبِّهِمْ مُشْفِقُونَ

translation: for none can feel secure from their Lord’s punishment –
arabic: إِنَّ عَذَابَ رَبِّهِمْ غَيْرُ مَأْمُونٍ

translation: and those who guard their private parts[9],
footnotes: [9] i.e., their chastity and honor from immoralities.
arabic: وَالَّذِينَ هُمْ لِفُرُوجِهِمْ حَافِظُونَ

translation: except from their wives or bondwomen[10] whom they own, for then they are not to be blamed.
footnotes: [10] i.e., female slaves or slave-girls.
arabic: إِلَّا عَلَىٰ أَزْوَاجِهِمْ أَوْ مَا مَلَكَتْ أَيْمَانُهُمْ فَإِنَّهُمْ غَيْرُ مَلُومِينَ

translation: But whoever seeks beyond that, it is they who are the transgressors.
arabic: فَمَنِ ابْتَغَىٰ وَرَاءَ ذَٰلِكَ فَأُولَٰئِكَ هُمُ الْعَادُونَ

translation: and those who fulfill their trusts and pledges;
arabic: وَالَّذِينَ هُمْ لِأَمَانَاتِهِمْ وَعَهْدِهِمْ رَاعُونَ

translation: and who are upright in their testimonies;
arabic: وَالَّذِينَ هُمْ بِشَهَادَاتِهِمْ قَائِمُونَ

translation: and who take due care of their prayers;
arabic: وَالَّذِينَ هُمْ عَلَىٰ صَلَاتِهِمْ يُحَافِظُونَ

translation: they will be honored in gardens[11].
footnotes: [11] Of Paradise.
arabic: أُولَٰئِكَ فِي جَنَّاتٍ مُكْرَمُونَ

translation: What is the matter with the disbelievers that they are rushing towards you [O Prophet][12],
footnotes: [12] i.e., rushing to deny you.
arabic: فَمَالِ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا قِبَلَكَ مُهْطِعِينَ

translation: from the right and from the left, in crowds[13]?
footnotes: [13] Some pagans of Makkah gathered around the Prophet (ﷺ) mocking and opposing him, claiming that if there is in fact a Hereafter, they would enter Paradise before the believers.
arabic: عَنِ الْيَمِينِ وَعَنِ الشِّمَالِ عِزِينَ

translation: Does everyone of them aspire to enter a garden of bliss?
arabic: أَيَطْمَعُ كُلُّ امْرِئٍ مِنْهُمْ أَنْ يُدْخَلَ جَنَّةَ نَعِيمٍ

translation: By no means! We have created them from what they know[14].
footnotes: [14] i.e., from a disdained fluid.
arabic: كَلَّا ۖ إِنَّا خَلَقْنَاهُمْ مِمَّا يَعْلَمُونَ

translation: I swear by the Lord of the sunrises and sunsets[15] that We are surely Capable
footnotes: [15] i.e., Allah is the One Who determines the daily points of sunrise and sunset according to each season by the rotation of the earth around its axis.
arabic: فَلَا أُقْسِمُ بِرَبِّ الْمَشَارِقِ وَالْمَغَارِبِ إِنَّا لَقَادِرُونَ

translation: to replace them with others better than them, and none can escape Our decree.
arabic: عَلَىٰ أَنْ نُبَدِّلَ خَيْرًا مِنْهُمْ وَمَا نَحْنُ بِمَسْبُوقِينَ

translation: So leave them to engage in their falsehood and amuse themselves until they meet their Day which they are promised;
arabic: فَذَرْهُمْ يَخُوضُوا وَيَلْعَبُوا حَتَّىٰ يُلَاقُوا يَوْمَهُمُ الَّذِي يُوعَدُونَ

translation: the Day when they will rush out of their graves as if they are racing towards an idol[16],
footnotes: [16] i.e., just as they used to race towards a newly appointed idol, to be among the first of its worshipers.
arabic: يَوْمَ يَخْرُجُونَ مِنَ الْأَجْدَاثِ سِرَاعًا كَأَنَّهُمْ إِلَىٰ نُصُبٍ يُوفِضُونَ

translation: with their eyes downcast and overwhelmed with disgrace. That is the Day that they were promised.
arabic: خَاشِعَةً أَبْصَارُهُمْ تَرْهَقُهُمْ ذِلَّةٌ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ الْيَوْمُ الَّذِي كَانُوا يُوعَدُونَ

translation: Indeed, We sent Noah to his people, “Warn your people before there comes to them a painful punishment.”
arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ إِنَّا أَرْسَلْنَا نُوحًا إِلَىٰ قَوْمِهِ أَنْ أَنْذِرْ قَوْمَكَ مِنْ قَبْلِ أَنْ يَأْتِيَهُمْ عَذَابٌ أَلِيمٌ

translation: He said: “O my people, indeed I am a clear warner to you,
arabic: قَالَ يَا قَوْمِ إِنِّي لَكُمْ نَذِيرٌ مُبِينٌ

translation: that you worship Allah and fear Him, and obey me;
arabic: أَنِ اعْبُدُوا اللَّهَ وَاتَّقُوهُ وَأَطِيعُونِ

translation: He will forgive you some of your sins and grant you respite until an appointed term[1]. Indeed, when Allah’s appointed term comes, it cannot be delayed, if you only knew!”
footnotes: [1] i.e., until the time your life comes to an end.
arabic: يَغْفِرْ لَكُمْ مِنْ ذُنُوبِكُمْ وَيُؤَخِّرْكُمْ إِلَىٰ أَجَلٍ مُسَمًّى ۚ إِنَّ أَجَلَ اللَّهِ إِذَا جَاءَ لَا يُؤَخَّرُ ۖ لَوْ كُنْتُمْ تَعْلَمُونَ

translation: He said, “My Lord, I have surely called my people night and day,
arabic: قَالَ رَبِّ إِنِّي دَعَوْتُ قَوْمِي لَيْلًا وَنَهَارًا

translation: but my call only drove them further away.
arabic: فَلَمْ يَزِدْهُمْ دُعَائِي إِلَّا فِرَارًا

translation: Every time I call them so that You may forgive them, they thrust their fingers into their ears and cover their faces with their garments[2], and persist in obstinacy and grow extremely arrogant.
footnotes: [2] Refusing to see me or listen to my call.
arabic: وَإِنِّي كُلَّمَا دَعَوْتُهُمْ لِتَغْفِرَ لَهُمْ جَعَلُوا أَصَابِعَهُمْ فِي آذَانِهِمْ وَاسْتَغْشَوْا ثِيَابَهُمْ وَأَصَرُّوا وَاسْتَكْبَرُوا اسْتِكْبَارًا

translation: Then I called them openly,
arabic: ثُمَّ إِنِّي دَعَوْتُهُمْ جِهَارًا

translation: then I addressed them in public and in private,
arabic: ثُمَّ إِنِّي أَعْلَنْتُ لَهُمْ وَأَسْرَرْتُ لَهُمْ إِسْرَارًا

translation: I said, ‘Seek forgiveness from your Lord. Indeed, He is Most Forgiving.
arabic: فَقُلْتُ اسْتَغْفِرُوا رَبَّكُمْ إِنَّهُ كَانَ غَفَّارًا

translation: He will shower you with abundant rain from the sky,
arabic: يُرْسِلِ السَّمَاءَ عَلَيْكُمْ مِدْرَارًا

translation: and He will give you wealth and children, and bestow upon you gardens and rivers.
arabic: وَيُمْدِدْكُمْ بِأَمْوَالٍ وَبَنِينَ وَيَجْعَلْ لَكُمْ جَنَّاتٍ وَيَجْعَلْ لَكُمْ أَنْهَارًا

translation: What is the matter with you that you do not fear the Majesty of Allah[3],
footnotes: [3] While disobeying Him carelessly.
arabic: مَا لَكُمْ لَا تَرْجُونَ لِلَّهِ وَقَارًا

translation: when He has created you in stages[4]?
footnotes: [4] See 22:5 and 23:12-14 for the stages of the embryo.
arabic: وَقَدْ خَلَقَكُمْ أَطْوَارًا

translation: Do you not see how Allah has created seven heavens, one above another,
arabic: أَلَمْ تَرَوْا كَيْفَ خَلَقَ اللَّهُ سَبْعَ سَمَاوَاتٍ طِبَاقًا

translation: and has placed the moon therein as a light and the sun as a burning lamp?
arabic: وَجَعَلَ الْقَمَرَ فِيهِنَّ نُورًا وَجَعَلَ الشَّمْسَ سِرَاجًا

translation: Allah has produced you from the earth like a plant[5],
footnotes: [5] i.e., your father Adam, whom Allah created from clay.
arabic: وَاللَّهُ أَنْبَتَكُمْ مِنَ الْأَرْضِ نَبَاتًا

translation: then He will return you into it and then will bring you out again.
arabic: ثُمَّ يُعِيدُكُمْ فِيهَا وَيُخْرِجُكُمْ إِخْرَاجًا

translation: Allah has made the earth widespread for you
arabic: وَاللَّهُ جَعَلَ لَكُمُ الْأَرْضَ بِسَاطًا

translation: so that you may tread its spacious paths[6].’”
footnotes: [6] In the pursuit of a lawful livelihood.
arabic: لِتَسْلُكُوا مِنْهَا سُبُلًا فِجَاجًا

translation: Noah said, “My Lord, they have disobeyed me and followed those whose wealth and children did not increase them except in loss[7].
footnotes: [7] i.e., the lowly people among them followed their wealthy chiefs.
arabic: قَالَ نُوحٌ رَبِّ إِنَّهُمْ عَصَوْنِي وَاتَّبَعُوا مَنْ لَمْ يَزِدْهُ مَالُهُ وَوَلَدُهُ إِلَّا خَسَارًا

translation: They have contrived a mighty plot,
arabic: وَمَكَرُوا مَكْرًا كُبَّارًا

translation: They said, ‘Do not abandon your gods; and do not abandon Wadd, Suwā‘, Yaghūth, Ya‘ūq, and Nasr[8].’
footnotes: [8] These were the names of idols named after pious men of past generations before the time of Noah, to commemorate them. In later generations, people started worshiping these idols.
arabic: وَقَالُوا لَا تَذَرُنَّ آلِهَتَكُمْ وَلَا تَذَرُنَّ وَدًّا وَلَا سُوَاعًا وَلَا يَغُوثَ وَيَعُوقَ وَنَسْرًا

translation: They have led many astray. So [O Lord], do not increase the wrongdoers except in error.”
arabic: وَقَدْ أَضَلُّوا كَثِيرًا ۖ وَلَا تَزِدِ الظَّالِمِينَ إِلَّا ضَلَالًا

translation: Because of their sins, they were drowned and then were cast into the Fire, and they did not find any helpers against Allah.
arabic: مِمَّا خَطِيئَاتِهِمْ أُغْرِقُوا فَأُدْخِلُوا نَارًا فَلَمْ يَجِدُوا لَهُمْ مِنْ دُونِ اللَّهِ أَنْصَارًا

translation: Noah said, “My Lord, do not leave on earth a single disbeliever.
arabic: وَقَالَ نُوحٌ رَبِّ لَا تَذَرْ عَلَى الْأَرْضِ مِنَ الْكَافِرِينَ دَيَّارًا

translation: For if You leave them, they will surely lead Your slaves astray and beget none but wicked disbelievers.
arabic: إِنَّكَ إِنْ تَذَرْهُمْ يُضِلُّوا عِبَادَكَ وَلَا يَلِدُوا إِلَّا فَاجِرًا كَفَّارًا

translation: My Lord, forgive me and my parents, and whoever enters my house as a believer, and all the believing men and women, and do not increase the wrongdoers except in ruin.”
arabic: رَبِّ اغْفِرْ لِي وَلِوَالِدَيَّ وَلِمَنْ دَخَلَ بَيْتِيَ مُؤْمِنًا وَلِلْمُؤْمِنِينَ وَالْمُؤْمِنَاتِ وَلَا تَزِدِ الظَّالِمِينَ إِلَّا تَبَارًا

translation: Say, “It has been revealed to me that a group of jinn listened [to the Qur’an,] and they said, ‘Indeed, we have heard a wondrous recitation
arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ قُلْ أُوحِيَ إِلَيَّ أَنَّهُ اسْتَمَعَ نَفَرٌ مِنَ الْجِنِّ فَقَالُوا إِنَّا سَمِعْنَا قُرْآنًا عَجَبًا

translation: that guides to the right way, so we have believed in it, and we will never associate anyone with our Lord.
arabic: يَهْدِي إِلَى الرُّشْدِ فَآمَنَّا بِهِ ۖ وَلَنْ نُشْرِكَ بِرَبِّنَا أَحَدًا

translation: And that He – our exalted and glorified Lord[1] – has neither taken a wife nor a child;
footnotes: [1] “Jadd” of Our Lord means His Glory, Grandeur, and Command.
arabic: وَأَنَّهُ تَعَالَىٰ جَدُّ رَبِّنَا مَا اتَّخَذَ صَاحِبَةً وَلَا وَلَدًا

translation: and that the fool among us [i.e., Satan] used to say outrageous things about Allah[2],
footnotes: [2] i.e., Satan tempted humans to believe that Allah has a wife and children, and that the angels are Allah's daughters.
arabic: وَأَنَّهُ كَانَ يَقُولُ سَفِيهُنَا عَلَى اللَّهِ شَطَطًا

translation: although we thought that humans and jinn would never tell lies about Allah.
arabic: وَأَنَّا ظَنَنَّا أَنْ لَنْ تَقُولَ الْإِنْسُ وَالْجِنُّ عَلَى اللَّهِ كَذِبًا

translation: And there were some men who used to seek refuge with some jinn, but they only increased them in burden.
arabic: وَأَنَّهُ كَانَ رِجَالٌ مِنَ الْإِنْسِ يَعُوذُونَ بِرِجَالٍ مِنَ الْجِنِّ فَزَادُوهُمْ رَهَقًا

translation: They thought, just like you [jinn] thought that Allah would never send any messenger.
arabic: وَأَنَّهُمْ ظَنُّوا كَمَا ظَنَنْتُمْ أَنْ لَنْ يَبْعَثَ اللَّهُ أَحَدًا

translation: We have sought to reach heaven but found it filled with stern guards and flaming fire.
arabic: وَأَنَّا لَمَسْنَا السَّمَاءَ فَوَجَدْنَاهَا مُلِئَتْ حَرَسًا شَدِيدًا وَشُهُبًا

translation: We used to take up positions there for eavesdropping, but now anyone who eavesdrops will find a flaming fire waiting for him[3].
footnotes: [3] After the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) was sent as a messenger, the jinn who used to eavesdrop on heaven and then pass it on to fortune-tellers came to an end.
arabic: وَأَنَّا كُنَّا نَقْعُدُ مِنْهَا مَقَاعِدَ لِلسَّمْعِ ۖ فَمَنْ يَسْتَمِعِ الْآنَ يَجِدْ لَهُ شِهَابًا رَصَدًا

translation: We do not know whether evil is intended for those on earth, or their Lord intends good for them.
arabic: وَأَنَّا لَا نَدْرِي أَشَرٌّ أُرِيدَ بِمَنْ فِي الْأَرْضِ أَمْ أَرَادَ بِهِمْ رَبُّهُمْ رَشَدًا

translation: Among us are some who are righteous and some who are otherwise, for we follow divergent ways[4].
footnotes: [4] In beliefs and religious duties.
arabic: وَأَنَّا مِنَّا الصَّالِحُونَ وَمِنَّا دُونَ ذَٰلِكَ ۖ كُنَّا طَرَائِقَ قِدَدًا

translation: We have realized that we can never escape Allah on earth, nor can we ever escape Him by fleeing.
arabic: وَأَنَّا ظَنَنَّا أَنْ لَنْ نُعْجِزَ اللَّهَ فِي الْأَرْضِ وَلَنْ نُعْجِزَهُ هَرَبًا

translation: When we heard the guidance [of the Qur’an], we believed in it. Whoever believes in his Lord will have no fear of curtailment [from his reward] or injustice[5].
footnotes: [5] i.e., nor will the sins of another be placed upon him.
arabic: وَأَنَّا لَمَّا سَمِعْنَا الْهُدَىٰ آمَنَّا بِهِ ۖ فَمَنْ يُؤْمِنْ بِرَبِّهِ فَلَا يَخَافُ بَخْسًا وَلَا رَهَقًا

translation: Among us are some who are Muslims and some who are deviant[6]. Those who accepted Islam have sought the true guidance,
footnotes: [6] i.e., deviant from the right way.
arabic: وَأَنَّا مِنَّا الْمُسْلِمُونَ وَمِنَّا الْقَاسِطُونَ ۖ فَمَنْ أَسْلَمَ فَأُولَٰئِكَ تَحَرَّوْا رَشَدًا

translation: but those who are deviant, they will be fuel for Hell.’”
arabic: وَأَمَّا الْقَاسِطُونَ فَكَانُوا لِجَهَنَّمَ حَطَبًا

translation: “If they had remained steadfast on the right way, We would have given them abundant rain,
arabic: وَأَنْ لَوِ اسْتَقَامُوا عَلَى الطَّرِيقَةِ لَأَسْقَيْنَاهُمْ مَاءً غَدَقًا

translation: as a test for them[7]. But whoever turns away from the remembrance of his Lord[8], He will make him suffer an arduous punishment.
footnotes:
[7] As to whether they will be grateful for Allah's provisions or not.
 [8] i.e., the Qur’an and obedience to Him.
arabic: لِنَفْتِنَهُمْ فِيهِ ۚ وَمَنْ يُعْرِضْ عَنْ ذِكْرِ رَبِّهِ يَسْلُكْهُ عَذَابًا صَعَدًا

translation: The mosques[9] are for Allah alone, so do not supplicate anyone along with Allah.
footnotes: [9] "Masjid" here means every place of worship on earth.
arabic: وَأَنَّ الْمَسَاجِدَ لِلَّهِ فَلَا تَدْعُوا مَعَ اللَّهِ أَحَدًا

translation: Yet when the slave of Allah stood up supplicating Him, they swarmed around him[10].”
footnotes: [10] Crowding in the manner of locusts on top of one another in order to hear him (ﷺ). It refers to the jinn or to the Arabs pagans.
arabic: وَأَنَّهُ لَمَّا قَامَ عَبْدُ اللَّهِ يَدْعُوهُ كَادُوا يَكُونُونَ عَلَيْهِ لِبَدًا

translation: Say [O Prophet], “I only supplicate my Lord and I do not associate anyone with Him.”
arabic: قُلْ إِنَّمَا أَدْعُو رَبِّي وَلَا أُشْرِكُ بِهِ أَحَدًا

translation: Say, “I have no power to harm or benefit you[11].”
footnotes: [11] i.e., grant you goodness and guidance.
arabic: قُلْ إِنِّي لَا أَمْلِكُ لَكُمْ ضَرًّا وَلَا رَشَدًا

translation: Say, “None can ever protect me from Allah [if I should disobey Him], nor can I ever find refuge except in Him.
arabic: قُلْ إِنِّي لَنْ يُجِيرَنِي مِنَ اللَّهِ أَحَدٌ وَلَنْ أَجِدَ مِنْ دُونِهِ مُلْتَحَدًا

translation: I only convey what I receive from Allah and His messages.” And whoever disobeys Allah and His Messenger will certainly be in the Fire of Hell, abiding therein forever.
arabic: إِلَّا بَلَاغًا مِنَ اللَّهِ وَرِسَالَاتِهِ ۚ وَمَنْ يَعْصِ اللَّهَ وَرَسُولَهُ فَإِنَّ لَهُ نَارَ جَهَنَّمَ خَالِدِينَ فِيهَا أَبَدًا

translation: Until when they see what they were promised, they will realize who is weaker in helpers and fewer in number.
arabic: حَتَّىٰ إِذَا رَأَوْا مَا يُوعَدُونَ فَسَيَعْلَمُونَ مَنْ أَضْعَفُ نَاصِرًا وَأَقَلُّ عَدَدًا

translation: Say, “I do not know if what you are promised is near or my Lord has appointed a distant time for it.
arabic: قُلْ إِنْ أَدْرِي أَقَرِيبٌ مَا تُوعَدُونَ أَمْ يَجْعَلُ لَهُ رَبِّي أَمَدًا

translation: [He is] the Knower of the unseen, He does not reveal His unseen to anyone,
arabic: عَالِمُ الْغَيْبِ فَلَا يُظْهِرُ عَلَىٰ غَيْبِهِ أَحَدًا

translation: except the messenger whom He chooses, then He appoints angel-guards before him and behind him[12]
footnotes: [12] Protecting him so that others do not know what he was informed of the unseen.
arabic: إِلَّا مَنِ ارْتَضَىٰ مِنْ رَسُولٍ فَإِنَّهُ يَسْلُكُ مِنْ بَيْنِ يَدَيْهِ وَمِنْ خَلْفِهِ رَصَدًا

translation: to ensure[13] that the messengers fully conveyed the messages of their Lord. He encompasses in His knowledge all about them, and keeps count of all things.”
footnotes: [13] Or "So He may make evident."
arabic: لِيَعْلَمَ أَنْ قَدْ أَبْلَغُوا رِسَالَاتِ رَبِّهِمْ وَأَحَاطَ بِمَا لَدَيْهِمْ وَأَحْصَىٰ كُلَّ شَيْءٍ عَدَدًا

translation: O you the enwrapped one[1],
footnotes: [1] Allah is addressing the Messenger (ﷺ), who was wrapped in his garments.
arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ يَا أَيُّهَا الْمُزَّمِّلُ

translation: Stand up in prayer at night except a little,
arabic: قُمِ اللَّيْلَ إِلَّا قَلِيلًا

translation: half of it, or a little less,
arabic: نِصْفَهُ أَوِ انْقُصْ مِنْهُ قَلِيلًا

translation: or a little more, and recite the Qur’an at a measured pace.
arabic: أَوْ زِدْ عَلَيْهِ وَرَتِّلِ الْقُرْآنَ تَرْتِيلًا

translation: We will send down upon you a heavy Word[2].
footnotes: [2] i.e., the revelation, which the Prophet (ﷺ) would feel its great weight when descending upon him. Also, it is heavy for its ordinances, rulings, punishments, ethics, etc.
arabic: إِنَّا سَنُلْقِي عَلَيْكَ قَوْلًا ثَقِيلًا

translation: Indeed, worship at night is more effective[3] and more conducive to proper recitation[4].
footnotes:
[3] Or "getting up at night is more difficult...," meaning that it can only be done by sincere believers.
 [4] i.e., for reciting, hearing, and understanding of the Qur’an.
arabic: إِنَّ نَاشِئَةَ اللَّيْلِ هِيَ أَشَدُّ وَطْئًا وَأَقْوَمُ قِيلًا

translation: In the daytime, you have plenty of time for your worldly matters.
arabic: إِنَّ لَكَ فِي النَّهَارِ سَبْحًا طَوِيلًا

translation: And remember the Name of your Lord, and devote yourself completely to Him.
arabic: وَاذْكُرِ اسْمَ رَبِّكَ وَتَبَتَّلْ إِلَيْهِ تَبْتِيلًا

translation: [He is] Lord of the east and the west; none has the right to be worshiped except Him, so take Him as the Disposer of your affairs[5].
footnotes: [5] i.e., trust in Allah and rely upon Him in all your matters.
arabic: رَبُّ الْمَشْرِقِ وَالْمَغْرِبِ لَا إِلَٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ فَاتَّخِذْهُ وَكِيلًا

translation: Bear patiently what they say, and avoid them in a gracious manner.
arabic: وَاصْبِرْ عَلَىٰ مَا يَقُولُونَ وَاهْجُرْهُمْ هَجْرًا جَمِيلًا

translation: Leave to Me the deniers who are having a life of luxury, and bear with them for a little while.
arabic: وَذَرْنِي وَالْمُكَذِّبِينَ أُولِي النَّعْمَةِ وَمَهِّلْهُمْ قَلِيلًا

translation: Indeed, We have heavy shackles and a Blazing Fire,
arabic: إِنَّ لَدَيْنَا أَنْكَالًا وَجَحِيمًا

translation: and food that chokes, and a painful punishment,
arabic: وَطَعَامًا ذَا غُصَّةٍ وَعَذَابًا أَلِيمًا

translation: on the Day when the earth and the mountains will convulse, and the mountains will be like dunes of loose sand.
arabic: يَوْمَ تَرْجُفُ الْأَرْضُ وَالْجِبَالُ وَكَانَتِ الْجِبَالُ كَثِيبًا مَهِيلًا

translation: Indeed, We have sent to you a Messenger to be a witness over you, just as We sent to Pharaoh a messenger.
arabic: إِنَّا أَرْسَلْنَا إِلَيْكُمْ رَسُولًا شَاهِدًا عَلَيْكُمْ كَمَا أَرْسَلْنَا إِلَىٰ فِرْعَوْنَ رَسُولًا

translation: But Pharaoh disobeyed the messenger, so We seized him with a severe punishment.
arabic: فَعَصَىٰ فِرْعَوْنُ الرَّسُولَ فَأَخَذْنَاهُ أَخْذًا وَبِيلًا

translation: If you disbelieve, then how will you protect yourselves against a Day that will turn children’s hair gray?
arabic: فَكَيْفَ تَتَّقُونَ إِنْ كَفَرْتُمْ يَوْمًا يَجْعَلُ الْوِلْدَانَ شِيبًا

translation: It will cause the sky to break asunder[6]. His promise will certainly be fulfilled.
footnotes: [6] Out of the terror of that Day.
arabic: السَّمَاءُ مُنْفَطِرٌ بِهِ ۚ كَانَ وَعْدُهُ مَفْعُولًا

translation: Indeed, this is a reminder; so whoever wills may take a way to his Lord.
arabic: إِنَّ هَٰذِهِ تَذْكِرَةٌ ۖ فَمَنْ شَاءَ اتَّخَذَ إِلَىٰ رَبِّهِ سَبِيلًا

translation: Indeed, your Lord knows that you [O Prophet] stand up in prayer for nearly two-thirds of the night, or half of it, or one-third of it, as do others among your companions. Allah determines the night and the day; He knows that you [Muslims] cannot keep an accurate count of it, so He pardoned you[7]. Recite then as much of the Qur’an as is easy for you [in the night prayers]. He knows that there are some among you who will be ill, and others traveling in the land, seeking the grace of Allah, and others fighting in Allah’s way. So recite as much of it as is easy for you; establish prayer and give zakah; and lend to Allah a goodly loan[8]. Whatever good you send forth for yourselves, you will find it with Allah, much better in condition and much greater in reward[9]. And seek forgiveness of Allah, for indeed Allah is All-Forgiving, Most-Merciful.
footnotes:
[7] The ruling mentioned at the beginning of this surah is lightened here. So from now on, the believers do not have to stick to any of the portions specified there; rather, they can pray whatever they can at night. It is out of the mercy of Allah upon His servants that He does not want hardship for them.
 [8] i.e., giving in charity and for His causes.
 [9] It will be rewarded tenfold, or 700-fold, and Allah gives even more to whoever He wills. See 2:261.
