arabic: ۞ إِنَّ رَبَّكَ يَعْلَمُ أَنَّكَ تَقُومُ أَدْنَىٰ مِنْ ثُلُثَيِ اللَّيْلِ وَنِصْفَهُ وَثُلُثَهُ وَطَائِفَةٌ مِنَ الَّذِينَ مَعَكَ ۚ وَاللَّهُ يُقَدِّرُ اللَّيْلَ وَالنَّهَارَ ۚ عَلِمَ أَنْ لَنْ تُحْصُوهُ فَتَابَ عَلَيْكُمْ ۖ فَاقْرَءُوا مَا تَيَسَّرَ مِنَ الْقُرْآنِ ۚ عَلِمَ أَنْ سَيَكُونُ مِنْكُمْ مَرْضَىٰ ۙ وَآخَرُونَ يَضْرِبُونَ فِي الْأَرْضِ يَبْتَغُونَ مِنْ فَضْلِ اللَّهِ ۙ وَآخَرُونَ يُقَاتِلُونَ فِي سَبِيلِ اللَّهِ ۖ فَاقْرَءُوا مَا تَيَسَّرَ مِنْهُ ۚ وَأَقِيمُوا الصَّلَاةَ وَآتُوا الزَّكَاةَ وَأَقْرِضُوا اللَّهَ قَرْضًا حَسَنًا ۚ وَمَا تُقَدِّمُوا لِأَنْفُسِكُمْ مِنْ خَيْرٍ تَجِدُوهُ عِنْدَ اللَّهِ هُوَ خَيْرًا وَأَعْظَمَ أَجْرًا ۚ وَاسْتَغْفِرُوا اللَّهَ ۖ إِنَّ اللَّهَ غَفُورٌ رَحِيمٌ

translation: O you covered [in your cloak][1],
footnotes: [1] It refers to the Prophet (ﷺ).
arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ يَا أَيُّهَا الْمُدَّثِّرُ

translation: arise and warn,
arabic: قُمْ فَأَنْذِرْ

translation: and proclaim the greatness of your Lord,
arabic: وَرَبَّكَ فَكَبِّرْ

translation: and purify your garments,
arabic: وَثِيَابَكَ فَطَهِّرْ

translation: and shun idol worshiping[2],
footnotes: [2] And other sins and bad conducts and morals.
arabic: وَالرُّجْزَ فَاهْجُرْ

translation: and do not do a favor for a greater return[3],
footnotes: [3] Or: do not consider your good deeds as a favor to Allah, thinking of your little deeds as abundant.
arabic: وَلَا تَمْنُنْ تَسْتَكْثِرُ

translation: and be patient for the sake of your Lord.
arabic: وَلِرَبِّكَ فَاصْبِرْ

translation: When the Trumpet is sounded[4],
footnotes: [4] For the second time, causing all to rise from the dead for resurrection. See 39:68.
arabic: فَإِذَا نُقِرَ فِي النَّاقُورِ

translation: that Day will be a difficult day,
arabic: فَذَٰلِكَ يَوْمَئِذٍ يَوْمٌ عَسِيرٌ

translation: not easy for the disbelievers.
arabic: عَلَى الْكَافِرِينَ غَيْرُ يَسِيرٍ

translation: Leave me to deal with the one whom I created lonely[5],
footnotes: [5] i.e., having no wealth or children. It refers to al-Walīd bin al-Mughīrah, who was impressed by the Qur’an, yet he publicly denied it to win the approval of the pagans of Makkah.
arabic: ذَرْنِي وَمَنْ خَلَقْتُ وَحِيدًا

translation: and gave him abundant wealth,
arabic: وَجَعَلْتُ لَهُ مَالًا مَمْدُودًا

translation: and sons by his side,
arabic: وَبَنِينَ شُهُودًا

translation: and gave him a life of comfort and power,
arabic: وَمَهَّدْتُ لَهُ تَمْهِيدًا

translation: yet he aspires that I should give him more.
arabic: ثُمَّ يَطْمَعُ أَنْ أَزِيدَ

translation: By no means! For he has been stubborn against Our verses.
arabic: كَلَّا ۖ إِنَّهُ كَانَ لِآيَاتِنَا عَنِيدًا

translation: I will subject him to an unbearable punishment.
arabic: سَأُرْهِقُهُ صَعُودًا

translation: For he reflected and plotted [against the Qur’an][6].
footnotes: [6] In order to discredit it.
arabic: إِنَّهُ فَكَّرَ وَقَدَّرَ

translation: May he perish, how he plotted!
arabic: فَقُتِلَ كَيْفَ قَدَّرَ

translation: Again, may he perish, how he plotted!
arabic: ثُمَّ قُتِلَ كَيْفَ قَدَّرَ

translation: Then he looked around,
arabic: ثُمَّ نَظَرَ

translation: then he frowned and scowled,
arabic: ثُمَّ عَبَسَ وَبَسَرَ

translation: then turned away with arrogance,
arabic: ثُمَّ أَدْبَرَ وَاسْتَكْبَرَ

translation: then said, “This is nothing but magic from the past.
arabic: فَقَالَ إِنْ هَٰذَا إِلَّا سِحْرٌ يُؤْثَرُ

translation: This is nothing but the words of a man.”
arabic: إِنْ هَٰذَا إِلَّا قَوْلُ الْبَشَرِ

translation: Soon I will make him burn in the Scorching Fire[7].
footnotes: [7] "Saqar" is one of the names of Hell.
arabic: سَأُصْلِيهِ سَقَرَ

translation: How do you know what Scorching Fire is?
arabic: وَمَا أَدْرَاكَ مَا سَقَرُ

translation: It leaves nothing and spares no one,
arabic: لَا تُبْقِي وَلَا تَذَرُ

translation: scorching the skin.
arabic: لَوَّاحَةٌ لِلْبَشَرِ

translation: It is overseen by nineteen [angels].
arabic: عَلَيْهَا تِسْعَةَ عَشَرَ

translation: We have only appointed angels as keepers of the Fire, and We have only made their number as a test for the disbelievers[8], so that those who were given the Scripture may have certainty and the believers may increase in faith; and neither those who were given the Scripture nor the believers may have any doubts; and so that those [hypocrites] in whose hearts is sickness and the disbelievers may say, “What does Allah mean by this number?” Thus Allah causes to stray whom He wills and guides whom He wills, and none knows the soldiers of your Lord but He. This is but a reminder to mankind.
footnotes: [8] To say what they want to say, so their punishment will be multiplied for them. Abu Jahl, one of the chief pagans in Makkah, made fun of the Prophet (ﷺ) when they came to know that the keepers of Hell are nineteen angels, so he ridiculed this number and said that it is an easy number to overcome.
arabic: وَمَا جَعَلْنَا أَصْحَابَ النَّارِ إِلَّا مَلَائِكَةً ۙ وَمَا جَعَلْنَا عِدَّتَهُمْ إِلَّا فِتْنَةً لِلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا لِيَسْتَيْقِنَ الَّذِينَ أُوتُوا الْكِتَابَ وَيَزْدَادَ الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا إِيمَانًا ۙ وَلَا يَرْتَابَ الَّذِينَ أُوتُوا الْكِتَابَ وَالْمُؤْمِنُونَ ۙ وَلِيَقُولَ الَّذِينَ فِي قُلُوبِهِمْ مَرَضٌ وَالْكَافِرُونَ مَاذَا أَرَادَ اللَّهُ بِهَٰذَا مَثَلًا ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ يُضِلُّ اللَّهُ مَنْ يَشَاءُ وَيَهْدِي مَنْ يَشَاءُ ۚ وَمَا يَعْلَمُ جُنُودَ رَبِّكَ إِلَّا هُوَ ۚ وَمَا هِيَ إِلَّا ذِكْرَىٰ لِلْبَشَرِ

translation: No indeed! By the moon,
arabic: كَلَّا وَالْقَمَرِ

translation: and by the night when it departs,
arabic: وَاللَّيْلِ إِذْ أَدْبَرَ

translation: and by the dawn when it brightens,
arabic: وَالصُّبْحِ إِذَا أَسْفَرَ

translation: Hellfire is indeed one of the greatest matters,
arabic: إِنَّهَا لَإِحْدَى الْكُبَرِ

translation: a warning to mankind,
arabic: نَذِيرًا لِلْبَشَرِ

translation: to whoever among you chooses to advance or regress.
arabic: لِمَنْ شَاءَ مِنْكُمْ أَنْ يَتَقَدَّمَ أَوْ يَتَأَخَّرَ

translation: Every soul is held in pledge[9] for its deeds,
footnotes: [9] i.e., held responsible.
arabic: كُلُّ نَفْسٍ بِمَا كَسَبَتْ رَهِينَةٌ

translation: except the People of the Right[10],
footnotes: [10] i.e., the believers who receive their records of deeds in their right hands.
arabic: إِلَّا أَصْحَابَ الْيَمِينِ

translation: who will be in gardens, asking one another
arabic: فِي جَنَّاتٍ يَتَسَاءَلُونَ

translation: about the wicked:
arabic: عَنِ الْمُجْرِمِينَ

translation: “What brought you to Hell?”
arabic: مَا سَلَكَكُمْ فِي سَقَرَ

translation: They will say, “We were not among those who prayed,
arabic: قَالُوا لَمْ نَكُ مِنَ الْمُصَلِّينَ

translation: nor did we feed the poor,
arabic: وَلَمْ نَكُ نُطْعِمُ الْمِسْكِينَ

translation: and we indulged in falsehood along with those who indulged in it,
arabic: وَكُنَّا نَخُوضُ مَعَ الْخَائِضِينَ

translation: and we denied the Day of Judgment,
arabic: وَكُنَّا نُكَذِّبُ بِيَوْمِ الدِّينِ

translation: until the certainty [of death] came to us.”
arabic: حَتَّىٰ أَتَانَا الْيَقِينُ

translation: So the intercession of intercessors will not benefit them.
arabic: فَمَا تَنْفَعُهُمْ شَفَاعَةُ الشَّافِعِينَ

translation: Then what is the matter with them that they turn away from the Reminder,
arabic: فَمَا لَهُمْ عَنِ التَّذْكِرَةِ مُعْرِضِينَ

translation: as if they were terrified wild asses,
arabic: كَأَنَّهُمْ حُمُرٌ مُسْتَنْفِرَةٌ

translation: fleeing from a lion?
arabic: فَرَّتْ مِنْ قَسْوَرَةٍ

translation: In fact, each one of them desires that open [divine] letters be sent to each of them[11].
footnotes: [11] Instead of Muhammad (ﷺ), not due to the lack of proofs or signs presented to them but out of obstinacy and arrogance.
arabic: بَلْ يُرِيدُ كُلُّ امْرِئٍ مِنْهُمْ أَنْ يُؤْتَىٰ صُحُفًا مُنَشَّرَةً

translation: By no means! They rather do not fear the Hereafter.
arabic: كَلَّا ۖ بَلْ لَا يَخَافُونَ الْآخِرَةَ

translation: No indeed! This [Qur’an] is a reminder.
arabic: كَلَّا إِنَّهُ تَذْكِرَةٌ

translation: So whoever wills may take heed.
arabic: فَمَنْ شَاءَ ذَكَرَهُ

translation: But they will not take heed unless Allah so wills. He is most worthy to be feared and most worthy to forgive.
arabic: وَمَا يَذْكُرُونَ إِلَّا أَنْ يَشَاءَ اللَّهُ ۚ هُوَ أَهْلُ التَّقْوَىٰ وَأَهْلُ الْمَغْفِرَةِ

translation: I swear by the Day of Resurrection,
arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ لَا أُقْسِمُ بِيَوْمِ الْقِيَامَةِ

translation: and I swear by the self-reproaching soul[1]!
footnotes: [1] Of the believer, which blames oneself whenever falls into sin or error.
arabic: وَلَا أُقْسِمُ بِالنَّفْسِ اللَّوَّامَةِ

translation: Does man think that We cannot reassemble his bones?
arabic: أَيَحْسَبُ الْإِنْسَانُ أَلَّنْ نَجْمَعَ عِظَامَهُ

translation: In fact, We are able to restore even his very fingertips.
arabic: بَلَىٰ قَادِرِينَ عَلَىٰ أَنْ نُسَوِّيَ بَنَانَهُ

translation: But man desires to persist in sin[2],
footnotes: [2] While denying the coming of the Day of Judgment.
arabic: بَلْ يُرِيدُ الْإِنْسَانُ لِيَفْجُرَ أَمَامَهُ

translation: and asks [mockingly], “When is the Day of Resurrection?”
arabic: يَسْأَلُ أَيَّانَ يَوْمُ الْقِيَامَةِ

translation: But when the sight is dazzled,
arabic: فَإِذَا بَرِقَ الْبَصَرُ

translation: and the moon is darkened,
arabic: وَخَسَفَ الْقَمَرُ

translation: and the sun and the moon are brought together[3],
footnotes: [3] They both have never been together since they were created. On this Day they will be brought together, darkened, and both will be thrown into the Hell; so that all should know that they were subservient created beings, especially those who worshiped them.
arabic: وَجُمِعَ الشَّمْسُ وَالْقَمَرُ

translation: on that Day man will say, “Where is the escape?”
arabic: يَقُولُ الْإِنْسَانُ يَوْمَئِذٍ أَيْنَ الْمَفَرُّ

translation: No indeed! There will be no refuge.
arabic: كَلَّا لَا وَزَرَ

translation: On that Day all will end up before your Lord.
arabic: إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ يَوْمَئِذٍ الْمُسْتَقَرُّ

translation: On that Day man will be informed of what he has sent forth[4] and left behind[5].
footnotes:
[4] i.e., of his deeds for the Hereafter.
 [5] i.e., that which he failed to do.
arabic: يُنَبَّأُ الْإِنْسَانُ يَوْمَئِذٍ بِمَا قَدَّمَ وَأَخَّرَ

translation: In fact, man will be a witness against himself[6],
footnotes: [6] His organs will testify against him, as mentioned in 36:65 and 41:20-23.
arabic: بَلِ الْإِنْسَانُ عَلَىٰ نَفْسِهِ بَصِيرَةٌ

translation: despite the excuses he may put forward.
arabic: وَلَوْ أَلْقَىٰ مَعَاذِيرَهُ

translation: Do not move your tongue [O Prophet] in haste trying to memorize it.
arabic: لَا تُحَرِّكْ بِهِ لِسَانَكَ لِتَعْجَلَ بِهِ

translation: It is upon Us to make you memorize and recite it.
arabic: إِنَّ عَلَيْنَا جَمْعَهُ وَقُرْآنَهُ

translation: Then when We recite it [through Gabriel], follow its recitation attentively;
arabic: فَإِذَا قَرَأْنَاهُ فَاتَّبِعْ قُرْآنَهُ

translation: then it is upon Us to explain its meanings.
arabic: ثُمَّ إِنَّ عَلَيْنَا بَيَانَهُ

translation: No indeed! You [people] love this fleeting world,
arabic: كَلَّا بَلْ تُحِبُّونَ الْعَاجِلَةَ

translation: and neglect the Hereafter.
arabic: وَتَذَرُونَ الْآخِرَةَ

translation: On that Day some faces will be bright,
arabic: وُجُوهٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ نَاضِرَةٌ

translation: looking at their Lord[7].
footnotes: [7] The dwellers of Paradise will be granted the honor of actually seeing their Lord in the Hereafter.
arabic: إِلَىٰ رَبِّهَا نَاظِرَةٌ

translation: And on that Day, some faces will be gloomy,
arabic: وَوُجُوهٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ بَاسِرَةٌ

translation: knowing that a crushing calamity will befall them.
arabic: تَظُنُّ أَنْ يُفْعَلَ بِهَا فَاقِرَةٌ

translation: Indeed, when the soul reaches the throat[8],
footnotes: [8] Upon death.
arabic: كَلَّا إِذَا بَلَغَتِ التَّرَاقِيَ

translation: and it is said, “Is there any healer?”
arabic: وَقِيلَ مَنْ ۜ رَاقٍ

translation: And he realizes that it is time to depart,
arabic: وَظَنَّ أَنَّهُ الْفِرَاقُ

translation: when legs are brought together [in a shroud][9];
footnotes: [9] The difficulties the person faces while leaving this world and moving on to the Hereafter; or the people arrange for the departure of his body, while angels arrange for the departure of his soul.
arabic: وَالْتَفَّتِ السَّاقُ بِالسَّاقِ

translation: on that Day, he will be driven to your Lord.
arabic: إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ يَوْمَئِذٍ الْمَسَاقُ

translation: He neither believed nor prayed;
arabic: فَلَا صَدَّقَ وَلَا صَلَّىٰ

translation: rather he denied and turned away,
arabic: وَلَٰكِنْ كَذَّبَ وَتَوَلَّىٰ

translation: then he went to his people, elated with pride,
arabic: ثُمَّ ذَهَبَ إِلَىٰ أَهْلِهِ يَتَمَطَّىٰ

translation: Woe to you, and woe!
arabic: أَوْلَىٰ لَكَ فَأَوْلَىٰ

translation: Again, woe to you, and woe!
arabic: ثُمَّ أَوْلَىٰ لَكَ فَأَوْلَىٰ

translation: Does man think that he will be left neglected[10]?
footnotes: [10] i.e., without purpose and responsibility, or without returning to Allah for account.
arabic: أَيَحْسَبُ الْإِنْسَانُ أَنْ يُتْرَكَ سُدًى

translation: Was he not once a drop of semen emitted,
arabic: أَلَمْ يَكُ نُطْفَةً مِنْ مَنِيٍّ يُمْنَىٰ

translation: then he became a clinging clot[11], then He created him and perfected his form,
footnotes: [11] "‘Alaqah": an embryo that resembles a leech.
arabic: ثُمَّ كَانَ عَلَقَةً فَخَلَقَ فَسَوَّىٰ

translation: and made from him both genders, male and female?
arabic: فَجَعَلَ مِنْهُ الزَّوْجَيْنِ الذَّكَرَ وَالْأُنْثَىٰ

translation: Is not He able to bring the dead back to life?
arabic: أَلَيْسَ ذَٰلِكَ بِقَادِرٍ عَلَىٰ أَنْ يُحْيِيَ الْمَوْتَىٰ

translation: Was there not a period of time when man was not a thing [even] mentioned[1]?
footnotes: [1] Before coming into being.
arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ هَلْ أَتَىٰ عَلَى الْإِنْسَانِ حِينٌ مِنَ الدَّهْرِ لَمْ يَكُنْ شَيْئًا مَذْكُورًا

translation: Indeed, We created man from a drop of mixed fluids[2], in order to test him. So We gave him hearing and sight.
footnotes: [2] A combination of male and female gametes (sperm and egg) which form the zygote after fertilization in the womb.
arabic: إِنَّا خَلَقْنَا الْإِنْسَانَ مِنْ نُطْفَةٍ أَمْشَاجٍ نَبْتَلِيهِ فَجَعَلْنَاهُ سَمِيعًا بَصِيرًا

translation: Indeed, We showed him the way, whether he is grateful or ungrateful.
arabic: إِنَّا هَدَيْنَاهُ السَّبِيلَ إِمَّا شَاكِرًا وَإِمَّا كَفُورًا

translation: We have surely prepared for the disbelievers chains, shackles, and a Blazing Fire.
arabic: إِنَّا أَعْتَدْنَا لِلْكَافِرِينَ سَلَاسِلَ وَأَغْلَالًا وَسَعِيرًا

translation: Indeed, the righteous will drink from a cup [of wine] flavored with camphor[3],
footnotes: [3] "Kāfoor": a sweet-scent spring in Paradise.
arabic: إِنَّ الْأَبْرَارَ يَشْرَبُونَ مِنْ كَأْسٍ كَانَ مِزَاجُهَا كَافُورًا

translation: a spring from which Allah’s slaves will drink, which will flow as they wish.
arabic: عَيْنًا يَشْرَبُ بِهَا عِبَادُ اللَّهِ يُفَجِّرُونَهَا تَفْجِيرًا

translation: They fulfill their vows and fear a Day whose evil will spread far and wide,
arabic: يُوفُونَ بِالنَّذْرِ وَيَخَافُونَ يَوْمًا كَانَ شَرُّهُ مُسْتَطِيرًا

translation: and they give food, despite their love for it[4], to the needy, the orphans, and the captives,
footnotes: [4] Or "out of love for Him (Allah)".
arabic: وَيُطْعِمُونَ الطَّعَامَ عَلَىٰ حُبِّهِ مِسْكِينًا وَيَتِيمًا وَأَسِيرًا

translation: [saying to themselves] “We feed you only for the sake of Allah; we seek from you neither reward nor gratitude.
arabic: إِنَّمَا نُطْعِمُكُمْ لِوَجْهِ اللَّهِ لَا نُرِيدُ مِنْكُمْ جَزَاءً وَلَا شُكُورًا

translation: We fear from our Lord a grim and distressful Day.”
arabic: إِنَّا نَخَافُ مِنْ رَبِّنَا يَوْمًا عَبُوسًا قَمْطَرِيرًا

translation: So Allah will protect them from the evil of that Day, and will grant them radiance and delight,
arabic: فَوَقَاهُمُ اللَّهُ شَرَّ ذَٰلِكَ الْيَوْمِ وَلَقَّاهُمْ نَضْرَةً وَسُرُورًا

translation: and will reward them for their perseverance with Paradise and garments of silk.
arabic: وَجَزَاهُمْ بِمَا صَبَرُوا جَنَّةً وَحَرِيرًا

translation: They will recline therein on adorned couches; neither feeling scorching heat[5] nor freezing cold.
footnotes: [5] i.e., the sun.
arabic: مُتَّكِئِينَ فِيهَا عَلَى الْأَرَائِكِ ۖ لَا يَرَوْنَ فِيهَا شَمْسًا وَلَا زَمْهَرِيرًا

translation: with shady branches spread above them, and clusters of fruit will be made within their reach.
arabic: وَدَانِيَةً عَلَيْهِمْ ظِلَالُهَا وَذُلِّلَتْ قُطُوفُهَا تَذْلِيلًا

translation: They will be served frequently with silver vessels and crystal cups,
arabic: وَيُطَافُ عَلَيْهِمْ بِآنِيَةٍ مِنْ فِضَّةٍ وَأَكْوَابٍ كَانَتْ قَوَارِيرَا

translation: crystalline goblets of silver, filled precisely as desired.
arabic: قَوَارِيرَ مِنْ فِضَّةٍ قَدَّرُوهَا تَقْدِيرًا

translation: They will be given a glass [of wine] flavored with ginger
arabic: وَيُسْقَوْنَ فِيهَا كَأْسًا كَانَ مِزَاجُهَا زَنْجَبِيلًا

translation: from a spring therein called Salsabīl.
arabic: عَيْنًا فِيهَا تُسَمَّىٰ سَلْسَبِيلًا

translation: They will be served by eternal young boys; if you see them, you would think that they are scattered pearls.
arabic: ۞ وَيَطُوفُ عَلَيْهِمْ وِلْدَانٌ مُخَلَّدُونَ إِذَا رَأَيْتَهُمْ حَسِبْتَهُمْ لُؤْلُؤًا مَنْثُورًا

translation: If you were to look around, you would see bliss and a vast dominion.
arabic: وَإِذَا رَأَيْتَ ثَمَّ رَأَيْتَ نَعِيمًا وَمُلْكًا كَبِيرًا

translation: They will be dressed in garments of fine green silk and rich brocade, and will be adorned with bracelets of silver, and their Lord will give them a pure drink.
arabic: عَالِيَهُمْ ثِيَابُ سُنْدُسٍ خُضْرٌ وَإِسْتَبْرَقٌ ۖ وَحُلُّوا أَسَاوِرَ مِنْ فِضَّةٍ وَسَقَاهُمْ رَبُّهُمْ شَرَابًا طَهُورًا

translation: [And they will be told,] “Indeed, this is your reward, and your efforts have been appreciated.”
arabic: إِنَّ هَٰذَا كَانَ لَكُمْ جَزَاءً وَكَانَ سَعْيُكُمْ مَشْكُورًا

translation: Indeed, it is We Who have sent down the Qur’an to you in stages.
arabic: إِنَّا نَحْنُ نَزَّلْنَا عَلَيْكَ الْقُرْآنَ تَنْزِيلًا

translation: So be patient with your Lord’s decree, and do not obey any sinner or disbeliever from among them.
arabic: فَاصْبِرْ لِحُكْمِ رَبِّكَ وَلَا تُطِعْ مِنْهُمْ آثِمًا أَوْ كَفُورًا

translation: And remember the Name of your Lord morning and evening[6],
footnotes: [6] This and the next verse refer to the five daily prayers: here it refers to the dawn prayer, then the noon and afternoon prayers.
arabic: وَاذْكُرِ اسْمَ رَبِّكَ بُكْرَةً وَأَصِيلًا

translation: and prostrate to Him at night, and glorify Him at length by night[7].
footnotes: [7] It refers to the sunset and night prayers.
arabic: وَمِنَ اللَّيْلِ فَاسْجُدْ لَهُ وَسَبِّحْهُ لَيْلًا طَوِيلًا

translation: Indeed, these [pagans] love this fleeting life and pay no heed to a heavy Day ahead of them.
arabic: إِنَّ هَٰؤُلَاءِ يُحِبُّونَ الْعَاجِلَةَ وَيَذَرُونَ وَرَاءَهُمْ يَوْمًا ثَقِيلًا

translation: It is We Who created them and strengthened their build. If We will, We can replace them with others like them.
arabic: نَحْنُ خَلَقْنَاهُمْ وَشَدَدْنَا أَسْرَهُمْ ۖ وَإِذَا شِئْنَا بَدَّلْنَا أَمْثَالَهُمْ تَبْدِيلًا

translation: Indeed, this is a reminder; so let anyone who wills may take a way to his Lord.
arabic: إِنَّ هَٰذِهِ تَذْكِرَةٌ ۖ فَمَنْ شَاءَ اتَّخَذَ إِلَىٰ رَبِّهِ سَبِيلًا

translation: But you cannot will unless Allah wills. Indeed, Allah is All-Knowing, All-Wise.
arabic: وَمَا تَشَاءُونَ إِلَّا أَنْ يَشَاءَ اللَّهُ ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ كَانَ عَلِيمًا حَكِيمًا

translation: He admits whom He wills into His mercy, but for the wrongdoers He has prepared a painful punishment.
arabic: يُدْخِلُ مَنْ يَشَاءُ فِي رَحْمَتِهِ ۚ وَالظَّالِمِينَ أَعَدَّ لَهُمْ عَذَابًا أَلِيمًا

translation: By those [winds] sent forth in succession,
arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ وَالْمُرْسَلَاتِ عُرْفًا

translation: those that blow violently,
arabic: فَالْعَاصِفَاتِ عَصْفًا

translation: and scatter [rainclouds] far and wide,
arabic: وَالنَّاشِرَاتِ نَشْرًا

translation: And by those [angels] who bring criterion[1];
footnotes: [1] To Allah's messengers to distinguish between truth and falsehood.
arabic: فَالْفَارِقَاتِ فَرْقًا

translation: and those who deliver revelation,
arabic: فَالْمُلْقِيَاتِ ذِكْرًا

translation: leaving no excuse or giving warning –
arabic: عُذْرًا أَوْ نُذْرًا

translation: what you are promised will surely come to pass.
arabic: إِنَّمَا تُوعَدُونَ لَوَاقِعٌ

translation: So when the stars are effaced,
arabic: فَإِذَا النُّجُومُ طُمِسَتْ

translation: and when the sky is split apart,
arabic: وَإِذَا السَّمَاءُ فُرِجَتْ

translation: and when the mountains are blown away,
arabic: وَإِذَا الْجِبَالُ نُسِفَتْ

translation: and when the messengers are summoned[2],
footnotes: [2] To testify concerning their nations.
arabic: وَإِذَا الرُّسُلُ أُقِّتَتْ

translation: until which Day has all this been postponed?
arabic: لِأَيِّ يَوْمٍ أُجِّلَتْ

translation: Until the Day of Judgment.
arabic: لِيَوْمِ الْفَصْلِ

translation: How do you know what the Day of Judgment is?
arabic: وَمَا أَدْرَاكَ مَا يَوْمُ الْفَصْلِ

translation: Woe on that Day to the deniers[3]!
footnotes: [3] i.e., Death and destruction be upon them.
arabic: وَيْلٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ لِلْمُكَذِّبِينَ

translation: Did We not destroy the earlier nations?
arabic: أَلَمْ نُهْلِكِ الْأَوَّلِينَ

translation: Then We will do likewise to the later ones.
arabic: ثُمَّ نُتْبِعُهُمُ الْآخِرِينَ

translation: This is how We deal with the wicked.
arabic: كَذَٰلِكَ نَفْعَلُ بِالْمُجْرِمِينَ

translation: Woe on that Day to the deniers!
arabic: وَيْلٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ لِلْمُكَذِّبِينَ

translation: Did We not create you from a worthless fluid,
arabic: أَلَمْ نَخْلُقْكُمْ مِنْ مَاءٍ مَهِينٍ

translation: then We placed it in a secure repository
arabic: فَجَعَلْنَاهُ فِي قَرَارٍ مَكِينٍ

translation: for a determined period[4]?
arabic: إِلَىٰ قَدَرٍ مَعْلُومٍ

translation: For We determined it; How excellently We determine!
arabic: فَقَدَرْنَا فَنِعْمَ الْقَادِرُونَ

translation: Woe on that Day to the deniers!
arabic: وَيْلٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ لِلْمُكَذِّبِينَ

translation: Have We not made the earth a receptacle[5]
footnotes: [5] i.e., a lodging, a container that contains all people.
arabic: أَلَمْ نَجْعَلِ الْأَرْضَ كِفَاتًا

translation: for the living and the dead,
arabic: أَحْيَاءً وَأَمْوَاتًا

translation: and placed therein firm towering mountains, and given you fresh water to drink?
arabic: وَجَعَلْنَا فِيهَا رَوَاسِيَ شَامِخَاتٍ وَأَسْقَيْنَاكُمْ مَاءً فُرَاتًا

translation: Woe on that Day to the deniers!
arabic: وَيْلٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ لِلْمُكَذِّبِينَ

translation: [They will be told,] “Proceed to that [Fire] which you used to deny!
arabic: انْطَلِقُوا إِلَىٰ مَا كُنْتُمْ بِهِ تُكَذِّبُونَ

translation: Proceed to the shadow [of smoke] ascending in three columns,
arabic: انْطَلِقُوا إِلَىٰ ظِلٍّ ذِي ثَلَاثِ شُعَبٍ

translation: that provides neither shade nor protection from the flames.
arabic: لَا ظَلِيلٍ وَلَا يُغْنِي مِنَ اللَّهَبِ

translation: Indeed, it [i.e., Hell] throws up sparks as big as castles,
arabic: إِنَّهَا تَرْمِي بِشَرَرٍ كَالْقَصْرِ

translation: as if they were tawny camels[6].
footnotes: [6] i.e., huge and black camels.
arabic: كَأَنَّهُ جِمَالَتٌ صُفْرٌ

translation: Woe on that Day to the deniers!
arabic: وَيْلٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ لِلْمُكَذِّبِينَ

translation: On that Day they won’t speak,
arabic: هَٰذَا يَوْمُ لَا يَنْطِقُونَ

translation: nor will they be allowed to make excuses.
arabic: وَلَا يُؤْذَنُ لَهُمْ فَيَعْتَذِرُونَ

translation: Woe on that Day to the deniers!
arabic: وَيْلٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ لِلْمُكَذِّبِينَ

translation: [They will be told,] “This is the Day of Judgment: We have gathered you along with the earlier generations.
arabic: هَٰذَا يَوْمُ الْفَصْلِ ۖ جَمَعْنَاكُمْ وَالْأَوَّلِينَ

translation: So if you have any scheme, then plot it against Me.”
arabic: فَإِنْ كَانَ لَكُمْ كَيْدٌ فَكِيدُونِ

translation: Woe on that Day to the deniers!
arabic: وَيْلٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ لِلْمُكَذِّبِينَ

translation: Indeed, the righteous will be amid shades and springs
arabic: إِنَّ الْمُتَّقِينَ فِي ظِلَالٍ وَعُيُونٍ

translation: and will have whatever fruit they desire.
arabic: وَفَوَاكِهَ مِمَّا يَشْتَهُونَ

translation: [They will be told,] “Eat and drink joyfully, as a reward for what you used to do.”
arabic: كُلُوا وَاشْرَبُوا هَنِيئًا بِمَا كُنْتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ

translation: This is how We reward those who do good.
arabic: إِنَّا كَذَٰلِكَ نَجْزِي الْمُحْسِنِينَ

translation: Woe on that Day to the deniers!
arabic: وَيْلٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ لِلْمُكَذِّبِينَ

translation: “Eat and enjoy yourselves for a while; you are truly wicked.”
arabic: كُلُوا وَتَمَتَّعُوا قَلِيلًا إِنَّكُمْ مُجْرِمُونَ

translation: Woe on that Day to the deniers!
arabic: وَيْلٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ لِلْمُكَذِّبِينَ

translation: When it is said to them, “Bow [in prayer],” they do not bow.
arabic: وَإِذَا قِيلَ لَهُمُ ارْكَعُوا لَا يَرْكَعُونَ

translation: Woe on that Day to the deniers!
arabic: وَيْلٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ لِلْمُكَذِّبِينَ

translation: In which message after this [Qur’an] will they believe?
arabic: فَبِأَيِّ حَدِيثٍ بَعْدَهُ يُؤْمِنُونَ

translation: About what are they asking one another?
arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ عَمَّ يَتَسَاءَلُونَ

translation: About the momentous news[1],
footnotes: [1] i.e., the Resurrection.
arabic: عَنِ النَّبَإِ الْعَظِيمِ

translation: that which they differ about[2].
footnotes: [2] The pagans of Makkah denied the Qur’an, resurrection, and judgment. They differed as to whether the Qur’an was magic, fortune-telling, or poetry.
arabic: الَّذِي هُمْ فِيهِ مُخْتَلِفُونَ

translation: No indeed; they will come to know.
arabic: كَلَّا سَيَعْلَمُونَ

translation: Again no; they will come to know.
arabic: ثُمَّ كَلَّا سَيَعْلَمُونَ

translation: Have We not made the earth a resting place?
arabic: أَلَمْ نَجْعَلِ الْأَرْضَ مِهَادًا

translation: And the mountains as stakes[3],
footnotes: [3] Mountains go deep below the surface like pegs and icebergs, stabilizing the earth and slowing tectonic movement.
arabic: وَالْجِبَالَ أَوْتَادًا

translation: and created you in pairs,
arabic: وَخَلَقْنَاكُمْ أَزْوَاجًا

translation: and made your sleep for rest,
arabic: وَجَعَلْنَا نَوْمَكُمْ سُبَاتًا

translation: and made the night a covering[4],
footnotes: [4] Covering you in its darkness as garments cover you.
arabic: وَجَعَلْنَا اللَّيْلَ لِبَاسًا

translation: and made the day for seeking a livelihood,
arabic: وَجَعَلْنَا النَّهَارَ مَعَاشًا

translation: and built above you seven mighty heavens,
arabic: وَبَنَيْنَا فَوْقَكُمْ سَبْعًا شِدَادًا

translation: and made therein a blazing lamp,
arabic: وَجَعَلْنَا سِرَاجًا وَهَّاجًا

translation: and sent down from the rainclouds abundant water,
arabic: وَأَنْزَلْنَا مِنَ الْمُعْصِرَاتِ مَاءً ثَجَّاجًا

translation: so that We may produce thereby grains and vegetation,
arabic: لِنُخْرِجَ بِهِ حَبًّا وَنَبَاتًا

translation: and gardens with dense foliage?
arabic: وَجَنَّاتٍ أَلْفَافًا

translation: Indeed, the Day of Judgment is a time appointed,
arabic: إِنَّ يَوْمَ الْفَصْلِ كَانَ مِيقَاتًا

translation: the Day when the Trumpet will be blown, you will come forth in crowds,
arabic: يَوْمَ يُنْفَخُ فِي الصُّورِ فَتَأْتُونَ أَفْوَاجًا

translation: and the sky will be opened up and will become gateways,
arabic: وَفُتِحَتِ السَّمَاءُ فَكَانَتْ أَبْوَابًا

translation: and the mountains will vanish, becoming like a mirage.
arabic: وَسُيِّرَتِ الْجِبَالُ فَكَانَتْ سَرَابًا

translation: Indeed, Hell is lying in wait,
arabic: إِنَّ جَهَنَّمَ كَانَتْ مِرْصَادًا

translation: a resort for the transgressors,
arabic: لِلطَّاغِينَ مَآبًا

translation: wherein they will abide for endless ages.
arabic: لَابِثِينَ فِيهَا أَحْقَابًا

translation: They will neither taste therein any coolness nor any drink,
arabic: لَا يَذُوقُونَ فِيهَا بَرْدًا وَلَا شَرَابًا

translation: except for scalding water and discharge of wounds,
arabic: إِلَّا حَمِيمًا وَغَسَّاقًا

translation: a fitting recompense[5].
footnotes: [5] To their disbelief and evil deeds.
arabic: جَزَاءً وِفَاقًا

translation: Indeed, they did not expect a reckoning,
arabic: إِنَّهُمْ كَانُوا لَا يَرْجُونَ حِسَابًا

translation: and utterly rejected Our verses.
arabic: وَكَذَّبُوا بِآيَاتِنَا كِذَّابًا

translation: But We have enumerated everything in a record[6].
footnotes: [6] i.e., a record of deeds.
arabic: وَكُلَّ شَيْءٍ أَحْصَيْنَاهُ كِتَابًا

translation: So taste [the punishment], for We will not increase you except in torment[7].”
footnotes: [7] The addressees are the dwellers of Hell.
arabic: فَذُوقُوا فَلَنْ نَزِيدَكُمْ إِلَّا عَذَابًا

translation: Indeed, the righteous will have salvation[8],
footnotes: [8] i.e., safety from Hell and winning Paradise.
arabic: إِنَّ لِلْمُتَّقِينَ مَفَازًا

translation: gardens and vineyards,
arabic: حَدَائِقَ وَأَعْنَابًا

translation: and full-bosomed maidens of equal age,
arabic: وَكَوَاعِبَ أَتْرَابًا

translation: and a full cup [of wine][9].
footnotes: [9] i.e., tasteful wine which neither intoxicates nor causes headache.
arabic: وَكَأْسًا دِهَاقًا

translation: They will not hear therein vain talk or lies –
arabic: لَا يَسْمَعُونَ فِيهَا لَغْوًا وَلَا كِذَّابًا

translation: a reward and a generous gift from your Lord[10],
footnotes: [10] Or "a gift adequately calculated"; as a result of their righteous deeds as well as the ample generosity of Allah.
arabic: جَزَاءً مِنْ رَبِّكَ عَطَاءً حِسَابًا

translation: [from] the Lord of the heavens and earth and all that is between them, the Most Compassionate; none will dare to speak to Him[11].
footnotes: [11] None can ask or plead on the Day of Judgment except by Allah's permission.
arabic: رَبِّ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا الرَّحْمَٰنِ ۖ لَا يَمْلِكُونَ مِنْهُ خِطَابًا

translation: On the Day when the Spirit and the angels will stand in rows; none will dare to speak, except those to whom the Most Compassionate granted permission, and they will only speak the truth.
arabic: يَوْمَ يَقُومُ الرُّوحُ وَالْمَلَائِكَةُ صَفًّا ۖ لَا يَتَكَلَّمُونَ إِلَّا مَنْ أَذِنَ لَهُ الرَّحْمَٰنُ وَقَالَ صَوَابًا

translation: That Day is sure to come. So whoever wills may seek a path leading to his Lord[12].
footnotes: [12] i.e., the path of guidance and righteous deeds.
arabic: ذَٰلِكَ الْيَوْمُ الْحَقُّ ۖ فَمَنْ شَاءَ اتَّخَذَ إِلَىٰ رَبِّهِ مَآبًا

translation: Indeed, We have warned you of an imminent punishment on the Day when everyone will see what his hands have sent forth[13], and the disbeliever will say, “Oh, I wish that I were dust!”
footnotes: [13] i.e., the deeds he did in this world.
arabic: إِنَّا أَنْذَرْنَاكُمْ عَذَابًا قَرِيبًا يَوْمَ يَنْظُرُ الْمَرْءُ مَا قَدَّمَتْ يَدَاهُ وَيَقُولُ الْكَافِرُ يَا لَيْتَنِي كُنْتُ تُرَابًا

translation: By those who pull out [evil souls][1] harshly,
footnotes: [1] Of the disbelievers.
arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ وَالنَّازِعَاتِ غَرْقًا

translation: and by those who draw out [good souls][2] gently,
footnotes: [2] Of the believers.
arabic: وَالنَّاشِطَاتِ نَشْطًا

translation: and by those who glide swiftly[3],
footnotes: [3] i.e., angels glide swiftly through the heavens and earth with Allah’s command.
arabic: وَالسَّابِحَاتِ سَبْحًا

translation: and those who overtake one another as in a race[4],
footnotes: [4] To execute Allah's commands.
arabic: فَالسَّابِقَاتِ سَبْقًا

translation: and those who carry out the command [of Allah],
arabic: فَالْمُدَبِّرَاتِ أَمْرًا

translation: on the Day when the earth convulses [by the first Blast],
arabic: يَوْمَ تَرْجُفُ الرَّاجِفَةُ

translation: followed by the second Blast,
arabic: تَتْبَعُهَا الرَّادِفَةُ

translation: hearts[5] will be pounding on that Day,
footnotes: [5] Of those who denied the Resurrection.
arabic: قُلُوبٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ وَاجِفَةٌ

translation: and their eyes[6] will be downcast.
footnotes: [6] Of the disbelievers.
arabic: أَبْصَارُهَا خَاشِعَةٌ

translation: They say, “Will we be brought back to life,
arabic: يَقُولُونَ أَإِنَّا لَمَرْدُودُونَ فِي الْحَافِرَةِ

translation: after we have turned into decayed bones[7]?”
footnotes: [7] They would say this in ridicule of the warning.
arabic: أَإِذَا كُنَّا عِظَامًا نَخِرَةً

translation: They say, “Then that would surely be a losing return[8]!”
footnotes: [8] To one another.
arabic: قَالُوا تِلْكَ إِذًا كَرَّةٌ خَاسِرَةٌ

translation: It will only be a single Blast,
arabic: فَإِنَّمَا هِيَ زَجْرَةٌ وَاحِدَةٌ

translation: then they will immediately be above the ground.
arabic: فَإِذَا هُمْ بِالسَّاهِرَةِ

translation: Has there come to you the story of Moses,
arabic: هَلْ أَتَاكَ حَدِيثُ مُوسَىٰ

translation: when his Lord called out to him at the sacred valley of Tuwa?
arabic: إِذْ نَادَاهُ رَبُّهُ بِالْوَادِ الْمُقَدَّسِ طُوًى

translation: [Saying,] “Go to Pharaoh, for he has transgressed all bounds”.
arabic: اذْهَبْ إِلَىٰ فِرْعَوْنَ إِنَّهُ طَغَىٰ

translation: And say: ‘Are you willing to be purified,
arabic: فَقُلْ هَلْ لَكَ إِلَىٰ أَنْ تَزَكَّىٰ

translation: and I will guide you to your Lord so that you may fear Him?’”
arabic: وَأَهْدِيَكَ إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ فَتَخْشَىٰ

translation: Then Moses showed him the greatest sign[9].
footnotes: [9] i.e., the miracle of the staff turning into a snake. See 20:17-23.
arabic: فَأَرَاهُ الْآيَةَ الْكُبْرَىٰ

translation: But Pharaoh denied it and disobeyed.
arabic: فَكَذَّبَ وَعَصَىٰ

translation: Then he turned back striving to plot.
arabic: ثُمَّ أَدْبَرَ يَسْعَىٰ

translation: He gathered [his people] and proclaimed,
arabic: فَحَشَرَ فَنَادَىٰ

translation: saying, “I am your lord, the most high.”
arabic: فَقَالَ أَنَا رَبُّكُمُ الْأَعْلَىٰ

translation: So Allah seized him for an exemplary punishment in this life and in the Hereafter[10].
footnotes: [10] Or for his claim of being the greatest god and for his previous oppression of the Children of Israel.
arabic: فَأَخَذَهُ اللَّهُ نَكَالَ الْآخِرَةِ وَالْأُولَىٰ

translation: Indeed, there is a lesson in this for those who fear Allah.
arabic: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَعِبْرَةً لِمَنْ يَخْشَىٰ

translation: Are you more difficult to create or the heaven that He built?
arabic: أَأَنْتُمْ أَشَدُّ خَلْقًا أَمِ السَّمَاءُ ۚ بَنَاهَا

translation: He raised its vault high and proportioned it,
arabic: رَفَعَ سَمْكَهَا فَسَوَّاهَا

translation: and darkened its night and brought forth its daylight.
arabic: وَأَغْطَشَ لَيْلَهَا وَأَخْرَجَ ضُحَاهَا

translation: And thereafter He spread out the earth,
arabic: وَالْأَرْضَ بَعْدَ ذَٰلِكَ دَحَاهَا

translation: brought forth from it its water and its pasture,
arabic: أَخْرَجَ مِنْهَا مَاءَهَا وَمَرْعَاهَا

translation: and set the mountains firmly,
arabic: وَالْجِبَالَ أَرْسَاهَا

translation: as a provision for you and your grazing livestock.
arabic: مَتَاعًا لَكُمْ وَلِأَنْعَامِكُمْ

translation: But when the Supreme Calamity comes[11],
footnotes: [11] i.e., the second Blast which marks the Day of judgment.
arabic: فَإِذَا جَاءَتِ الطَّامَّةُ الْكُبْرَىٰ

translation: on that Day man will remember all what he did,
arabic: يَوْمَ يَتَذَكَّرُ الْإِنْسَانُ مَا سَعَىٰ

translation: and the Blazing Fire will be exposed for all to see.
arabic: وَبُرِّزَتِ الْجَحِيمُ لِمَنْ يَرَىٰ

translation: As for those who transgressed,
arabic: فَأَمَّا مَنْ طَغَىٰ

translation: and preferred the life of this world,
arabic: وَآثَرَ الْحَيَاةَ الدُّنْيَا

translation: the Blazing Fire will be their abode.
arabic: فَإِنَّ الْجَحِيمَ هِيَ الْمَأْوَىٰ

translation: But those who feared standing before their Lord and restrained themselves from evil desires,
arabic: وَأَمَّا مَنْ خَافَ مَقَامَ رَبِّهِ وَنَهَى النَّفْسَ عَنِ الْهَوَىٰ

translation: Paradise will surely be their abode.
arabic: فَإِنَّ الْجَنَّةَ هِيَ الْمَأْوَىٰ

translation: They ask you concerning the Hour, “When will it be[12]?”
footnotes: [12] Lit., "established."
arabic: يَسْأَلُونَكَ عَنِ السَّاعَةِ أَيَّانَ مُرْسَاهَا

translation: How could you possibly mention that?
arabic: فِيمَ أَنْتَ مِنْ ذِكْرَاهَا

translation: Its knowledge rests only with your Lord[13].
footnotes: [13] i.e., its end and termination. Its ultimate knowledge belongs to Allah alone.
arabic: إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ مُنْتَهَاهَا

translation: You are only a warner for those who fear it.
arabic: إِنَّمَا أَنْتَ مُنْذِرُ مَنْ يَخْشَاهَا

translation: On the Day when they see it[14], it will be as if they had remained [in this world] no more than an evening or a morning.
footnotes: [14] i.e., the Hour.
arabic: كَأَنَّهُمْ يَوْمَ يَرَوْنَهَا لَمْ يَلْبَثُوا إِلَّا عَشِيَّةً أَوْ ضُحَاهَا

translation: He frowned and turned away,
arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ عَبَسَ وَتَوَلَّىٰ

translation: when the blind man came to him[1].
footnotes: [1] Abdullah ibn Um Maktūm, an early Muslim who was blind, came to the Prophet (ﷺ) seeking knowledge and guidance, while the Prophet (ﷺ) was in the middle of a discussion with some leading pagans of Makkah, calling them to Islam. The Prophet (ﷺ) frowned and turned his attention from him. So this Makkan surah was revealed.
arabic: أَنْ جَاءَهُ الْأَعْمَىٰ

translation: How would you know? Perhaps he might be purified[2],
footnotes: [2] Through the knowledge he learns from you.
arabic: وَمَا يُدْرِيكَ لَعَلَّهُ يَزَّكَّىٰ

translation: or he might take heed and benefit from the reminder?
arabic: أَوْ يَذَّكَّرُ فَتَنْفَعَهُ الذِّكْرَىٰ

translation: But he who was indifferent[3],
footnotes: [3] Towards faith. Here it is referring to that influential pagan of the Quraysh whom the Prophet (ﷺ) had hoped to embrace Islam.
arabic: أَمَّا مَنِ اسْتَغْنَىٰ

translation: you give him your full attention,
arabic: فَأَنْتَ لَهُ تَصَدَّىٰ

translation: although you are not to be blamed if he does not purify himself[4].
footnotes: [4] The Prophets are only responsible to convey the message, not for people’s guidance.
arabic: وَمَا عَلَيْكَ أَلَّا يَزَّكَّىٰ

translation: But as for the one who came to you striving [for purification],
arabic: وَأَمَّا مَنْ جَاءَكَ يَسْعَىٰ

translation: and he fears Allah,
arabic: وَهُوَ يَخْشَىٰ

translation: you let yourself be distracted from him.
arabic: فَأَنْتَ عَنْهُ تَلَهَّىٰ

translation: No indeed; this is a reminder –
arabic: كَلَّا إِنَّهَا تَذْكِرَةٌ

translation: so whoever wills may give heed to it –
arabic: فَمَنْ شَاءَ ذَكَرَهُ

translation: on venerable pages,
arabic: فِي صُحُفٍ مُكَرَّمَةٍ

translation: exalted and purified,
arabic: مَرْفُوعَةٍ مُطَهَّرَةٍ

translation: [preserved] in the hands of angel-scribes,
arabic: بِأَيْدِي سَفَرَةٍ

translation: honorable and obedient.
arabic: كِرَامٍ بَرَرَةٍ

translation: Woe to man; how ungrateful he is[5]!
footnotes: [5] i.e., the disbelievers.
arabic: قُتِلَ الْإِنْسَانُ مَا أَكْفَرَهُ

translation: From what did He create him?
arabic: مِنْ أَيِّ شَيْءٍ خَلَقَهُ

translation: He created him from a drop of semen and proportioned him[6],
footnotes: [6] His creation, provisions, life span, etc.
arabic: مِنْ نُطْفَةٍ خَلَقَهُ فَقَدَّرَهُ

translation: then He made the way easy for him[7];
footnotes: [7] i.e., the way out of his mothers’ wombs (his birth), or the way to guidance.
arabic: ثُمَّ السَّبِيلَ يَسَّرَهُ

translation: then He caused him to die and be buried;
arabic: ثُمَّ أَمَاتَهُ فَأَقْبَرَهُ

translation: then when He wills, He will resurrect him.
arabic: ثُمَّ إِذَا شَاءَ أَنْشَرَهُ

translation: Yet he has not fulfilled what He commanded him.
arabic: كَلَّا لَمَّا يَقْضِ مَا أَمَرَهُ

translation: Let man consider the food he eats:
arabic: فَلْيَنْظُرِ الْإِنْسَانُ إِلَىٰ طَعَامِهِ

translation: How We pour down rainwater in torrents,
arabic: أَنَّا صَبَبْنَا الْمَاءَ صَبًّا

translation: and cause the soil to split open [for sprouts],
arabic: ثُمَّ شَقَقْنَا الْأَرْضَ شَقًّا

translation: and cause grains to grow in it,
arabic: فَأَنْبَتْنَا فِيهَا حَبًّا

translation: as well as grapes and fodder,
arabic: وَعِنَبًا وَقَضْبًا

translation: and olive trees and date palms,
arabic: وَزَيْتُونًا وَنَخْلًا

translation: and dense orchards,
arabic: وَحَدَائِقَ غُلْبًا

translation: and fruits and grass,
arabic: وَفَاكِهَةً وَأَبًّا

translation: as provision for you and your livestock.
arabic: مَتَاعًا لَكُمْ وَلِأَنْعَامِكُمْ

translation: But when the Deafening Blast[8] comes,
footnotes: [8] The piercing Blast; the second Blast for resurrection.
arabic: فَإِذَا جَاءَتِ الصَّاخَّةُ

translation: on that Day everyone will flee from his brother,
arabic: يَوْمَ يَفِرُّ الْمَرْءُ مِنْ أَخِيهِ

translation: and from his mother and father,
arabic: وَأُمِّهِ وَأَبِيهِ

translation: and from his wife and children.
arabic: وَصَاحِبَتِهِ وَبَنِيهِ

translation: On that day, everyone will have enough concern of his own[9].
footnotes: [9] Thus forgetting all others.
arabic: لِكُلِّ امْرِئٍ مِنْهُمْ يَوْمَئِذٍ شَأْنٌ يُغْنِيهِ

translation: On that Day, some faces will be bright,
arabic: وُجُوهٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ مُسْفِرَةٌ

translation: cheerful and rejoicing;
arabic: ضَاحِكَةٌ مُسْتَبْشِرَةٌ

translation: while other faces will be dust-stained,
arabic: وَوُجُوهٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ عَلَيْهَا غَبَرَةٌ

translation: covered in darkness.
arabic: تَرْهَقُهَا قَتَرَةٌ

translation: Such are the disbelievers, the wicked.
arabic: أُولَٰئِكَ هُمُ الْكَفَرَةُ الْفَجَرَةُ

translation: When the sun is wrapped up in darkness,
arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ إِذَا الشَّمْسُ كُوِّرَتْ

translation: and when the stars fall down,
arabic: وَإِذَا النُّجُومُ انْكَدَرَتْ

translation: and when the mountains are set in motion,
arabic: وَإِذَا الْجِبَالُ سُيِّرَتْ

translation: and when pregnant camels[1] are left unattended,
footnotes: [1] Which are near delivery. It alludes to the distraction of people from their most valuable possessions, such as ten-month pregnant camels for nomadic Arabs.
arabic: وَإِذَا الْعِشَارُ عُطِّلَتْ

translation: and when wild beasts are gathered,
arabic: وَإِذَا الْوُحُوشُ حُشِرَتْ

translation: and when the seas are set on fire,
arabic: وَإِذَا الْبِحَارُ سُجِّرَتْ

translation: and when the souls are sorted[2],
footnotes: [2] i.e., "joined" with their groups or sects, wicked with the wicked souls, righteous with the righteous.
arabic: وَإِذَا النُّفُوسُ زُوِّجَتْ

translation: and when the baby girl buried alive[3] is asked,
footnotes: [3] As the pagan Arabs used to do for fear of shame or poverty. The Qur’an condemned this practice. See 16:58-59.
arabic: وَإِذَا الْمَوْءُودَةُ سُئِلَتْ

translation: for what crime she was killed,
arabic: بِأَيِّ ذَنْبٍ قُتِلَتْ

translation: and when records of deeds are spread open,
arabic: وَإِذَا الصُّحُفُ نُشِرَتْ

translation: and when the sky is stripped away[4],
footnotes: [4] As the skin of sheep is stripped away.
arabic: وَإِذَا السَّمَاءُ كُشِطَتْ

translation: and when the Blazing Fire is flared up,
arabic: وَإِذَا الْجَحِيمُ سُعِّرَتْ

translation: and when Paradise is brought near –
arabic: وَإِذَا الْجَنَّةُ أُزْلِفَتْ

translation: then every soul will know what it has brought about[5].
footnotes: [5] Of faith or disbelief, good or bad deeds for that Day.
arabic: عَلِمَتْ نَفْسٌ مَا أَحْضَرَتْ

translation: I swear by the receding stars,
arabic: فَلَا أُقْسِمُ بِالْخُنَّسِ

translation: that rise and hide[6],
footnotes: [6] This probably refers to black holes in the sky. "Kanasa" means sweeping or hiding.
arabic: الْجَوَارِ الْكُنَّسِ

translation: and by the night as it departs,
arabic: وَاللَّيْلِ إِذَا عَسْعَسَ

translation: and by the day as it breaks –
arabic: وَالصُّبْحِ إِذَا تَنَفَّسَ

translation: Indeed, this [Qur’an] is a word conveyed by a noble angel-messenger.
arabic: إِنَّهُ لَقَوْلُ رَسُولٍ كَرِيمٍ

translation: extremely powerful, highly revered by the Lord of the Throne,
arabic: ذِي قُوَّةٍ عِنْدَ ذِي الْعَرْشِ مَكِينٍ

translation: obeyed there [by other angels] and trustworthy.
arabic: مُطَاعٍ ثَمَّ أَمِينٍ

translation: Your fellow [i.e., the Prophet] is not a madman.
arabic: وَمَا صَاحِبُكُمْ بِمَجْنُونٍ

translation: He indeed saw him [i.e., Gabriel] on the clear horizon[7].
footnotes: [7] i.e., the eastern horizon, where the sun rises. See footnote 53:6
arabic: وَلَقَدْ رَآهُ بِالْأُفُقِ الْمُبِينِ

translation: He does not withhold [knowledge of] the unseen[8].
footnotes: [8] He (ﷺ) did not withhold the unseen which Allah had revealed to him in the Qur’an.
arabic: وَمَا هُوَ عَلَى الْغَيْبِ بِضَنِينٍ

translation: This [Qur’an] is not the word of an accursed devil.
arabic: وَمَا هُوَ بِقَوْلِ شَيْطَانٍ رَجِيمٍ

translation: So which way are you going[9]?
footnotes: [9] In your denial of the Qur’an for being the revelation from Allah.
arabic: فَأَيْنَ تَذْهَبُونَ

translation: It is but a reminder to the worlds,
arabic: إِنْ هُوَ إِلَّا ذِكْرٌ لِلْعَالَمِينَ

translation: for those among you who wish to take the straight path.
arabic: لِمَنْ شَاءَ مِنْكُمْ أَنْ يَسْتَقِيمَ

translation: But you cannot wish except by the Will of Allah, the Lord of the worlds.
arabic: وَمَا تَشَاءُونَ إِلَّا أَنْ يَشَاءَ اللَّهُ رَبُّ الْعَالَمِينَ

translation: When the sky breaks apart.
arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ إِذَا السَّمَاءُ انْفَطَرَتْ

translation: and when the stars fall, scattered,
arabic: وَإِذَا الْكَوَاكِبُ انْتَثَرَتْ

translation: and when the seas burst forth,
arabic: وَإِذَا الْبِحَارُ فُجِّرَتْ

translation: and when the graves are overturned,
arabic: وَإِذَا الْقُبُورُ بُعْثِرَتْ

translation: then each soul will come to know what it has done or what it has left undone.
arabic: عَلِمَتْ نَفْسٌ مَا قَدَّمَتْ وَأَخَّرَتْ

translation: O mankind, what has lured you away from your Lord, the Most Generous,
arabic: يَا أَيُّهَا الْإِنْسَانُ مَا غَرَّكَ بِرَبِّكَ الْكَرِيمِ

translation: Who created you, then shaped and proportioned you,
arabic: الَّذِي خَلَقَكَ فَسَوَّاكَ فَعَدَلَكَ

translation: and assembled you in whatever form He willed?
arabic: فِي أَيِّ صُورَةٍ مَا شَاءَ رَكَّبَكَ

translation: No indeed; but you deny the Judgment Day,
arabic: كَلَّا بَلْ تُكَذِّبُونَ بِالدِّينِ

translation: while there are watchers[1] over you,
footnotes: [1] i.e., angels who preserve all your deeds.
arabic: وَإِنَّ عَلَيْكُمْ لَحَافِظِينَ

translation: honorable scribes,
arabic: كِرَامًا كَاتِبِينَ

translation: who know whatever you do.
arabic: يَعْلَمُونَ مَا تَفْعَلُونَ

translation: Indeed, the righteous will be in Bliss,
arabic: إِنَّ الْأَبْرَارَ لَفِي نَعِيمٍ

translation: and the wicked will be in Blazing Fire,
arabic: وَإِنَّ الْفُجَّارَ لَفِي جَحِيمٍ

translation: which they will enter on Judgment Day,
arabic: يَصْلَوْنَهَا يَوْمَ الدِّينِ

translation: and will never come out of it.
arabic: وَمَا هُمْ عَنْهَا بِغَائِبِينَ

translation: How do you know what Judgment Day is?
arabic: وَمَا أَدْرَاكَ مَا يَوْمُ الدِّينِ

translation: Again, how do you know what Judgment Day is?
arabic: ثُمَّ مَا أَدْرَاكَ مَا يَوْمُ الدِّينِ

translation: It is the Day when no soul will be of any help to another, and all command on that Day will be with Allah.
arabic: يَوْمَ لَا تَمْلِكُ نَفْسٌ لِنَفْسٍ شَيْئًا ۖ وَالْأَمْرُ يَوْمَئِذٍ لِلَّهِ

translation: Woe to the defrauders[1],
footnotes: [1] i.e., those who cheat people by giving them less in sale transactions, an amount so little as to hardly be noticed.
arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ وَيْلٌ لِلْمُطَفِّفِينَ

translation: those who take full measure when they take from others,
arabic: الَّذِينَ إِذَا اكْتَالُوا عَلَى النَّاسِ يَسْتَوْفُونَ

translation: but they give less when they measure or weigh for them.
arabic: وَإِذَا كَالُوهُمْ أَوْ وَزَنُوهُمْ يُخْسِرُونَ

translation: Do they really not think that they will be resurrected
arabic: أَلَا يَظُنُّ أُولَٰئِكَ أَنَّهُمْ مَبْعُوثُونَ

translation: for a momentous Day,
arabic: لِيَوْمٍ عَظِيمٍ

translation: a Day when people will stand before the Lord of the worlds?
arabic: يَوْمَ يَقُومُ النَّاسُ لِرَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ

translation: No indeed! The record of the wicked is surely in Sijjīn.
arabic: كَلَّا إِنَّ كِتَابَ الْفُجَّارِ لَفِي سِجِّينٍ

translation: How do you know what Sijjīn is?
arabic: وَمَا أَدْرَاكَ مَا سِجِّينٌ

translation: It is a clearly inscribed Record.
arabic: كِتَابٌ مَرْقُومٌ

translation: Woe on that Day to the deniers,
arabic: وَيْلٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ لِلْمُكَذِّبِينَ

translation: those who deny the Judgment Day!
arabic: الَّذِينَ يُكَذِّبُونَ بِيَوْمِ الدِّينِ

translation: None denies it except every sinful transgressor.
arabic: وَمَا يُكَذِّبُ بِهِ إِلَّا كُلُّ مُعْتَدٍ أَثِيمٍ

translation: When Our verses are recited to him, he says, “Ancient fables[2]!”
footnotes: [2] i.e., tales of old times, legends of former peoples.
arabic: إِذَا تُتْلَىٰ عَلَيْهِ آيَاتُنَا قَالَ أَسَاطِيرُ الْأَوَّلِينَ

translation: No indeed! Their hearts have been stained by what they used to commit[3]!
footnotes: [3] i.e., their sins and evil deeds.
arabic: كَلَّا ۖ بَلْ ۜ رَانَ عَلَىٰ قُلُوبِهِمْ مَا كَانُوا يَكْسِبُونَ

translation: No indeed! On that Day they will be barred from seeing their Lord[4].
footnotes: [4] As a punishment, since the believers will see Him.
arabic: كَلَّا إِنَّهُمْ عَنْ رَبِّهِمْ يَوْمَئِذٍ لَمَحْجُوبُونَ

translation: They will then surely enter the Blazing Fire,
arabic: ثُمَّ إِنَّهُمْ لَصَالُو الْجَحِيمِ

translation: then they will be told, “This is what you used to deny.”
arabic: ثُمَّ يُقَالُ هَٰذَا الَّذِي كُنْتُمْ بِهِ تُكَذِّبُونَ

translation: No indeed! The record of the righteous is certainly in ‘illiyyīn –
arabic: كَلَّا إِنَّ كِتَابَ الْأَبْرَارِ لَفِي عِلِّيِّينَ

translation: and how do you know what ‘illiyyūn is? –
arabic: وَمَا أَدْرَاكَ مَا عِلِّيُّونَ

translation: It is a record inscribed,
arabic: كِتَابٌ مَرْقُومٌ

translation: witnessed by those who are close to Allah.
arabic: يَشْهَدُهُ الْمُقَرَّبُونَ

translation: Indeed, the righteous will be in Bliss,
arabic: إِنَّ الْأَبْرَارَ لَفِي نَعِيمٍ

translation: seated on the couches, gazing in wonder.
arabic: عَلَى الْأَرَائِكِ يَنْظُرُونَ

translation: You will see on their faces the radiance of bliss.
arabic: تَعْرِفُ فِي وُجُوهِهِمْ نَضْرَةَ النَّعِيمِ

translation: They will be served to drink pure wine from a sealed container,
arabic: يُسْقَوْنَ مِنْ رَحِيقٍ مَخْتُومٍ

translation: whose last sip is musk[5] – let those who strive, strive for that –
footnotes: [5] i.e., having a lingering odor.
arabic: خِتَامُهُ مِسْكٌ ۚ وَفِي ذَٰلِكَ فَلْيَتَنَافَسِ الْمُتَنَافِسُونَ

translation: and it will be mixed with water from the spring of Tasnīm[6],
footnotes: [6] It is the highest spring in Paradise.
arabic: وَمِزَاجُهُ مِنْ تَسْنِيمٍ

translation: a spring from which those who are close to Allah will drink.
arabic: عَيْنًا يَشْرَبُ بِهَا الْمُقَرَّبُونَ

translation: Indeed, the wicked used to laugh at the believers;
arabic: إِنَّ الَّذِينَ أَجْرَمُوا كَانُوا مِنَ الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا يَضْحَكُونَ

translation: when they passed by them, they would wink at one another,
arabic: وَإِذَا مَرُّوا بِهِمْ يَتَغَامَزُونَ

translation: and when they went back to their people, they would return exulting.
arabic: وَإِذَا انْقَلَبُوا إِلَىٰ أَهْلِهِمُ انْقَلَبُوا فَكِهِينَ

translation: When they saw the believers, they would say, “These people are truly misguided,”
arabic: وَإِذَا رَأَوْهُمْ قَالُوا إِنَّ هَٰؤُلَاءِ لَضَالُّونَ

translation: although they were not sent as their keepers.
arabic: وَمَا أُرْسِلُوا عَلَيْهِمْ حَافِظِينَ

translation: So Today[7] the believers will laugh at the disbelievers,
footnotes: [7] i.e., the Day of Judgment.
arabic: فَالْيَوْمَ الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا مِنَ الْكُفَّارِ يَضْحَكُونَ

translation: while sitting on the couches, gazing around.
arabic: عَلَى الْأَرَائِكِ يَنْظُرُونَ

translation: Have the disbelievers been rewarded except for what they used to do?
arabic: هَلْ ثُوِّبَ الْكُفَّارُ مَا كَانُوا يَفْعَلُونَ

translation: When the sky is rent asunder,
arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ إِذَا السَّمَاءُ انْشَقَّتْ

translation: and hearkens to its Lord[1], as it must,
footnotes: [1] In full obedience.
arabic: وَأَذِنَتْ لِرَبِّهَا وَحُقَّتْ

translation: and when the earth is leveled out[2],
footnotes: [2] i.e., spread out.
arabic: وَإِذَا الْأَرْضُ مُدَّتْ

translation: and casts out all what it contains[3], and becomes empty,
footnotes: [3] i.e., its dead bodies and treasures buried in it.
arabic: وَأَلْقَتْ مَا فِيهَا وَتَخَلَّتْ

translation: and hearkens to its Lord, as it must,
arabic: وَأَذِنَتْ لِرَبِّهَا وَحُقَّتْ

translation: O humans, you are toiling towards your Lord[4], and you will surely meet Him[5].
footnotes:
[4] i.e., striving in doing good or evil until you meet your Lord.
 [5] To be recompensed by Him for your deeds.
arabic: يَا أَيُّهَا الْإِنْسَانُ إِنَّكَ كَادِحٌ إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ كَدْحًا فَمُلَاقِيهِ

translation: Whoever is given his Record in his right hand,
arabic: فَأَمَّا مَنْ أُوتِيَ كِتَابَهُ بِيَمِينِهِ

translation: he will have an easy reckoning,
arabic: فَسَوْفَ يُحَاسَبُ حِسَابًا يَسِيرًا

translation: and he will return to his people joyfully.
arabic: وَيَنْقَلِبُ إِلَىٰ أَهْلِهِ مَسْرُورًا

translation: But whoever is given his Record from behind his back,
arabic: وَأَمَّا مَنْ أُوتِيَ كِتَابَهُ وَرَاءَ ظَهْرِهِ

translation: he will call out for destruction,
arabic: فَسَوْفَ يَدْعُو ثُبُورًا

translation: and he will enter the Blazing Fire.
arabic: وَيَصْلَىٰ سَعِيرًا

translation: Indeed, he used to live among his people joyfully.
arabic: إِنَّهُ كَانَ فِي أَهْلِهِ مَسْرُورًا

translation: and he thought that he would never return [to Allah].
arabic: إِنَّهُ ظَنَّ أَنْ لَنْ يَحُورَ

translation: Indeed he will! His Lord was always watching him.
arabic: بَلَىٰ إِنَّ رَبَّهُ كَانَ بِهِ بَصِيرًا

translation: Indeed, I swear by the twilight,
arabic: فَلَا أُقْسِمُ بِالشَّفَقِ

translation: and by the night and what it covers,
arabic: وَاللَّيْلِ وَمَا وَسَقَ

translation: and by the moon when it becomes full,
arabic: وَالْقَمَرِ إِذَا اتَّسَقَ

translation: You will surely pass from one stage to another[6].
footnotes: [6] i.e., from sperm-drop to clinging clot to lump, from life to death to resurrection.
arabic: لَتَرْكَبُنَّ طَبَقًا عَنْ طَبَقٍ

translation: Then what is the matter with them that they do not believe,
arabic: فَمَا لَهُمْ لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ

translation: and when the Qur’an is recited to them, they do not prostrate?
arabic: وَإِذَا قُرِئَ عَلَيْهِمُ الْقُرْآنُ لَا يَسْجُدُونَ ۩

translation: Rather, the disbelievers persist in denying it,
arabic: بَلِ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا يُكَذِّبُونَ

translation: but Allah knows best whatever they harbor in their hearts.
arabic: وَاللَّهُ أَعْلَمُ بِمَا يُوعُونَ

translation: So give them the tidings of a painful punishment.
arabic: فَبَشِّرْهُمْ بِعَذَابٍ أَلِيمٍ

translation: But those who believe and do righteous deeds will have a never-ending reward.
arabic: إِلَّا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَعَمِلُوا الصَّالِحَاتِ لَهُمْ أَجْرٌ غَيْرُ مَمْنُونٍ

translation: By the sky full of constellations,
arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ وَالسَّمَاءِ ذَاتِ الْبُرُوجِ

translation: and by the promised Day,
arabic: وَالْيَوْمِ الْمَوْعُودِ

translation: and by the witness and the witnessed,
arabic: وَشَاهِدٍ وَمَشْهُودٍ

translation: cursed be the makers of the trench[1],
footnotes: [1] Those who worked for a tyrannical king and did not allow the people to believe in Allah. Their blind obedience to their ruler incurred upon them the curse of Allah.
arabic: قُتِلَ أَصْحَابُ الْأُخْدُودِ

translation: the fire full of fuel,
arabic: النَّارِ ذَاتِ الْوَقُودِ

translation: when they sat around it,
arabic: إِذْ هُمْ عَلَيْهَا قُعُودٌ

translation: and were witnessing what they did to the believers[2].
footnotes: [2] After the believers were casted into a trench of fire, they sat around it watching them burn to death. It occurred long before Prophet Muhammad's (ﷺ) time.
arabic: وَهُمْ عَلَىٰ مَا يَفْعَلُونَ بِالْمُؤْمِنِينَ شُهُودٌ

translation: Their only grievance against them was that they believed in Allah, the All-Mighty, the Praiseworthy,
arabic: وَمَا نَقَمُوا مِنْهُمْ إِلَّا أَنْ يُؤْمِنُوا بِاللَّهِ الْعَزِيزِ الْحَمِيدِ

translation: to Whom belongs the dominion of the heavens and earth, and Allah is Witness over all things.
arabic: الَّذِي لَهُ مُلْكُ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ ۚ وَاللَّهُ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَيْءٍ شَهِيدٌ

translation: Indeed, for those who tortured the believing men and women, and then did not repent, there will be the punishment of Hell and the punishment of the burning fire[3].
footnotes: [3] Those who burned the believers will be punished with the burning fire in the Hereafter.
arabic: إِنَّ الَّذِينَ فَتَنُوا الْمُؤْمِنِينَ وَالْمُؤْمِنَاتِ ثُمَّ لَمْ يَتُوبُوا فَلَهُمْ عَذَابُ جَهَنَّمَ وَلَهُمْ عَذَابُ الْحَرِيقِ

translation: But those who believed and did righteous deeds will certainly have gardens under which rivers flow; that is the supreme triumph.
arabic: إِنَّ الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَعَمِلُوا الصَّالِحَاتِ لَهُمْ جَنَّاتٌ تَجْرِي مِنْ تَحْتِهَا الْأَنْهَارُ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ الْفَوْزُ الْكَبِيرُ

translation: Indeed, the punishment of your Lord is severe.
arabic: إِنَّ بَطْشَ رَبِّكَ لَشَدِيدٌ

translation: Indeed, it is He Who originates [the creation] and then resurrects all,
arabic: إِنَّهُ هُوَ يُبْدِئُ وَيُعِيدُ

translation: and He is the All-Forgiving, the Most Affectionate,
arabic: وَهُوَ الْغَفُورُ الْوَدُودُ

translation: the Lord of the Glorious Throne;
arabic: ذُو الْعَرْشِ الْمَجِيدُ

translation: He does whatever He wills.
arabic: فَعَّالٌ لِمَا يُرِيدُ

translation: Has there not come to you the story of the forces
arabic: هَلْ أَتَاكَ حَدِيثُ الْجُنُودِ

translation: of Pharaoh and Thamūd?
arabic: فِرْعَوْنَ وَثَمُودَ

translation: But the disbelievers are in persistent denial,
arabic: بَلِ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا فِي تَكْذِيبٍ

translation: although Allah encompasses them from all sides.
arabic: وَاللَّهُ مِنْ وَرَائِهِمْ مُحِيطٌ

translation: But this is a glorious Qur’an,
arabic: بَلْ هُوَ قُرْآنٌ مَجِيدٌ

translation: [inscribed] in a Preserved Tablet.
arabic: فِي لَوْحٍ مَحْفُوظٍ

translation: By the sky and the night comer –
arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ وَالسَّمَاءِ وَالطَّارِقِ

translation: and how do you know what the night comer is?
arabic: وَمَا أَدْرَاكَ مَا الطَّارِقُ

translation: It is the star of piercing brightness[1] –
footnotes: [1] Whose light pierces through the darkness or through the sky.
arabic: النَّجْمُ الثَّاقِبُ

translation: there is no soul except that there is a watcher over it.
arabic: إِنْ كُلُّ نَفْسٍ لَمَّا عَلَيْهَا حَافِظٌ

translation: Let man reflect on what he was created from.
arabic: فَلْيَنْظُرِ الْإِنْسَانُ مِمَّ خُلِقَ

translation: He was created from a spurting fluid,
arabic: خُلِقَ مِنْ مَاءٍ دَافِقٍ

translation: emerging from between the backbone and the ribs[2].
footnotes: [2] Both testes and ovaries are sustained by arteries originating between the backbone and the ribcage.
arabic: يَخْرُجُ مِنْ بَيْنِ الصُّلْبِ وَالتَّرَائِبِ

translation: Indeed, Allah is able to bring him back to life.
arabic: إِنَّهُ عَلَىٰ رَجْعِهِ لَقَادِرٌ

translation: On the Day when all secrets will be disclosed[3],
footnotes: [3] The secrets will be examined, disclosing the real intentions and faiths people harbored, distinguishing between righteous and evil therefrom.
arabic: يَوْمَ تُبْلَى السَّرَائِرُ

translation: he will then have no power, nor any helper.
arabic: فَمَا لَهُ مِنْ قُوَّةٍ وَلَا نَاصِرٍ

translation: By the sky and its recurring rain[4],
footnotes: [4] And sun, moon, stars, clouds, heat, etc.
arabic: وَالسَّمَاءِ ذَاتِ الرَّجْعِ

translation: and by the earth that cracks open [with the sprout of plants],
arabic: وَالْأَرْضِ ذَاتِ الصَّدْعِ

translation: Indeed, this [Qur’an] is a decisive word,
arabic: إِنَّهُ لَقَوْلٌ فَصْلٌ

translation: which is not for amusement.
arabic: وَمَا هُوَ بِالْهَزْلِ

translation: Indeed, they are devising a plan.
arabic: إِنَّهُمْ يَكِيدُونَ كَيْدًا

translation: I am too devising a plan.
arabic: وَأَكِيدُ كَيْدًا

translation: So bear with the disbelievers, and give them respite for a while[5].
footnotes: [5] i.e., Do not be in haste in seeking their punishment and destruction.
arabic: فَمَهِّلِ الْكَافِرِينَ أَمْهِلْهُمْ رُوَيْدًا

translation: Glorify the name of your Lord, the Most High,
arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ سَبِّحِ اسْمَ رَبِّكَ الْأَعْلَى

translation: Who created and fashioned in due proportion,
arabic: الَّذِي خَلَقَ فَسَوَّىٰ

translation: and Who determined [the creation] then inspired them,
arabic: وَالَّذِي قَدَّرَ فَهَدَىٰ

translation: and Who brings forth the pasture,
arabic: وَالَّذِي أَخْرَجَ الْمَرْعَىٰ

translation: then makes it into withered chaff.
arabic: فَجَعَلَهُ غُثَاءً أَحْوَىٰ

translation: We will teach you [the Qur’an], so you will not forget,
arabic: سَنُقْرِئُكَ فَلَا تَنْسَىٰ

translation: except what Allah wills[1], for indeed He knows what is manifest and what is hidden.
footnotes: [1] i.e., except what Allah wills to make you forget for wisdom such as abrogating or replacing a ruling by another.
arabic: إِلَّا مَا شَاءَ اللَّهُ ۚ إِنَّهُ يَعْلَمُ الْجَهْرَ وَمَا يَخْفَىٰ

translation: We will guide you to the easy way[2].
footnotes: [2] To the way of Islam which brings about ease in this life and attainment of Paradise in the Hereafter, or will give you opportunities for righteous deeds that lead to Paradise.
arabic: وَنُيَسِّرُكَ لِلْيُسْرَىٰ

translation: So remind, if the reminder should benefit[3].
footnotes: [3] Wherever this Qur’an will be heard.
arabic: فَذَكِّرْ إِنْ نَفَعَتِ الذِّكْرَىٰ

translation: He who fears Allah will take heed,
arabic: سَيَذَّكَّرُ مَنْ يَخْشَىٰ

translation: but the wretched will avoid it,
arabic: وَيَتَجَنَّبُهَا الْأَشْقَى

translation: who will enter the Great Fire,
arabic: الَّذِي يَصْلَى النَّارَ الْكُبْرَىٰ

translation: wherein he will neither die nor live.
arabic: ثُمَّ لَا يَمُوتُ فِيهَا وَلَا يَحْيَىٰ

translation: Indeed, he who purifies himself will attain success,
arabic: قَدْ أَفْلَحَ مَنْ تَزَكَّىٰ

translation: and remembers his Lord’s Name and prays.
arabic: وَذَكَرَ اسْمَ رَبِّهِ فَصَلَّىٰ

translation: But you prefer the life of this world,
arabic: بَلْ تُؤْثِرُونَ الْحَيَاةَ الدُّنْيَا

translation: even though the Hereafter is better and more lasting.
arabic: وَالْآخِرَةُ خَيْرٌ وَأَبْقَىٰ

translation: Indeed, this was in the earlier Scriptures,
arabic: إِنَّ هَٰذَا لَفِي الصُّحُفِ الْأُولَىٰ

translation: the Scriptures of Abraham and Moses.
arabic: صُحُفِ إِبْرَاهِيمَ وَمُوسَىٰ

translation: Has there come to you the story of the Overwhelming Event?
arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ هَلْ أَتَاكَ حَدِيثُ الْغَاشِيَةِ

translation: On that Day, some faces will be humiliated,
arabic: وُجُوهٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ خَاشِعَةٌ

translation: overburdened and weary[1],
footnotes: [1] They will be burdened with the heavy shackles in the Hereafter, or they performed deeds in their worldly life which were bereft of faith or not done for the sake of Allah.
arabic: عَامِلَةٌ نَاصِبَةٌ

translation: as they burn in a scorching Fire.
arabic: تَصْلَىٰ نَارًا حَامِيَةً

translation: They will be made to drink from a boiling spring,
arabic: تُسْقَىٰ مِنْ عَيْنٍ آنِيَةٍ

translation: and they will have no food except bitter thorny plants,
arabic: لَيْسَ لَهُمْ طَعَامٌ إِلَّا مِنْ ضَرِيعٍ

translation: that neither nourishes nor satisfies hunger.
arabic: لَا يُسْمِنُ وَلَا يُغْنِي مِنْ جُوعٍ

translation: Other faces on that Day will be joyful,
arabic: وُجُوهٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ نَاعِمَةٌ

translation: well-pleased with their past striving,
arabic: لِسَعْيِهَا رَاضِيَةٌ

translation: in an elevated garden,
arabic: فِي جَنَّةٍ عَالِيَةٍ

translation: wherein no idle talk will be heard[2].
footnotes: [2] Rather than an insult, falsehood, immorality, etc.
arabic: لَا تَسْمَعُ فِيهَا لَاغِيَةً

translation: There will be a flowing spring;
arabic: فِيهَا عَيْنٌ جَارِيَةٌ

translation: and couches raised high,
arabic: فِيهَا سُرُرٌ مَرْفُوعَةٌ

translation: and cups placed ready,
arabic: وَأَكْوَابٌ مَوْضُوعَةٌ

translation: and cushions lined up,
arabic: وَنَمَارِقُ مَصْفُوفَةٌ

translation: and splendid carpets spread out.
arabic: وَزَرَابِيُّ مَبْثُوثَةٌ

translation: Do they not reflect on the camel, how it is created;
arabic: أَفَلَا يَنْظُرُونَ إِلَى الْإِبِلِ كَيْفَ خُلِقَتْ

translation: and the sky, how it is raised high;
arabic: وَإِلَى السَّمَاءِ كَيْفَ رُفِعَتْ

translation: and the mountains, how they are firmly set up;
arabic: وَإِلَى الْجِبَالِ كَيْفَ نُصِبَتْ

translation: and the earth, how it is spread out?
arabic: وَإِلَى الْأَرْضِ كَيْفَ سُطِحَتْ

translation: So remind [O Prophet]; your duty is only to remind;
arabic: فَذَكِّرْ إِنَّمَا أَنْتَ مُذَكِّرٌ

translation: you are not assigned to compel them.
arabic: لَسْتَ عَلَيْهِمْ بِمُصَيْطِرٍ

translation: But whoever turns away and disbelieves,
arabic: إِلَّا مَنْ تَوَلَّىٰ وَكَفَرَ

translation: Allah will inflict upon him the greatest punishment[3].
footnotes: [3] i.e., the greatest punishment is the Hellfire. The minor punishment includes disasters in worldly life and grave punishment.
arabic: فَيُعَذِّبُهُ اللَّهُ الْعَذَابَ الْأَكْبَرَ

translation: Indeed, to Us is their return,
arabic: إِنَّ إِلَيْنَا إِيَابَهُمْ

translation: then it is for Us to call them to account.
arabic: ثُمَّ إِنَّ عَلَيْنَا حِسَابَهُمْ

translation: By the dawn,
arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ وَالْفَجْرِ

translation: and the ten nights[1],
footnotes: [1] i.e., the first ten nights of the lunar month of Dhul-Hijjah.
arabic: وَلَيَالٍ عَشْرٍ

translation: and the even and the odd[2],
footnotes: [2] Of the things.
arabic: وَالشَّفْعِ وَالْوَتْرِ

translation: and by the night when it comes,
arabic: وَاللَّيْلِ إِذَا يَسْرِ

translation: are these oaths not sufficient for those who have sense?
arabic: هَلْ فِي ذَٰلِكَ قَسَمٌ لِذِي حِجْرٍ

translation: Have you not considered how your Lord dealt with ‘Ād
arabic: أَلَمْ تَرَ كَيْفَ فَعَلَ رَبُّكَ بِعَادٍ

translation: of Iram[3], who were people of great stature,
footnotes: [3] Iram: an ancient tribe; or a well-known tribe in Yemen; or the grandfather of the people of ‘Aad, etc. Prophet Hūd was sent to the people of ‘Aad.
arabic: إِرَمَ ذَاتِ الْعِمَادِ

translation: the like of whom had never been created in the land;
arabic: الَّتِي لَمْ يُخْلَقْ مِثْلُهَا فِي الْبِلَادِ

translation: and Thamūd, who carved out the rocks in the Valley;
arabic: وَثَمُودَ الَّذِينَ جَابُوا الصَّخْرَ بِالْوَادِ

translation: and the mighty and powerful[4] Pharaoh?
footnotes: [4] Or the owner of the stakes by which he used to torture people.
arabic: وَفِرْعَوْنَ ذِي الْأَوْتَادِ

translation: All of them transgressed in the land,
arabic: الَّذِينَ طَغَوْا فِي الْبِلَادِ

translation: and spread therein much corruption,
arabic: فَأَكْثَرُوا فِيهَا الْفَسَادَ

translation: so your Lord poured upon them a scourge of punishment.
arabic: فَصَبَّ عَلَيْهِمْ رَبُّكَ سَوْطَ عَذَابٍ

translation: Indeed, your Lord is ever vigilant.
arabic: إِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَبِالْمِرْصَادِ

translation: As for man, when he is tested by his Lord by honoring him and bestowing blessings upon him, he says, “My Lord has [deservedly] honored me[5]!”
footnotes: [5] Instead of being grateful, he is proud, attributing the favor to his own merit.
arabic: فَأَمَّا الْإِنْسَانُ إِذَا مَا ابْتَلَاهُ رَبُّهُ فَأَكْرَمَهُ وَنَعَّمَهُ فَيَقُولُ رَبِّي أَكْرَمَنِ

translation: But when he is tested by restricting his provision, he says, “My Lord has [undeservedly] humiliated me!”
arabic: وَأَمَّا إِذَا مَا ابْتَلَاهُ فَقَدَرَ عَلَيْهِ رِزْقَهُ فَيَقُولُ رَبِّي أَهَانَنِ

translation: No indeed[6]! You are not kind to the orphan,
footnotes: [6] It is not as you think. Allah puts people to test through prosperity and hardship and rewards their gratitude and patience in the Hereafter.
arabic: كَلَّا ۖ بَلْ لَا تُكْرِمُونَ الْيَتِيمَ

translation: nor do you urge one another to feed the needy,
arabic: وَلَا تَحَاضُّونَ عَلَىٰ طَعَامِ الْمِسْكِينِ

translation: and you greedily consume the entire inheritance[7],
footnotes: [7] Whether lawful or unlawful.
arabic: وَتَأْكُلُونَ التُّرَاثَ أَكْلًا لَمًّا

translation: and love wealth immensely.
arabic: وَتُحِبُّونَ الْمَالَ حُبًّا جَمًّا

translation: No indeed! When the earth is crushed over and over,
arabic: كَلَّا إِذَا دُكَّتِ الْأَرْضُ دَكًّا دَكًّا

translation: and your Lord comes[8] with the angels, rank after rank,
footnotes: [8] To pass judgment between people.
arabic: وَجَاءَ رَبُّكَ وَالْمَلَكُ صَفًّا صَفًّا

translation: and Hell is brought near on that Day – this is when man will understand, but what is the use of that understanding?
arabic: وَجِيءَ يَوْمَئِذٍ بِجَهَنَّمَ ۚ يَوْمَئِذٍ يَتَذَكَّرُ الْإِنْسَانُ وَأَنَّىٰ لَهُ الذِّكْرَىٰ

translation: He will say, “Would that I had sent forth something for my [eternal] life!”
arabic: يَقُولُ يَا لَيْتَنِي قَدَّمْتُ لِحَيَاتِي

translation: None can punish as He punishes on that Day,
arabic: فَيَوْمَئِذٍ لَا يُعَذِّبُ عَذَابَهُ أَحَدٌ

translation: and none can bind as He binds.
arabic: وَلَا يُوثِقُ وَثَاقَهُ أَحَدٌ

translation: [It will be said to the believer,] “O the tranquil soul!
arabic: يَا أَيَّتُهَا النَّفْسُ الْمُطْمَئِنَّةُ

translation: Return to your Lord, well pleased and pleasing [to Him].
arabic: ارْجِعِي إِلَىٰ رَبِّكِ رَاضِيَةً مَرْضِيَّةً

translation: Join My [righteous] slaves,
arabic: فَادْخُلِي فِي عِبَادِي

translation: and enter My Paradise.”
arabic: وَادْخُلِي جَنَّتِي

translation: I do swear by this city [of Makkah] –
arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ لَا أُقْسِمُ بِهَٰذَا الْبَلَدِ

translation: and you are free of restriction [for a while] in this city[1] –
footnotes: [1] To punish the enemies of Islam on the Conquest Day.
arabic: وَأَنْتَ حِلٌّ بِهَٰذَا الْبَلَدِ

translation: and by every parent[2] and his offspring,
footnotes: [2] i.e., Adam.
arabic: وَوَالِدٍ وَمَا وَلَدَ

translation: We have created man in hardship.
arabic: لَقَدْ خَلَقْنَا الْإِنْسَانَ فِي كَبَدٍ

translation: Does he think that none can ever have power over him?
arabic: أَيَحْسَبُ أَنْ لَنْ يَقْدِرَ عَلَيْهِ أَحَدٌ

translation: He says, “I have squandered enormous wealth!”
arabic: يَقُولُ أَهْلَكْتُ مَالًا لُبَدًا

translation: Does he think that no one sees him?
arabic: أَيَحْسَبُ أَنْ لَمْ يَرَهُ أَحَدٌ

translation: Have We not given him two eyes,
arabic: أَلَمْ نَجْعَلْ لَهُ عَيْنَيْنِ

translation: and a tongue and two lips,
arabic: وَلِسَانًا وَشَفَتَيْنِ

translation: and shown him the two ways [of right and wrong]?
arabic: وَهَدَيْنَاهُ النَّجْدَيْنِ

translation: Yet he did not make his way through the steep path[3],
footnotes: [3] He did not spend for the sake of Allah but to show off.
arabic: فَلَا اقْتَحَمَ الْعَقَبَةَ

translation: and how do you know what the steep path is?
arabic: وَمَا أَدْرَاكَ مَا الْعَقَبَةُ

translation: It is freeing a slave,
arabic: فَكُّ رَقَبَةٍ

translation: or giving food on a day of hunger,
arabic: أَوْ إِطْعَامٌ فِي يَوْمٍ ذِي مَسْغَبَةٍ

translation: to an orphan relative,
arabic: يَتِيمًا ذَا مَقْرَبَةٍ

translation: or to a needy person in misery,
arabic: أَوْ مِسْكِينًا ذَا مَتْرَبَةٍ

translation: then [most importantly] to be one of those who believe and exhort one another to patience and exhort one another to compassion.
arabic: ثُمَّ كَانَ مِنَ الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَتَوَاصَوْا بِالصَّبْرِ وَتَوَاصَوْا بِالْمَرْحَمَةِ

translation: Such are the people of the Right[4].
footnotes: [4] i.e., those who receive the records of their deeds in the right hand and proceed to Paradise.
arabic: أُولَٰئِكَ أَصْحَابُ الْمَيْمَنَةِ

translation: As for those who reject Our signs, they are the people of the Left[5],
footnotes: [5] i.e., those who receive the records of their deeds in the left hand and proceed to Hellfire.
arabic: وَالَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا بِآيَاتِنَا هُمْ أَصْحَابُ الْمَشْأَمَةِ

translation: who will be locked up in the Fire.
arabic: عَلَيْهِمْ نَارٌ مُؤْصَدَةٌ

translation: By the sun and its brightness,
arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ وَالشَّمْسِ وَضُحَاهَا

translation: and by the moon as it follows it[1],
footnotes: [1] i.e., appears after the sun disappears.
arabic: وَالْقَمَرِ إِذَا تَلَاهَا

translation: and by the day as it displays it[2],
footnotes: [2] i.e., the earth or the sun.
arabic: وَالنَّهَارِ إِذَا جَلَّاهَا

translation: and by the night as it covers it[3],
footnotes: [3] i.e., the earth or the sun.
arabic: وَاللَّيْلِ إِذَا يَغْشَاهَا

translation: and by the sky and how He made it,
arabic: وَالسَّمَاءِ وَمَا بَنَاهَا

translation: and by the earth and how He spread it,
arabic: وَالْأَرْضِ وَمَا طَحَاهَا

translation: and by the soul and how He fashioned it[4],
footnotes: [4] By sound natural disposition.
arabic: وَنَفْسٍ وَمَا سَوَّاهَا

translation: then inspired it [to know] its wickedness and righteousness,
arabic: فَأَلْهَمَهَا فُجُورَهَا وَتَقْوَاهَا

translation: Indeed, he who purifies his soul will attain success,
arabic: قَدْ أَفْلَحَ مَنْ زَكَّاهَا

translation: and he who corrupts it will be doomed.
arabic: وَقَدْ خَابَ مَنْ دَسَّاهَا

translation: Thamūd rejected [the messenger] because of their transgression,
arabic: كَذَّبَتْ ثَمُودُ بِطَغْوَاهَا

translation: when the most wretched among them rose[5].
footnotes: [5] To kill the camel that Allah sent as a miracle to them.
arabic: إِذِ انْبَعَثَ أَشْقَاهَا

translation: Although the messenger of Allah warned them, “Hands off the she-camel of Allah and her drink!”
arabic: فَقَالَ لَهُمْ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ نَاقَةَ اللَّهِ وَسُقْيَاهَا

translation: Yet they rejected him and hamstrung her[6]. So their Lord destroyed them for their sin and leveled them to the ground.
footnotes: [6] And then killed her.
arabic: فَكَذَّبُوهُ فَعَقَرُوهَا فَدَمْدَمَ عَلَيْهِمْ رَبُّهُمْ بِذَنْبِهِمْ فَسَوَّاهَا

translation: And He has no fear of the consequences thereof[7].
footnotes: [7] Allah is not asked for what He does, but His slaves will be asked. See 21:23
arabic: وَلَا يَخَافُ عُقْبَاهَا

translation: By the night when it covers[1],
footnotes: [1] Everything between sky and earth with its darkness.
arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ وَاللَّيْلِ إِذَا يَغْشَىٰ

translation: and by the day when it appears,
arabic: وَالنَّهَارِ إِذَا تَجَلَّىٰ

translation: and by His creation of male and female,
arabic: وَمَا خَلَقَ الذَّكَرَ وَالْأُنْثَىٰ

translation: surely your efforts are divergent.
arabic: إِنَّ سَعْيَكُمْ لَشَتَّىٰ

translation: As for the one who gives in charity and fears Allah,
arabic: فَأَمَّا مَنْ أَعْطَىٰ وَاتَّقَىٰ

translation: and truly believes in the best reward,
arabic: وَصَدَّقَ بِالْحُسْنَىٰ

translation: We will make easy for him the way of salvation.
arabic: فَسَنُيَسِّرُهُ لِلْيُسْرَىٰ

translation: But as for the one who is miserly and deems himself self-sufficient,
arabic: وَأَمَّا مَنْ بَخِلَ وَاسْتَغْنَىٰ

translation: and denies the best reward,
arabic: وَكَذَّبَ بِالْحُسْنَىٰ

translation: We will make easy for him the way of perdition.
arabic: فَسَنُيَسِّرُهُ لِلْعُسْرَىٰ

translation: His wealth will be of no avail to him when he tumbles [into Hell].
arabic: وَمَا يُغْنِي عَنْهُ مَالُهُ إِذَا تَرَدَّىٰ

translation: Indeed, it is upon Us to show the right way,
arabic: إِنَّ عَلَيْنَا لَلْهُدَىٰ

translation: and surely to Us belong the Hereafter and the present life.
arabic: وَإِنَّ لَنَا لَلْآخِرَةَ وَالْأُولَىٰ

translation: So I warn you of a raging Fire,
arabic: فَأَنْذَرْتُكُمْ نَارًا تَلَظَّىٰ

translation: none will enter it except the most wretched,
arabic: لَا يَصْلَاهَا إِلَّا الْأَشْقَى

translation: who denied and turned away.
arabic: الَّذِي كَذَّبَ وَتَوَلَّىٰ

translation: But the most righteous will be saved from it,
arabic: وَسَيُجَنَّبُهَا الْأَتْقَى

translation: who spends his wealth to purify himself,
arabic: الَّذِي يُؤْتِي مَالَهُ يَتَزَكَّىٰ

translation: not in return for someone’s favors[2],
footnotes: [2] i.e., not as a repayment for a favor he received.
arabic: وَمَا لِأَحَدٍ عِنْدَهُ مِنْ نِعْمَةٍ تُجْزَىٰ

translation: but to seek the pleasure of his Lord, the Most High.
arabic: إِلَّا ابْتِغَاءَ وَجْهِ رَبِّهِ الْأَعْلَىٰ

translation: He will surely be well pleased.
arabic: وَلَسَوْفَ يَرْضَىٰ

translation: By the morning sunlight,
arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ وَالضُّحَىٰ

translation: and by the night when it covers with darkness[1],
footnotes: [1] And everything becomes still.
arabic: وَاللَّيْلِ إِذَا سَجَىٰ

translation: your Lord has neither forsaken you [O Prophet] nor hated you;
arabic: مَا وَدَّعَكَ رَبُّكَ وَمَا قَلَىٰ

translation: the Hereafter is better for you than the present life;
arabic: وَلَلْآخِرَةُ خَيْرٌ لَكَ مِنَ الْأُولَىٰ

translation: and your Lord will certainly give you so much that you will be well pleased.
arabic: وَلَسَوْفَ يُعْطِيكَ رَبُّكَ فَتَرْضَىٰ

translation: Did He not find you an orphan then take good care of you?
arabic: أَلَمْ يَجِدْكَ يَتِيمًا فَآوَىٰ

translation: Did He not find you unguided then guide you?
arabic: وَوَجَدَكَ ضَالًّا فَهَدَىٰ

translation: Did He not find you in need then enrich you?
arabic: وَوَجَدَكَ عَائِلًا فَأَغْنَىٰ

translation: So do not mistreat the orphan,
arabic: فَأَمَّا الْيَتِيمَ فَلَا تَقْهَرْ

translation: nor repulse the beggar[2];
footnotes: [2] i.e., anyone in need who seeks help.
arabic: وَأَمَّا السَّائِلَ فَلَا تَنْهَرْ

translation: and proclaim the favors of your Lord[3].
footnotes: [3] i.e., be grateful to Allah by proclaiming the favors He has given you.
arabic: وَأَمَّا بِنِعْمَةِ رَبِّكَ فَحَدِّثْ

translation: Have We not reassured your heart for you [O Prophet][1],
footnotes: [1] i.e., enlighten and gladden your heart for receiving the revelation.
arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ أَلَمْ نَشْرَحْ لَكَ صَدْرَكَ

translation: and relieved you of your burden[2]
footnotes: [2] forgave your previous or future errors, or relieved you of the anxiety you experienced at the beginning of your mission.
arabic: وَوَضَعْنَا عَنْكَ وِزْرَكَ

translation: that weighed down your back,
arabic: الَّذِي أَنْقَضَ ظَهْرَكَ

translation: and raised high your fame for you[3]?
footnotes: [3] Allah raised the Prophet's name in numerous ways, such as his name is mentioned twice in the call to prayer five times a day, as well the second call to prayer; at the end of each of the five daily prayers; believers invoke Allah’s blessings upon him and his family; and upon reverting to Islam, his name is mentioned, etc.
arabic: وَرَفَعْنَا لَكَ ذِكْرَكَ

translation: For indeed, with hardship comes ease[4],
footnotes: [4] In Arabic grammar, if a definite noun is repeated, it is referring to the same thing. However, if an indefinite noun is repeated, it is referring to two different things. So here in this and the coming verse they refer to one hardship (a definite noun) and two eases (an indefinite noun), which manifests Allah's favors upon His servants even in times of hardships.
arabic: فَإِنَّ مَعَ الْعُسْرِ يُسْرًا

translation: indeed, with hardship comes ease.
arabic: إِنَّ مَعَ الْعُسْرِ يُسْرًا

translation: So whenever you are free[5], strive in worship,
footnotes: [5] Of your duties.
arabic: فَإِذَا فَرَغْتَ فَانْصَبْ

translation: and turn to your Lord in devotion.
arabic: وَإِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ فَارْغَبْ

translation: By the fig and the olive[1],
footnotes: [1] Of Jerusalem.
arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ وَالتِّينِ وَالزَّيْتُونِ

translation: and by Mount Sinai[2],
footnotes: [2] Of Egypt.
arabic: وَطُورِ سِينِينَ

translation: and by this secure city [of Makkah][3],
footnotes: [3] This passage refers to the land of the three great prophets of Allah: Jesus (ﷺ) lived in the land of figs and olives, Moses (ﷺ) communicated with Allah on Mount Sinai, and Muhammad's (ﷺ) birthplace was Makkah. There is a similar reference in Deuteronomy 33:1, [Moses said:] “The Lord came from Sinai. Rising from Seir upon us, and he shone forth from Mount Paran.” Seir is a mountain near Jerusalem, and Paran is a mountain near Makkah.
arabic: وَهَٰذَا الْبَلَدِ الْأَمِينِ

translation: Surely We have created man in the best form[4],
footnotes: [4] i.e., in upright and balanced form and nature.
